original: avatārā mahāviṣṇoḥ sarve pūrṇāḥ prakīrtitāḥ /
analyzed: avatārāḥ mahā viṣṇoḥ sarve pūrṇāḥ prakīrtitāḥ
translated: All the incarnations of Maha Vishnu are declared to be complete.

original: pūrṇaṃ ca tatparaṃ rūpaṃ pūrṇātpūrṇāḥ samudgatāḥ // / / //
analyzed: pūrṇam ca tat param rūpam pūrṇāt pūrṇāḥ samudgatāḥ
translated: And that supreme form is complete, and the complete ones have emerged from the complete one.

original: parāvaratvaṃ teṣāṃ tu vyaktimātraviśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: parāvara tvam teṣām tu vyakti mātra viśeṣataḥ
translated: Their supremacy is only due to the difference in manifestation,

original: na deśakālasāmarthyātpārāvaryaṃ kathañcana // / / //
analyzed: na deśa kāla sāmarthyāt pārāvaryam kathañcana
translated: not in any way due to the power of place or time.

original: pūrvarūpaṃ ca pūrṇaṃ ca pūrṇaṃ padavitāragam / /
analyzed: pūrvarūpam ca pūrṇam ca pūrṇam padavī tāragam
translated: And the previous form is complete, and the complete one is the abode of the knower of the state.

original: rūpaṃ tadātmanyādāya pūrṇamevāvaśiṣyate // / / //
analyzed: rūpam tat ātmani ādāya pūrṇam eva avaśiṣyate
translated: Having taken that form into oneself, only the complete one remains.

original: laukikavyavahāroyaṃ bhūbhārakṣapaṇādikaḥ /
analyzed: laukika vyavahāraḥ ayam bhū bhāra kṣapaṇa ādikaḥ
translated: This worldly conduct such as bearing the burden of the earth,

original: tasya dṛrṣṭi vinā nānyo layaḥ kṛṣṇādinā kvacit // / / //
analyzed: tasya dṛrṣṭi vinā nā anyaḥ layaḥ kṛṣṇa ādinā kvacid
translated: without seeing it, there is no other dissolution anywhere by Krishna or anyone else.

original: tattve pīḍā na kartavyā tayā duḥ khāni vindati /
analyzed: tattve pīḍā na kartavyā tayā duḥkhāni vindati
translated: One should not cause pain in the truth, by that one experiences miseries.

original: atyantapīḍanāttasya rogastasya na saṃśayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: atyanta pīḍanāt tasya rogaḥ tasya na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Due to excessive pain, he has disease, there is no doubt about it.

original: jñātavyāṃśe tu pīḍā tu kartavyā guruṇā saha /
analyzed: jñātavyā aṃśe tu pīḍā tu kartavyā guruṇā saha
translated: But pain should be caused in the part to be known, along with the teacher.

original: tamantevāsinaṃ cāhuḥ sa eva cu guruḥ smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tam antevāsinam ca āhuḥ saḥ eva guruḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: He is called the disciple, and he alone is remembered as the teacher.

original: ye kurvanti harestattvavicāraṃ tu parasparam /
analyzed: ye kurvanti hareḥ tattva vicāram tu parasparam
translated: Those who engage in the consideration of the truth of Hari with each other,

original: tāveva guruśiṣyau tu vinatānandasaṃyuta // / / //
analyzed: tau eva guru śiṣyau tu vinatā ānanda saṃyuta
translated: Those two, the guru and the disciple, are united with the joy of Vinata.

original: guruṇāpi samaṃ hāsyaṃ kartavyaṃ kuṭilaṃ vinā /
analyzed: guruṇā api samam hāsyam kartavyam kuṭilam vinā
translated: The guru should laugh with the disciple, but not deceitfully.

original: harṣāmarṣayutaḥ śiṣyo guruḥ kauṭilyasaṃyutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: harṣa amarṣa yutaḥ śiṣyaḥ guruḥ kauṭilya saṃyutaḥ
translated: The disciple is full of joy and anger, the guru is full of deceit.

original: ubhau tau nirayaṃ yāto yāvadācandratārakam /🔽sākṣāddhariḥ puruṣaḥ piṅgalākṣaḥ svamāyāyāṃ guṇamayyāṃ mahātmā /
analyzed: ubhau tau nirayam yātaḥ yāvat ācandratārakam  sākṣāt hariḥ puruṣaḥ piṅgala akṣaḥ sva māyāyām guṇa mayyām mahātmā
translated: Both of them go to hell as long as the moon and stars exist.🔽Hari himself, the Supreme Being, the great soul with tawny eyes,

original: svapauruṣeṇaiva sumaṅgalena adhāttu vīryaṃ bhagavānvīryavāṃśca // / / //
analyzed: sva pauruṣeṇa eva su maṅgalena adhāt tu vīryam bhagavān vīryavān ca
translated: By his own auspicious prowess, the powerful Lord deposited his seed in his own illusory potency full of material qualities.

original: garuḍa uvāca /
analyzed: garuḍaḥ uvāca
translated: Garuda said:

original: vīryasvarūpaṃ brūhi me vāsudeva vīrye tvadīye saṃśayo me vibhāti /
analyzed: vīrya svarūpam brūhi me vāsudeva vīrye tvadīye saṃśayaḥ me vibhāti
translated: Tell me the nature of that seed, O Vasudeva. I have a doubt about your seed.

original: kiṃ vīryamīśasya svarūpabhūtaṃ kiṃ vā vibhinnaṃ vada sādhu vetsi // / / //
analyzed: kim vīryam īśasya svarūpa bhūtam kim vā vibhinnam vada sādhu vetsi
translated: What is the nature of the Lord's seed? Is it identical with Him or different? Tell me properly, for you know it well.

original: śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /🔽yadvīryamādhatta hariḥ svayaṃ prabhurmāyābhidhāyāṃ vinatātanūja /
analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca  yat vīryam ādhatta hariḥ svayam prabhuḥ māyā abhidhāyām vinatā tanūja
translated: Sri Krishna said:

original: tadvīryamāhurnṛhareḥ svarūpaṃ vipaścito niścitatattvadarśinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tat vīryam āhuḥ nṛhareḥ sva rūpam vipaścitaḥ niścita tattva darśinaḥ
translated: O son of Vinata, the wise ones who have seen the truth, say that the seed which Lord Hari deposited in His illusory potency is identical with Him.

original: bhinnaṃ tadāhuḥ prākṛtameva cāhuḥ svanābhipadmādikavacca bodhyam /
analyzed: bhinnam tat āhuḥ prākṛtam eva ca āhuḥ sva nābhi padma ādika vat ca bodhyam
translated: They say that it is different from Him, and is natural. It should be known as like His navel and other parts.

original: naitāvatā jñānarūpasya viṣṇorna vīryahāniriti cintanīyam // / / //
analyzed: na etāvatā jñāna rūpasya viṣṇoḥ na vīrya hāniḥ iti cintanīyam
translated: It should not be thought that by this much there is a loss of power of Vishnu, who is of the form of knowledge.

original: vīryasvarūpī bhagavānvā sudevaḥ sarvatra deśepi ca sarvakāle /
analyzed: vīrya svarūpī bhagavān vā sudevaḥ sarvatra deśe pi ca sarva kāle
translated: The Blessed One, who is of the form of power, is indeed good, in all places and at all times.

original: sarvārthavānyadi na syātkhagendra tarhīśvaraḥ puruṣo naiva sa syāt // / / //
analyzed: sarva arthavān yadi na syāt khaga indra tarhi īśvaraḥ puruṣaḥ nā eva sa syāt
translated: If he were not to be of all purposes, O lord of birds, then he would not be the Lord, the Supreme Being.

original: acintyavīryaiścintyavīryairdvirūpaḥ strīrūpamekaṃ puruṣaṃ tathā param /
analyzed: acintya vīryaiḥ cintya vīryaiḥ dvi rūpaḥ strī rūpam ekam puruṣam tathā param
translated: He is of two forms, of inconceivable power and of conceivable power, one form is female and the other is male.

original: ubhe rūpe vīryavatī khagendra tayorabhedaścintanīyo hi samyakū // / / //
analyzed: ubhe rūpe vīryavatī khaga indra tayoḥ abhedaḥ cintanīyaḥ hi samyak
translated: Both forms are powerful, O lord of birds, and their non-difference should be properly contemplated.

original: strīrūpavānyadi na syātkhargedrastrīṇāṃ kathaṃ pratibiṃbatvameva // / / //
analyzed: strī rūpavān yadi na syāt kharga idra strīṇām katham pratibiṃba tvam eva
translated: If he were not to be of the female form, O lord of birds, how could women be mere reflections?

original: strīrūpamasmādbrahmajaṃ dvāstavaṃ
analyzed: strī rūpam asmāt brahma jam dvāstavam
translated: The female form is born from Brahman, it is the second form.

original: cintanīyaṃ svarūpametannānyathā cintanīyam /
analyzed: cintanīyam svarūpam etat na anyathā cintanīyam
translated: It should be contemplated as such, not otherwise.

original: strīrūpavannaiva vicintanīyaṃ napuṃsakaṃ tbasya janyaṃ hi viddhi // / / //
analyzed: strī rūpa vat na eva vicintanīyam napuṃsakam tu asya janyam hi viddhi
translated: It should not be contemplated as neuter, know that it is born from him.

original: napuṃsakaṃ navaiva svarūpabhūtamato harau nāsti vicintanīyam /
analyzed: napuṃsakam navā eva svarūpa bhūtam atas harau nā asti vicintanīyam
translated: The neuter is not the original form, therefore there is nothing to be contemplated in Hari.

original: strībiṃbabhūte harirūpe khagendra śrīrūpamastīti vicintanīyam // / / //
analyzed: strī biṃba bhūte hari rūpe khaga indra śrī rūpam asti iti vicintanīyam
translated: It should be contemplated that in the form of Hari, which is the reflection of the female form, O lord of birds, the form of Shri exists.

original: garuḍa uvāca /
analyzed: garuḍaḥ uvāca
translated: Garuda said:

original: striyā striyaśca saṃyogaṃ vyarthamahurmanīṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: striyā striyaḥ ca saṃyogam vyartham ahuḥ manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: The wise have said that the union of women with women is useless.

original: strīrūpabhūte viṃbe tu strīrūpāḥ santi sarvadā // / / //
analyzed: strī rūpa bhūte viṃbe tu strī rūpāḥ santi sarvadā
translated: But in the mirror-like form of a woman, women are always present.

original: sthitau tatra nimittaṃ ca brūhi kṛṣṇa mama prabho // / / //
analyzed: sthitau tatra nimittam ca brūhi kṛṣṇa mama prabho
translated: O Krishna, my lord, tell me the reason for their presence there.

original: śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /
analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Sri Krishna said:

original: strībiṃbabhūtastrīrūpe lakṣmīrna syātkhageśvara /
analyzed: strī biṃba bhūta strī rūpe lakṣmīḥ na syāt khageśvara
translated: O lord of birds, Lakshmi would not be present in the mirror-like form of a woman.

original: nityāviyoginī devī kathaṃ syātparamātmanaḥ // / / //🔽hareranantarūpāṇāṃ strīrūpāṇāṃ khageśvara /
analyzed: nitya aviyoginī devī katham syāt paramātmanaḥ  hareḥ ananta rūpāṇām strī rūpāṇām khageśvara
translated: How could the goddess, who is always inseparable from the Supreme Self, be so?

original: anantānantarūpeṇa nityaṃ śuśrūṣaṇe ratā // / / //
analyzed: ananta ananta rūpeṇa nityam śuśrūṣaṇe ratā
translated: O lord of birds, among the infinite forms of Hari, the female forms are always engaged in serving Him with infinite forms.

original: ato lakṣmyā viyogastu śaṅkanīyaḥ kathañcana /
analyzed: atas lakṣmyāḥ viyogaḥ tu śaṅkanīyaḥ kathañcana
translated: Therefore, separation from Lakshmi can never be suspected.

original: nārāyaṇo nāma hariḥ svatantraḥ śriyā vinā nāsti kadāpi tārkṣya /
analyzed: nārāyaṇaḥ nāma hariḥ svatantraḥ śriyā vinā nā asti kadāpi tārkṣya
translated: Hari, known as Narayana, is independent, but never without Lakshmi, O Tarkshya.

original: harermukundasya padāravinde śuśrūṣamāṇā paramādareṇa // / / //
analyzed: hareḥ mukundasya pada aravinde śuśrūṣamāṇā parama ādareṇa
translated: Serving the lotus feet of Mukunda, Hari, with great respect,

original: hariṃ vinā śrīrapi deśakāle nāstīti mokṣecchubhireva vedyam /
analyzed: harim vinā śrīḥ api deśa kāle nā asti iti mokṣa icchubhiḥ eva vedyam
translated: Those who desire liberation should know that Lakshmi herself does not exist at any time or place without Hari.

original: yasyāmadhādvīryamanukṣaṇaṃ ca sā māmikā cendrajālā tmiketi // / / //
analyzed: yasyām adhāt vīryam anukṣaṇam ca sā māmikā ca indrajālā tmikā iti
translated: She in whom He places His power moment by moment, she is my own, and she is the most wonderful of all illusions.

original: vadanti ye asurā mūḍharūpā adhaṃmataḥ praviśantyeva sarve /
analyzed: vadanti ye asurāḥ mūḍha rūpāḥ a dhaṃmataḥ praviśanti eva sarve
translated: Those who say that the Asuras are of deluded form, all enter into the lower path.

original: māyā nāma prakṛtistvemāhuḥ susūkṣmarūpā na tu cendrajālikā // / / //
analyzed: māyā nāma prakṛtiḥ tu emā āhuḥ su sūkṣma rūpā na tu ca indrajālikā
translated: They call this primordial nature Maya, which is of a very subtle form, not of the nature of an illusion.

original: tasyābhimānaḥ śrīriti veditavyo vīryādhānaṃ tatra teṣāṃ ca melaḥ /🔽kāryonmukhaṃ melanaṃ cāhurāryā ito rūpaṃ nāhurāyyāśca viṣṇoḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasya abhimānaḥ śrīḥ iti veditavyaḥ vīrya ādhānam tatra teṣām ca melaḥ  kārya unmukham melanam ca āhuḥ āryāḥ itas rūpam na āhuḥ āyyāḥ ca viṣṇoḥ
translated: The pride of that should be known as Shri, and the impregnation of seed is their union there.🔽The union of the one inclined towards action, that is called the form of Vishnu by the noble ones.

original: sānādi nityā satyarūpā ca viṣṇormithyā rūpā sā kathaṃ syātkhagendra /
analyzed: sā anādi nityā satya rūpā ca viṣṇoḥ mithyā rūpā sā katham syāt khaga indra
translated: She is beginningless, eternal, and of true form. How can she be of false form to Vishnu, O lord of birds?

original: satyā tanuḥ prakṛtestannigūḍhā satyatvamāhurvyavahārārtharūpam // / / //
analyzed: satyā tanuḥ prakṛteḥ tat nigūḍhā satya tvam āhuḥ vyavahāra artha rūpam
translated: The true body of Prakriti is hidden in that. They say that truth is for the sake of worldly transactions.

original: vyavahārarūpā satyatā cetprakṛtyāstadā kathaṃ syādyadanādibhūtā /
analyzed: vyavahāra rūpā satyatā ced prakṛtyāḥ tadā katham syāt yat anādi bhūtā
translated: If the truth of Prakriti is in the form of worldly transactions, then how can she be the beginningless one?

original: anādinityā yadi na syātkhagendra suśūkṣmarūpeṇa na kāraṇaṃ syāt // / / //
analyzed: anādi nityā yadi na syāt khagendra su śūkṣma rūpeṇa na kāraṇam syāt
translated: If she were not beginningless and eternal, O lord of birds, she would not be the cause in the form of the subtlest.

original: sūkṣmeṇa rūpeṇa ca kāraṇaṃ syāt tarhi prapañcasya ca kāraṇaṃ vada /
analyzed: sūkṣmeṇa rūpeṇa ca kāraṇam syāt tarhi prapañcasya ca kāraṇam vada
translated: If she were to be the cause in the form of the subtle, then tell me the cause of the universe.

original: avidyāyā vaśato viṣṇureva nānārūpairdṛśyate viṣṇureva // / / //
analyzed: avidyāyāḥ vaśataḥ viṣṇuḥ eva nānā rūpaiḥ dṛśyate viṣṇuḥ eva
translated: Due to the power of ignorance, Vishnu alone is seen in various forms. Vishnu alone is seen.

original: śāstrajñānānnāśameti hyavidyā na saṃśayo hariṇā caikyameti /
analyzed: śāstra jñānāt nāśam eti hi avidyā na saṃśayaḥ hariṇā ca aikyam eti
translated: By the knowledge of the scriptures, ignorance indeed perishes, and there is no doubt that one becomes united with Hari.

original: evaṃ brūṣe yadi vādatkhagendra vakṣyehaṃ te tatra yuktiṃ śṛṇu tvam // / / //
analyzed: evam brūṣe yadi vādat khaga indra vakṣyā iham te tatra yuktim śṛṇu tvam
translated: If you speak thus, O king of birds, I will tell you the reason there, listen to it.

original: sarvajñarūpasya hi me murāreḥ kathaṃ harerghaṭate hyajñatā ca /
analyzed: sarvajña rūpasya hi me murāreḥ katham hareḥ ghaṭate hi ajña tā ca
translated: How can ignorance be possible for me, who am of the form of the omniscient Murari (Krishna), the destroyer of Mura?

original: sūrye yathā tamo nāsti tathā nārāyaṇe harau /
analyzed: sūrye yathā tamaḥ na asti tathā nārāyaṇe harau
translated: Just as there is no darkness in the sun, similarly there is no ignorance in Narayana Hari.

original: ajñānaṃ nāsti pakṣīdra kathaṃ tatvaṃ bravīṣyaho // / / //
analyzed: ajñānam nā asti pakṣīdra katham bravīṣi aho
translated: O bird, how can you say that there is ignorance?

original: ato nāhaṃ brāhmaṇastvādikālādupādhisaṃbandhavaśādajñatācet /
analyzed: atas na aham brāhmaṇaḥ tu ādi kālāt upādhi saṃbandha vaśāt ajña tā ced
translated: Therefore, if you say that I am not a Brahmin because of the connection with limiting adjuncts since beginningless time,

original: sarvajñosau kutra pakṣīndra viṣṇuralpajñajīvo jñānaśūnyaśca kutra // / / //
analyzed: sarvajñaḥ asau kutra pakṣi indra viṣṇuḥ alpa jña jīvaḥ jñāna śūnyaḥ ca kutra
translated: then where is Vishnu, the omniscient one, O king of birds? And where is the limited soul, devoid of knowledge?

original: viruddhayoścānayoḥ sarvadaiva kathaṃ caikyaṃ saṃvādiṣyanti vedāḥ /
analyzed: viruddhayoḥ ca anayoḥ sarvadā eva katham ca aikyam saṃvādiṣyanti vedāḥ
translated: And how will the Vedas declare the identity of these two, which are always contradictory?

original: deśe kāle sarvadā dduḥ khahīno jagatkartā pūrṇaśaktiḥ sadaiva // / / //
analyzed: deśe kāle sarvadā kha hīnaḥ jagatkartā pūrṇa śaktiḥ sadā eva
translated: In place, time, always free from sorrow, the creator of the world, always of complete power.

original: jīvaḥ sadā svalpakartāsti pūrṇaḥ saṃsārarūpe duḥ kharūpe ca nityam /
analyzed: jīvaḥ sadā su alpa kartā asti pūrṇaḥ saṃsāra rūpe duḥkha rūpe ca nityam
translated: The soul is always a limited agent, complete, always in the form of worldly existence and sorrow.

original: viruddhayoścānayoraikyamāhurīśasya māyāvaśato māyinaśca // / / //
analyzed: viruddhayoḥ ca anayoḥ aikyam āhuḥ īśasya māyā vaśataḥ māyinaḥ ca
translated: They declare the identity of these two, which are contradictory, by the power of the illusion of the Lord and the one who possesses illusion.

original: ye vaiṣṇavā vaiṣṇavadāsavaśyāsteṣāṃ drohaṃ sarvadā saṃcaredyaḥ /
analyzed: ye vaiṣṇavāḥ vaiṣṇava dāsa vaśyāḥ teṣām droham sarvadā saṃcaret yaḥ
translated: Those who are devotees of Vishnu and are under the control of Vishnu's servants, if one always moves around harming them,

original: hariprītistena bhavenna nityamānandavṛddhistena bhavenna muktau // / / //
analyzed: hari prītiḥ tena bhavet na nityam ānanda vṛddhiḥ tena bhavet na muktau
translated: then one will not have constant delight in Hari, and one will not have increasing bliss in liberation.

original: māyī sadā māyibhṛtyastathāpi bhedajñānānnindyate kāryate ca /
analyzed: māyī sadā māyi bhṛtyaḥ tathā api bheda jñānāt nindyate kāryate ca
translated: Even though the illusory one is always the servant of the illusory one, he is still censured and acted upon due to the knowledge of difference.

original: tenāpi teṣāṃ duḥ khavṛddhirbhavecca hyadhaṃ tamaḥ punarāvṛttihīnam // / / //
analyzed: tena api teṣām duḥ kha vṛddhiḥ bhavet ca hi adham tamaḥ punarāvṛtti hīnam
translated: Therefore, there will be an increase in their suffering, and he will go to the lowest darkness, devoid of return.

original: khagendrātaḥ prakṛtiḥ sūkṣmarūpā sā nityā sā satyabhūtā sadaiva /
analyzed: khagendrātaḥ prakṛtiḥ sūkṣma rūpā sā nityā sā satya bhūtā sadā eva
translated: From the lord of birds, the subtle form of nature, which is eternal and always true,

original: evaṃ svayaṃ kālavāyvādikānāṃ parā ramā
analyzed: evam svayam kāla vāyu ādikānām parā ramā
translated: Thus, the supreme Rama of time, wind, and others,

original: ṇavaḥ satyarūpāśca santi // / / //
analyzed: ṇavaḥ satya rūpāḥ ca santi
translated: the atoms are also truly existent.

original: parā māṇūnāṃ lakṣaṇaṃ veditavyaṃ jñānecchubhirnānyathā veditavyam /
analyzed: parā māṇūnām lakṣaṇam veditavyam jñāna icchubhiḥ na anyathā veditavyam
translated: The characteristics of the supreme atoms should be known by those desiring knowledge, not otherwise.

original: padārthānāṃ pārthivānāṃ khagendra viśeṣāṇāṃ caramākhyo viśeṣaḥ // / / //
analyzed: padārthānām pārthivānām khaga indra viśeṣāṇām carama ākhyaḥ viśeṣaḥ
translated: O lord of birds, the ultimate particular is the particular of the earthly substances.

original: sa evaḥ syātparamāṇurdvijendra yontyovi va
analyzed: saḥ evaḥ syāt paramāṇuḥ dvijendra va
translated: O best of the twice-born, that alone would be the atom, the last one,

original: śeṣovayavaśca sa smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śeṣaḥ uvayavaḥ ca sa smṛtaḥ
translated: the remaining one is remembered as the part.

original: garuḍa uvāca /
analyzed: garuḍaḥ uvāca
translated: Garuda said:

original: he kṛṣṇa he mādhava sāttvatāṃ pate padārthānāṃ caramāṃśaḥ parāṇu // / / //
analyzed: he kṛṣṇa he mādhava sāttvatām pate padārthānām carama aṃśaḥ parāṇu
translated: O Krishna, O Madhava, lord of the Satvatas, the last part of the words is the supreme atom.

original: iti proktaṃ tatra me saṃśayosti yontyo viśeṣaḥ sa tu nāṃśayuktaḥ /
analyzed: iti proktam tatra me saṃśayaḥ asti yaḥ antyaḥ viśeṣaḥ sa tu na aṃśa yuktaḥ
translated: Thus it is said, but I have a doubt there, that last distinction is not endowed with parts.

original: yo hyaṃśayukto na tu soṃtyo viśeṣa evaṃ mamābhāti vacastu tathyam // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ hi aṃśa yuktaḥ na tu saḥ antyaḥ viśeṣaḥ evam mama ābhāti vacaḥ tu tathyam
translated: He who is endowed with parts is not the last distinction, thus my words appear to be true.

original: śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /
analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Shrikrishna said:

original: ya eva loke saṃsthitā mānuṣāstu viśeṣāṇāṃ darśane śaktiyuktāḥ /
analyzed: ye eva loke saṃsthitāḥ mānuṣāḥ tu viśeṣāṇām darśane śakti yuktāḥ
translated: Those who are established in the world, endowed with the power to see distinctions,

original: tathāpi te yasya cāṃśitvameva viśeṣaṃ vai naiva draṣṭuṃ samarthāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tathā api te yasya ca aṃśi tvam eva viśeṣam vai nā eva draṣṭum samarthāḥ
translated: Even so, they are not able to see the distinction that is merely a part of Him.

original: tamevāhuścaramāṃśaṃ viśeṣaṃ ye caivamāhurmunayastena cānye /
analyzed: tam eva āhuḥ carama aṃśam viśeṣam ye ca evam āhuḥ munayaḥ tena ca anye
translated: They call that last distinction, and those who say so are the sages, and others.

original: ye kāṇādā gautamādyāḥ khagendra niraṃśakaṃ paramāṇuṃ vadanti // / / //
analyzed: ye kāṇādāḥ gautama ādyāḥ khaga indra niraṃśakam paramāṇum vadanti
translated: Those who are Kaṇāda, Gautama, and others, O king of birds, say that the atom is partless.

original: anantāṃśaiḥ saṃyutatvepi tāṃśca niraṃśino bhrāntidṛṣṭyā vadanti /
analyzed: ananta aṃśaiḥ saṃyuta tve pi tān ca niraṃśinaḥ bhrānti dṛṣṭyā vadanti
translated: Even though they are endowed with infinite parts, they say that they are partless through a deluded vision.

original: tasmātparā ramā
analyzed: tasmāt parā ramā
translated: Therefore, the supreme bliss

original: ṇoḥ paramāṇutvamasti tadaṃśānāṃ vinatāgarbhajāta // / / //
analyzed: ṇoḥ paramāṇu tvam asti tad aṃśānām vinatā garbha jāta
translated: has the nature of an atom, and its parts are born from the womb of Vinata, O king of birds.

original: parā ramā ṇūnāmekadeśe khagendra tanno saṃti prāṇināṃ rāśayaśca /
analyzed: parā rama ṇūnām eka deśe khaga indra tat no saṃti prāṇinām rāśayaḥ ca
translated: The supreme bliss of the atoms is in one place, O king of birds, and there are multitudes of beings there.

original: pratyekaśa saṃti rūpā hareśca hyataśca tatparamāṇoraṇīyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pratyekaśa saṃti rūpāḥ hareḥ ca hi atas ca tat paramāṇoḥ aṇīyaḥ
translated: Each of these forms of Hari is smaller than the smallest atom.

original: yo vā tvaṇīyānparamasya viṣṇoḥ sa eva rūpo mahato mahīyān /
analyzed: yaḥ vā tu aṇīyān paramasya viṣṇoḥ saḥ eva rūpaḥ mahataḥ mahīyān
translated: Or, that which is smaller than the smallest form of Viṣṇu is itself a form of the great one.

original: teṣāmanyonyaṃ na viśeṣosti kaścidacintyarūpe ca vicintanīyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: teṣām anyonyam na viśeṣaḥ usti kaścid acintya rūpe ca vicintanīyaḥ
translated: Among them, there is no difference at all. It should be contemplated in the inconceivable form.

original: kālakoṭivihīnatvaṃ kālānantyaṃ vidurbudhāḥ /
analyzed: kāla koṭi vihīna tvam kāla ānantyam viduḥ budhāḥ
translated: The absence of crores of kalpas is known by the wise as the infinity of time.

original: deśakoṭivihīnatvaṃ deśānantyaṃ vidurbudhāḥ // / / //
analyzed: deśa koṭi vihīna tvam deśa ānantyam viduḥ budhāḥ
translated: The absence of crores of directions is known by the wise as the infinity of space.

original: guṇānāmaprameyatve guṇānantyaṃ vidurbudhāḥ /
analyzed: guṇānām aprameya tve guṇa ānantyam viduḥ budhāḥ
translated: The wise know the infinity of qualities in the immeasurable nature of qualities.

original: ānantyaṃ trividhaṃ nityaṃ harernānyasya kasyacit // / / //
analyzed: ānantyam trividham nityam hareḥ na anyasya kasyacid
translated: The three kinds of infinity belong to Hari alone, not to anyone else.

original: tasya sarvasvarūpeṣu cānantyaṃ tu trilakṣaṇam /🔽tathāpi deśatastasya paricchedopi yujyate // / / //
analyzed: tasya sarva svarūpeṣu ca ānantyam tu tri lakṣaṇam  tathā api deśataḥ tasya paricchedaḥ api yujyate
translated: In all His forms, He has the three characteristics of infinity.🔽Still, it is proper to delimit Him in terms of space.

original: paricchedastathā vyāpterekarūpepi yujyate /
analyzed: paricchedaḥ tathā vyāpteḥ eka rūpe api yujyate
translated: Similarly, it is proper to delimit Him in terms of pervasion, even in a single form.

original: tasyācintyādbhutaiśvaryaṃ vyavahārārthameva ca // / / //
analyzed: tasya acintya adbhuta aiśvaryam vyavahāra artham eva ca
translated: His inconceivable and wonderful lordship is for the sake of worldly transactions alone.

original: guṇataḥ kālataścaiva paricchedo na kutracit /
analyzed: guṇataḥ kālataḥ ca eva paricchedaḥ na kutracid
translated: In terms of qualities and time, there is no delimitation anywhere.

original: vyāptatvaṃ deśato hyasti sarvabhūteṣu yadyāpi // / / //
analyzed: vyāpta tvam deśataḥ hi asti sarva bhūteṣu yadi api
translated: Although there is pervasion in all beings in terms of space,

original: na ca bhedaḥ kvacittasya hyaṇumātrepi yujyate /
analyzed: na ca bhedaḥ kvacid tasya hi aṇu mātre api yujyate
translated: And difference is not possible in even an atom of it.

original: tathāpi vidyateṇutvaṃ tasmādaiśvaryayogataḥ // / / //
analyzed: tathā api vidyateṇu tvam tasmāt aiśvarya yogataḥ
translated: Yet, minuteness exists in it due to the union with lordship.

original: tasmādviddhyavatārārthaṃ vyāptatvaṃ cāpi bhaṇyate /🔽yattasya vyāpakaṃ rūpaṃ paraṃ nārāyaṇaṃ viduḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt viddhi avatāra artham vyāpta tvam ca api bhaṇyate  yat tasya vyāpakam rūpam param nārāyaṇam viduḥ
translated: Therefore, the all-pervasiveness is also stated for the purpose of manifestation.🔽That all-pervading form of it, they know as the supreme Narayana.

original: ataśca paramāṇūnāṃ pārthivā'nantyavādinām /
analyzed: atas ca paramāṇūnām pārthiva ānantya vādinām
translated: And therefore, the difference of atoms, of those who assert the infinity of earth,

original: bhedaḥ parasparaṃ jñeyastatheśasya mahātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhedaḥ parasparam jñeyaḥ tathā īśasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: and likewise of the great lord, should be known.

original: jaḍeśayorjaḍānāṃ ca jīvānāṃ ca parasparam /
analyzed: jaḍa īśayoḥ jaḍānām ca jīvānām ca parasparam
translated: The difference between the insentient and the sentient, and of the living beings,

original: tathaiva jaḍajīvānāṃ nityaṃ bhedo jaḍeśayoḥ // / / //
analyzed: tathā eva jaḍa jīvānām nityam bhedaḥ jaḍa īśayoḥ
translated: and likewise of the insentient and the sentient, is always the difference between the insentient and the sentient.

original: pañca bhedā ime nityaṃ sarvāvasthāsu sarvaśaḥ /
analyzed: pañca bhedāḥ ime nityam sarva avasthāsu sarvaśas
translated: These five differences are always in all states and in every way.

original: etādṛśyāṃ tu māyāyāṃ vīryamādhatta vīryavān // / / //
analyzed: etādṛśyām tu māyāyām vīryam ādhatta vīryavān
translated: In such an illusion, the powerful one deposited his semen.

original: puruṣākhyo haristasmāttriguṇānasṛjatprabhuḥ // / / //
analyzed: puruṣa ākhyaḥ hariḥ tasmāt triguṇān asṛjat prabhuḥ
translated: From him, the lord Hari called Purusha, created the three qualities.

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe tṛtīyāṃśe brahmakāṇḍe bhagavadvīryasvarūpatadādhānadvārakaguṇatraya sṛṣṭijaḍeśabhedādinirūpaṇaṃ nāma tṛtīyo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe tṛtīya aṃśe brahmakāṇḍe bhagavat vīryasvarūpatadādhānadvārakaguṇatrayasṛṣṭijaḍeśabhedādinirūpaṇam nāma tṛtīyaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the third chapter on the description of the nature of the Lord's semen, the creation of the three qualities through the deposition of semen, the difference between the insentient and the sentient, etc., in the Brahma Kanda of the third part of the great Garuda Purana.

original: śrīgaruḍamahāpurāṇam
analyzed: śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam
translated: Shree Garuda Maha Purana

original: śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /
analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Shri Krishna said:

original: yathā sasarja bhagavāṃstrīn guṇānprakṛtestadā /
analyzed: yathā sasarja bhagavān trīn guṇān prakṛteḥ tadā
translated: As the Lord created the three qualities from Prakruti,

original: lakṣmīstrirūpā saṃbhūtā śrīrbhūrdurgoti saṃjñitā // / / //
analyzed: lakṣmīḥ tri rūpā saṃbhūtā śrīḥ bhūḥ durgā iti saṃjñitā
translated: Lakshmi, having three forms, originated - Shri, Bhu, and Durga.

original: sattvābhimāninī śrīstu bhūrdevī rajamāninī /
analyzed: sattva abhimāninī śrīḥ tu bhūḥ devī raja māninī
translated: The wise say that Shri is the embodiment of Sattva, Goddess Bhu is the embodiment of Rajas,

original: tamobhimāninī durgā hyevamāhurmanīṣiṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tamaḥ abhimāninī durgā hi evam āhuḥ manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: and Durga is the embodiment of Tamas.

original: antaraṃ na vijānīyādrūpāṇāṃ ca parasparam /
analyzed: antaram na vijānīyāt rūpāṇām ca parasparam
translated: One should not know the difference between the forms and each other,

original: guṇānāṃ caiva saṃbandhāddurgādīnāṃ khageśvara // / / //
analyzed: guṇānām ca eva saṃbandhāt durgā ādīnām khageśvara
translated: and between the qualities of Durga and others, O Lord of Birds.

original: antaraṃ ye vijānanti te yāntyandhantamaḥ param /
analyzed: antaram ye vijānanti te yānti andhantamaḥ param
translated: Those who know the difference go to the highest blinding darkness.

original: puruṣastu trirūpobhūdviṣṇurbrahmā bhavetisaḥ // / / //🔽sattvena lokānvardhayituṃ viṣṇuḥ sākṣāddhariḥ svayam /
analyzed: puruṣaḥ tu tri rūpaḥ bhūt viṣṇuḥ brahmā bhava iti saḥ  sattvena lokān vardhayitum viṣṇuḥ sākṣāt hariḥ svayam
translated: The Purusha became of three forms - Vishnu, Brahma, and Bhava.

original: sṛṣṭiṃ kartuṃ ca rajasā brahmaṇi prāviśaddhariḥ // / / //
analyzed: sṛṣṭim kartum ca rajasā brahmaṇi prāviśat hariḥ
translated: Vishnu, Hari himself, entered into Brahma with Rajas to create the world.

original: ādyo brahmā sa vijñeyo na tu sākṣāddhariḥ svayam /
analyzed: ādyaḥ brahmā sa vijñeyaḥ na tu sākṣāt hariḥ svayam
translated: The first one should be known as Brahma, but not Hari himself.

original: tamasāpi samānhantuṃ rudre ca prāviśaddhariḥ // / / //
analyzed: tamasā api samān hantum rudre ca prāviśat hariḥ
translated: Hari entered into Rudra with Tamas to destroy.

original: rudre sthito rudrasaṃjño na rudrastu hariḥ svayam /
analyzed: rudre sthitaḥ rudra saṃjñaḥ na rudraḥ tu hariḥ svayam
translated: Hari, abiding in Rudra, is called Rudra, but not Rudra himself.

original: viṣṇureva hariḥ sākṣāttāvubhauna harī smṛtau // / / //
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ eva hariḥ sākṣāt tau ubhau na harī smṛtau
translated: Vishnu alone is Hari, and both of them are known as Hari.

original: āviṣṭarūpau vijñeyau brahmarudrābhidhāyakau /
analyzed: āviṣṭa rūpau vijñeyau brahma rudra abhidhāyakau
translated: They should be known as having entered forms, and are designated by the names Brahma and Rudra.

original: evaṃ jñātvā mokṣameti nānyathā tu kathañcana // / / //
analyzed: evam jñātvā mokṣam eti na anyathā tu kathañcana
translated: Knowing this, one attains liberation, not otherwise at all.

original: viṣṇubrahmādirūpāṇāmaikyaṃ jānanti ye dvijāḥ /
analyzed: viṣṇu brahma ādi rūpāṇām aikyam jānanti ye dvijāḥ
translated: Those twice-born ones who know the oneness of the forms of Vishnu, Brahma, and others,

original: te yānti narakaṃ ghoraṃ punarāvṛttivarjitam // / / //
analyzed: te yānti narakam ghoram punarāvṛtti varjitam
translated: They go to a terrible hell, devoid of return.

original: guṇatrayaṃ praviṣṭastu puruṣo hariravyayaḥ /
analyzed: guṇatrayam praviṣṭaḥ tu puruṣaḥ hariḥ avyayaḥ
translated: The imperishable Hari, the Purusha, having entered the three qualities,

original: kāryonmukhaṃ yathā bhūyātkṣobhayāmāsa vai tathā // / / //
analyzed: kārya unmukham yathā bhūyāt kṣobhayāmāsa vai tathā
translated: Agitated them in such a way that they would turn towards creation.

original: jātakṣobhādbhagavato mahānāsīdguṇatrayāt /
analyzed: jāta kṣobhāt bhagavataḥ mahān āsīt guṇa trayāt
translated: From the agitation of the Lord, the great one arose from the three qualities,

original: guṇatraye vidyamānādbhāgādeva na saṃśayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: guṇatraye vidyamānāt bhāgāt eva na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Without a doubt, from a part existing in the three qualities.

original: mahato brahmavāyū ca jajñāte khābhimāninau /
analyzed: mahataḥ brahma vāyū ca jajñāte kha abhimāninau
translated: From the great one, Brahma and Vayu, who consider space to be their abode, were born.

original: tasya saṃvatsarātpaścādyamalau saṃbabhūvatuḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasya saṃvatsarāt paścāt yamalau saṃbabhūvatuḥ
translated: After a year, Yama and Kala were born from him.

original: rajaḥ pradhānaṃ yattatvaṃ mahattattavamitīritam /
analyzed: rajaḥ pradhānam mahat tattavam iti īritam
translated: That principle which is predominantly rajas is called the principle of mahat.

original: sargaṃ tvimaṃ vijānīyādguṇavaiṣamyanāmakam // / / //
analyzed: sargam tu imam vijānīyāt guṇa vaiṣamya nāmakam
translated: One should know this creation to be named after the inequality of the qualities.

original: garuḍa uvāca /
analyzed: garuḍaḥ uvāca
translated: Garuda said:

original: mahattattavasvarūpasya jñānārthaṃ devakīsuta /
analyzed: mahat tat tava svarūpasya jñāna artham devakī suta
translated: O son of Devaki, for the sake of knowing the nature of the mahat principle,

original: tvayoktā guṇavaiṣamyanāmikā sṛṣṭiruttamā // / / //
analyzed: tvayā uktā guṇa vaiṣamya nāmikā sṛṣṭiḥ uttamā
translated: The creation characterized by the inequality of the gunas is the best, as spoken by you.

original: guṇavaiṣamyaśabdārthaṃ mama brūhi mahāprabho /
analyzed: guṇa vaiṣamya śabda artham mama brūhi mahā prabho
translated: O great lord, tell me the meaning of the word guna-vaishamya.

original: śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /
analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Shrikrsna said:

original: guṇavaiṣamyaśabdārthajñāpanāya khageśvara // / / //
analyzed: guṇa vaiṣamya śabda artha jñāpanāya khageśvara
translated: O lord of birds, for the purpose of conveying the meaning of the word guna-vaishamya...

original: apikṣitaṃ ca tatrādau guṇasāmyaṃ na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: apikṣitam ca tatra ādau guṇa sāmyam na saṃśayaḥ
translated: And there, at the beginning, the equality of the gunas is certainly examined.

original: samyagjñāpayituṃ tatra khādau tāvatsvageśvara // / / //
analyzed: samyak jñāpayitum tatra kha ādau tāvat svaga īśvara
translated: In order to properly convey that, O lord of birds, first...

original: rāśibhūtaṃ guṇānāṃ tu darśayiṣye sthitiṃ ca vai /
analyzed: rāśi bhūtam guṇānām tu darśayiṣye sthitim ca vai
translated: I will show the state of the gunas that have become a mass.

original: rāśībhūtasya tasamaḥ sakāśādvinatāsuta // / / //
analyzed: rāśībhūtasya tasamaḥ sakāśāt vinatā suta
translated: O son of Vinata, from the mass that is equal...

original: rāśībhūtaṃ rajo jñeyandviguṇaṃ tattu nānyathā /
analyzed: rāśībhūtam rajaḥ jñeyat dviguṇam tat tu na anyathā
translated: The mass that has become rajas should be known as twice that, not otherwise.

original: rāśībhūtasya rajasaḥ sakāśādvinatāsuta // / / //
analyzed: rāśībhūtasya rajasaḥ sakāśāt vinatā suta
translated: O son of Vinata, from the mass that has become rajas...

original: rāśībhūtaṃ tathā sattvaṃ dviguṇaṃ samudāhṛtam /
analyzed: rāśībhūtam tathā sattvam dviguṇam samudāhṛtam
translated: The mass that has become sattva is declared to be twice that.

original: mūlaprakṛtijā hyete na mūlā prakṛtiḥ smṛtā // / / //
analyzed: mūlaprakṛti jāḥ hi ete na mūlā prakṛtiḥ smṛtā
translated: These are born from the original prakriti, but are not remembered as the original prakriti.

original: yataḥ prakṛtirūpāṇāṃ paricchedo na vidyate /
analyzed: yatas prakṛti rūpāṇām paricchedaḥ na vidyate
translated: Because there is no determination of the forms of prakriti.

original: ataḥ prakṛtijā jñeyā na mūlāste khageśvara // / / //
analyzed: atas prakṛti jāḥ jñeyāḥ na mūlāḥ te khageśvara
translated: Therefore, they should be known as born from prakriti, but not as the original, O lord of birds.

original: evaṃ tava guṇānāñca parimāṇaṃ khageśvara /
analyzed: evam tava guṇānām ca parimāṇam khageśvara
translated: Thus, O lord of birds, is the measure of the gunas for you.

original: uktaṃ svarūpaṃ teṣāṃ tu tava samyak khageśvara // / / //
analyzed: uktam svarūpam teṣām tu tava samyak khageśvara
translated: O Lord of birds, I have thus described to you the nature of those three qualities.

original: tatra rāśitraye sattvaṃ kevalaṃ samudāhṛtam /
analyzed: tatra rāśi traye sattvam kevalam samudāhṛtam
translated: In that, sattva is said to be purely present in the three groups.

original: rajastamobhyāṃ garuḍa hyavimiśraṃ hyatastu tat // / / //
analyzed: rajaḥ tamobhyām garuḍa hi avimiśram hi atas tu tat
translated: O Garuda, it is unmixed with rajas and tamas, therefore it is so.

original: kevalaṃ sattvamityuktaṃ na tu śreṣṭhatvataḥ prabho /
analyzed: kevalam sattvam iti uktam na tu śreṣṭha tvataḥ prabho
translated: It is said to be purely sattva, not because of being the best, O Lord.

original: sṛṣṭikāle kevalaṃ syātpralaye miśritaṃ bhavet // / / //🔽sarvadāpyavimiśraṃ ca sattvarāśiṃ khageśvara /
analyzed: sṛṣṭi kāle kevalam syāt pralaye miśritam bhavet  sarvadā api avimiśram ca sattva rāśim khageśvara
translated: At the time of creation, it would be purely sattva, but at the time of dissolution, it would be mixed.🔽O Lord of birds, even at all times, the mass of sattva is unmixed.

original: sarvadāpi vimiśraṃ ca sattvarāśiṃ dvijottama // / / //
analyzed: sarvadā api vimiśram ca sattva rāśim dvijottama
translated: O best of Brahmins, even at all times, the mass of sattva is mixed.

original: ye vijānanti te sarve viśanti hyadharaṃ tamaḥ /
analyzed: ye vijānanti te sarve viśanti hi adharam tamaḥ
translated: Those who know this, all of them enter the lower darkness.

original: rajastamoguṇau vīndra itarābhyāṃ vimiśritau // / / //
analyzed: rajaḥ tamaḥ guṇau vi indraḥ itarābhyām vimiśritau
translated: O Indra among birds, rajas and tamas are mixed with the other two.

original: sṛṣṭau pralayakālepi miśrāveva khageśvara /🔽rāśibhūtepi rajasi rajobhāgācchatādhikam // / / //
analyzed: sṛṣṭau pralaya kāle api miśrau eva khageśvara  rāśi bhūte pi rajasi rajaḥ bhāgāt śata adhikam
translated: Even at the time of creation and dissolution, they are mixed, O Lord of birds.

original: sattvaṃ ca miśritaṃ jñeyaṃ nānyathā pakṣisattama /
analyzed: sattvam ca miśritam jñeyam na anyathā pakṣi sattama
translated: Even in the mass of rajas, sattva should be known as mixed with a hundred parts of rajas, O best of birds, not otherwise.

original: rajasaḥ śatabhāgānāṃ madhye tu vinatāsuta // / / //
analyzed: rajasaḥ śata bhāgānām madhye tu vinatā suta
translated: O son of Vinata, among the hundred parts of rajas,

original: ya eko bhāga uddiṣṭastāvatparimitaṃ tamaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ekaḥ bhāgaḥ uddiṣṭaḥ tāvat parimitam tamaḥ
translated: the one part that is designated, that much is tamas.

original: rāśibhūtepi rajasi miśritaṃ parikīrtitam // / / //
analyzed: rāśi bhūte pi rajasi miśritam parikīrtitam
translated: Even when situated in a mass of rajas, it is said to be mixed.

original: rajorāśisthitistvevaṃ tāta vyāptaṃ tamoguṇaiḥ /
analyzed: rajaḥ rāśi sthitiḥ tu evam tāta vyāptam tamaḥ guṇaiḥ
translated: O son, the state of being situated in a mass of rajas is thus pervaded by the quality of tamas.

original: rāśibhūtepi tamasi sattvaṃ ca vinatāsuta // / / //🔽tamaḥ sakāśādgaruḍa daśabhāgādhikena ca /
analyzed: rāśi bhūte api tamasi sattvam ca vinatā suta  tamaḥ sakāśāt garuḍa daśa bhāga adhikena ca
translated: Even when situated in a mass of tamas, sattva is mixed, O son of Vinata.

original: miśritaṃ bhavatītyevaṃ jñātavyaṃ nātra saṃśayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: miśritam bhavati iti evam jñātavyam na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: O Garuda, from tamas, it becomes mixed with ten parts more. Thus it should be known, there is no doubt.

original: tamaso daśabhāgānāṃ madhye tu vinatāsuta /🔽ya eko bhāga uddiṣṭastāvatparimitaṃ rajaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tamasaḥ daśa bhāgānām madhye tu vinatā suta  yaḥ ekaḥ bhāgaḥ uddiṣṭaḥ tāvat parimitam rajaḥ
translated: O son of Vinata, among the ten parts of tamas,🔽one part is designated, and that much is the limited rajas.

original: rāśibhūtepi tamasi miśritaṃ bhavati dhruvam /
analyzed: rāśi bhūta ipi tamasi miśritam bhavati dhruvam
translated: Even when situated in a mass of tamas, it certainly becomes mixed.

original: tamorāśisthitistvevaṃ jñātavyā pakṣisattama // / / //
analyzed: tamaḥ rāśi sthitiḥ tu evam jñātavyā pakṣi sattama
translated: The state of being situated in a mass of tamas should be known thus, O best of birds.

original: garuḍa uvāca /
analyzed: garuḍaḥ uvāca
translated: Garuda said:

original: raśibhūtepi rajasi rāśibhūte tamasyapi /
analyzed: raśi bhūte api rajasi rāśi bhūte tamasi api
translated: Even when situated in a mass of rajas and a mass of tamas,

original: sattvāṃśā hyadhikāḥ saṃtītyevamuktaṃ mayānagha // / / //
analyzed: sattva aṃśāḥ hi adhikāḥ saṃti iti evam uktam mayā anagha
translated: the parts of sattva are indeed more, thus it was said by me, O sinless one.

original: tatra me saṃśayo hyasti śṛṇu tvaṃ sāttvatāṃ pate /🔽yadrāśyāṃ yadrā śibhāgā hyadhikāḥ saṃti yāvatā // / / //
analyzed: tatra me saṃśayaḥ hi asti śṛṇu tvam sāttvatām pate  yad rāśyām yad rā śi bhāgāḥ hi adhikāḥ saṃti yāvatā
translated: There I have a doubt, listen, O lord of the Sātvatas,🔽to the extent that the parts of a mass are more in a mass,

original: tāvatā vyavahāraḥ syātkṣīranīramiva prabho /
analyzed: tāvatā vyavahāraḥ syāt kṣīra nīram iva prabho
translated: to that extent there would be usage, like milk and water, O lord.

original: śrutvā sa garuḍenoktaṃ bhagavānpuruṣottamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śrutvā sa garuḍena uktam bhagavān puruṣottamaḥ
translated: Having heard what was said by Garuda, the Blessed Lord, the Supreme Being,

original: uvāca para maprītyā saṃstuvan garuḍaṃ hariḥ /
analyzed: uvāca para ma prītyā saṃstuvan garuḍam hariḥ
translated: spoke with great delight, praising Garuda, Hari said:

original: śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /
analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Lord Krishna said:

original: rajorāśyā tamorāśyā sattvarāśyadhikā sadā // / / //
analyzed: rajaḥ rāśyā tamaḥ rāśyā sattva rāśī adhikā sadā
translated: The mass of rajas, the mass of tamas, and the mass of sattva are always superior.

original: miśritaṃ cāpi pakṣīndra na sattavamiti kīrtyate /
analyzed: miśritam ca api pakṣi indra na sattavam iti kīrtyate
translated: And also mixed, O lord of birds, it is not called sattva.

original: rajorāśistamorāśirityevaṃ vibudhā viduḥ // / / //
analyzed: rajaḥ rāśiḥ tamaḥ rāśiḥ iti evam vibudhāḥ viduḥ
translated: The mass of rajas and the mass of tamas, thus the gods know.

original: viṣaṃ tu carudugdhasthaṃ viṣamityucyate yathā /
analyzed: viṣam tu caru dugdha stham viṣam iti ucyate yathā
translated: Just as poison in cooked rice or milk is called poison.

original: evaṃ mayoktā garuḍa guṇānāṃ nijasaṃsthitiḥ // / / //
analyzed: evam mayā uktā garuḍa guṇānām nija saṃsthitiḥ
translated: Thus, O Garuda, the natural state of the qualities has been told by me.

original: sāmyāvasthāṃ guṇānāṃ ca śṛṇvidānīṃ khageśvara /
analyzed: sāmya avasthām guṇānām ca śṛṇu idānīm khageśvara
translated: Now listen, O lord of birds, to the state of equilibrium of the qualities.

original: rāśīkṛtācca rajasaḥ janyaṃ yacca kageśvara // / / //🔽mahattattve praviṣṭaṃ ca yadrajaḥ parikīrtitam /
analyzed: rāśīkṛtāt ca rajasaḥ janyam yat ca kaga īśvara  mahat tattve praviṣṭam ca yat rajaḥ parikīrtitam
translated: And what is produced from the mass of rajas, O lord of birds,🔽is declared to have entered the principle of Mahat.

original: pralaye samanuprāpte mahattattve sthitaṃ rajaḥ // / / //🔽dvādaśāṃśena tu hyaddhā vibhaktaṃ bhavatiṃ prabho /
analyzed: pralaye samanuprāpte mahat tattve sthitam rajaḥ  dvādaśa aṃśena tu hi addhā vibhaktam bhavatim prabho
translated: When dissolution arrives, the rajas residing in the principle of Mahat,🔽is indeed divided into twelve parts, O lord.

original: rāśībhūte hi sattve tu daśabhāgena miśritam // / / //
analyzed: rāśībhūte hi sattve tu daśa bhāgena miśritam
translated: When sattva becomes a mass, it is mixed with ten parts.

original: samyak bhavati pakṣīndra tathaikāṃśena cāṇḍaja /
analyzed: samyak bhavati pakṣi indra tathā eka aṃśena ca aṇḍaja
translated: O lord of birds, it becomes correct in the same way, O egg-born one.

original: tamorāśyā miśritaṃ ca bhavatyeva na saṃśayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tamaḥ rāśyā miśritam ca bhavati eva na saṃśayaḥ
translated: And it certainly becomes mixed with the mass of tamas, there is no doubt.

original: anyenaikena bhāgena rajorāśyā khageśvara /
analyzed: anyena ekena bhāgena rajaḥ rāśyā khageśvara
translated: O lord of birds, by another part, it becomes mixed with the mass of rajas.

original: miśritaṃ bhavatītyevaṃ jñātavyaṃ nānyathā kvacit // / / //
analyzed: miśritam bhavati iti evam jñātavyam na anyathā kvacid
translated: It should be known thus, not otherwise anywhere.

original: guṇatrayepi bhagavānmahattattvasya cāṇḍaja /
analyzed: guṇatraye api bhagavān mahat tattvasya ca aṇḍaja
translated: O egg-born one, the Lord is in all three qualities and in the principle of Mahat.

original: evaṃ layastu jñātavyo hṛdi tattvārthavodibhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: evam layaḥ tu jñātavyaḥ hṛdi tattva artha vodibhiḥ
translated: Thus, the dissolution should be known by those who expound the truth of the principles in the heart.

original: evaṃ guṇatrayāṇāṃ ca miśritattvātkhageśvara /
analyzed: evam guṇa trayāṇām ca miśri tattvāt khageśvara
translated: Thus, O lord of birds, due to the mixed nature of the three qualities,

original: guṇasāmyamiti prāhurevaṃ jānīhi vai khaga // / / //
analyzed: guṇa sāmyam iti prāhuḥ evam jānīhi vai khaga
translated: they speak of the equality of qualities. Know it thus, O bird.

original: anyathā ye vijānanti te yānti hyadharaṃ tamaḥ /
analyzed: anyathā ye vijānanti te yānti hi adharam tamaḥ
translated: Those who know otherwise go to the lower darkness.

original: garuḍa uvāca /
analyzed: garuḍaḥ uvāca
translated: Garuda said:

original: rāśīkṛtaguṇānāṃ ca trayāṇāṃ parameśvara // / / //
analyzed: rāśīkṛta guṇānām ca trayāṇām parameśvara
translated: O Supreme Lord, of the three qualities that have been accumulated,

original: viśālānāṃ paraṃ brahmanpralaye guṇasāmyatā /
analyzed: viśālānām param brahman pralaye guṇa sāmya tā
translated: O great Brahman, in the great dissolution, the equality of qualities of the extensive ones,

original: kathaṃ brūhi mahābhāga etattattvaṃ samāsataḥ // / / //
analyzed: katham brūhi mahābhāga etat tattvam samāsatas
translated: please tell me, O greatly fortunate one, this truth in brief.

original: śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /
analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Shri Krishna said:

original: rāśībhūtaguṇānāṃ tu trayaṇāmapi sattama /
analyzed: rāśībhūta guṇānām tu trayaṇām api sattama
translated: O best one, of the three qualities that have been accumulated,

original: tadā vimiśritatvena hyavasthānaṃ vidurbudhāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tadā vimiśrita tvena hi avasthānam viduḥ budhāḥ
translated: the wise know that they exist then in a mixed state.

original: idānīṃ guṇavaiṣamyaṃ śṛṇu samyaṅ mama priya /
analyzed: idānīm guṇa vaiṣamyam śṛṇu samyak mama priya
translated: Now listen attentively to the inequality of the qualities, O my dear.

original: sṛṣṭikāle tu saṃprāpte yatpūrvaṃ pralaye khaga // / / //
analyzed: sṛṣṭi kāle tu saṃprāpte yat pūrvam pralaye khaga
translated: When the time for creation arrives, O bird, what was previously dissolved in the dissolution,

original: daśabhāgaiśca sattve tu miśritaṃ yadra jastathā /🔽tamasyapyekabhāgena praviṣṭaṃ yattu tadrajaḥ // / / //
analyzed: daśa bhāgaiḥ ca sattve tu miśritam yat rajaḥ tathā  tamasi api eka bhāgena praviṣṭam yat tu tat rajaḥ
translated: The sattva is mixed with ten parts, and the rajas is mixed with five parts.🔽And the tamas is mixed with one part, which is the rajas.

original: rajasyapyekabhāgena praviṣṭaṃ yacca tadrajaḥ /
analyzed: rajasi api eka bhāgena praviṣṭam yat ca tat rajaḥ
translated: And the rajas is mixed with one part, which is the tamas.

original: evaṃ dvādaśabhāgaiśca praviṣṭaṃ sarvaśo rajaḥ // / / //
analyzed: evam dvādaśa bhāgaiḥ ca praviṣṭam sarvaśas rajaḥ
translated: Thus the rajas is mixed with twelve parts in every way.

original: sattvastairdaśabhāgaiśca tathaikena rajoṃśinā /
analyzed: sattvaḥ taiḥ daśa bhāgaiḥ ca tathā ekena rajaḥ oṃśinā
translated: The sattva is mixed with those ten parts and with one part of rajas.

original: evamekādaśairbhāgaistamasthāṃśena vai vdija // / / //
analyzed: evam ekādaśaiḥ bhāgaiḥ tamastha aṃśena vai
translated: Thus the tamas is mixed with eleven parts and with one part of rajas.

original: miśritaṃ bhavati hyaddhā mahattattvaṃ tadā smṛtam /
analyzed: miśritam bhavati hi addhā mahat tattvam tadā smṛtam
translated: Indeed, the mahat principle is then said to be mixed.

original: etadanyo viśeṣaśca mantadhyo vinatāsuta // / / //
analyzed: etad anyaḥ viśeṣaḥ ca mantadhyaḥ vinatā suta
translated: O son of Vinata, this and other distinctions should be understood.

original: ekāṃśastāmaso jñeyo mahattattve na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: eka aṃśaḥ tāmasaḥ jñeyaḥ mahat tattve na saṃśayaḥ
translated: One part should be known as tamas in the mahat principle, there is no doubt.

original: evaṃ trayodaśairbhāgairmiśritaṃ tacca sattama // / / //
analyzed: evam trayodaśaiḥ bhāgaiḥ miśritam tat ca sattama
translated: Thus that is mixed with thirteen parts, O best one.

original: evametadvijānīyānnānyathā tu kathañcana /
analyzed: evam etat vijānīyāt na anyathā tu kathañcana
translated: This should be known thus, and not otherwise in any way.

original: garuḍa uvāca /
analyzed: garuḍaḥ uvāca
translated: Garuda said:

original: caturmukhācchrutaṃ pūrvaṃ bhagavansāttvatāṃ pate // / / //
analyzed: caturmukhāt śrutam pūrvam bhagavan sāttvatām pate
translated: O Lord, O master of the Satvatas, I have heard it from the Four-faced One before.

original: caturbhāgātsamutpannaṃ mahattattvamiti prabho /
analyzed: catur bhāgāt samutpannam mahat tattvam iti prabho
translated: O Lord, the principle of Mahat is said to have arisen from a quarter.

original: tatraikāṃśastamaḥ proktaḥ tribhāgo raja eva ca // / / //
analyzed: tatra eka aṃśaḥ tamaḥ proktaḥ tri bhāgaḥ rajaḥ eva ca
translated: There, one part is said to be tamas, and three parts are rajas.

original: tadāhurbrahmaṇo rūpaṃ guṇavaiṣamyanāmakam /
analyzed: tat āhuḥ brahmaṇaḥ rūpam guṇa vaiṣamya nāmakam
translated: They call that the form of Brahman, named the inequality of the qualities.

original: caturbhāgātmakaṃ proktaṃ mahattattvaṃ śrutaṃ mayā // / / //
analyzed: catur bhāga ātmakam proktam mahat tattvam śrutam mayā
translated: The principle of Mahat is said to consist of four parts. I have heard that it is

original: trayodaśāṃśaiḥ saṃbhūtamiti proktaṃ tvayānagha /
analyzed: trayodaśa aṃśaiḥ saṃbhūtam iti proktam tvayā anagha
translated: composed of thirteen parts, as you have said, O sinless one.

original: tadetatsaṃśayaṃ chindhi kṛpālo bhaktavatsala // / / //
analyzed: tat etat saṃśayam chindhi kṛpālaḥ bhakta vatsala
translated: Please resolve this doubt, O merciful one, O lover of devotees.

original: śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /
analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Shrikrsna said:

original: brahmoktamya mayoktasya vivādo nāsti sarvathā /
analyzed: mayā uktasya vivādaḥ nā asti sarvathā
translated: There is no dispute at all between what is said by Brahma and what is said by me.

original: mūlasattve miśritaṃ ca daśabhāgena yadrajaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mūla sattve miśritam ca daśa bhāgena yat rajaḥ
translated: The rajas mixed with the original sattva is one-tenth.

original: tatsarvaṃ ca militvaiva tveko bhāgastu kīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: tat sarvam ca militvā eva tu ekaḥ bhāgaḥ tu kīrtitaḥ
translated: All that together is said to be one part.

original: mūle rajasi yaccokto rajobhāgaḥ khageśvara // / / //
analyzed: mūle rajasi yat ca uktaḥ rajaḥ bhāgaḥ khageśvara
translated: O lord of birds, the part of rajas that is said to be in the original rajas,

original: bhāge dvitīye vijñeyastadrajo nātra saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: bhāge dvitīye vijñeyaḥ tat rajaḥ na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: should be known as the second part, there is no doubt about it.

original: mūle tamasi yaccokto rajobhāgastathaiva ca // / / //
analyzed: mūle tamasi yat ca uktaḥ rajaḥ bhāgaḥ tathā eva ca
translated: And the part of rajas that is said to be in the original tamas,

original: tṛtīyabhāgo vijñeyo nātra kāryā vicāraṇā /
analyzed: tṛtīya bhāgaḥ vijñeyaḥ na atra kāryā vicāraṇā
translated: The third part should be known as tamas. No doubt should be entertained in this matter.

original: tathā mūle ca tamasi hyeko bhāgastamaḥ smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tathā mūle ca tamasi hi ekaḥ bhāgaḥ tamaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Similarly, in the root tamas, one part is said to be tamas.

original: evaṃ tribhāgo rajasaḥ ekāṃśastamasaḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: evam tri bhāgaḥ rajasaḥ eka aṃśaḥ tamasaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Thus, the three parts are of rajas, and one part is said to be of tamas.

original: tadāhurbrahmaṇo dehaṃ guṇavaiṣamyanāmakam // / / //
analyzed: tat āhuḥ brahmaṇaḥ deham guṇa vaiṣamya nāmakam
translated: They call that the body of Brahman, named after the inequality of the qualities.

original: garuḍa uvāca /
analyzed: garuḍaḥ uvāca
translated: Garuda said:

original: mahattattvasya catvāro bhāgāsteṣu rajastrayaḥ /
analyzed: mahat tattvasya catvāraḥ bhāgāḥ teṣu rajaḥ trayaḥ
translated: The mahat tattva has four parts, of which three are rajas,

original: tamasastveka eveti tvayoktaṃ garuḍadhvaja // / / //🔽rajobhāgātmako dehoḥ brahmaṇaḥ parameṣṭhinaḥ /
analyzed: tamasaḥ tu ekaḥ evā iti tvayā uktam garuḍadhvaja  rajaḥ bhāga ātmakaḥ brahmaṇaḥ parameṣṭhinaḥ
translated: and one is tamas, O Garuda-bannered one.🔽Thus it is understood that the body of Brahman, the Supreme Lord,

original: iti pratīyate brahmanvacanāttava mādhava // / / //
analyzed: iti pratīyate brahman vacanāt tava mādhava
translated: is composed of the part of rajas, O Brahman, from your statement, O Madhava.

original: śuddhasattvātmako deho brahmaṇaḥ parameṣṭhinaḥ /
analyzed: śuddha sattva ātmakaḥ dehaḥ brahmaṇaḥ parameṣṭhinaḥ
translated: The body of Brahman, the Supreme Lord, is said to be composed of pure sattva.

original: evaṃ hi śrūyate kṛṣṇa saṃśayo metra bādhate // / / //
analyzed: evam hi śrūyate kṛṣṇa saṃśayaḥ mā itra bādhate
translated: O Krishna, this is what is heard, but doubt still afflicts me.

original: tamevaṃ saṃśayaṃ chindhi yaddhi tacchrotumarhati /
analyzed: tam evam saṃśayam chindhi yat hi tat śrotum arhati
translated: Please resolve this doubt, which is worthy of being heard.

original: śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /🔽tribhāgabhūte rajasi tathā dvādaśadhāpi ca // / / //
analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca  tri bhāga bhūte rajasi tathā dvādaśadhā api ca
translated: Shrikrishna said:🔽In the three parts of rajas, and also in the twelve parts,

original: rajasopekṣayā sattvaṃ daśāṃśādhikameva ca /
analyzed: rajasā upekṣayā sattvam daśa aṃśa adhikam eva ca
translated: the sattva is ten parts more than the rajas, in comparison.

original: praviṣṭamastīti khaga jñātavyaṃ tacchaṇu dvija // / / //
analyzed: praviṣṭam asti iti khaga jñātavyam tat śaṇu dvija
translated: O bird, it should be known that it has entered. Listen, O twice-born one.

original: tamasopekṣayā sattvaṃ daśāṃśādhikameva vai /
analyzed: tamasā upekṣayā sattvam daśa aṃśa adhikam eva vai
translated: In comparison to tamas, sattva is indeed ten parts more.

original: praviṣṭamastīti khaga vaktavyaṃ nātra saṃśayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: praviṣṭam asti iti khaga vaktavyam na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: O bird, it should be said without doubt that it has entered.

original: tamasopekṣayā tatra tama ekādaśaṃ smṛtam /
analyzed: tamasā upekṣayā tatra tamaḥ ekādaśam smṛtam
translated: In comparison to tamas there, tamas is remembered as the eleventh part.

original: ekāṃśastu rajo jñeyamevamāhurmanīṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: eka aṃśaḥ tu rajaḥ jñeyam evam āhuḥ manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: Rajas should be known as one part. Thus say the wise.

original: evaṃ ca militānbhāgānvakṣye śṛṇu mahāmate // / / //
analyzed: evam ca militān bhāgān vakṣye śṛṇu mahāmate
translated: And thus I will describe the combined parts. Listen, O greatly wise one.

original: mahattattvasamutpattā upādānaṃ khageśvara /
analyzed: mahat tattva samutpattā upādānam khageśvara
translated: O lord of birds, the material cause of the origin of the mahat tattva

original: trayodaśāṃśā vijñeyā dvādaśāśaṃ rajaḥ smṛtam // / / //
analyzed: trayodaśa aṃśāḥ vijñeyāḥ dvādaśa āśam rajaḥ smṛtam
translated: should be known as thirteen parts. Rajas is remembered as twelve parts.

original: ekāṃśastamaso jñeyastatra bhāgāñchṛṇu dvijā /
analyzed: eka aṃśaḥ tamasaḥ jñeyaḥ tatra bhāgān śṛṇu dvijāḥ
translated: Tamas should be known as one part. Listen to the parts there, O twice-born one.

original: ādau tu dvādaśāṃśeṣu bhāgānvakṣyāmi tacchṛṇu // / / //
analyzed: ādau tu dvādaśa aṃśeṣu bhāgān vakṣyāmi tat śṛṇu
translated: First, I will describe the parts in the twelve parts. Listen to that.

original: ekāṃśastamaso jñeyastaddaśāṃ śādhikaṃ rajaḥ /🔽tacchatāṃśādhikaṃ sattvamevamāhurmanīṣiṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: eka aṃśaḥ tamasaḥ jñeyaḥ tad daśām śa adhikam rajaḥ  tad śata aṃśa adhikam sattvam evam āhuḥ manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: Tamas should be known as one part. Rajas is more than that by ten parts.🔽The wise say that sattva is more than that by one hundred parts.

original: ekāṃśatamasi hyevaṃ vibhāgāñchṛṇu sattama /
analyzed: eka aṃśa tamasi hi evam vibhāgān śṛṇu sattama
translated: Thus, O best one, listen to the divisions in tamas.

original: ekāṃśastu rajo jñeyastamo hyekā daśādhikam // / / //
analyzed: eka aṃśaḥ tu rajaḥ jñeyaḥ tamaḥ hi ekā daśa adhikam
translated: Rajas should be known as one part. Tamas is indeed more than that by ten parts.

original: tamobhāgāstu vijñeyāstaddaśāṃśādhikaḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tamaḥ bhāgāḥ tu vijñeyāḥ tad daśa aṃśa adhikaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The parts of tamas should be known as one-tenth more than that.

original: sattvabhāga iti jñeyo mahattattve khageśvara // / / //
analyzed: sattva bhāgaḥ iti jñeyaḥ mahat tattve khageśvara
translated: O Lord of birds, it is known as the part of sattva in the principle of Mahat.

original: sattvāṃśo bahulo yasmācchuddhasattvaṃ caturmukhaḥ /
analyzed: sattva aṃśaḥ bahulaḥ yasmāt śuddhasattvam caturmukhaḥ
translated: Because the part of sattva is predominant, the four-faced one is pure sattva.

original: utpattirmahataścoktā evaṃ ca vinatāsuta // / / //
analyzed: utpattiḥ mahataḥ ca uktā evam ca vinatā suta
translated: Thus, O son of Vinata, the origin of Mahat is described.

original: tajjñānānmokṣamāpnoti nānyathā tu kathañcana // / / //
analyzed: tad jñānāt mokṣam āpnoti na anyathā tu kathañcana
translated: By knowing that, one attains liberation, not otherwise, under any circumstances.

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttarakhaṇḍe kṛṣṇa garuḍasaṃvāde tṛtīyāṃśe brahmakāṇḍe guṇavaiṣamyabhedabrahmadehasvarūpaguṇasāmyanirūpaṇaṃ nāma caturtho
analyzed: iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttara khaṇḍe kṛṣṇa garuḍa saṃvāde tṛtīya aṃśe brahmakāṇḍe guṇavaiṣamyabhedabrahmadehasvarūpaguṇasāmyanirūpaṇam nāma caturthaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fourth chapter on the nature of the body of Brahman, the equality of qualities, and the determination of the nature of the Brahman principle in the third part of the Krishna Garudayana in the great Purana called Sri Garuda Purana.

original: śrīgaruḍamahāpurāṇam
analyzed: śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam
translated: The glorious Garuda Mahapurana

original: etādṛśe mahattattve lakṣmyā saha hariḥ svayam /
analyzed: etādṛśe mahat tattve lakṣmyā saha hariḥ svayam
translated: In such a Mahat principle, Hari himself, along with Lakshmi,

original: praviveśa mahābhāga kṣobhayāmāsa vai hariḥ // / / //
analyzed: praviveśa mahābhāga kṣobhayāmāsa vai hariḥ
translated: entered, O illustrious one, and Hari agitated it.

original: ahantattvamabhūttasmājjñānadravyakriyātmakam /
analyzed: aham tattvam abhūt tasmāt jñāna dravya kriyā ātmakam
translated: From that, the principle of ego arose, consisting of knowledge, substance, and action.

original: ahaṅkārasamutpattāvekāṃśastamasi smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ahaṅkāra samutpattau eka aṃśaḥ tamasi smṛtaḥ
translated: In the origin of ego, one part is said to be in tamas.

original: taddaśāṃśādhikarajastaddaśāṃśādhikaṃ prabho /
analyzed: tad daśa aṃśa adhika rajaḥ tad daśa aṃśa adhikam prabho
translated: O Lord, it is one-tenth more than rajas, and one-tenth more than tamas.

original: sattvamityucyate sadbhirhyetadātmā tvahaṃ smṛtam // / / //
analyzed: sattvam iti ucyate sadbhiḥ hi etat ātmā tu aham smṛtam
translated: This is called Sattva by the virtuous, and it is remembered as the Self.

original: ahantattvābhimānī tu ādau śeṣo babhūvaha /
analyzed: ahar tattva abhimānī tu ādau śeṣaḥ babhūva ha
translated: At first, Shesha was the one who had the pride of the principle of I.

original: sahasrābdācca paścāttau jātau khagaharau dvija // / / //
analyzed: sahasra abdāt ca paścāt tau jātau khaga harau dvija
translated: After a thousand years, the two, Garuda and Hara, were born, O Brahmin.

original: ahantattve khaga hyeṣu praviṣṭo hariravyayaḥ /
analyzed: ahar tattve khaga hi eṣu praviṣṭaḥ hariḥ avyayaḥ
translated: In the principle of I, Garuda, Hari, the imperishable one, entered.

original: kṣobhayāmāsa bhagavāllaṅkṣmyā saha hariḥ svayam // / / //
analyzed: kṣobhayāmāsa bhagavān laṅkṣmyā saha hariḥ svayam
translated: The Lord Hari himself, along with Lakshmi, agitated (the principle of I).

original: vaikārikastāmasaśca taijasaścetyahaṃ tridhā /
analyzed: vaikārikaḥ tāmasaḥ ca taijasaḥ ca iti aham tridhā
translated: The I is threefold: Vaikarika, Taimarika, and Taijasa.

original: tridhā babhūva rudropi yatasteṣāṃ niyāmakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tridhā babhūva rudraḥ api yatas teṣām niyāmakaḥ
translated: Rudra also became threefold, as he is the controller of those (three).

original: vaikārikasthito rudro vaikārika iti smṛtaḥ /🔽tāmase tu sthito rudrastāmaso hyabhidhīyate // / / //
analyzed: vaikārika sthitaḥ rudraḥ vaikārikaḥ iti smṛtaḥ  tāmase tu sthitaḥ rudraḥ tāmasaḥ hi abhidhīyate
translated: Rudra residing in the Vaikarika is known as Vaikarika.🔽Rudra residing in the Taimarika is called Taimarika.

original: taijase tu sthito rudro loke vai taijasaḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: taijase tu sthitaḥ rudraḥ loke vai taijasaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Rudra residing in the Taijasa is known in the world as Taijasa.

original: taijase tu hyahantattve lakṣmyā saha hariḥ svayam // / / //
analyzed: taijase tu hi ahar tattve lakṣmyā saha hariḥ svayam
translated: In the Taijasa principle of I, Hari himself, along with Lakshmi,

original: viśitvā kṣobhayāmāsa tadāsau daśadhā tvabhūt /
analyzed: viśitvā kṣobhayāmāsa tadā asau daśadhā tu abhūt
translated: having entered, agitated it, and then it became tenfold.

original: śrotraṃ cakṣuḥ sparśanaṃ ca rasanaṃ ghrāṇameva ca // / / //
analyzed: śrotram cakṣuḥ sparśanam ca rasanam ghrāṇam eva ca
translated: The ear, the eye, the skin, the tongue, and the nose,

original: vākpāṇipādaṃ pāyuśca upastheti daśa smṛtāḥ /
analyzed: vāc pāṇi pādam pāyuḥ ca upasthā iti daśa smṛtāḥ
translated: Speech, hands, feet, the anus, and the genitals are known as the ten.

original: vaikārike hyahantattve praviśya kṣobhayaddhariḥ // / / //🔽mahattattvādimā adāvindriyāṇāṃ ca devatāḥ /
analyzed: vaikārike hi ahar tattve praviśya kṣobhayat hariḥ  mahat tattva ādimāḥ adau indriyāṇām ca devatāḥ
translated: Hari, having entered the egoity born of transformation, agitates it.🔽The deities of the eleven sense organs, beginning with the principle of Mahat,

original: ekādaśavidhā āsankrameṇa tu khageśvara // / / //
analyzed: ekādaśavidhāḥ āsan krameṇa tu khageśvara
translated: were born in due order, O lord of birds.

original: manobhimāni nī hyādau vāruṇī tvabhavattadā /
analyzed: nī hi ādau vāruṇī tu abhavat tadā
translated: The deity of the mind was born first, then Varuni,

original: anantaraṃ ca sauparṇī gaurojāpi tathaiva ca // / / //🔽śeṣādanantarāstāsāṃ daśavarṣādanaṃram /
analyzed: anantaram ca sauparṇī gaurojā api tathā eva ca  śeṣāt anantarāḥ tāsām daśa varṣāt anaṃram
translated: then Suparni, Gouri, and Japa.

original: utpattiriti vijñeyaṃ krameṇa tu khageśvara // / / //
analyzed: utpattiḥ iti vijñeyam krameṇa tu khageśvara
translated: After Shesha, their birth is known to have taken place in order, O lord of birds.

original: manobhimānināvanyāvindrakāmau prajajñatuḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ abhimāninau anyau indra kāmau prajajñatuḥ
translated: Indra and Kama, the deities of the mind, gave birth to

original: tārkṣya hyanantarau jñeyau muktau saṃsāra eva ca // / / //
analyzed: tārkṣya hi anantarau jñeyau muktau saṃsāraḥ eva ca
translated: Tarkshya and Ananta, who are known to be liberated even in the world.

original: tatastvagātmā hyabhavatsohaṃ kārika īritaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tvac ātmā hi abhavat saḥ ham kārikaḥ īritaḥ
translated: Then the egoity born of transformation was born,

original: tataḥ pāṇyātmakāścaiva jajñire pakṣisattama // / / //
analyzed: tatas pāṇi ātmakāḥ ca eva jajñire pakṣi sattama
translated: then those born of the hands, O best of birds.

original: śacī ratiścāniruddhastathā svāyaṃbhuvo manuḥ /🔽bṛhaspatistathā dakṣa ete pāṇyātmakāḥ smṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: śacī ratiḥ ca aniruddhaḥ tathā svāyaṃbhuvaḥ manuḥ  bṛhaspatiḥ tathā dakṣaḥ ete pāṇi ātmakāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: Shachi, Rati, Aniruddha, the Manu Svayambhuva,🔽Brihaspati, and Daksha - these are known to be born of the hands.

original: dakṣasyānantaraṃ jajñe pravāho nāma cāṇḍaja /
analyzed: dakṣasya anantaram jajñe pravāhaḥ nāma ca aṇḍaja
translated: After Daksha, O bird, a son named Pravaha was born,

original: sa evoktaścātiṃvāho yāpayatyātmacoditaḥ // / / //
analyzed: saḥ eva uktaḥ ca atiṃvāhaḥ yāpayati ātma coditaḥ
translated: He alone is said to be the overlord, who governs himself and is self-directed.

original: hastādanantaraṃ jñeyo na tu śacyādivatsmṛtaḥ /
analyzed: hastāt anantaram jñeyaḥ na tu śacī ādi vat smṛtaḥ
translated: He should be known as after the hands, but is not remembered like Śacī and others.

original: tatobhavanmahābhāga cakṣuridriyamātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas bhavat mahābhāga cakṣuḥ idriyam ātmanaḥ
translated: Then, O illustrious one, the eye sense organ was born of him.

original: svāyaṃbhuvamanorbhāryā śatarūpā yamastathā /🔽candrasūryau tu cattvāraścakṣurindriyamāninaḥ // / / //
analyzed: svāyaṃbhuva manoḥ bhāryā śatarūpā yamaḥ tathā  candra sūryau tu cattvāraḥ cakṣuḥ indriya māninaḥ
translated: The wife of Svāyambhuva Manu was Śatarūpā, and Yama was born.🔽The moon and sun are the four who consider the eye sense organ as their self.

original: candraḥ śrotrābhimānīti tathā jñeyaḥ khageśvara /🔽jihvendriyātmā varuṇaḥ sūryasyānantarobhavat // / / //
analyzed: candraḥ śrotra abhimānī iti tathā jñeyaḥ khageśvara  jihvā indriya ātmā varuṇaḥ sūryasya anantaraḥ bhavat
translated: O lord of birds, the moon should be known as the one who considers the ear sense organ as his self.🔽Varuṇa, the soul of the tongue sense organ, was born after the sun.

original: vāgindriyābhimāninyo hyabhavanvaruṇādanu /
analyzed: vāc indriya abhimāninyaḥ hi abhavan varuṇāt anu
translated: The wives of Varuṇa were born after him, considering the speech sense organ as their self.

original: dakṣapatnī prasūtiśca bhṛguragnistarthava ca // / / //
analyzed: dakṣa patnī prasūtiḥ ca bhṛguḥ agniḥ ca
translated: Dakṣa's wife Prasūti, Bhṛgu, Agni, and Tvaṣṭṛ

original: tatra vaite mahātmāno vāgindriyaniyāmakāḥ /
analyzed: tatra vā ete mahātmānaḥ vāc indriya niyāmakāḥ
translated: There, those great souls are the controllers of the speech sense organ.

original: ye kravyādādayaścoktāstenantattvaniyāmakāḥ // / / //
analyzed: ye kravyāda ādayaḥ ca uktāḥ tenan tattva niyāmakāḥ
translated: And those mentioned as Kṛavyād and others are the controllers of that principle.

original: sāmyatvācca tathaivoktirna tu tattvābhimānitaḥ /
analyzed: sāmya tvāt ca tathā evā uktiḥ na tu tattva abhimānitaḥ
translated: And the statement is made in the same way due to similarity, not because of considering the principle as their self.

original: upasthamānino vīndra babhūvustadanantaram // / / //
analyzed: upastha māninaḥ vi indra babhūvuḥ tad anantaram
translated: O Vīndra, after that, those who consider the organ of procreation as their self were born.

original: viśvāmitro vasiṣṭotrirmarīciḥ pulahaḥ kratuḥ /
analyzed: viśvāmitraḥ vasiṣṭotriḥ marīciḥ pulahaḥ kratuḥ
translated: Viśvāmitra, Vasiṣṭha, Atri, Marīci, Pulaha, and Kratu,

original: pulastyoṅgirasaścaiva tathā vaivasvato manuḥ // / / //
analyzed: pulastyaḥ uṅgirasaḥ ca eva tathā vaivasvataḥ manuḥ
translated: Pulastya, Angiras, and also Manu Vaivasvata,

original: manvādayonantasaṃkhyā upasthātmāna īritāḥ /
analyzed: manu ādayaḥ ananta saṃkhyāḥ upastha ātmānaḥ īritāḥ
translated: Manu and others of infinite number are said to be the presiding deities of the soul.

original: pāyośca mānino vīndra jajñire tadanantaram // / / //
analyzed: pāyoḥ ca māninaḥ vi indra jajñire tad anantaram
translated: And after them, O Indra among kings, the Manis were born from the womb.

original: sūryeṣu dvādaśasveko mitrastārā guroḥ priyā /
analyzed: sūryeṣu dvādaśasu ekaḥ mitraḥ tārā guroḥ priyā
translated: Among the twelve suns, one is Mitra, Tara is the beloved of Guru,

original: koṇādhipo nirṛtiśca pravahapriyā // / / //
analyzed: koṇādhipaḥ nirṛtiḥ ca pravahapriyā
translated: the lord of the angles is Nirriti, and the beloved of Pravaha,

original: cattvāra ete pakṣīndra vāyutattvābhimāninaḥ /
analyzed: cattvāraḥ ete pakṣi indra vāyu tattva abhimāninaḥ
translated: these four, O lord of birds, are the presiding deities of the wind principle.

original: ghrāṇābhimāninaḥ sarve jajñire dvijasattama // / / //
analyzed: ghrāṇa abhimāninaḥ sarve jajñire dvijasattama
translated: All of them are born as the presiding deities of the nose, O best of the twice-born.

original: viṣvavaseno vāyuputrau hyaśvinau gaṇapastathā /
analyzed: viṣvavasenaḥ vāyuputrau hi aśvinau gaṇapaḥ tathā
translated: The two Ashvins, the son of Vayu, and Ganesha,

original: vittapaḥ sapta vasava ukto hyāgnistathāṣṭamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vittapaḥ sapta vasavaḥ uktaḥ
translated: the seven Vasus are said to be Vitatha, Tapas, Agni, and the eighth,

original: satyānāṃ śṛṇu nāmāni droṇaḥ prāṇo dhruvastathā /
analyzed: satyānām śṛṇu nāmāni droṇaḥ prāṇaḥ dhruvaḥ tathā
translated: hear the names of the Satyas, Drona, Prana, Dhruva,

original: arke doṣastathā vaskaḥ saptamastu vibhāvasuḥ // / / //
analyzed: arke doṣaḥ tathā vaskaḥ saptamaḥ tu vibhāvasuḥ
translated: Arka, Dosa, and also Vaska, and the seventh is Vibhavasu.

original: daśarudrāstathā jñeyā mūlarudro bhavaḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: daśa rudrāḥ tathā jñeyāḥ mūlarudraḥ bhavaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The ten Rudras should be known, and Mularudra is known as Bhava.

original: daśa rudrasya nāmāni śṛṇuṣva dvijasattama // / / //
analyzed: daśa rudrasya nāmāni śṛṇuṣva dvijasattama
translated: O best of the twice-born, listen to the ten names of Rudra.

original: raivanteyastathā bhīmo vāmadevo vṛṣākapiḥ /
analyzed: raivanteyaḥ tathā bhīmaḥ vāmadevaḥ vṛṣākapiḥ
translated: Raivanteya, Bhima, Vamadeva, Vrishakapi,

original: ajaikapādahirvudhnyo bahurūpo mahāniti // / / //
analyzed: ajaikapād ahirvudhnyaḥ bahu rūpaḥ mahān iti
translated: Ajaikapada, Ahirbudhnya, Bahurupa, and Mahadeva.

original: daśa rudrā iti proktāḥ ṣaḍādityāñchṛṇu dvija /
analyzed: daśa rudrāḥ iti proktāḥ ṣaṭ ādityān śṛṇu dvija
translated: These are said to be the ten Rudras. O Brahmin, listen to the six Adityas.

original: urukramastathā śakro vivasvānvaruṇastathā // / / //🔽parjanyotibāhureta uktāḥ pūrvaṃ dvijottama /
analyzed: urukramaḥ tathā śakraḥ vivasvān varuṇaḥ tathā  parjanya ūtibāhuḥ ete uktāḥ pūrvam dvijottama
translated: Urukrama, Shakra, Vivasvan, Varuna,

original: parjanyavyatiriktāstu pañcaivoktā na saṃśayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: parjanya vyatiriktāḥ tu pañca eva uktāḥ na saṃśayaḥ
translated: and Parjanya, Atibhuja - these are said to be the five, O best of Brahmins, excluding Parjanya.🔽There is no doubt about this.

original: gaṅgāsamastu parjanya iti coktaḥ khageśvara /
analyzed: gaṅgā samaḥ tu parjanyaḥ iti ca uktaḥ khageśvara
translated: O Lord of Birds, Parjanya is said to be equal to the Ganges.

original: savitā hyaryamā dhātā pūṣā tvaṣṭā tathā bhagaḥ // / / //
analyzed: savitā hi aryamā dhātā pūṣā tvaṣṭā tathā bhagaḥ
translated: Savita, Aryama, Dhatri, Pushan, Tvashtra, and Bhaga,

original: catvāriṃśattathā sapta mahataḥ parikīrtitāḥ /
analyzed: catvāriṃśat tathā sapta mahataḥ parikīrtitāḥ
translated: these are said to be the forty-seven beyond the great ones.

original: dvāvuktāviti vijñeyo pravahotivahastathā // / / //
analyzed: dvau uktau iti pravahaḥ ūtivahaḥ tathā
translated: The two known as Pravaha and Ati-vaha should be known.

original: tathā daśavidhā jñeyā viśvedevāḥ khageśvara /
analyzed: tathā daśavidhāḥ jñeyāḥ viśvedevāḥ khageśvara
translated: O Lord of Birds, the Vishvedevas should be known to be of ten kinds.

original: śṛṇu nāmāni teṣāṃ tu purūravārdravasaṃjñakau // / / //🔽dhūrilocanasaṃjñau dvau kratudakṣetisaṃjñakau /
analyzed: śṛṇu nāmāni teṣām tu purūrava ārdrava saṃjñakau  dhūri locana saṃjñau dvau kratu dakṣa iti saṃjñakau
translated: Listen to their names - Pururava and Ardrava,🔽Dhu and Locana, Kratu and Daksha,

original: dvau satyavasusaṃjñau ca kāmakālakasaṃjñakau // / / //
analyzed: dvau satyavasu saṃjñau ca kāmakālaka saṃjñakau
translated: two Satya and Vasu, Kama and Kala,

original: evaṃ daśavidhā jñeyā viśvedevāḥ prakīrtitāḥ /
analyzed: evam daśavidhāḥ jñeyāḥ viśvedevāḥ prakīrtitāḥ
translated: thus the Vishvedevas are said to be of ten kinds.

original: tathā ṛbhugaṇaścoktastathā ca pitarastrayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tathā ṛbhu gaṇaḥ ca uktaḥ tathā ca pitaraḥ trayaḥ
translated: Similarly, the group of Rbhus is mentioned, and also the three Pitrs.

original: dyāvā pṛthivyau vijñeyau ete ca ṣaḍaśītayaḥ /
analyzed: dyāvā pṛthivyau vijñeyau ete ca ṣaḍaśītayaḥ
translated: The heaven and the earth should be known, these are the sixty-eight.

original: devāḥ prajajñire sarve nāsikadriyamāninaḥ // / / //
analyzed: devāḥ prajajñire sarve nāsikadriya māninaḥ
translated: All the gods were born, having the sense of smell as their leader.

original: ākāśasyābhimānī tu gaṇapaḥ sudāhṛtaḥ /
analyzed: ākāśasya abhimānī tu gaṇapaḥ sudāhṛtaḥ
translated: The leader of the Gaṇas is said to be the one who is proud of space.

original: ubhayatrābhi mānīti jñeyaṃ tattvārthavedibhiḥ // / / //🔽viṣvaksenaṃ vinā sarve jayādyā viṣṇupārṣadāḥ /
analyzed: ubhayatra abhi māni iti jñeyam tattva artha vedibhiḥ  viṣvaksenam vinā sarve jaya ādyāḥ viṣṇu pārṣadāḥ
translated: It should be known by those who know the truth that he is proud of both.🔽Except for Viṣvaksena, all the Viṣṇu attendants beginning with Jaya

original: abhavansamahīnāśca viṣvaksenādanantaram // / / //
analyzed: abhavan sama hīnāḥ ca viṣvaksenāt anantaram
translated: became equal and inferior after Viṣvaksena.

original: etepi nāsikāyāśca avāntaraniyāmakāḥ /
analyzed: ete api nāsikāyāḥ ca avāntara niyāmakāḥ
translated: These too are the sub-controllers of the nose.

original: ataste tattvamānibhyo hyavarāste prakīrtitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: atas te tattva mānibhyaḥ hi avarāḥ te prakīrtitāḥ
translated: Therefore, they are declared to be inferior to those who are proud of the principles.

original: sparśatattvābhimānī tu apānaścetyudāhṛtaḥ /
analyzed: sparśa tattva abhimānī tu apānaḥ ca iti udāhṛtaḥ
translated: Apāna is said to be the one who is proud of the principle of touch.

original: rūpābhimānī saṃjajñe vyāno nāma mahānprabho // / / //
analyzed: rūpa abhimānī saṃjajñe vyānaḥ nāma mahān prabho
translated: The great lord named Vyāna, who is proud of form, was born.

original: rasātmaka udānaśca samāno gandhanāmakaḥ /
analyzed: rasa ātmakaḥ udānaḥ ca samānaḥ gandha nāmakaḥ
translated: Udāna, which consists of taste, and Samāna, which is named after smell,

original: apāṃ nāthāśca catvāro marutaḥ parikīrtitāḥ // / / //🔽jayādyanantarānvakṣye samutpannānkhageśvara /
analyzed: apām nāthāḥ ca catvāraḥ marutaḥ parikīrtitāḥ  jaya ādi anantarān vakṣye samutpannān khageśvara
translated: the four lords of water are declared to be the Maruts.🔽O lord of birds, I will tell you about those born after Jaya and others.

original: pradhānāgre prathamajaḥ pāvakaḥ samudāhṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pradhāna agre prathama jaḥ pāvakaḥ samudāhṛtaḥ
translated: The first-born fire is said to be at the beginning of Pradhāna.

original: bhṛgormaharṣeḥ putraśca cyavanaḥ samudāhṛtaḥ /
analyzed: bhṛgoḥ mahā ṛṣeḥ putraḥ ca cyavanaḥ samudāhṛtaḥ
translated: The son of the great sage Bhrigu is said to be Cyavana.

original: bṛhaspateśca putrastu utathyaḥ parikīrtitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bṛhaspateḥ ca putraḥ tu utathyaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translated: The son of Brihaspati is declared to be Utathya.

original: raivataścākṣuṣaścaiva tathā svārociṣaḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: raivataḥ cākṣuṣaḥ ca eva tathā svārociṣaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Raivata, Cākṣuṣa, and also Sāvarṇi are remembered.

original: uttamo brahmasāvarṇī rudrasāvarṇireva ca // / / //
analyzed: uttamaḥ brahmasāvarṇiḥ rudrasāvarṇiḥ eva ca
translated: Uttama, Brahmā's son, and Rudra's son,

original: devasāvarṇisāvarṇirindrasāvarṇirevaca /
analyzed: devasāvarṇi sāvarṇiḥ indrasāvarṇiḥ eva ca
translated: Devā's son, Sāvarṇi, Indra's son,

original: tathaiva dakṣasāvarṇirdharmabhāvarṇireva ca // / / //
analyzed: tathā eva dakṣasāvarṇiḥ dharmabhāvarṇiḥ eva ca
translated: and also Dakṣa's son, Dharma's son,

original: ekādaśavidhā hyevaṃ manavaḥ parikīrtitāḥ /
analyzed: ekādaśavidhāḥ hi evam manavaḥ parikīrtitāḥ
translated: thus the eleven types of Manus are declared.

original: pitṝṇāṃ saptakaṃ caivetyādyāḥ saṃjajñire khaga // / / //
analyzed: pitṝṇām saptakam ca eva ityādyāḥ saṃjajñire khaga
translated: The seven groups of ancestors, and so on, were born, O bird.

original: tadanantaramutpannāstebhyo nīcāḥ śṛṇu dvija /
analyzed: tad anantaram utpannāḥ tebhyaḥ nīcāḥ śṛṇu dvija
translated: After that, listen, O Brahmin, those born lower than them.

original: varuṇasya patnī gaṅgā parjanyākhyo vibhāvasuḥ // / / //
analyzed: varuṇasya patnī gaṅgā parjanya ākhyaḥ vibhāvasuḥ
translated: Varuṇa's wife is Gaṅgā, and Vibhāvasu is called Parjanya.

original: yamabhāryā śyāmalā tu hyaniruddhapriyā virāṭ /
analyzed: yama bhāryā śyāmalā tu hi aniruddha priyā virāj
translated: Yama's wife is Śyāmā, and Virāṭ is Aniruddha's beloved.

original: brahmāṇḍamāninī saiva hyuṣānāmnā suśabditā // / / //
analyzed: brahmāṇḍa māninī sā eva hi uṣā nāmnā su śabditā
translated: She is called by the beautiful name of Uṣā, and is the wife of Brahmā.

original: rohiṇī candrabhāryoktā sūryabhāryā tu saṃjñakā /
analyzed: rohiṇī candra bhāryā uktā sūrya bhāryā tu saṃjñakā
translated: Rohiṇī is said to be the wife of the Moon, and Saṃjñā is the wife of the Sun.

original: etā gaṅgādiṣaṭūsaṃkhyā jajñire vinatāsuta // / / //
analyzed: etāḥ jajñire vinatā suta
translated: These six, beginning with Gaṅgā, were born, O son of Vinatā.

original: gaṅgādyanantaraṃ jajñe svāhā vai mantradevatā /
analyzed: gaṅgā ādi anantaram jajñe svāhā vai mantradevatā
translated: After Ganga, the deity of mantras, Svaha, was born.

original: svāhānāmāgnibhāryoktā gaṅgādibhyodhamā śrutā // / / //🔽svāhānantarajo jñeyo jñānātmā budhanāmakaḥ /🔽budhastu candraputro yaḥ svāhāyā adhamaḥ smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: svāhā nāmā agni bhāryā uktā gaṅgā ādibhyaḥ adhamā śrutā               budhaḥ tu candra putraḥ yaḥ svāhāyāḥ adhamaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Svaha, the wife of Agni, is said to be lower than Ganga and others.🔽After Svaha, one should know the one born, known as Budha, the soul of knowledge.

original: uṣā nāma tathā jajñe budhasyānantaraṃ khaga /
analyzed: uṣāḥ nāma tathā jajñe budhasya anantaram khaga
translated: Budha, who is the son of Chandra, is remembered as lower than Svaha.🔽O bird, then Ushas was born after Budha.

original: uṣānāmā bhimānī tu hyaśvibhāryā prakīrtitā // / / //
