analyzed: dvāpara sthe vāyu rūpe yādṛś vā darśayat prabhuḥ
translated: in the form of Vayu abiding in Dvapara, whatever the Lord showed,

original: vāyuḥ kaliyuge rūpe taddarśayati tādṛśam // / / //
analyzed: vāyuḥ kali yuge rūpe tat darśayati tādṛśam
translated: Vayu shows that same in the form of Kali Yuga.

original: tathā darśayate vāyurdaityānāṃ mohanāya ca /
analyzed: tathā darśayate vāyuḥ daityānām mohanāya ca
translated: And Vayu shows that way in order to delude the demons.

original: avatāreṣu vāyośca antaraṃ ye viduḥ prabho // / / //
analyzed: avatāreṣu vāyoḥ ca antaram ye viduḥ prabho
translated: Those who know the difference between Vayu and the incarnations of the Lord,

original: te 'dhaṃ tamaḥ praviśante te daityā na ca te surāḥ /
analyzed: te dham tamaḥ praviśante te daityāḥ na ca te surāḥ
translated: they enter into the lowest darkness, they are demons, not gods.

original: vāyāvapyantaraṃ nāsti haritattvavinirṇaye // / / //
analyzed: vāyau api antaram na asti hari tattva vinirṇaye
translated: In the determination of the truth of Hari, there is no difference even in Vayu.

original: nindāṃ kurvanti ye viṣṇorjihvāchedaṃ karomyaham /
analyzed: nindām kurvanti ye viṣṇoḥ jihvā chedam karomi aham
translated: I cut off the tongues of those who criticize Vishnu.

original: tadarthameva vāyośca avatāraḥ sadā bhuvi // / / //
analyzed: tad artham eva vāyoḥ ca avatāraḥ sadā bhuvi
translated: For that very purpose, the incarnation of Vayu always descends on earth.

original: guṇapūrṇasya viṣṇostu nirguṇatvavicintanam /🔽jātānandādipūrṇāṅkhyaṃ sohamityādicintanam // / / //
analyzed: guṇa pūrṇasya viṣṇoḥ tu nirguṇa tva vicintanam  jāta ānanda ādi pūrṇa āṅkhyam saḥ ham ityādi cintanam
translated: The contemplation of the qualityless nature of Vishnu, who is full of qualities,🔽The contemplation of oneself as born, blissful, and so on, and as I am that and so on,

original: cidānandātmake dehe utpattyādivicintanam /
translated: The contemplation of origination and so on in the body consisting of consciousness and bliss,

original: acchedyābhedyagātreṣu cchedabhedādicintanam // / / //
analyzed: acchedya abhedya gātreṣu cheda bheda ādi cintanam
translated: The contemplation of cutting, piercing, and so on in the body that cannot be cut or pierced,

original: devyā nityāviyoginyā viyogādivicintanam /
analyzed: devyāḥ nitya aviyoginyāḥ viyoga ādi vicintanam
translated: The contemplation of separation and so on from the Goddess who is always inseparable,

original: kleśaśokādiśūnyasya hareḥ kleśādicintanam // / / //
analyzed: kleśa śoka ādi śūnyasya hareḥ kleśa ādi cintanam
translated: The contemplation of suffering and so on in Hari, who is devoid of suffering, sorrow, and so on,

original: vyāsarāmādirūpeṣvanṛṣivipratvacintanam /🔽kṛṣṇarāmādirūpeṣu antarasya vicintanam // / / //🔽rāmakṛṣṇādirūpeṣu antarasya vicintanam /
analyzed: vyāsa rāma ādi rūpeṣu an ṛṣi vipra tva cintanam  kṛṣṇa rāma ādi rūpeṣu antarasya vicintanam  rāma kṛṣṇa ādi rūpeṣu antarasya vicintanam
translated: The contemplation of not being a sage or Brahmin in the forms of Vyasa, Rama, and so on,🔽The contemplation of the inner self in the forms of Krishna, Rama, and so on,🔽The contemplation of the inner self in the forms of Rama, Krishna, and so on,

original: rāmakṛṣṇādirūpeṣu parājayavicintanam // / / //
analyzed: rāma kṛṣṇa ādi rūpeṣu parājaya vicintanam
translated: The contemplation of defeat in the forms of Rama, Krishna, and so on,

original: santānārthaṃ tu kṛṣṇe na śivapūjādicintanam /
analyzed: santāna artham tu kṛṣṇe na śiva pūjā ādi cintanam
translated: The contemplation of Shiva worship and so on in Krishna for the sake of progeny,

original: rāmeṇa duḥ khayuktena liṅgasya sthāpanaṃ kṛtam // / / //
analyzed: rāmeṇa duḥ kha yuktena liṅgasya sthāpanam kṛtam
translated: The installation of the Linga by Rama, who was full of sorrow,

original: pañcadhātumaye kṛṣṇe harirūpavicintanam /
analyzed: pañca dhātu maye kṛṣṇe hari rūpa vicintanam
translated: The contemplation of Hari's form in Krishna, who is made of the five elements,

original: svayaṃ vyaktasthale cāpi cidā nandatvakalpanam // / / //
analyzed: svayam vyakta sthale ca api cit ā nanda tva kalpanam
translated: Even in the case of manifest forms, imagining them to be of the nature of bliss of consciousness,

original: pitṛmātṛdvijātīnāṃ harirūpatvacintanam /
analyzed: pitṛ mātṛ dvijātīnām hari rūpa tva cintanam
translated: Contemplating the form of Hari in one's father, mother, and twice-born people,

original: asvatantreṇa rudreṇa hareraikyadicintanam // / / //
analyzed: asvatantreṇa rudreṇa hareḥ aikya di cintanam
translated: Contemplating the oneness of Hari with Rudra, who is not independent,

original: viṣṇoḥ sūryeṇa sākaṃ ca abhedā divicintanam /
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ sūryeṇa sākam ca abhedāḥ
translated: Contemplating the non-difference of Vishnu with the sun,

original: sarvottamaḥ sūrya eva viṣṇvādyāstasya kiṅkarāḥ // / / //
analyzed: sarva uttamaḥ sūryaḥ eva viṣṇu ādyāḥ tasya kiṅkarāḥ
translated: The sun alone is the highest of all, Vishnu and others are his servants,

original: ityādicintanaṃ doṣo harinindeti cocyate /🔽asvayaṃ vyaktiliṅgeṣu aśvatthatulasīṣu ca // / / //
analyzed: ityādi cintanam doṣaḥ hari nindā iti ca ucyate  a svayam vyakti liṅgeṣu aśvattha tulasīṣu ca
translated: Such contemplation is said to be a fault and also a disparagement of Hari.🔽In the case of self-manifest lingas and in the case of the holy fig tree and basil plants,

original: śālagrāmaṃ vihāyaiva namanaṃ ye prakurvate /
analyzed: śālagrāmam vihāya eva namanam ye prakurvate
translated: Those who bow down without the Shālagrāma stone,

original: te sarve harinindāyāmavikāriṇa eva hi // / / //
analyzed: te sarve hari nindāyām avikāriṇaḥ eva hi
translated: All of them are indeed immutable in the disparagement of Hari.

original: mokṣādhikāriṇo ye tu ajñānātparameśvaram /
analyzed: mokṣa adhikāriṇaḥ ye tu ajñānāt parameśvaram
translated: Those who are eligible for liberation, due to ignorance,

original: pārthakyanayanaṃ yeṣu kurvanti yarhi vā prabho // / / //
analyzed: pārthakya nayanam yeṣu kurvanti yarhi vā prabho
translated: When they make distinctions between the supreme Lord, O Lord,

original: tarhi teṣāṃ hi kāleṣu duḥ khaṃ yāti na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: tarhi teṣām hi kāleṣu duḥ kham yāti na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Then there is no doubt that they experience suffering in those times.

original: ataḥ prārthakyanayanaṃ ye kurvantyeṣu sarvadā // / / //
analyzed: atas prārthakya nayanam ye kurvanti eṣu sarvadā
translated: Therefore, those who always make distinctions in these,

original: te sarve tvabudhā jñeyā nātra kāryā vicāraṇā /
analyzed: te sarve tu abudhāḥ jñeyāḥ na atra kāryā vicāraṇā
translated: All of them should be known as ignorant, there is no need for deliberation in this matter.

original: asvayaṃvyaktaliṅgeṣu namanaṃ ye prakurvate // / / //
analyzed: a svayam vyakta liṅgeṣu namanam ye prakurvate
translated: Those who bow down to the self-manifested liṅgas,

original: te sarve hyasurā jñeyā nānyathā tu kathañcana /
analyzed: te sarve hi asurāḥ jñeyāḥ na anyathā tu kathañcana
translated: all of them should be known as asuras, and not otherwise at all.

original: vihāya śūnyamaśvatthaṃ namanaṃ ye prakurvate // / / //
analyzed: vihāya śūnyam aśvattham namanam ye prakurvate
translated: Those who bow down to the empty aśvattha tree,

original: dvimāsahīnāṃ tulasīmaprasūtāṃ ca gāṃ navām /
analyzed: dvi māsa hīnām tulasīm aprasūtām ca gām navām
translated: the tulasī plant less than two months old, and the new cow that has not given birth,

original: te sarve hyasurā jñeyā nātra kāryā vicāraṇā // / / //
analyzed: te sarve hi asurāḥ jñeyāḥ na atra kāryā vicāraṇā
translated: all of them should be known as asuras. No doubt should be entertained in this matter.

original: gulmādyāśca manuṣyāntāste jñeyā brahmabāhavaḥ /
analyzed: gulma ādyāḥ ca manuṣya antāḥ te jñeyāḥ brahma bāhavaḥ
translated: Those beginning with gulma and ending with humans should be known as having the arms of Brahman.

original: asmacchatāyuḥ paryantameka eva kaliḥ smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: asmad śata āyuḥ paryantam ekaḥ eva kaliḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Only one Kali is remembered to last for the period of one hundred years of ours.

original: kalau saṃti kalpamānaṃ kalerante saṃti ca /
analyzed: kalau saṃti kalpamānam kaleḥ ante saṃti ca
translated: In Kali, they exist for the duration of a Kalpa, and at the end of Kali, they exist.

original: tasmindine brahmarūpe gacchanti ca tamontikam // / / //
analyzed: tasmin dine brahma rūpe gacchanti ca tamaḥ ntikam
translated: On that day, in the form of Brahman, they go near the darkness.

original: tatra sthitvā lokamārgaṃ pratīkṣante na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: tatra sthitvā loka mārgam pratīkṣante na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Having stayed there, they undoubtedly wait for the path of the world.

original: sādhakairviṣṇukāryāṇāṃ vāyudāsaiḥ prapīḍitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: sādhakaiḥ viṣṇu kāryāṇām vāyudāsaiḥ prapīḍitāḥ
translated: Oppressed by the servants of Vayu, the performers of Vishnu's tasks,

original: śatavarṣānantaraṃ ca sarveṣāṃ kalinā saha /
analyzed: śata varṣa anantaram ca sarveṣām kalinā saha
translated: and after one hundred years, all of them along with Kali,

original: vāyorgadāprahāreṇa liṅgabhaṅgo bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: vāyoḥ gadā prahāreṇa liṅga bhaṅgaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: the breaking of the liṅga will occur by the blow of Vayu's mace.

original: tamondhaṃ praviśantyete tāratamyena sarvaśaḥ /
analyzed: tamaḥ ndham praviśanti ete tāratamyena sarvaśas
translated: They all enter the blinding darkness in a graded manner.

original: tamasyandhepi saṃsāre nātra kāryā vicāraṇā // / / //
analyzed: tamasi andhe api saṃsāre nā atra kāryā vicāraṇā
translated: Even in this world of darkness, there is no doubt about this.

original: sarveṣāmuttamonte yaḥ kalireva na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: sarveṣām uttamaḥ nte yaḥ kaliḥ eva na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Among all, the last one is indeed Kali. There is no doubt.

original: dūṣako viṣṇubhaktānāṃ tatsamo nāsti sarvadā // / / //
analyzed: dūṣakaḥ viṣṇu bhaktānām tad samaḥ nā asti sarvadā
translated: He is the defiler of devotees of Vishnu. There is none equal to him at all times.

original: saṃsāre vāndhatamasi sarvatra haridūṣakaḥ /
analyzed: saṃsāre vā andha tamasi sarvatra hari dūṣakaḥ
translated: In this world of blinding darkness, he is the defiler of Hari everywhere.

original: mithyādāne jñānabuddhirduḥ khe ca sukhabuddhimān // / / //
analyzed: mithyā dāne jñāna buddhiḥ duḥkhe ca sukha buddhimān
translated: He has the intellect of false giving and the notion of happiness in misery.

original: tasmātkalisamo loke śivabhakto na kutracit /
analyzed: tasmāt kali samaḥ loke śiva bhaktaḥ na kutracid
translated: Therefore, nowhere in the world is there a devotee of Shiva equal to Kali.

original: duryodhanaḥ sa evokto duḥ khānantyasvarūpavān // / / //
analyzed: duryodhanaḥ saḥ eva uktaḥ duḥ kha ānantya sva rūpavān
translated: He is said to be Duryodhana, having the nature of endless misery.

original: tasmācchataguṇāṃśena kalibhāryā tu sarvadā /
analyzed: tasmāt śataguṇa aṃśena kali bhāryā tu sarvadā
translated: Therefore, Kali's wife is always a hundred times less than that.

original: alakṣmīriti vikhyātā sā loke mantharā smṛtā // / / //
analyzed: alakṣmīḥ iti vikhyātā sā loke mantharā smṛtā
translated: She is known as Alakṣmī (ill-fortune) and is remembered in the world as Mantharā.

original: tasmāddaśaguṇāṃśono vipracittistu sarvadā /
analyzed: tasmāt daśaguṇa aṃśa ūnaḥ vipracittiḥ tu sarvadā
translated: Therefore, Vipracitti is always ten times less than that.

original: jarāsaṃdhaḥ sa evoktaḥ kālanemistataḥ param // / / //
analyzed: jarāsaṃdhaḥ saḥ eva uktaḥ kālanemiḥ tatas param
translated: He is said to be Jarāsandha, and beyond him is Kālanemi.

original: tasmācchataguṇāṃśonaḥ sa tu kaṃseti viśrutaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt śataguṇa aṃśa ūnaḥ sa tu kaṃsa iti viśrutaḥ
translated: He is known as Kaṃsa, a hundred times less than that.

original: tasmātpañcaguṇairhīnau madhukraiṭabhasaṃjñakau // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt pañcaguṇaiḥ hīnau madhu kraiṭabha saṃjñakau
translated: Madhu and Kaiṭabha are known as those who are five times less than that.

original: tāveva haṃsahiḍaṃbakau jñeyau tau ca janārdana /
analyzed: tau eva haṃsa hiḍaṃbakau jñeyau tau ca janārdana
translated: O Janārdana, they should be known as Haṃsa and Hiḍambaka.

original: vipracittisamo jñeyo bhaumo vai bhūtale smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vipracitti samaḥ jñeyaḥ bhaumaḥ vai bhū tale smṛtaḥ
translated: should be known as equal to Viprachitti, and Bhouma is remembered on the earth.

original: tasmādaṣṭa guṇairucyo hariṇyakaśiṣuḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt aṣṭa guṇaiḥ ucyaḥ hariṇyakaśiṣuḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: From him, Hariṇyaśiṣu is remembered as having eight times the qualities.

original: tasmācca triguṇairhīno hiraṇyākṣo mahāsuraḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt ca triguṇaiḥ hīnaḥ hiraṇyākṣaḥ mahā asuraḥ
translated: And the great demon Hiraṇyākṣa is less by three times those qualities.

original: maṇimāṃstatsamo jñeyaḥ kiñcidūno bakaḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: maṇimān tad samaḥ jñeyaḥ kiñcid ūnaḥ bakaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Maṇimān should be known as equal to him, and Baka is remembered as slightly less.

original: tasmādviṃśadguṇairhīnastārakākhyo mahāsuraḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt viṃśadguṇaiḥ hīnaḥ tāraka ākhyaḥ mahā asuraḥ
translated: The great demon known as Tāraka is less by twenty times those qualities.

original: tasmātṣaḍguṇato hīnaḥ śaṃbaro lokakaṇṭakaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt ṣaḍguṇataḥ hīnaḥ śaṃbaraḥ loka kaṇṭakaḥ
translated: Śambara, the thorn of the world, is less by six times those qualities.

original: śaṃbarasya samo jñeyaḥ śālvo daityeṣu cādhamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śaṃbarasya samaḥ jñeyaḥ śālvaḥ daityeṣu ca adhamaḥ
translated: Śālva, the lowest among the demons, should be known as equal to Śambara.

original: śaṃbarāttu dviguṇato hiḍiṃbo nyūna ucyate /
analyzed: śaṃbarāt tu dviguṇataḥ hiḍiṃbaḥ nyūnaḥ ucyate
translated: Hiḍimbā is said to be less by two times those qualities than Śambara.

original: bāṇastato 'dhamo jñeyaḥ sa tu kīcakanāmataḥ // / / //
analyzed: bāṇaḥ tatas dhamaḥ jñeyaḥ sa tu kīcaka nāmataḥ
translated: Bāṇa should be known as the lowest, and he is named Kīcaka.

original: dvāpārakhyo mahāhāsobāṇāsurasamaḥ smṛtaḥ /
translated: Mahāhāsa, known as Dvāparākhya, is remembered as equal to demon Bāṇa.

original: tasmāddaśaguṇairhīno namucidaityasattamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt daśaguṇaiḥ hīnaḥ namuci daitya sattamaḥ
translated: The best of demons, Namuci, is less by ten times those qualities.

original: namucestusamau jñeyau pāka ilvala ityubhau /
analyzed: namuceḥ tu samau jñeyau pākaḥ ilvalaḥ iti ubhau
translated: Both Pāka and Ilvala should be known as equal to Namuci.

original: tasmāccaturguṇairhīno vātāpirdānavādhamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt caturguṇaiḥ hīnaḥ vātāpiḥ dānava adhamaḥ
translated: Vātāpi, the lowest of demons, is less by four times those qualities.

original: tasmātsārdhaguṇairhīno dhenuko nāma daityarāṭ /
analyzed: tasmāt sārdha guṇaiḥ hīnaḥ dhenukaḥ nāma daitya rāj
translated: Dhenuka, the king of demons, is less by one and a half times those qualities.

original: dhenukādardhaguṇataḥ keśī daityastu cāvaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: dhenukāt ardha guṇataḥ keśī daityaḥ tu ca avaraḥ
translated: The demon Dhenuka is half as powerful as Keshi.

original: keśīdaityasamo jñeyastṛṇāvarto mahāsuraḥ /
analyzed: keśī daitya samaḥ jñeyaḥ tṛṇāvartaḥ mahā asuraḥ
translated: The great demon Trinavarta is to be known as equal to the demon Keshi.

original: tasmāddaśaguṇairhīno haṃso nāmaramāpate // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt daśaguṇaiḥ hīnaḥ haṃsaḥ nāma ramāpate
translated: The lord of demons, named Hamsa, is ten times inferior to him.

original: tririkastu samo jñeyastatsamaḥ paurukasmṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tririkaḥ tu samaḥ jñeyaḥ tad samaḥ pauruka smṛtaḥ
translated: Trivikrama is to be known as equal to him, and Puru is remembered as equal to him.

original: vetaḥ sa eva vijñeyaḥ pūrvajanmani sattama // / / //
analyzed: vetaḥ saḥ eva vijñeyaḥ pūrva janmani sattama
translated: O best one, he is to be known as Vata in his previous birth.

original: tasmādekaguṇairhīnau kuṃbhāṇḍakakuparṇakau /
analyzed: tasmāt eka guṇaiḥ hīnau kuṃbhāṇḍaka kuparṇakau
translated: Kumbhanda and Kuparna are each one-sixth inferior to him.

original: duḥ śāsanastu vijñeyo jarāsaṃdhasamaḥ prabho // / / //🔽kaṃsena tulyo vijñeyo vikarṇo daityasattamaḥ /
analyzed: duḥ śāsanaḥ tu vijñeyaḥ jarāsaṃdha samaḥ prabho  kaṃsena tulyaḥ vijñeyaḥ vikarṇaḥ daitya sattamaḥ
translated: O lord, Dushasana is to be known as equal to Jarasandha.🔽The best of demons, Vikarna, is to be known as equal to Kansa.

original: kuṃbhakarṇācchataguṇairhīnau kradhyeti viśrutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kuṃbhakarṇāt śataguṇaiḥ hīnau kradhyā iti viśrutaḥ
translated: The famous Krodha is known as a hundred times inferior to Kumbhakarna.

original: tasmācchataguṇairhīnaḥ śatadhanvā mahāsuraḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt śataguṇaiḥ hīnaḥ śatadhanvā mahā asuraḥ
translated: The great demon Shatadhanva is a hundred times inferior to him.

original: samānastasya vijñeyaḥ karmārirdaityasattamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: samānaḥ tasya vijñeyaḥ karmāriḥ daitya sattamaḥ
translated: The best of demons, Karmari, is to be known as equal to him.

original: kālakeyastu vijñeyaḥ sadā venasamo mataḥ /
analyzed: kālakeyaḥ tu vijñeyaḥ sadā vena samaḥ mataḥ
translated: Kalakeya is to be known as always equal to Vena.

original: adhamānāṃ tu daityānāmuttamaiḥ sāmyamucyate // / / //
analyzed: adhamānām tu daityānām uttamaiḥ sāmyam ucyate
translated: The equality of the best with the worst demons is declared.

original: tatrāveśācca vijñeyaṃ devānāṃ nātra saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: tatra āveśāt ca vijñeyam devānām na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: There is no doubt that the gods are to be known by their influence.

original: tasmācchatagurṇaihīnaścittamānasuro mahān // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt śata gurṇaiḥ hīnaḥ cittamāna suraḥ mahān
translated: Therefore, the great Manasura, who is a hundred times inferior in qualities, is the mind.

original: taccharīrābhimānī tu tasmācchataguṇairvaraḥ /🔽tasmācchataguṇaihīṃno hastamānasuro mahān // / / //
analyzed: tad śarīra abhimānī tu tasmāt śataguṇaiḥ varaḥ  tasmāt śataguṇaiḥ ihi naḥ hastamāna suraḥ mahān
translated: But one who has the pride of that body is a hundred times better than him.🔽Therefore, the great Hastamanasura, who is a hundred times inferior in qualities, is the hand.

original: tasmācchataguṇairhīnaḥ pādamānasuro mahān /🔽netrendriyābhimānī tu tasmācchataguṇo varaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt śataguṇaiḥ hīnaḥ pādamāna suraḥ mahān  netra indriya abhimānī tu tasmāt śataguṇaḥ varaḥ
translated: The great Pada-manasura, who is a hundred times inferior, is the foot.🔽But one who has the pride of the sense of sight is a hundred times better than him.

original: cakṣurindriyamānī tu tasmācchataguṇo varaḥ /🔽tasmācchaguṇairhīnaḥ sparśamānasuro mahān // / / //🔽tasmācchatagurṇaihīnaścaṇḍamānasuro mahān /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ indriya mānī tu tasmāt śataguṇaḥ varaḥ  tasmāt śaguṇaiḥ hīnaḥ sparśamāna suraḥ mahān  tasmāt śata gurṇaiḥ hīnaḥ caṇḍamāna suraḥ mahān
translated: One who has the pride of the sense of sight is a hundred times better than him.🔽The great Sparsamanasura, who is a hundred times inferior in qualities, is the touch.

original: tasmācchatagurṇairhīnaḥ śiśramānasuro mahān // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt śata gurṇaiḥ hīnaḥ śiśramāna asuraḥ mahān
translated: The great Candamanasura, who is a hundred times inferior in qualities, is the anger.

original: tasmācchataguṇairhīnaḥ karmamānasuraḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt śataguṇaiḥ hīnaḥ karma māna suraḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The great Sishramanasura, who is a hundred times inferior, is remembered as the Karmamanasura.

original: kalpādyaiḥ preritāḥ sarve rudrādyā adhikāriṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kalpa ādyaiḥ preritāḥ sarve rudra ādyāḥ adhikāriṇaḥ
translated: All the authorities beginning with Rudra, urged by the Kalpas, are

original: kadācitsuviruddhaṃ ca kurvanti tava sattama /
analyzed: kadācid su viruddham ca kurvanti tava sattama
translated: sometimes very contradictory, O best one.

original: kadāpyahaṃ ca vāyuśca viruddhaṃ nācareva bhoḥ // / / //
analyzed: kadāpi aham ca vāyuḥ ca viruddham na ācara iva bhoḥ
translated: Sometimes I and Vayu do not act in a contradictory way, O Lord.

original: mūleṣvaṃśāvatāreṣu rudrādīnā mahāprabho /
analyzed: mūleṣu aṃśa avatāreṣu rudra ādīnām mahā prabho
translated: O great Lord, in the incarnations of the parts in the roots, of Rudra and others,

original: buddhirvinaśyate yasmāttasmācchinnā hi te 'khilāḥ // / / //🔽mahīpate ca madbuddhistasmādacchinnasaṃjñikaḥ /
analyzed: buddhiḥ vinaśyate yasmāt tasmāt chinnāḥ hi te khilāḥ  mahīpate ca mad buddhiḥ tasmāt acchinna saṃjñikaḥ
translated: Since the intellect is destroyed, therefore all of them are cut off.🔽O Lord of the Earth, my intellect is therefore not cut off.

original: etādṛśopyahaṃ deva na ca śaktistu nastave // / / //
analyzed: etādṛśā upi aham deva na ca śaktiḥ tu nastave
translated: Even though I am like this, O God, I do not have the power to praise You fully.

original: mahyamacchinnabhaktāya dayāṃ kuru mahāprabho /
analyzed: mahyam acchinna bhaktāya dayām kuru mahā prabho
translated: Have mercy on me, O Great Lord, who am devoted to You without interruption.

original: iti stutvā hariṃ brahmā sthitaḥ prāñja liragrataḥ // / / //
analyzed: iti stutvā harim brahmā sthitaḥ prāñja liḥ agratas
translated: Having thus praised Hari, Brahma stood before Him with folded hands.

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe dvitīyāṃśe dharmakāṇḍe śrīkṛṣṇagaruḍasaṃvāde brahmastutivarṇanaṃ nāma dvādaśo 'dyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe dvitīya aṃśe dharmakāṇḍe śrī kṛṣṇa garuḍa saṃvāde brahmastutivarṇanam nāma dvādaśaḥ dyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twelfth chapter in the second section of the Dharma section in the glorious Garuda Purana, describing the praise of Brahma.

original: śrīgaruḍamahāpurāṇam
analyzed: śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam
translated: The Glorious Garuda Mahapurana

original: śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /
analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Shri Krishna said:

original: iti stutaḥ sa bhagavān svapūtreṇa dayānidhiḥ /
analyzed: iti stutaḥ sa bhagavān sva pūtreṇa dayā nidhiḥ
translated: Thus praised by His own son, the Lord, the abode of mercy,

original: medhagaṃbhīrayā vācā provāca madhusūdanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: medha gaṃbhīrayā vācā provāca madhusūdanaḥ
translated: The slayer of Madhu spoke in a voice deep like the clouds.

original: sṛja brahmannimāndevānmatprasādātkrameṇa ca /
analyzed: sṛja brahman imān devān mad prasādāt krameṇa ca
translated: Create these gods, O Brahma, in due order, by my grace.

original: yathā vai prākkṣaṇetadvatsṛja sarvaṃ mahāprabho // / / //
analyzed: yathā vai prāk kṣaṇā itadvat sṛja sarvam mahā prabho
translated: As it was done before, so create everything, O Great Lord.

original: nāsti prayojanaṃ tena tava matprītaye sṛja /
analyzed: na asti prayojanam tena tava mad prītaye sṛja
translated: There is no purpose in that. Create for my satisfaction.

original: evamuktastu hāriṇā brahmā stutvā hariṃ param // / / //
analyzed: evam uktaḥ tu hāriṇā brahmā stutvā harim param
translated: Thus addressed by Hari, Brahma, having praised the Supreme Hari,

original: sṛṣṭiṃ kartuṃ mano dadhre prīṇayanneva mādhavam /
analyzed: sṛṣṭim kartum manaḥ dadhre prīṇayan eva mādhavam
translated: He set his mind on creation, pleasing Madhava (Vishnu) himself.

original: mahattatvātmako brahmā vāyuṃ jīvabhimāninam // / / //
analyzed: mahat tatva ātmakaḥ brahmā vāyum jīva abhimāninam
translated: Brahma, consisting of the principle of Mahat, first created Vayu, who considers himself as the individual soul.

original: ādau sasarja garuḍa puruṣātmā sa eva ca /
analyzed: ādau sasarja garuḍa puruṣa ātmā saḥ eva ca
translated: O Garuda, he himself, having the form of a man, created Daksha.

original: tato dakṣiṇahastāttu brahmāṇīṃ bhārantī tathā // / / // /🔽asṛjatte mahābhāge avyaktasya niyāmike /
analyzed: tatas dakṣiṇa hastāt tu brahmāṇīm bhārantī tathā  asṛjat te mahābhāge avyaktasya niyāmike
translated: Then from his right hand, Brahma created Brahmani, who is his wife.🔽O greatly fortunate one, they are the controllers of the unmanifest.

original: vāmahastātsatyaputro mahattatvātmako 'nalaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vāma hastāt satya putraḥ mahat tatva ātmakaḥ nalaḥ
translated: From his left hand, the son of Satya, the fire consisting of the principle of Mahat, was created.

original: brahmaṇo dakṣiṇāddhastādahaṅkārātmako haraḥ /
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ dakṣiṇāt hastāt ahaṅkāra ātmakaḥ haraḥ
translated: From Brahma's right hand, Hara, consisting of the principle of ego, was created.

original: ādau śeṣastato jajñe garuḍatadanantaram // / / //
analyzed: ādau śeṣaḥ tatas jajñe garuḍa tad anantaram
translated: After him, Sesha was born, then Garuda, and after him,

original: tadanantarajo rudraḥ sa evaṃ sṛṣṭavānprabhuḥ /
analyzed: tad anantara jaḥ rudraḥ saḥ evam sṛṣṭavān prabhuḥ
translated: Rudra. The lord created thus.

original: svotpattyanantaraṃ brahmā daśavarṣānmahāprabhuḥ // / / //
analyzed: sva utpatti anantaram brahmā daśa varṣāt mahā prabhuḥ
translated: Brahma, the great lord, after his own creation, created Vayu after ten years.

original: vāyumuttpādrayāmāsa vatsarānantare prabhuḥ /🔽gāyatrīṃ janayāmāsa vāyorutpattyanantaram // / / //🔽saṃvatsarānantare tu bhāratīmasṛjatprabhuḥ /
analyzed: vāyum uttpādrayāmāsa vatsara anantare prabhuḥ  gāyatrīm janayāmāsa vāyoḥ utpatti anantaram  saṃvatsara anantare tu bhāratīm asṛjat prabhuḥ
translated: The lord created Gâyatrî after the creation of Vâyu.🔽The lord created Bharata after one year.

original: bhāratyanantaraṃ śeṃ divyasāhasravatsarāt // / / //
analyzed: bhāratī anantaram śeṃ divya sāhasra vatsarāt
translated: After Bharata, Shakra was created after one thousand divine years.

original: anantaraṃ saṃbabhūva garuḍastu tataḥ param /
analyzed: anantaram saṃbabhūva garuḍaḥ tu tatas param
translated: Then Garuḍa was born.

original: divyasāhasravarṣāttu tathā rudrañca sṛṣṭavān // / / //
analyzed: divya sāhasra varṣāt tu tathā rudran ca sṛṣṭavān
translated: After a thousand divine years, he created Rudra.

original: śeṣasyānantaraṃ devīṃ vāruṇīṃ ca mahāprabhuḥ /
analyzed: śeṣasya anantaram devīm vāruṇīm ca mahā prabhuḥ
translated: After Śeṣa, the great lord created the goddess Vāruṇī.

original: daśavarṣānantaraṃ tu hyasṛjatkamalāsanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: daśa varṣa anantaram tu hi asṛjat kamalāsanaḥ
translated: After ten years, the Lotus-born one created her.

original: garuḍānantaraṃ devīṃ sauparṇīmasṛjatprabhuḥ /
analyzed: garuḍa anantaram devīm sauparṇīm asṛjat prabhuḥ
translated: After Garuḍa, the lord created the goddess Sauparṇī.

original: daśavarṣānantaraṃ ca pārvatīṃ ca tathaiva saḥ // / / //
analyzed: daśa varṣa anantaram ca pārvatīm ca tathā eva saḥ
translated: After ten years, he also created Pārvatī.

original: pārvatyanantaraṃ candraṃ manastattvaniyāmakam /
translated: After Pārvatī, he created the moon, the regulator of the principle of mind.

original: daśavarṣānantaraṃ tu vāsavaṃ hyasṛjattataḥ // / / //
analyzed: daśa varṣa anantaram tu vāsavam hi asṛjat tatas
translated: After ten years, he then created Indra.

original: abhimānī dakṣiṇasya bāhośca parameṣṭhinaḥ /
analyzed: abhimānī dakṣiṇasya bāhoḥ ca parameṣṭhinaḥ
translated: The lord of the southern arm of the Supreme Being is said to be the embodiment of pride.

original: daśavarṣānantaraṃ tu śacī tāmasṛjatprabhuḥ // / / //
analyzed: daśa varṣa anantaram tu śacī tām asṛjat prabhuḥ
translated: After ten years, the lord created Śacī.

original: indrasyānantaraṃ kāmaṃ triṃśadvarṣādanantaram /
analyzed: indrasya anantaram kāmam triṃśat varṣāt anantaram
translated: After Indra, after thirty years, he created Kāma.

original: asṛjadvāmabāhoścamanastatvābhimāninam // / / //🔽tadanantarajāṃ devīṃ daśavarṣādanantaram /
analyzed: asṛjat vāma bāhoḥ camanaḥ tatva abhimāninam  tad anantara jām devīm daśa varṣāt anantaram
translated: He created the embodiment of the principle of mind in the left arm.

original: ratiṃ sa janayāmāsa kāmabhāryāṃ mahāprabhuḥ // / / //
analyzed: ratim sa janayāmāsa kāma bhāryām mahā prabhuḥ
translated: After that, after ten years, the great lord created Rati, the wife of Kāma.

original: kāmasyāpyabhimānī tu sa eva parikīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: kāmasya api abhimānī tu saḥ eva parikīrtitaḥ
translated: He is said to be the embodiment of Kāma.

original: brahmāhaṅkārikaṃ prāṇaṃ kāryotpatteranantaram // / / //
analyzed: brahma āhaṅkārikam prāṇam kārya utpatteḥ anantaram
translated: Brahma created the life-force born of egoism immediately after the creation of effects.

original: daśavarṣānantaraṃ tu nirmame nāsika tataḥ /🔽tasya bhāryāṃ nāsikasyaḥ pañcavarṣādanantaram // / / //
analyzed: daśa varṣa anantaram tu nirmame nāsika tatas  tasya bhāryām nāsikasyaḥ pañca varṣāt anantaram
translated: Ten years later, he then created the nose.

original: nirmame nāsikāṃ vāmāṃ brahmā lokapitāmahaḥ /
analyzed: nirmame nāsikām vāmām brahmā lokapitāmahaḥ
translated: Five years later, Brahma, the grandfather of the worlds, created the wife of the nose, the left nostril.

original: ahaṅkārādanu brahmā sajñānaṃ ca bṛhaspatim // / / //
analyzed: ahaṅkārāt anu brahmā sa jñānam ca bṛhaspatim
translated: After egoism, Brahma created Brihaspati, who possesses knowledge,

original: nirmame ca varṣayugmapañcavarṣādanantaram /
analyzed: nirmame ca varṣa yugma pañca varṣāt anantaram
translated: five years after the creation of the nose, and two years after the creation of the nose.

original: pañcavarṣānantaraṃ tu tārāṃ bhāryāṃ vinirmame // / / //
analyzed: pañca varṣa anantaram tu tārām bhāryām vinirmame
translated: Five years later, he created Tara as his wife.

original: guroranantaraṃ brahmā pañcaviṃśādanantaram /
analyzed: guroḥ anantaram brahmā pañcaviṃśāt anantaram
translated: After the preceptor, Brahma, twenty-five years later,

original: svāyaṃbhuvaṃ manuṃ caiva nirmame manasā vibhuḥ // / / //
analyzed: svāyaṃbhuvam manum ca eva nirmame manasā vibhuḥ
translated: the powerful one created Manu, the self-existent one, through his mind.

original: pañcavarṣānantaraṃ tu śatarūpāṃ vinirmame /
analyzed: pañca varṣa anantaram tu śatarūpām vinirmame
translated: Five years later, he created Shatarupa.

original: śatarūpānantaraṃ tu viṃśadvarṣadināntaram // / / //
analyzed: śata rūpa anantaram tu viṃśat varṣa dina antaram
translated: After Shatarupa, twenty years later,

original: dakṣaḥ śiṣyātmako jajñe dakṣiṇāṅguṣṭhataḥ prabhoḥ /
analyzed: dakṣaḥ śiṣya ātmakaḥ jajñe dakṣiṇa aṅguṣṭhataḥ prabhoḥ
translated: Daksha, consisting of disciples, was born from the right thumb of the Lord.

original: pañcavarṣānantaraṃ tu vāmāṅguṣṭhāccaturmukhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pañca varṣa anantaram tu vāma aṅguṣṭhāt caturmukhaḥ
translated: Five years later, from the left thumb of the four-faced one,

original: prasūtimasṛjadbrahmā sṛṣṭyarthaṃ paramādarāt /
analyzed: prasūtim asṛjat brahmā sṛṣṭi artham parama ādarāt
translated: Brahma created Prasuti for the purpose of creation with great respect.

original: dakṣasyānantaraṃ brahmā pañcaviṃśādanantaram // / / //
analyzed: dakṣasya anantaram brahmā pañcaviṃśāt anantaram
translated: After Daksha, Brahma, after twenty-five,

original: nirmame hyaniruddhaṃ ca madhyamāṅguliparvataḥ /
analyzed: nirmame hi aniruddham ca madhyamāṅguli parvataḥ
translated: Created Aniruddha, from the middle joint of the finger.

original: pañcavarṣānantaraṃ tu sasarja bhagavānajaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pañca varṣa anantaram tu sasarja bhagavān ajaḥ
translated: After five years, the unborn Lord

original: virājasaṃjñakāṃ bhāryāṃ madhyamāṅguliparvataḥ /
analyzed: virāja saṃjñakām bhāryām madhyamāṅguli parvataḥ
translated: Created Viraja, his wife, from the middle joint of the finger.

original: aniruddhānantara tu śatavarṣādanantaram // / / //
analyzed: tu śata varṣāt anantaram
translated: After Aniruddha, after a hundred years,

original: nirmame pravahaṃ vāyuṃ kaniṣṭhāṅguliparvataḥ /
analyzed: nirmame pravaham vāyum kaniṣṭhā aṅguli parvataḥ
translated: The Lord created Pravaha Vayu, from the last joint of the finger.

original: daśavarṣānantaraṃ tu pravāhīṃ nirmame prabhuḥ // / / //
analyzed: daśa varṣa anantaram tu pravāhīm nirmame prabhuḥ
translated: After ten years, the Lord created Pravaha,

original: kaniṣṭhāṅguliparvācca vāmadevaṃ na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: kaniṣṭhā aṅguli parvāt ca vāmadevam na saṃśayaḥ
translated: From the last joint of the finger, Vamadeva, there is no doubt.

original: pravahānantaraṃ tabrahmā śatavarṣādanantaram // / / //
analyzed: pravaha anantaram śata varṣāt anantaram
translated: After Pravaha, Brahma, after a hundred years,

original: yamaṃ vinirmame pṛṣṭhādaṣṭavarṣādanantaram /
analyzed: yamam vinirmame pṛṣṭhāt aṣṭa varṣāt anantaram
translated: Created Yama, from the back, after eight years.

original: tadbhāryāṃ śāmalāṃ devīṃ tasmādeva mahāprabhuḥ // / / //
analyzed: tad bhāryām śāmalām devīm tasmāt eva mahā prabhuḥ
translated: The great Lord created his wife Shayama, from the same place.

original: yamasyānantaraṃ candraṃ triṃśadvarṣādanantaram /
analyzed: yamasya anantaram candram triṃśat varṣāt anantaram
translated: After Yama, the moon, after thirty years,

original: asṛjaddakṣiṇācchotrācchotratattvaniyāmakam // / / //
analyzed: asṛjat dakṣiṇāt śotrāt śotra tattva niyāmakam
translated: The Lord created from the right ear, the regulator of the tattva of the ear.

original: navavarṣānantaraṃ tu rohiṇīsamṛjatprabhuḥ /
analyzed: nava varṣa anantaram tu rohiṇī samṛjat prabhuḥ
translated: After nine years, the Lord created Rohini,

original: vāmaśrotrācca garuḍaṃ vāmaśrotrābhimāninam // / / //🔽candrasyānantaraṃ sūryaṃ viṃśadvarṣādanantaram /
analyzed: vāma śrotrāt ca garuḍam vāma śrotra abhimāninam  candrasya anantaram sūryam viṃśat varṣāt anantaram
translated: And from the left ear, Garuḍa, who takes pride in the left ear.

original: samyagvinirmame brahmā dakṣiṇākṣṇaśca devatām // / / //
analyzed: samyak vinirmame brahmā dakṣiṇa akṣṇaḥ ca devatām
translated: After twenty years from the moon, Brahmā properly created the deity from his right eye.

original: vāmākṣṇo nirmame saṃjñāṃ ṣaḍvarṣānantaraṃ prabhuḥ /🔽sūryasyānantaraṃ brahmā śatavarṣādanantaram // / / //
analyzed: nirmame saṃjñām ṣaṣ varṣa anantaram prabhuḥ  sūryasya anantaram brahmā śata varṣāt anantaram
translated: The lord created Saṃjñā after six years from the left eye.

original: rasanendriyācca varuṇaṃ nirmame tasya māninam /🔽viṃśadvarṣānantaraṃ tu tasmādevedriyātprabhuḥ // / / //
analyzed: rasanā indriyāt ca varuṇam nirmame tasya māninam  viṃśat varṣa anantaram tu tasmāt evedriyāt prabhuḥ
translated: After a hundred years from the sun, Brahmā created Varuṇa, who takes pride in that sense organ.

original: gaṅgāṃ vinirmame brahmā rasanendriyadevatām /🔽varuṇasyānantaraṃ tu daśavarṣādanantaram // / / //
analyzed: gaṅgām vinirmame brahmā rasana indriya devatām  varuṇasya anantaram tu daśa varṣāt anantaram
translated: The lord created Gaṅgā, the deity of the sense of taste, from that very sense organ after twenty years.

original: utsaṃgānnirmame brahmā nāradaṃ bhagavatpriyam /🔽nāradasyānantaraṃ tu ṣaṣṭivarṣādanantaram // / / //
analyzed: utsaṃgāt nirmame brahmā nāradam bhagavat priyam  nāradasya anantaram tu ṣaṣṭi varṣāt anantaram
translated: After ten years from Varuṇa, Brahmā created Nārada, dear to the lord, from his lap.

original: agniṃ vinirmame brahmātvagindriyataḥ prabhuḥ /
analyzed: agnim vinirmame brahmā tvac indriyataḥ prabhuḥ
translated: After sixty years from Nārada, the lord Brahmā created Agni from the sense of touch.

original: ato vāgabhimānī saṃ pañcavarṣādanantaram // / / //
analyzed: atas vāc abhimānī sam pañca varṣāt anantaram
translated: Then, after five years, Svāhā, who takes pride in speech, was created.

original: svāhāṃ vinirmame brahmā tāmāhurmantradevatām /
analyzed: svāhām vinirmame brahmā tām āhuḥ mantradevatām
translated: Brahmā created Svāhā, whom they call the deity of mantras.

original: agneranantaraṃ vīndra bhṛguṃ brahmarṣisattamam // / / //
analyzed: agneḥ anantaram vi indra bhṛgum brahma ṛṣi sattamam
translated: After Agni, O Indra, Brahma created Bhrigu, the best of the Brahmana sages.

original: daśavarṣānantaraṃ tu bhruvormadhyādvinirmame /
analyzed: daśa varṣa anantaram tu bhruvoḥ madhyāt vinirmame
translated: After ten years, he created from the middle of his eyebrows

original: saṃvatsarānantaraṃ tu bhṛgubhāryāṃ vinirmame // / / //🔽bhṛgoranantaraṃ brahmā śatavarṣādanantaram /
analyzed: saṃvatsara anantaram tu bhṛgu bhāryām vinirmame  bhṛgoḥ anantaram brahmā śata varṣāt anantaram
translated: After one year, he created Bhrigu's wife.

original: kaśyapañjanayāmāsa manasā ca svayaṃ prabhuḥ // / / //
analyzed: kaśyapam janayāmāsa manasā ca svayam prabhuḥ
translated: After Bhrigu, Brahma, the lord, created Kashyapa in his mind, after one hundred years.

original: saṃvatsarānantaraṃ tu aditiṃ nirmame prabhuḥ /🔽kaśyapānantaraṃ cātriṃ daśavarṣādanantaram // / / //🔽atreranantaraṃ brahmā daśavarṣādanantaram /
analyzed: saṃvatsara anantaram tu aditim nirmame prabhuḥ  kaśyapa anantaram ca atrim daśa varṣāt anantaram  atreḥ anantaram brahmā daśa varṣāt anantaram
translated: After Kashyapa, the lord created Aditi after one year.🔽After Kashyapa, Brahma created Atri after ten years.

original: ajījanadbharadvājaṃ vasiṣṭha tadanataram // / / //🔽daśavarṣānantaraṃ tu teṣāṃ bhāryāḥ krameṇa tu /
analyzed: ajījanat bharadvājam vasiṣṭha tad anataram  daśa varṣa anantaram tu teṣām bhāryāḥ krameṇa tu
translated: After Atri, Brahma created Bharadvaja after ten years, and after him, Vasishtha.🔽After ten years, he created their wives in order.

original: saṃvatsarānantareṇa asṛjatkamalāsanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: saṃvatsara anantareṇa asṛjat kamalāsanaḥ
translated: After one year, the lotus-seated one created them.

original: vasiṣṭhasyānantaraṃ tu gautamaṃ hyasṛjatprabhuḥ /
analyzed: vasiṣṭhasya anantaram tu gautamam hi asṛjat prabhuḥ
translated: After Vasishtha, the lord created Gautama.

original: daśavarṣānantareṇa jamadagniṃ tato 'sṛjat // / / //
analyzed: daśa varṣa anantareṇa jamadagnim sṛjat
translated: After ten years, he created Jamadagni.

original: daśavarṣānantareṇa manurvaivasvato 'bhavat /
analyzed: daśa varṣa anantareṇa manuḥ vaivasvataḥ bhavat
translated: After ten years, Manu Vaivasvata came into being.

original: manoranantaraṃ jajñe śatavarṣādanantaram // / / //
analyzed: manoḥ anantaram jajñe śata varṣāt anantaram
translated: After Manu, after a hundred years,

original: viṣvakseno mahābhāgo vāyuputro mahābalaḥ /
analyzed: viṣvaksenaḥ mahābhāgaḥ vāyuputraḥ mahā balaḥ
translated: Visvaksena, the greatly fortunate son of Vayu, the greatly powerful one,

original: tasmāccaturdaśe varṣe gaṇapo hyabhavadvibhoḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt caturdaśe varṣe gaṇapaḥ hi abhavat vibhoḥ
translated: And after fourteen years, Ganapati became the lord's son.

original: tadanantarajo vīndra aṣṭavarṣādanantaram /
analyzed: tad anantara jaḥ vīndra aṣṭa varṣāt anantaram
translated: After him, O Indra of the gods, after eight years,

original: dhanapo hyabhavattatra tadbhāryā vatsare pare // / / //
analyzed: dhanapaḥ hi abhavat tatra tad bhāryā vatsare pare
translated: Dhanapati was born, and his wife a year later.

original: viṣvaksenānantaraṃ tu daśavarṣādanantaram /🔽jayādīnbha gavadbhaktānsṛṣṭavān kamalāsanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: viṣvaksena anantaram tu daśa varṣāt anantaram  jaya ādīn bha gavat bhaktān sṛṣṭavān kamalāsanaḥ
translated: After Visvaksena, after ten years,🔽Brahma, the lotus-seated one, created Jaya and other devotees of the Lord.

original: jayādyānantaraṃ brahmā vallādyāḥ karmadevatāḥ /
analyzed: jaya ādya anantaram brahmā valla ādyāḥ karma devatāḥ
translated: After Jaya and others, Brahma created Vala and other deities of action,

original: śatavarṣānantaraṃ tu sṛṣṭavāñchivavāhanam // / / //
analyzed: śata varṣa anantaram tu sṛṣṭavān śiva vāhanam
translated: And after a hundred years, he created Shiva's vehicle.

original: karmadevānantaraṃ tu triṃśadvarṣādanantaram /
analyzed: karma deva anantaram tu triṃśat varṣāt anantaram
translated: After the deities of action, after thirty years,

original: parjanyamasṛjbrahmā mantrayantrābhimāninam // / / //
analyzed: parjanyam asṛj brahmā mantra yantra abhimāninam
translated: Brahma created Parjanya, who is the embodiment of mantras and yantras.

original: parjanyānantaraṃ brahmā daśavarṣādanantaram /
analyzed: parjanya anantaram brahmā daśa varṣāt anantaram
translated: After Parjanya, Brahma, after ten years,

original: puṣkaraṃ janayāmāsa karmatattvābhimāninam // / / //
analyzed: puṣkaram janayāmāsa karma tattva abhimāninam
translated: Created Pushkara, who is the embodiment of the principle of action.

original: evaṃ vinirmame brahmā matprasādātkhageśvara /
analyzed: evam vinirmame brahmā mad prasādāt khageśvara
translated: Thus, O lord of birds, Brahma created these by my grace.

original: evaṃ jñātvā mokṣameti nānyathā tu kathañcana // / / //
analyzed: evam jñātvā mokṣam eti na anyathā tu kathañcana
translated: Knowing this, one attains liberation, not otherwise at all.

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe śrīkṛṣṇagaruḍasaṃvāde uttarakhaṇḍe tṛtīyāṃśe brahmakāṇḍe devotpattinirūpaṇaṃ nāma trayodaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe śrī kṛṣṇa garuḍa saṃvāde uttara khaṇḍe tṛtīya aṃśe brahmakāṇḍe devotpattinirūpaṇam nāma trayodaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirteenth chapter in the Third Section in the Uttara-Khanda of the Srimad-Bhagavata-Maha-Purana, describing the creation of the gods.

original: śrīgaruḍamahāpurāṇam
analyzed: śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam
translated: Sri Garuda Maha Purana

original: śrīgaruḍa uvāca /
analyzed: śrī garuḍaḥ uvāca
translated: Sri Garuda said:

original: avatārānhare brūhi tathā lakṣmyā divaukasām /
analyzed: avatārān hare brūhi tathā lakṣmyāḥ divaukasām
translated: Tell me about the incarnations of Hari, Lakshmi, and the gods,

original: guṇānāmantara brūhi śiṣyasya mama savrata // / / //
analyzed: guṇānām antara brūhi śiṣyasya mama savrata
translated: And the differences in their qualities, O my disciple, who is devoted to me.

original: śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /
analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Sri Krishna said:

original: yo mūlarūpī bhagavānananto brahmādibhiḥ purṇaguṇaḥ svatantraḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ mūla rūpī bhagavān anantaḥ brahma ādibhiḥ purṇa guṇaḥ svatantraḥ
translated: The original, infinite Lord, who is independent and has all perfect qualities like Brahma and others,

original: purātanaḥ pūrṇatanurmadātmā na tādṛśāḥ saṃti kadāpi vīdra // / / //
analyzed: purātanaḥ pūrṇa tanuḥ mad ātmā na tādṛśāḥ saṃti kadāpi
translated: The ancient, perfect-bodied one, whose self is in me, there are never any like him, O Garuda.

original: pādaśca pūrṇaḥ pādatalaṃ ca pūrṇaṃ nakhāśca pūrṇāḥ kaṭikaṇṭhau ca pūrṇau /
analyzed: pādaḥ ca pūrṇaḥ pāda talam ca pūrṇam nakhāḥ ca pūrṇāḥ kaṭi kaṇṭhau ca pūrṇau
translated: The foot is complete, the sole of the foot is complete, the nails are complete, the waist and neck are complete,

original: ūrū ca pūrṇe udaraṃ ca pūrṇaṃ labdhvāpi pūrṇāñjagṛhe tathāpyuraḥ // / / //
analyzed: ūrū ca pūrṇe udaram ca pūrṇam labdhvā api pūrṇān jagṛhe tathā api uraḥ
translated: The thighs are complete, the belly is complete, having obtained the complete ones, he still held the chest.

original: skandhaḥ supūrṇāḥ sakalāśca bāhavaḥ pūrṇāḥ keśāḥ śmaśrudantāśca pūrṇāḥ /
analyzed: skandhaḥ su pūrṇāḥ sakalāḥ ca bāhavaḥ pūrṇāḥ keśāḥ śmaśru dantāḥ ca pūrṇāḥ
translated: The shoulders are very full, and all the arms are complete, the hair, beard, and teeth are complete,

original: lomāni pūrṇāni tathaiva romakūpāśca pūrṇāstu tathaiva śiśraḥ // / / //
analyzed: lomāni pūrṇāni tathā eva romakūpāḥ ca pūrṇāḥ tu tathā eva śiśraḥ
translated: The hairs are full, and likewise the hair follicles are full, and likewise the neck.

original: aṇḍaśca pūrṇo hyaṇḍaromāṇi kakṣāścakṣuśca śrotre sarva ete ca pūrṇāḥ /
analyzed: aṇḍaḥ ca pūrṇaḥ hi aṇḍa romāṇi kakṣāḥ cakṣuḥ ca śrotre sarve ete ca pūrṇāḥ
translated: The testicles are full, and the pubic hair, the armpits, the eyes, and the ears are all full.

original: kiṃ varṇaye mūlarūpaṃ hareśca yāvadvalaṃ pūrṇaṃ samagradehe // / / //
analyzed: kim varṇaye mūla rūpam hareḥ ca yāvat valam pūrṇam samagra dehe
translated: What can I describe as the original form of Hari? As far as the full strength is present in the entire body,

original: tāvadbralaṃ hyekaromādikeṣu saṃtitvime hi yataḥ sa eva pūrṇaḥ /
analyzed: tāvat bralam hi eka roma ādikeṣu hi yatas saḥ eva pūrṇaḥ
translated: to that extent there is strength in each hair and so on. For they are full because he is full.

original: sa eva tu sarvasya kartā sa eva harthā sa tu sārāṃśabhoktā // / / //
analyzed: saḥ eva tu sarvasya kartā saḥ eva harthā sa tu sāra aṃśa bhoktā
translated: But he alone is the creator of all, he alone is the destroyer, he alone is the enjoyer of the essence.

original: asārāṃśaṃ naiva bhoktā haristu sārānvakṣye śṛṇu pakṣīndra samyak /🔽drākṣekṣusāraṃ nārikelasya sāraṃ cūtasya sāraṃ panasasyāpi sāram // / / //
analyzed: asāra aṃśam nā eva bhoktā hariḥ tu sārān vakṣye śṛṇu pakṣi indra samyak  drākṣā ikṣu sāram nārikelasya sāram cūtasya sāram panasasya api sāram
translated: Hari does not enjoy the inessential parts. I will tell you the essence properly, O lord of birds.🔽The essence of grapes, sugarcane, coconut, mango, jackfruit,

original: nāraṅgasāraṃ kramukasyāpi sāraṃ kharjūrasāraṃ kadalīphalasya /
analyzed: nāraṅga sāram kramukasya api sāram kharjūra sāram kadalī phalasya
translated: The essence of orange, betel nut, date, and banana,

original: nārāyaṇo bījarūpasya sāraṃ gṛhṇāti nityaṃ bhaktavaryo dayāluḥ // / / //
analyzed: nārāyaṇaḥ bīja rūpasya sāram gṛhṇāti nityam bhakta varyaḥ dayāluḥ
translated: The compassionate best devotee Narayana always takes the essence of the seed form.

original: tāmbūlasāraṃ khadirasya sāraṃ puṣpasya sāraṃ candanasyāpi sāram /
analyzed: tāmbūla sāram khadirasya sāram puṣpasya sāram candanasya api sāram
translated: The essence of betel nut, khadira, flower, and sandalwood,

original: godhūmasāraṃ yavānāṃ ca sāraṃ māṣasya sāraṃ hareṇośca sāram // / / //🔽śuddhaṃ tathā vrīhinīvārasāraṃ śyāmākasāraṃ śuddhadhānyasya sāram // / / //
analyzed: godhūma sāram yavānām ca sāram māṣasya sāram hareṇoḥ ca sāram  śuddham tathā vrīhi nīvāra sāram śyāmāka sāram śuddha dhānyasya sāram
translated: The essence of wheat, the essence of barley, the essence of beans, the essence of lentils,🔽The essence of pure rice and paddy, the essence of shyamaka rice, the essence of pure grains,

original: niṣiddhānsarvaśākasya sārāṃstathā nipiddhāllāṃvaṇasvāpi sārān /
analyzed: niṣiddhān sarva śākasya sārān tathā sārān
translated: The essences of all prohibited vegetables, and the essences of prohibited sour things,

original: gṛhṇāti viṣṇuḥ paramādareṇa annasya sāraṃ bhakṣyabhojyasya sāram // / / //
analyzed: gṛhṇāti viṣṇuḥ parama ādareṇa annasya sāram bhakṣya bhojyasya sāram
translated: Vishnu accepts with great respect, the essence of food, the essence of edible things,

original: sūpasya sāraṃ paramānnasya sāraṃ dugdhasya sāraṃ dadhitakrasya sāram /
analyzed: sūpasya sāram paramānnasya sāram dugdhasya sāram dadhi takrasya sāram
translated: The essence of soup, the essence of fine food, the essence of milk, the essence of curd and buttermilk,

original: ghṛtasya sāraṃ rāmaṭhasyāpi sāraṃ gṛhṇāti viṣṇuḥ sarṣapasyāpi sāram // / / //🔽marīcasāraṃ jīrakasyāpi sāraṃ tathā havirghṛtapakvasya sāram /
analyzed: ghṛtasya sāram rāmaṭhasya api sāram gṛhṇāti viṣṇuḥ sarṣapasya api sāram  marīca sāram jīrakasya api sāram tathā haviḥ ghṛta pakvasya sāram
translated: The essence of ghee, the essence of ramatha, and the essence of mustard, Vishnu accepts,🔽The essence of maricha, the essence of jiraka, and the essence of ghee-cooked oblations,

original: taileṣu pakvasya ca bharjitasya guḍasya sāraṃ navanītasya sāram // / / //
analyzed: taileṣu pakvasya ca bharjitasya guḍasya sāram navanītasya sāram
translated: The essence of oil-cooked and fried food, the essence of jaggery, and the essence of fresh butter,

original: lavaṅgasāraṃ śarkarāyāśca sāramityādisārān vāsudevastu bhukte /
analyzed: lavaṅga sāram śarkarāyāḥ ca sāram iti ādi sārān vāsudevaḥ tu bhukte
translated: The essence of lavanga, and the essence of sugar - such essences, Vasudeva eats.

original: lakṣmīpatiḥ sarvajagannivā sastasyājñayā vāsudevopi nityam // / / //
analyzed: lakṣmīpatiḥ sarva jagat nivā saḥ tasya ājñayā vāsudevaḥ api nityam
translated: The lord of Lakshmi, the abode of all worlds, always eats by her command, Vasudeva also,

original: taccheṣasārānapi cāvanīśo mahātmanoṃśāñchṛṇu śiṣyavarya /
analyzed: tad śeṣa sārān api mahātmanaḥ oṃśān śṛṇu śiṣya varya
translated: O Lord of the Earth, listen to the essence of the remaining parts of the great soul, O best of disciples.

original: evaṃ vimūḍhā vāsudevasya bhaktāḥ kiṃ vaktavyaṃ viṣṇubhaktā hi loke // / / //
analyzed: evam vimūḍhāḥ vāsudevasya bhaktāḥ kim vaktavyam viṣṇu bhaktāḥ hi loke
translated: Thus, the devotees of Vāsudeva are deluded. What need be said about the devotees of Viṣṇu in the world?

original: kalyāṇāste sārabhoktāra eva naiṣāṃ bhavettena duḥ khābhivṛddhiḥ /
analyzed: kalyāṇāḥ te sāra bhoktāraḥ eva nā eṣām bhavet tena duḥ kha abhivṛddhiḥ
translated: They are fortunate, they are the enjoyers of essence. Therefore, their suffering will not increase.

original: bhuñjanti ye vaiśvadevaṃ vihāya duṣṭāṃstānvai bhukticinttāṃśca viddhi // / / //
analyzed: bhuñjanti ye vaiśvadevam vihāya duṣṭān tān vai bhukti cinttān ca viddhi
translated: Know those who enjoy without offering Vaiśvadeva as wicked and concerned only with enjoyment.

original: vakṣye viśeṣaṃ vaiśvadeve khagendra gopyaṃ no vadānyatra vidvān /
analyzed: vakṣye viśeṣam vaiśvadeve khaga indra gopyam naḥ vadāni atra vidvān
translated: O lord of birds, I will tell the special thing in Vaiśvadeva, which should not be told to a miser or an ignorant person.

original: sūryādīnāṃ ye ca dāne ca dadyurvinā vāyorantarasthaṃ hariṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: sūrya ādīnām ye ca dāne ca dadyuḥ vinā vāyoḥ antara stham harim ca
translated: Those who offer to the sun etc. and to Vāyu, without Hari who is within,

original: te vai sadā sārabhoktāra eva jñeyāstvato viṣṇureko mahātmā /
analyzed: te vai sadā sāra bhoktāraḥ eva jñeyāḥ tu atas viṣṇuḥ ekaḥ mahātmā
translated: should be known as always the enjoyers of essence. Therefore, Viṣṇu alone is the great soul.

original: sārāṃśabhoktā na tu sarvasya bhoktā bhunakti sarvaṃ tvaviruddhaśaktiḥ // / / //
analyzed: sāra aṃśa bhoktā na tu sarvasya bhoktā bhunakti sarvam tu aviruddha śaktiḥ
translated: He is the enjoyer of the essence, not the enjoyer of everything. He who has unobstructed power enjoys everything.

original: vakṣye ha sārānpunaranyānkhagendra śṛṇuṣva guhyaṃ paramādareṇa /
analyzed: vakṣye ha sārān punar anyān khaga indra śṛṇuṣva guhyam parama ādareṇa
translated: O lord of birds, I will tell you other essences again. Listen to the secret with great respect.

original: drākṣādayaḥ sarva eva tvasārāḥ kālādiduṣṭā bhāvaduṣṭāḥ padārthāḥ // / / //
analyzed: drākṣā ādayaḥ sarve eva tu asārāḥ kāla ādi duṣṭāḥ bhāva duṣṭāḥ padārthāḥ
translated: Grapes and all others are indeed inessential. Things spoiled by time etc. and by nature are spoiled.

original: atipakvānantaraṃ tu tathā dinacatuṣṭaye /
analyzed: ati pakva anantaram tu tathā dina catuṣṭaye
translated: After over-ripening, for four days,

original: asārāḥ kaluṣā jñeyāstathā jaṃbūphalaṃ smṛtam // / / //🔽māsasyānantaraṃ vīndra tvasāraṃ panasaṃ smṛtam /
analyzed: asārāḥ kaluṣāḥ jñeyāḥ tathā jaṃbū phalam smṛtam  māsasya anantaram vīndra tu asāram panasam smṛtam
translated: they should be known as tasteless and impure, and also the rose-apple fruit is remembered as such.🔽After a month, O Indra among kings, the jackfruit is remembered as tasteless.

original: ṣaṇmāsānantaraṃ vīndra kharjūraṃ tiktavatsmṛtam // / / //
analyzed: ṣaṣ māsa anantaram vīndra kharjūram tikta vat smṛtam
translated: After six months, O Indra among kings, the date fruit is remembered as bitter.

original: ārdraṃ pūtaṃ nārikelaṃ sphoṭanānantaraṃ prabho /
analyzed: ārdram pūtam nārikelam sphoṭana anantaram prabho
translated: The wet and pure coconut, O Lord, after bursting,

original: ahorātrānantaraṃ tu asāraṃ parikīrtitam // / / //
analyzed: ahar rātra anantaram tu asāram parikīrtitam
translated: is declared to be tasteless after a day and night.

original: śuṣkabhūtaṃ nārikelaṃ khajūraṃ tu yathā tathā /
analyzed: śuṣka bhūtam nārikelam khajūram tu yathā tathā
translated: The dry coconut is like the date fruit.

original: pakṣasyānantaraṃ cūtamasāraṃ parikīrtitam // / / //🔽varṣasyānantaraṃ vīndra pūgīphalamudāhṛtam /
analyzed: pakṣasya anantaram cūtam asāram parikīrtitam  varṣasya anantaram vīndra pūgī phalam udāhṛtam
translated: After a fortnight, the mango is declared to be tasteless.🔽After a year, O Indra among kings, the betel nut is cited.

original: ghaṭikānantaraṃ vīndra tāṃbūlaṃ parikīrtitam // / / //
analyzed: ghaṭikā anantaram vīndra tāṃbūlam parikīrtitam
translated: After half an hour, O Indra among kings, the betel leaf is declared.

original: yāmasyānantaraṃ cānnaṃ sūpānnaṃ pāyasaṃ tathā /
analyzed: yāmasya anantaram ca annam sūpa annam pāyasam tathā
translated: After two hours, the food, the soup, the rice pudding,

original: bhakṣyaṃ ca kvathitaṃ vīndra asāraṃ parikīrtitam // / / //
analyzed: bhakṣyam ca kvathitam vīndra asāram parikīrtitam
translated: and the boiled food, O Indra among kings, are declared to be tasteless.

original: tripakṣānantaraṃ vīndra tailapakvaṃ tathā smṛtam /
analyzed: tri pakṣa anantaram vīndra taila pakvam tathā smṛtam
translated: After three fortnights, O Indra among kings, the oil-cooked food is remembered as such.

original: caturyāmānantaraṃ ca tvasāraṃ ghṛtapakvakam // / / //
analyzed: catur yāma anantaram ca tu asāram ghṛta pakvakam
translated: After four hours, the ghee-cooked food is declared to be tasteless.

original: triyāmānantaraṃ śākā niḥ sārāḥ parikīrtitāḥ /
analyzed: tri yāma anantaram śākāḥ niḥ sārāḥ parikīrtitāḥ
translated: After three years, vegetables are declared to be devoid of essence.

original: jaṃbīraṃ śṛṅgabere dhātrī karpūraṃ ca cūtakam // / / //
analyzed: jaṃbīram śṛṅgabere dhātrī karpūram ca cūtakam
translated: Jambeer, shringabera, emblic myrobalan, camphor, and mango,

original: vatsarānantaraṃ vīndra niḥ sāraṃ parikīrtitam /
analyzed: vatsara anantaram vīndra niḥ sāram parikīrtitam
translated: After one year, O Indra among kings, are declared to be devoid of essence.

original: parpaṭaḥ pakṣamātreṇa niḥ sāraḥ parikīrtitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: parpaṭaḥ pakṣa mātreṇa niḥ sāraḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translated: Parpata is declared to be devoid of essence after just a fortnight.

original: tulasī sarvadā sārā ekādaśyāmapi dvija /
analyzed: tulasī sarvadā sārā ekādaśyām api dvija
translated: O Brahmin, tulasi is always full of essence, even on ekadashi.

original: ārdrā vāpyathavā śuṣkā sārdrā sāravatī smṛtā // / / //
analyzed: ārdrā vā api athavā śuṣkā sārdrā sāravatī smṛtā
translated: Whether fresh or dry, when mixed with water, it is considered to be full of essence.

original: ekādaśyāṃ tu tulasī sārā grāhyā manīṣibhiḥ /
analyzed: ekādaśyām tu tulasī sārā grāhyā manīṣibhiḥ
translated: On ekadashi, the essence of tulasi should be taken by the wise,

original: tvacā nāseṃdriyeṇāpi na tu jihvendriyeṇa ca // / / //
analyzed: tvacā nāsā iṃdriyeṇa api na tu jihvā indriyeṇa ca
translated: Not by the skin or nose sense organ, but by the tongue sense organ.

original: ekādaśyāṃ harerannaṃ niḥ sāraṃ parikīrtitam /
analyzed: ekādaśyām hareḥ annam niḥ sāram parikīrtitam
translated: On ekadashi, the food of Hari is declared to be devoid of essence.

original: ekādaśyāṃ harestīrthaṃ manuṣyāṇāṃ khageśvara // / / //
analyzed: ekādaśyām hareḥ tīrtham manuṣyāṇām khageśvara
translated: On ekadashi, the holy place of Hari for humans, O lord of birds,

original: ekavāre ca sāraṃ syāddvivāre ca tatodhikam /
analyzed: eka vāre ca sāram syāt dvi vāre ca tatas adhikam
translated: Would be of essence once, and more than that twice.

original: ekādaśyāṃ mahābhāga tīrthaṃ gandhādimiśritam // / / //
analyzed: ekādaśyām mahābhāga tīrtham gandha ādi miśritam
translated: On ekadashi, O fortunate one, the holy place mixed with fragrance etc.,

original: asāramiti saṃproktaṃ tathā svādūdamiśritam /
analyzed: asāram iti saṃproktam tathā svādu uda miśritam
translated: Is declared to be devoid of essence, as well as mixed with sweet water.

original: ekādaśyāṃ hareḥ sāraṃ kṣīraṃ sarpirmadhūdakam // / / //
analyzed: ekādaśyām hareḥ sāram kṣīram sarpiḥ madhu udakam
translated: On ekadashi, the essence of Hari is milk, ghee, honey, and water.

original: niḥ sāraṃ manujendrāṇāmiti vedavidāṃ matam /🔽āṣāḍhamāse garuḍa śāko niḥ sāra ucyate // / / //
analyzed: niḥ sāram manuja indrāṇām iti veda vidām matam  āṣāḍha māse garuḍa śākaḥ niḥ sāraḥ ucyate
translated: The learned ones in the Vedas consider the lives of human kings to be devoid of essence.🔽O Garuda! In the month of Ashadha, vegetables are said to be devoid of essence.

original: māsi bhādrapade vīndra hyasāraṃ dadhi cocyate /🔽kṣīraṃ tu hyāśvine māse niḥ sāraṃ parikīrtitam // / / //
analyzed: māsi bhādrapade vi indra hi asāram dadhi ca ucyate  kṣīram tu hi āśvine māse niḥ sāram parikīrtitam
translated: O Indra of the birds! In the month of Bhadrapada, curd is said to be devoid of essence.🔽In the month of Ashvina, milk is declared to be devoid of essence.

original: ūrdhvapuṇḍragadāhīnā nāryasāreti gīyate /
analyzed: ūrdhva puṇḍra gadā hīnā nāryasārā iti gīyate
translated: A woman devoid of the vertical mark on the forehead and the club is sung as being devoid of essence.

original: haribhaktivihīnā ye hyasurāḥ parikīrtitāḥ // / / //🔽harināmavihīnaṃ tu mukhaṃ niḥ sāramucyate /
analyzed: hari bhakti vihīnāḥ ye hi asurāḥ parikīrtitāḥ  hari nāma vihīnam tu mukham niḥ sāram ucyate
translated: Those devoid of devotion to Hari are proclaimed as demons.🔽A face devoid of the name of Hari is said to be devoid of essence.

original: harinaivedyahīnastu pāko niḥ sāra ucyate // / / //
analyzed: hari naivedya hīnaḥ tu pākaḥ niḥ sāraḥ ucyate
translated: A meal devoid of the offerings to Hari is said to be devoid of essence.

original: tridinaiścātasīpuṣpaṃ niḥ sāraṃ parikīrtitam /
analyzed: tri dinaiḥ ca atasī puṣpam niḥ sāram parikīrtitam
translated: The flower of the linseed plant is declared to be devoid of essence for three days.

original: praharaṃ mallikā sāraṃ jātī tu praharārdhakam // / / //
translated: Jasmine is of essence for one watch, and jasmine for half a watch.

original: triyāmaṃ śatapatraṃ syātkaravīramaharniśam /
analyzed: tri yāmam śata patram syāt karavīram aharniśam
translated: The hundred-petalled lotus is for three watches, and the karavira for a day and night.

original: ghaṭikāvadhi sāraṃ syātpārijātaṃ khageśvara // / / //
analyzed: ghaṭikā avadhi sāram syāt pārijātam khageśvara
translated: O Lord of birds! The parijata flower is of essence for one ghatika.

original: trivarṣaṃ kesaraṃ phalga sāramityucyate budhaiḥ /
analyzed: tri varṣam kesaram phalga sāram iti ucyate budhaiḥ
translated: The kesara flower is said to be of essence for three years by the wise.

original: kastūrī daśavarṣaṃ tu karpūraṃ varṣamātrakam // / / //
analyzed: kastūrī daśa varṣam tu karpūram varṣa mātrakam
translated: Musk is for ten years, and camphor is for one year.

original: sasāramiti saṃproktaṃ candanaṃ sarvadā smṛtam /
analyzed: sasāram iti saṃproktam candanam sarvadā smṛtam
translated: Sandalwood is always said to be saras.

original: śuddhanniḥ sārabhūtāṃśca vakṣye śṛṇu khageśvara // / / //
analyzed: sāra bhūtān ca vakṣye śṛṇu khageśvara
translated: O Lord of birds, I will tell you about the pure and unsara ones, listen.

original: tuṣā medhyā āranālaṃ puṇyakaṃ bhiḥ saṭā tathā /
analyzed: tuṣāḥ medhyāḥ āranālam puṇyakam bhiḥ saṭā tathā
translated: Tuṣa, Āranāla, Puṇyakas, and Sāṭas,

original: upodvrajī alābūśca bṛhatkośātakī tathā // / / //
analyzed: upodvrajī alābūḥ ca bṛhatkośātakī tathā
translated: Upadvājī, Ālabu, and the large Kośātakī,

original: vṛntākaṃ cukraśākaśca bilvamauduṃvaraṃ tathā /
analyzed: vṛntākam cukra śākaḥ ca bilvam auduṃvaram tathā
translated: Brinjal, Chuccu vegetables, Bilva, and Mauduṃbara,

original: palāñjurlaśunaṃ vṛntaṃ kalañjaṃ ca tathā dvijā // / / //
analyzed: palāñjuḥ laśunam vṛntam kalañjam ca tathā dvijāḥ
translated: Palāṇju, garlic, stem, and Kalāñja, O twice-born ones,

original: etatsarvatra kāle ca niḥ sāramiti kīrtitam /
analyzed: etat sarvatra kāle ca niḥ sāram iti kīrtitam
translated: All of these are said to be unsara at all times.

original: ekādaśyāṃ vaiśvadevaṃ śrāddhaṃ tarpaṇameva ca // / / //
analyzed: ekādaśyām vaiśvadevam śrāddham tarpaṇam eva ca
translated: On Ekādaśī, Vaiśvadeva, Śrāddha, and Tarpaṇa,

original: mantreṇa pretadahanamasāraṃ parikīrtitam /
analyzed: mantreṇa preta dahanam asāram parikīrtitam
translated: The cremation of the dead with mantras is declared to be unsara.

original: havirnārāyaṇo devo etāṃśca hyaśubhānra sān // / / //
analyzed: haviḥ nārāyaṇaḥ etān ca hi aśubhān ra sān
translated: The god Nārāyaṇa does not accept these inauspicious things,

original: na gṛhṇāti na gṛhṇāti na gṛhṇāti hariḥ svayam /
analyzed: na gṛhṇāti na gṛhṇāti na gṛhṇāti hariḥ svayam
translated: Hari himself does not accept, does not accept, does not accept.

original: tathāpi sarvaṃ jānāti jīvānāṃ pāpakarmaṇām // / / //
analyzed: tathā api sarvam jānāti jīvānām pāpa karmaṇām
translated: Nevertheless, he knows everything about the sinful deeds of living beings,

original: āsvādanaṃ kārayati svayaṃ nāsvādate hariḥ /
analyzed: āsvādanam kārayati svayam na āsvādate hariḥ
translated: Hari himself causes the tasting, but does not taste himself.

original: asārabhojanaṃ caiva jīvānāṃ karmajaṃ phalam // / / //
analyzed: asāra bhojanam ca eva jīvānām karma jam phalam
translated: The eating of unsara is the result of the actions of living beings.

original: amukhyabhojino jīvāḥ kuntyādyā mukhyabhojinaḥ /
analyzed: amukhya bhojinaḥ jīvāḥ kuntī ādyāḥ mukhya bhojinaḥ
translated: The principal eaters are Kunti and others, while the secondary eaters are the living beings.

original: śubhāni ca pibedviṣṇuraśubhaṃ no pibedvibhuḥ // / / //
analyzed: śubhāni ca pibet viṣṇuḥ aśubham no pibet vibhuḥ
translated: May Vishnu drink the auspicious things, and the all-pervading Lord may not drink the inauspicious things.

original: ko vadettasya ceṣṭāṃ tu pūrṇānando hariḥ svayam /
analyzed: kaḥ vadet tasya ceṣṭām tu pūrṇānandaḥ hariḥ svayam
translated: Who can describe His deeds? The complete bliss is Hari Himself.

original: na tena sadṛśaḥ kopi deśe kāle ca vidyate /
analyzed: na tena sadṛśaḥ kaḥ api deśe kāle ca vidyate
translated: There is no one equal to Him in time and place.

original: tasyāvatārānvakṣyahaṃ śṛṇu pakṣīndrasattama // / / //
analyzed: tasya avatārān vakṣi aham śṛṇu pakṣi indra sattama
translated: I will describe His incarnations. Listen, O best of the birds.

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttarakhaṇḍe tṛtīyāṃśe brahmakāṇḍe vaiśvadevārthakasārāsāravastuviveko nāma caturdaśodhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttara khaṇḍe tṛtīya aṃśe brahmakāṇḍe vaiśvadevārthakasārāsāravastuvivekaḥ nāma caturdaśaḥ adhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the Fourteenth Chapter in the Third Section of the Uttara-Khanda in the Srimad-Bhagavata-Maha-Purana, describing the discrimination between the essential and the non-essential things for the sake of the Vishvadeva.

original: śrīgaruḍamahāpurāṇam
analyzed: śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam
translated: Sri Garuda Mahapurana

original: śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /
analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Sri Krishna said:

original: athāvatā rānpuruṣākhyo hariśca gato dhyānaṃ kartumīśo mahātmā /
analyzed: atha avatā rān puruṣa ākhyaḥ hariḥ ca gataḥ dhyānam kartum īśaḥ mahātmā
translated: Then the incarnation called Purusha, Hari, the great soul, went to meditate.

original: prādurbabhūvākhilasadguṇārṇavaḥ sa eva viṣṇuḥ sa ca bījabhūtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: prādurbabhūva akhila sat guṇa arṇavaḥ saḥ eva viṣṇuḥ sa ca bīja bhūtaḥ
translated: He manifested as Vishnu, the ocean of all good qualities, and He is the seed.

original: yo bījabhūtaḥ puruṣākhya viṣṇuḥ sa evābhūdvāsudevo mahātmā /
analyzed: yaḥ bīja bhūtaḥ viṣṇuḥ saḥ eva abhūt vāsudevaḥ mahātmā
translated: The Vishnu called Purusha is the seed, and He became the great soul Vasudeva.

original: sṛṣṭiṃ kartuṃ puruṣākhyasya vāyormāyākhyāyāṃ mūlarūpo yathā'sa // / / //
analyzed: sṛṣṭim kartum puruṣa ākhyasya vāyoḥ māyā ākhyāyām mūla rūpaḥ yathā āsa
translated: In order to create, the original form of Purusha Vishnu appeared in the Maya of Vayu, as follows.

original: yo vāsudevastu sa eva jātaḥ saṃkarṣaṇākhyo khilasadguṇātmā /
analyzed: yaḥ vāsudevaḥ tu saḥ eva jātaḥ saṃkarṣaṇa ākhyaḥ khila sat guṇa ātmā
translated: He who is Vāsudeva is born as Saṃkarṣaṇa, the embodiment of all good qualities.

original: sṛṣṭiṃ kartuṃ sūtrabhūtasya vāyorjayākhyāyaṃ pūrṇasaṃvitparātmā // / / //
analyzed: sṛṣṭim kartum sūtra bhūtasya vāyoḥ jaya ākhyā ayam pūrṇa saṃvid parātmā
translated: For the sake of creating the world, he, the Supreme Self of perfect consciousness, assumes the form of Jaya, the thread-like air.

original: sa evaṃ saṃkarṣaṇanāmadheyaḥ pradyumnanāmā ca sa eva viśrutaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ evam saṃkarṣaṇa nāmadheyaḥ pradyumna nāmā ca saḥ eva viśrutaḥ
translated: He, who is known as Saṃkarṣaṇa, is also known as Pradyumna.

original: sarasvatībhāratīsarjanārthaṃ sa eva devyā mūlarūpo babhūva // / / //
analyzed: sarasvatī bhāratī sarjana artham saḥ eva devyāḥ mūla rūpaḥ babhūva
translated: For the sake of creating Sarasvatī and Bhāratī, he, the original form of the Goddess, became known as Aniruddha.

original: sṛṣṭvā yuktaṃ ṣoḍaśabhiḥ kalābhirmahattattvaṃ sūkṣmarūpaṃ sa eva /
analyzed: sṛṣṭvā yuktam ṣoḍaśabhiḥ kalābhiḥ mahat tattvam sūkṣma rūpam saḥ eva
translated: He, who is the Supreme Self, having created the subtle principle of Mahat, consisting of sixteen parts,

original: sāhaṅkāraṃ krīḍayāmāsa devaḥ śṛṇu tvaṃ vai ṣoḍaśākhyāḥ kalāśca // / / //
analyzed: sa ahaṅkāram krīḍayāmāsa devaḥ śṛṇu tvam vai ṣoḍaśa ākhyāḥ kalāḥ ca
translated: played with it, along with ego. Listen to the sixteen parts.

original: bhūtāni karmendriyapañcakāni jñānendriyāṇīha tathā manaśca /
analyzed: bhūtāni karmendriya pañcakāni jñānendriyāṇi iha tathā manaḥ ca
translated: The five gross elements, the five organs of action, the five organs of sense, and the mind,

original: tato babhūva hyaniruddhasaṃjñako jīvāṃśca saṃgṛhya supūrṇaśaktiḥ // / / //🔽soyaṃ viriñcyādisamastadevān sthūlena dehena sasarja nāthaḥ /
analyzed: tatas babhūva hi aniruddha saṃjñakaḥ jīvān ca saṃgṛhya su pūrṇa śaktiḥ  saḥ ayam viriñci ādi samasta devān sthūlena dehena sasarja nāthaḥ
translated: then became known as Aniruddha, possessing the power to hold the individual souls.🔽This Lord, by means of his gross body, created all the gods beginning with Brahmā.

original: tathā sa viṣṇuḥ puruṣābhidhastu sanatkumāratvamavāpa vīndra // / / //
analyzed: tathā sa viṣṇuḥ puruṣa abhidhaḥ tu sanatkumāra tvam avāpa vīndra
translated: O Indra, that Viṣṇu, known as Puruṣa, attained the state of Sanatkumāra.

original: ananyasādhyaṃ brahmacaryaṃ ca kartuṃ daśendriyāṇāṃ śoṣaṇārthaṃ sadaiva /
analyzed: an anya sādhyam brahmacaryam ca kartum daśa indriyāṇām śoṣaṇa artham sadā eva
translated: To practice celibacy, which cannot be accomplished by any other means, and to always dry up the ten senses,

original: sanandanādau paṭhitaḥ kumārastasmānnānyo nātra vicāryamasti // / / //🔽sa eva viṣṇuḥ sūkaratvaṃ hyavāpa kṣopaṇīmuddhartuṃ daityavapurnihantum /
analyzed: sanandana ādau paṭhitaḥ kumāraḥ tasmāt na anyaḥ na atra vicāryam asti  saḥ eva viṣṇuḥ sūkara tvam hi avāpa kṣopaṇīm uddhartum daitya vapuḥ nihantum
translated: The Kumara mentioned in the scriptures beginning with Sanandana, is none other than that. There is nothing to be considered here.🔽That very Vishnu assumed the form of a boar to lift up the earth and to kill the demon Hiranyaksha in the form of a boar.

original: hiraṇyākṣaṃ sajjanānāṃ khagendra tathā bhūmeḥ sthāpanārthaṃ ca devaḥ // / / //
analyzed: hiraṇyākṣam sat janānām khaga indra tathā bhūmeḥ sthāpana artham ca devaḥ
translated: O best of birds, the god did this for the sake of the righteous and for the establishment of the earth.

original: tato harirmadvidāsatvamāpānṛṣerbhāryāyāṃ yāminyāṃ yo mahātmā /
analyzed: tatas hariḥ mad vidāsa tvam āpāt ṛṣeḥ bhāryāyām yāminyām yaḥ mahātmā
translated: Then Hari became the great soul in the womb of Yami, the wife of the sage, to be the servant of me (Brahma).

original: tatrāvatāre pañcarātraṃ samagramupādeṣṭuṃ nāpa dānaṃ svatantraḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatra avatāre pañcarātram samagram upādeṣṭum na apa dānam svatantraḥ
translated: In that incarnation, he was independent to teach the entire Pancharatra to me.

original: sa eva viṣṇuḥ samabhūdbradaryāṃ nārāyaṇākhyaḥ śamalāpahaśca /
analyzed: saḥ eva viṣṇuḥ samabhūt bradaryām nārāyaṇa ākhyaḥ śamala apahaḥ ca
translated: That very Vishnu became Narayana, the remover of impurities, in the womb of Devaki.

original: tapastaptuṃ śikṣayituṃ tvṛṣīṇāṃ tiraskartuṃ hyapsarasāṃ sahasram // / / //
analyzed: tapaḥ taptum śikṣayitum tu ṛṣīṇām tiraskartum hi apsarasām sahasram
translated: To perform austerities, to teach the sages, and to humiliate thousands of celestial nymphs.

original: tato hariḥ kapilatvaṃ hyavāpya tirohitānkālabalena tattvān /
analyzed: tatas hariḥ kapila tvam hi avāpya tirohitān kāla balena tattvān
translated: Then Hari, having attained the form of Kapila, concealed the twenty-four principles by the power of time.

original: caturviśatiṃ saṃśayaṃ coddhariṣyannupādiśaccāsuraye mahātmā // / / //
analyzed: caturviśatim saṃśayam ca uddhariṣyan upādiśat ca asuraye mahātmā
translated: The great soul will also remove the twenty-four doubts and teach them to Asuri.

original: sa eva dataḥ samabhūdrameśonasūyāyāmatrirūpaḥ parātmā /
analyzed: saḥ eva dataḥ samabhūt ramā īśa unasūyāyām atri rūpaḥ parātmā
translated: He himself was born as Atri, the Supreme Self in three forms, from Anasūyā.

original: ānvīkṣikiṃ nāma sutarkavidyāmalarkanāmne pradadāttāṃ mahātmā // / / //
analyzed: ānvīkṣikim nāma su tarka vidyām alarka nāmne pradadāt tām mahātmā
translated: The great soul gave that knowledge of logic named Ānvīkṣikī to the one named Amarka.

original: sa eva vaṃśepyabhavadraveśca ākūtyāṃ yaḥ saccidānandarūpaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eva ākūtyām yaḥ saccidānanda rūpaḥ
translated: He himself was born in the family of Raghu, in Ākūti, who is of the form of existence, knowledge and bliss.

original: svāyaṃbhuvaṃ yattu manvantaraṃ ca devaiḥ sākaṃ pālayāmāsa vīndra // / / //
analyzed: svāyaṃbhuvam yat tu manvantaram ca devaiḥ sākam pālayāmāsa vi indra
translated: And that Manu period of self-existence, he protected along with the gods, O Indra of the gods.

original: sa eva viṣṇuḥ sa urukramobhūdāgnīdhraputryāṃ merudevyāṃ ca nābheḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eva viṣṇuḥ saḥ urukramaḥ bhūt āgnīdhraputryām merudevyām ca nābheḥ
translated: He himself is Viṣṇu, he became Urukrama, the son of Nabha, from the daughter of Agnīdhra, the goddess Meru.

original: vidyāratānāṃ mānināṃ sarvadaivamatyāścaryaṃ darśayituṃ ca vīndra // / / //🔽tato harirjagṛhe kūrmarūpaṃ surāsurāṇāmudadhiṃ vimathnatām /
analyzed: vidyā ratānām māninām sarva daivam ati āścaryam darśayitum ca vi indra  tatas hariḥ jagṛhe kūrma rūpam sura asurāṇām udadhim vimathnatām
translated: To show the extremely wonderful thing to the proud ones always devoted to knowledge, O Indra of the gods.🔽Then Hari took the form of a tortoise, to hold on his back the Mandara mountain and the universe, while the gods and demons were churning the ocean.

original: pṛṣṭhe dhartuṃ mandaraṃ parvataṃ ca brahmāṇḍaṃ vā dhartumīśo mahātmā // / / //
analyzed: pṛṣṭhe dhartum mandaram parvatam ca brahmāṇḍam vā dhartum īśaḥ mahātmā
translated: The great soul is capable of holding the universe.

original: tato hariḥ prādurabhūnmahātmā dhanvantarirnāma harinmaṇidyutiḥ /
analyzed: tatas hariḥ prādurabhūt mahātmā dhanvantariḥ nāma harit maṇi dyutiḥ
translated: Then the great soul Hari appeared, named Dhanvantari, with the luster of an emerald,

original: apathyadoṣānparihartumeva haste gṛhītvā pūrṇakubhaṃ sudhābhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: apathya doṣān parihartum eva haste gṛhītvā pūrṇakubham sudhābhiḥ
translated: holding a full pot of nectar in his hand, in order to remove the harmful effects of improper diet.

original: tato harirjagṛhe śrīvapuśca yanmohinīti pravadanti loke /
analyzed: tatas hariḥ jagṛhe śrī vapuḥ ca yat mohinī iti pravadanti loke
translated: Then Hari assumed the form of Shri, whom people call Mohini in the world.

original: udvṛttānāṃ ditijānāṃ mahātmā samyakteṣāṃ vañcayituṃ harirbalam // / / //
analyzed: udvṛttānām ditijānām mahātmā samyak teṣām vañcayitum hariḥ balam
translated: The great soul, to properly deceive the arrogant demons,

original: tato hariḥ prādurabhūnmahātmā nṛsiṃhanāmā bhagavānanantaḥ /
analyzed: tatas hariḥ prādurabhūt mahātmā nṛsiṃha nāmā bhagavān anantaḥ
translated: Then Hari, the great soul, the infinite Lord, appeared as Narasimha.

original: daityo hiraṇyakaśipuśca tathorudeśe saṃsthāpitaḥ karajairdāritaśca // / / //
analyzed: daityaḥ hiraṇyakaśipuḥ ca tathā ūru deśe saṃsthāpitaḥ karajaiḥ dāritaḥ ca
translated: And the demon Hiranyakashipu was placed on his lap and torn apart with his claws.

original: tato harirbhagavānvāmanobhūdadityāṃ vai kaśyapāddavadevaḥ /
analyzed: tatas hariḥ bhagavān vāmanaḥ bhūt adityām vai kaśyapāt davadevaḥ
translated: Then Lord Hari became the dwarf Vamana, the true god, born from Aditi through Kashyapa.

original: indrāyedaṃ dātukāmaḥ khagendra tadarthaṃ vai pāvituṃ sovituṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: indrāya idam dātu kāmaḥ khaga indra tad artham vai pāvitum sovitum ca
translated: O lord of birds, he was desirous of giving this (earth) to Indra, and for that purpose, he was purifying and purifying himself.

original: tato harirjamadagneḥ sutobhūlloke sarve parśurāmaṃ vadanti /
analyzed: tatas hariḥ jamadagneḥ sutaḥ bhūt loke sarve parśurāmam vadanti
translated: Then Hari became the son of Jamadagni, whom all in the world call Parshu-Rama.

original: brahmadviṣāṃ kṣatriyāṇāṃ ca vīndra bhūmiṃ niḥ kṣatrāṃ kartukāmo maheśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: brahma dviṣām kṣatriyāṇām ca vi indra bhūmim niḥ kṣatrām kartu kāmaḥ maheśaḥ
translated: O lord of birds, Maheshvara, desirous of making the earth devoid of Kshatriyas, of those who hate Brahmins and Kshatriyas,

original: tatobhavadvyāsarūpī sa viṣṇuścaturvāraṃ rāghavāsyāpi pūrṇaḥ /
analyzed: tatobhavat vyāsa rūpī sa viṣṇuḥ catur vāram rāghava asya api pūrṇaḥ
translated: Then that Vishnu became Vyasa in four parts, and also as Rama, the complete one.

original: parāśarātsatyavatyāṃ babhūva pailādibhirvedabhāgāṃśca kartum // / / //
analyzed: parāśarāt satyavatyām babhūva paila ādibhiḥ veda bhāgān ca kartum
translated: To make the parts of the Vedas through Paila and others, he was born from Parashara to Satyavati.

original: tato harī raghuvaṃśevatīrṇaḥ kausalyāyāṃ rāghavaḥ sūryavaṃśe /
analyzed: tatas hariḥ raghu vaṃśa ivatīrṇaḥ kausalyāyām rāghavaḥ sūryavaṃśe
translated: Then Hari descended in the Raghu dynasty, as Rama, in the solar dynasty, to Kousalya.

original: samudrādorvigrahaṃ kartumīśo haṃ tuṃ bhūmyāṃ rāvaṇādīṃśca vīndra // / / //
analyzed: samudra ādoḥ vigraham kartum īśaḥ ham tum bhūmyām rāvaṇa ādīn ca vi indra
translated: He was capable of fighting with Ravana and others, the lords of demons, on earth, to protect the earth from the ocean of demons.

original: tato harirvyāsarūpī babhūva aṣṭāviṃśe dvapare jñānarūpī /
analyzed: tatas hariḥ vyāsa rūpī babhūva aṣṭāviṃśe dvi apare jñāna rūpī
translated: Then Hari became Vyasa in the twenty-eighth Dwapara age, in the form of knowledge.

original: parāśarātsatyavatyāṃ mahātmā svayaṃ vedān saṃvibhaktuṃ ca devaḥ // / / //
analyzed: parāśarāt satyavatyām mahātmā svayam vedān saṃvibhaktum ca devaḥ
translated: The great god himself, to divide the Vedas, was born from Parashara to Satyavati.

original: tato hariḥ kṛṣṇarūpī babhūva devakyāṃ vai vasudevātsa viṣṇuḥ /
analyzed: tatas hariḥ kṛṣṇa rūpī babhūva devakyām vai vasudevāt sa viṣṇuḥ
translated: Then Hari became Krishna in the form of Vishnu, born from Vasudeva to Devaki.

original: kaṃsādīnvai nitarāṃ hantukāmaḥ samyakpātuṃ pāṇḍavāṃścāpi vīndra // / / //
analyzed: kaṃsa ādīn vai nitarām hantu kāmaḥ samyak pātum pāṇḍavān ca api vīndra
translated: Desiring to kill Kamsa and others, and to properly protect the Pandavas, O lord of birds.

original: tataḥ kalau saṃpravṛtte haristu saṃmohanārthaṃ cāsurāṇāṃ khagendra /
analyzed: tatas kalau saṃpravṛtte hariḥ tu saṃmohana artham ca asurāṇām khaga indra
translated: Then, when Kali Yuga began, Hari, to delude the demons, O lord of birds,

original: nāmnā buddho kīkaṭeṣu prajāto vedapramāṇaṃ nirākartumeva // / / //
analyzed: nāmnā buddhaḥ kīkaṭeṣu prajātaḥ veda pramāṇam nirākartum eva
translated: was born as Buddha in the land of Kika, to deny the authority of the Vedas.

original: tato hariḥ kalkisaṃjñaśca vīndra utpatsyate yugayormadhyasaṃdhau /
analyzed: tatas hariḥ kalki saṃjñaḥ ca vīndraḥ utpatsyate yugayoḥ madhya saṃdhau
translated: Then, O lord of birds, Hari will be born as Kalki, at the junction of two yugas,

original: dasyuprāyānbhūmipānvai nihantuṃ nāmnā harirviṣṇuguptasya gehe // / / //
analyzed: dasyu prāyān bhūmipān vai nihantum nāmnā hariḥ viṣṇuguptasya gehe
translated: to kill the kings who have become like robbers, in the house of Hari Vishnu Gupta.

original: keśavādyāścaturviṃśatirvai saṃkarṣaṇādayaḥ /
analyzed: keśava ādyāḥ caturviṃśatiḥ vai saṃkarṣaṇa ādayaḥ
translated: The twenty-four beginning with Keśava are Saṃkarṣaṇa and so on.

original: viśvādaya sahasraṃ ca parādyā amitāḥ smṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: viśva ādaya sahasram ca para ādyāḥ amitāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: The twenty-four incarnations beginning with Keśava, and the thousand incarnations beginning with Saṃkarṣaṇa,🔽And the innumerable incarnations beginning with Viśva are remembered.

original: avatārā hyasaṃkhyātā viṣṇornārāyaṇasya ca /
analyzed: avatārāḥ hi asaṃkhyātāḥ viṣṇoḥ nārāyaṇasya ca
translated: The incarnations of Viṣṇu, Nārāyaṇa, are innumerable.

original: svayaṃ nārāyaṇāste te nāṇumātraṃ vibhidyate // / / //
analyzed: svayam nārāyaṇāḥ te te na aṇu mātram vibhidyate
translated: They are all Nārāyaṇa themselves, not even an atom is different.

original: balatorūpataścāpi guṇataśca kathañcana /
analyzed: balataḥ rūpataḥ ca api guṇataḥ ca kathañcana
translated: In strength, form, and qualities, in any way,

original: anantonantaguṇataḥ pūrṇo viṣṇurna cānyathā // / / //
analyzed: anantaḥ unanta guṇataḥ pūrṇaḥ viṣṇuḥ na ca anyathā
translated: Viṣṇu is infinite, full of infinite qualities, not otherwise.

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttarakhaṇḍe tṛtīyāṃśe brahmakāṇḍe viṣṇoravatāranirūpaṇaṃ nāma pañcadaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttara khaṇḍe tṛtīya aṃśe brahmakāṇḍe viṣṇoravatāranirūpaṇam nāma pañcadaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fifteenth chapter in the Third Kāṇḍa of the Uttarārdha in the Nṛsiṃha-purāṇa, composed by Śrī Parāśara.

original: śrīgaruḍamahāpurāṇam
analyzed: śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam
translated: Śrī Garuḍa Mahāpurāṇa

original: śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /🔽mahālakṣmyāḥ svarūpaṃ ca avatārānkhageśvara /
analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca  mahālakṣmyāḥ svarūpam ca avatārān khageśvara
translated: Śrī Kṛṣṇa said:🔽O lord of birds, listen carefully to the nature and incarnations of Mahālakṣmī,

original: śṛṇu samyaṅ mahābhāga tajjñānasya vinirṇayam // / / //
analyzed: śṛṇu samyak mahābhāga tad jñānasya vinirṇayam
