translated: the determination of that knowledge.

original: īśādanyasya jagato hyātmo locana eva tu /
analyzed: īśāt anyasya jagataḥ hi ātmaḥ locanaḥ eva tu
translated: The soul of the world is indeed the eye of the Lord himself.

original: viṣayīkurute tatsyājjñānaṃ lakṣmyāḥ prakīrtitam // / / //
analyzed: viṣayīkurute tat syāt jñānam lakṣmyāḥ prakīrtitam
translated: When He makes that the object of knowledge, it is declared to be the knowledge of Lakṣmī.

original: nityāviyoginī devī haripādaikasaṃśrayā /
translated: The Goddess is eternally inseparable, solely devoted to the feet of Hari.

original: nityamuktā nityabuddhā mahālakṣmīḥ prakīrtitā // / / //
analyzed: nitya muktā nitya buddhā mahā lakṣmīḥ prakīrtitā
translated: She is always liberated, always enlightened, and is proclaimed as Mahālakṣmī.

original: mūlasya ca harerbhāryā lakṣmīḥ saṃprakīrtitā /
analyzed: mūlasya ca hareḥ bhāryā lakṣmīḥ saṃprakīrtitā
translated: Lakṣmī is proclaimed as the wife of Hari, the original one.

original: puṃso hibhāryā prakṛtiḥ prakṛteścā bhimāninī // / / //🔽sṛṣṭiṃ kartuṃ guṇānvīndra puruṣeṇa saha prabho /
analyzed: puṃsaḥ hi bhāryā prakṛtiḥ prakṛteḥ ca abhimāninī  sṛṣṭim kartum guṇān vīndra puruṣeṇa saha prabho
translated: The wife of the Puruṣa is Prakṛti, and Prakṛti is the one who conceives.🔽O Indra, in order to create, along with the Puruṣa, the Lord

original: tamaḥ pānaṃ tathā kartuṃ prakṛtyākhyā tadābhavat // / / //
analyzed: tamaḥ pānam tathā kartum prakṛti ākhyā tadā bhavat
translated: became known as Prakṛti, in order to create the three guṇas and the five elements.

original: vāsudevasya bhāryā tu māyā nāmnī prakīrtitā /
analyzed: vāsudevasya bhāryā tu māyā nāmnī prakīrtitā
translated: The wife of Vāsudeva is known as Māyā by name.

original: saṃkarṣaṇasya bhāryā tu jayeti parikīrtitā // / / //
analyzed: saṃkarṣaṇasya bhāryā tu jayā iti parikīrtitā
translated: The wife of Saṅkarṣaṇa is known as Jayā.

original: aniruddhasya bhāryā tu śāntā nāmnīti kīrtitā /
analyzed: aniruddhasya bhāryā tu śāntā nāmnī iti kīrtitā
translated: The wife of Aniruddha is known as Śāntā by name.

original: kṛtiḥ pradyumnabhāryāpiṃ sṛṣṭiṃ kartuṃ babhūvaha // / / //
analyzed: kṛtiḥ pradyumna bhāryā āpim sṛṣṭim kartum babhūvaha
translated: Kṛti also became the wife of Pradyumna in order to create.

original: viṣṇupatnī kīrtitā ca śrīdevī sattvamāninī /
analyzed: viṣṇu patnī kīrtitā ca śrī devī sattva māninī
translated: Śrī Devī, who is considered the wife of Viṣṇu, is the one who conceives Sattva.

original: tamobhimāninī durgā kanyaketi prakīrtitā // / / //🔽kṛṣṇāvatāre kanyeva nandaputrānujā hi sā /
analyzed: tamaḥ abhimāninī durgā kanyakā iti prakīrtitā  kṛṣṇa avatāre kanyā iva nanda putra anujā hi sā
translated: Durgā, who conceives Tamas, is known as the daughter.🔽In the Kṛṣṇa incarnation, she is the daughter, the younger sister of Nanda's son.

original: rajobhimānibhūdevī bhāryā sā sūkarasya ca // / / //
analyzed: rajobhimāni bhūdevī bhāryā sā sūkarasya ca
translated: The wife of Varāha is the goddess who conceives Rajas.

original: vedābhimāninī vīndra annapūrṇā prakīrtitā /
analyzed: veda abhimāninī vīndra anna pūrṇā prakīrtitā
translated: O Indra of the Vedas, Annapūrṇā is proclaimed as the one who conceives the Vedas.

original: nārāyaṇasya bhāryā tu lakṣmīrūpā tvajā smṛtā // / / //
analyzed: nārāyaṇasya bhāryā tu lakṣmī rūpā tu ajā smṛtā
translated: The wife of Narayana is known as Lakshmi, born from the womb.

original: yajñākhyasya harerbhāryā dakṣiṇā saṃprakīrtitā // / / //
analyzed: yajña ākhyasya hareḥ bhāryā dakṣiṇā saṃprakīrtitā
translated: The wife of Hari known as Yajna is declared as Dakshina.

original: jayantī vṛṣabhasyaiva patnī saṃparikīrtitā /
analyzed: jayantī vṛṣabhasya eva patnī saṃparikīrtitā
translated: Jayanti is declared as the wife of Vrishabha.

original: videhaputrī sītā tu rāmabhāryā prakīrtitā // / / //
analyzed: videha putrī sītā tu rāma bhāryā prakīrtitā
translated: The daughter of Videha, Sita, is declared as the wife of Rama.

original: rukmiṇīsatyabhāmā ca bhārye kṛṣṇasya kīrtite /
analyzed: rukmiṇī satyabhāmā ca bhārye kṛṣṇasya kīrtite
translated: Rukmini and Satyabhama are declared as the wives of Krishna.

original: ityādikā hyanantāścāpyāvatārāḥ pṛthagvidhāḥ // / / //
analyzed: ityādikāḥ hi anantāḥ ca api āvatārāḥ pṛthagvidhāḥ
translated: Thus, the incarnations of Rama are of various kinds and are infinite.

original: ramāyāḥ saṃti viprendra bhedahīnāḥ parasparam /
analyzed: ramāyāḥ saṃti vipra indra bheda hīnāḥ parasparam
translated: O best of Brahmins, they are all of Rama, without any difference among themselves.

original: anantānantaguṇakādviṣṇornyūnāḥ prakīrtitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: ananta ananta guṇakāt viṣṇoḥ nyūnāḥ prakīrtitāḥ
translated: They are declared as less than Vishnu, who has infinite and endless qualities.

original: atha brahmā ca vāyuśca śriyaḥ koṭiguṇādhamau /
analyzed: atha brahmā ca vāyuḥ ca śriyaḥ koṭi guṇa adhamau
translated: Then Brahma and Vayu are inferior to a croreth part of Shri.

original: vakṣye ca brahmaṇo rūpaṃ śṛṇu pakṣīndrasattama // / / //
analyzed: vakṣye ca brahmaṇaḥ rūpam śṛṇu pakṣi indra sattama
translated: I shall describe the form of Brahma. Listen, O best of the lords of birds.

original: vāsudevātsamutpanno māyāyāṃ ca khageśvara /
analyzed: vāsudevāt samutpannaḥ māyāyām ca khageśvara
translated: O lord of birds, he was born from Vasudeva and Maya.

original: sa eva puruṣonāma viriñca iti kīrtitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: saḥ eva puruṣaḥ nāma viriñcaḥ iti kīrtitaḥ
translated: He is known as Purusha and also as Virincha.

original: aniruddhāttu śāntāyāṃ mahattattvatanustvabhūt /
analyzed: aniruddhāt tu śāntāyām mahat tattva tanuḥ tu abhūt
translated: From Aniruddha, in Shanti, he became the body of the principle of Mahat.

original: tadā mahānviriñceti saṃjñāmāpa khageśvara // / / //
analyzed: tadā mahān viriñca iti saṃjñām āpa khageśvara
translated: Then, O lord of birds, he obtained the name of Mahat and Virincha.

original: rajasātra samutpanno māyāyāṃ vāsudevataḥ /
analyzed: rajasā atra samutpannaḥ māyāyām vāsudevataḥ
translated: In Rajas, from Maya, was born Vasudeva.

original: vidhisaṃjño viriñcaḥ sa jñātavyaḥ pakṣisattama // / / //
analyzed: vidhi saṃjñaḥ viriñcaḥ sa jñātavyaḥ pakṣi sattama
translated: O best of birds, he should be known as Brahma, the creator.

original: brahmāṇḍāntaḥ padmanābho yo jātaḥ kamalāsanaḥ /
analyzed: brahmāṇḍa antar padmanābhaḥ yaḥ jātaḥ kamalāsanaḥ
translated: He who was born in the Cosmic Egg as the lotus-seated one,

original: sa cartumukhasaṃjñāṃ cāpyavāpa khagasattama // / / //
analyzed: sa cartumukha saṃjñām ca api avāpa khaga sattama
translated: he also obtained the name of the four-faced one, O best of birds.

original: evaṃ catvārirūpāṇi brahmaṇaḥ kīrtitāni ca /
analyzed: evam catvāri rūpāṇi brahmaṇaḥ kīrtitāni ca
translated: Thus the four forms of Brahman have been described.

original: vāyornāmāni vakṣyehaṃ śṛṇu pakṣīndrasattama // / / //
analyzed: vāyoḥ nāmāni vakṣye iham śṛṇu pakṣi indra sattama
translated: O best of bird-kings, I shall now tell you the names of Vayu. Listen.

original: saṃkarṣaṇācca garuḍa jayāyāṃ yo vabhūva ha /
analyzed: saṃkarṣaṇāt ca garuḍa jayāyām yaḥ vabhūva ha
translated: O Garuda, he who was born from Sankarshana in Jaya,

original: sa vāyuḥ prathamo jñeyo pradhāna iti kīrtitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa vāyuḥ prathamaḥ pradhānaḥ iti kīrtitaḥ
translated: that Vayu should be known as the first, proclaimed as the principal one.

original: lokaceṣṭāpradatvātsa sūtranāmnāpi kīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: loka ceṣṭā prada tvāt sa sūtra nāmnā api kīrtitaḥ
translated: He is also known by the name of Sutra because he is the cause of the movement of the world.

original: badarīsthasya viṣṇośca dhairyeṇa stavanāya saḥ // / / //
analyzed: badarī sthasya viṣṇoḥ ca dhairyeṇa stavanāya saḥ
translated: In order to praise Vishnu residing in Badari, he

original: dhṛtirūpaṃ yayau vāyustasmāddhṛtiriti smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: dhṛti rūpam yayau vāyuḥ tasmāt dhṛtiḥ iti smṛtaḥ
translated: assumed the form of Dhriti, therefore he is known as Dhriti.

original: yogyānāṃ haribhaktānāṃ dhṛtirūpeṇa saṃsthitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yogyānām hari bhaktānām dhṛti rūpeṇa saṃsthitaḥ
translated: He abides in the form of Dhriti for the yogis, devotees of Hari.

original: yato hṛdi sthito vāyustato vai dhṛtisaṃjñakaḥ /
analyzed: yatas hṛdi sthitaḥ vāyuḥ tatas vai dhṛti saṃjñakaḥ
translated: Since Vayu resides in the heart, he is known as Dhriti.

original: sarveṣāṃ ca dṛdi sthitvā smarate sarvadā harim // / / //
analyzed: sarveṣām ca dṛdi sthitvā smarate sarvadā harim
translated: Residing in the hearts of all, he always remembers Hari.

original: ato vāyuḥsthitirnāma babhūva khagasattama /🔽athavā vāyurevaikaḥ śvetadvīpagataṃ harim // / / //
analyzed: atas vāyuḥsthitiḥ nāma babhūva khaga sattama  athavā vāyuḥ eva ekaḥ śvetadvīpa gatam harim
translated: Therefore, O best of birds, the wind came to be known as Sthiti.🔽Or else, the wind alone, O lord of birds, always remembers Hari who resides in the White Island,

original: sadā smarati vai vīndra atosau smṛtisaṃjñakaḥ /
analyzed: sadā smarati vai vi indra atas asau smṛti saṃjñakaḥ
translated: Therefore, he is called Smriti.

original: sarveṣāṃ ca hṛdisthitvā jñāto viṣṇorudīraṇāt // / / //
analyzed: sarveṣām ca hṛdi sthitvā jñātaḥ viṣṇoḥ udīraṇāt
translated: Residing in the hearts of all, he is known by the utterance of Vishnu.

original: ato me muktināmābhūdvāyureva na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: atas me mukti nāmā abhūt vāyuḥ eva na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Therefore, the wind itself undoubtedly became known as Mukti to me.

original: jñānadvāreṇa bhaktānāṃ muktido madanujñayā // / / //
analyzed: jñāna dvāreṇa bhaktānām mukti daḥ mad anujñayā
translated: By the path of knowledge, he grants liberation to the devotees with my permission.

original: yato sau vāyurevaiko muktināmā bhūvaha /
analyzed: yatas sau vāyuḥ eva ekaḥ mukti nāmā bhūvaha
translated: Therefore, that wind alone became known as Mukti.

original: viṣṇau bhaktiṃ vardhyati bhaktānāṃ hṛdi saṃsthitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: viṣṇau bhaktim vardhyati bhaktānām hṛdi saṃsthitaḥ
translated: Residing in the hearts of the devotees, he increases devotion to Vishnu.

original: atosau viṣṇubhaktaśca kīrtito nātra saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: atas asau viṣṇu bhaktaḥ ca kīrtitaḥ na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: Therefore, he is undoubtedly declared to be a devotee of Vishnu.

original: eṣosau sarvajīvānāṃ cittasaṃjñānameva ca // / / //
analyzed: eṣā usau sarva jīvānām citta saṃjñānam eva ca
translated: He is indeed the consciousness of all living beings.

original: cittarūpo yato vāyurataścittamiti smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: citta rūpaḥ yatas vāyuḥ atas cittam iti smṛtaḥ
translated: Since the wind is in the form of the mind, therefore it is known as the mind.

original: prabhuḥ prabhūṇāṃ garuḍa sodarāṇāṃ ca sarvaśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: prabhuḥ prabhūṇām garuḍa sodarāṇām ca sarvaśas
translated: O Garuda, he is the lord of all lords and of all brothers.

original: atastu vāyurevaiko mahāprabhuriti smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: atas tu vāyuḥ eva ekaḥ mahā prabhuḥ iti smṛtaḥ
translated: Therefore, the wind alone is known as the great lord.

original: sarveṣāṃ ca hṛhi sthitvā balaṃ paśyati sattama // / / //
analyzed: sarveṣām ca hṛhi sthitvā balam paśyati sattama
translated: Residing in the hearts of all, he sees their strength, O best one.

original: ato balamiti hyākhyāmavāpa vinatāsuta /
analyzed: atas balam iti hi ākhyām avāpa vinatā suta
translated: Therefore, the son of Vinata obtained the name of Bala (strength).

original: sarveṣāṃ ca hṛdi sthitvā putrapautrādikairjanaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: sarveṣām ca hṛdi sthitvā putra pautra ādikaiḥ janaiḥ
translated: And having remained in the hearts of all, he always performs sacrifices with his sons, grandsons and other people.

original: yājanaṃ kurute nityamatosau yaṣṭṛsaṃjñakaḥ /
analyzed: yājanam kurute nityam atas asau yaṣṭṛ saṃjñakaḥ
translated: He is called the sacrificer because he always performs sacrifices.

original: anantakalpamārabhya vāyuparyantameva ca // / / //
analyzed: ananta kalpam ārabhya vāyu paryantam eva ca
translated: Beginning from the endless kalpa and ending with Vayu,

original: vakratvaṃ nāsti yogasya ṛjuryogya iti smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: vakra tvam na asti yogasya ṛjuḥ yogyaḥ iti smṛtaḥ
translated: there is no crookedness in yoga, it is said to be straight yoga.

original: yogasya vakratā nāma kāmyatā haripūjane /
analyzed: yogasya vakra tā nāma kāmya tā hari pūjane
translated: Crookedness in yoga means desiring to worship Hari.

original: īśarudrādikānāṃ ca kāmyena haripūjanam // / / //
analyzed: īśa rudra ādikānām ca kāmyena hari pūjanam
translated: The worship of Hari by Ishvara, Rudra and others is done with desire.

original: kasyacittvatha pakṣīndra hyatastvanṛjavaḥ smṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: kasyacid tu atha pakṣi indra hi atas tu anṛjavaḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: O king of birds, therefore, they are considered crooked.

original: ṛṣyādīnāṃ ca madhyepi kāmyena haripūjanam /
analyzed: ṛṣi ādīnām ca madhye api kāmyena hari pūjanam
translated: Even among the sages and others, the worship of Hari with desire,

original: ato na ṛjavo jñeyā manuṣyāṇāṃ ca kā kathā // / / //
analyzed: atas na ṛjavaḥ jñeyāḥ manuṣyāṇām ca kā kathā
translated: therefore, they should not be known as straight, what to speak of human beings.

original: yāvatkāmyasaparyāṃ vai na jahāti narottamaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat kāmya saparyām vai na jahāti narottamaḥ
translated: As long as the best of men does not abandon the worship with desire,

original: tathā ṛṣyādayaścaiva mokṣasya paripanthinīm // / / //
analyzed: tathā ṛṣi ādayaḥ ca eva mokṣasya paripanthinīm
translated: so also the sages and others, the obstacle to liberation,

original: anādikālamārabhya karmajanyā ca vāsanā /
analyzed: anādi kālam ārabhya karma janyā ca vāsanā
translated: the impressions born of karma, beginning from beginningless time,

original: mokṣādhikāriṇaḥ sarve kurvate kasya pūjanam // / / //
analyzed: mokṣa adhikāriṇaḥ sarve kurvate kasya pūjanam
translated: all those eligible for liberation perform whose worship?

original: naṣṭaprāyaṃ ca tatsarvaṃ guroḥ saṃjñānabodhakāt /
analyzed: naṣṭa prāyam ca tat sarvam guroḥ saṃjñāna bodhakāt
translated: All that is almost lost, from the teacher's instruction and awakening,

original: prāpyayogaṃ samācarya ante mokṣamavāpnuyāt // / / //
analyzed: prāpya yogam samācarya ante mokṣam avāpnuyāt
translated: Having attained yoga and practiced it, one attains liberation in the end.

original: kāmyena pūjanaṃ viṣṇoraiśvaryaṃ pradadāti ca /🔽jñānaṃ ca viparītaṃ syāttena yātyadharaṃ tamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kāmyena pūjanam viṣṇoḥ aiśvaryam pradadāti ca  jñānam ca viparītam syāt tena yāti adharam tamaḥ
translated: The worship of Vishnu with desires grants lordship.🔽But inverted knowledge leads one to lower darkness.

original: tadeva viparītaṃ cejjñānāya parikīrtitam /
analyzed: tat eva viparītam ced jñānāya parikīrtitam
translated: If that itself is inverted, it is proclaimed for knowledge.

original: śilāyāṃ viṣṇubuddhistu viṣṇubuddhirdvije tathā // / / //
analyzed: śilāyām viṣṇu buddhiḥ tu viṣṇu buddhiḥ dvije tathā
translated: The notion of Vishnu in a stone, and the notion of Vishnu in a Brahmin,

original: salile tīrthabuddhistu roṇukāyāṃ tathaiva ca /
analyzed: salile tīrtha buddhiḥ tu roṇukāyām tathā eva ca
translated: The notion of a sacred place in water, and likewise in a small particle,

original: śive sūrye paṇmukhe ca viṣṇubuddhiḥ khageśvara // / / //
analyzed: śive sūrye paṇmukhe ca viṣṇu buddhiḥ khageśvara
translated: The notion of Vishnu in Shiva, the sun, and the east, O lord of birds,

original: ityādyamakhilaṃ jñānaṃ viparītamiti smṛtam /
analyzed: iti ādyam akhilam jñānam viparītam iti smṛtam
translated: All this knowledge is said to be inverted.

original: śilādyeṣu ca sarveṣu aikyenava vicintanam // / / //
analyzed: śilā ādyeṣu ca sarveṣu vicintanam
translated: The contemplation of oneness in all things like stones, etc.,

original: viṣṇubuddhiriti proktaṃ na tu tatrasthavedanam /
analyzed: viṣṇu buddhiḥ iti proktam na tu tatrastha vedanam
translated: Is said to be the notion of Vishnu, not the knowledge of what is there.

original: anādyanantakālepi kāmyena haripūjanam // / / //
translated: The worship of Hari with desires at any time, beginningless and endless,

original: yato nāsti tato vāyurṛjuryogyaḥ prakīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: yatas nā asti tatas vāyuḥ ṛjuḥ yogyaḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: Since it does not exist, the wind is declared to be straight and fit.

original: anyeṣāṃ sarvadā nāsti ato na ṛjavaḥ smṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: anyeṣām sarvadā na asti atas na ṛjavaḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: Others do not have it always, therefore they are not considered straight.

original: hariṃ darśayate vāpi aparokṣeṇa sarvadā /
analyzed: harim darśayate vā api aparokṣeṇa sarvadā
translated: Or it always reveals Hari by non-concealment,

original: mokṣādhikāriṇāṃ kāle ataḥ prajñeti kathyate // / / //
analyzed: mokṣa adhikāriṇām kāle atas prajñā iti kathyate
translated: For those eligible for liberation, it is called wisdom.

original: parokṣeṇāpi sarveṣāṃ hariṃ darśayate sadā /
analyzed: parokṣeṇa api sarveṣām harim darśayate sadā
translated: Even indirectly, he always shows Hari to all.

original: ato vāyuḥ sadā vīndra jñānamityeva kīrtitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: atas vāyuḥ sadā vi indra jñānam iti eva kīrtitaḥ
translated: Therefore, O lord of birds, Vayu is always proclaimed as knowledge.

original: hitāhitopadeṣṭṛtvādbhaktānāṃ hṛdaye sthitaḥ /
analyzed: hita ahita upadeṣṭṛ tvāt bhaktānām hṛdaye sthitaḥ
translated: By instructing on what is beneficial and harmful, he resides in the hearts of devotees.

original: tataśca gurusaṃjñāṃ cāpyavāpa sa ca mārutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas ca guru saṃjñām ca api avāpa sa ca mārutaḥ
translated: And thus, that Marut also obtained the designation of Guru.

original: yogināṃ hṛdaye sthitvā sadhyāyati hariṃ param /
analyzed: yoginām hṛdaye sthitvā sa dhyāyati harim param
translated: Residing in the hearts of yogis, he meditates on the supreme Hari.

original: pārthakyenāpi taṃ dhyāyanmahādhyāteti sa smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pārthakyena api tam dhyāyan mahādhyātā iti sa smṛtaḥ
translated: Meditating on him separately, he is known as the great meditator.

original: yadyogyatānusāreṇa vijānāti paraṃ harim /
analyzed: yad yogyatā anusāreṇa vijānāti param harim
translated: According to one's eligibility, he knows the supreme Hari.

original: rudrādau vidyamānāṃśca guṇāñjānāti sarvadā // / / //
analyzed: rudra ādau vidyamānān ca guṇān jānāti sarvadā
translated: He always knows the qualities present in Rudra and others.

original: ato vai vijñanāmāsau prokto hi khagasattama /
analyzed: atas vai vijña nāmā asau proktaḥ hi khaga sattama
translated: Therefore, O best of birds, he is called Vijnana.

original: kāmyānāṃ karmaṇāṃ tyāgādvirāga iti sa smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kāmyānām karmaṇām tyāgāt virāgaḥ iti sa smṛtaḥ
translated: By renouncing desirable actions, he is known as Viraga.

original: athavāyogināṃ nityaṃ hṛdi sthitvā sa mārutaḥ /
analyzed: athavā ayoginām nityam hṛdi sthitvā sa mārutaḥ
translated: Or, residing in the hearts of yogis, that Marut

original: vairāgyaṃ saṃjanayati virāga iti sa smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vairāgyam saṃjanayati virāgaḥ iti sa smṛtaḥ
translated: generates detachment and is known as Viraga.

original: devānāṃ puṇyapāpābhyāṃ sukhamevottarottaram /
analyzed: devānām puṇya pāpābhyām sukham eva uttarottaram
translated: The gods experience only increasing happiness from their merits and sins.

original: tatsukhaṃ tūttareṣāṃ ca vāyuparyantameva ca // / / //
analyzed: tat sukham tu uttareṣām ca vāyu paryantam eva ca
translated: That happiness extends up to the wind for the superior ones,

original: devānāṃ ca ṛṣīṇāṃ ca uttamānāṃ nṛṇāṃ tathā /
analyzed: devānām ca ṛṣīṇām ca uttamānām nṛṇām tathā
translated: For the gods, sages, and the best of men.

original: sukhāṃśaṃ janayedvāyuryatotaḥ sukhasaṃjñakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sukha aṃśam janayet vāyuḥ yatas utas sukha saṃjñakaḥ
translated: The wind generates a portion of happiness, therefore it is called happiness.

original: bhunakti sarvadā vīdraṃ tatra mukhyastu mārutaḥ /
analyzed: bhunakti sarvadā vīdram tatra mukhyaḥ tu mārutaḥ
translated: The wind always enjoys the essence of happiness, and the wind is the principal one there.

original: duḥ khaśokādikaṃ kiñciddevānāṃ bhavati prabho // / / //
analyzed: duḥ kha śoka ādikam kiñcid devānām bhavati prabho
translated: O Lord, there is some unhappiness, grief, etc. for the gods,

original: taccāsurāveśavaśādityavehi na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: tat ca asura āveśa vaśāt iti avehi na saṃśayaḥ
translated: And that is due to the influence of the demons' possession, know this, there is no doubt.

original: tajjīvasya bhavetkiñciddaityānāṃ kramaśo bhavet // / / //
analyzed: tat jīvasya bhavet kiñcid daityānām kramaśas bhavet
translated: That may happen to the individual soul, and gradually to the demons,

original: yataḥ kaliścādhikaḥ syādato duḥ khīti sa smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: yatas kaliḥ ca adhikaḥ syāt atas duḥ khī iti sa smṛtaḥ
translated: From where Kali would be excessive, therefore he is known as unhappy.

original: daityānāṃ puṇyapāpābhyāṃ duḥ kha mevottarottaram // / / //
analyzed: daityānām puṇya pāpābhyām duḥkham eva uttarottaram
translated: For the demons, unhappiness is more and more due to both merit and sin,

original: tadduḥ khamuttareṣāṃ ca kaliparyantameva ca /
analyzed: tat duḥ kham uttareṣām ca kali paryantam eva ca
translated: That unhappiness extends up to the wind for the superior ones, and up to Kali.

original: bhunakti sarvadā vīndra tataḥ kaliriti smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhunakti sarvadā vi indra tatas kaliḥ iti smṛtaḥ
translated: O Indra of the gods, he always enjoys, therefore he is known as Kali.

original: sukhaharṣādikaṃ kiṃ ciddaityānāṃ bhavati prabho /🔽devāveśo bhavettasya nātra kāryā vicāraṇā // / / //
analyzed: sukha harṣa ādikam kim cit daityānām bhavati prabho  deva āveśaḥ bhavet tasya na atra kāryā vicāraṇā
translated: O Lord, some happiness, joy, etc. happen to the demons,🔽There is no doubt that the possession of the gods happens to him.

original: devānāṃ nirayo nāsti daityānāṃ vinatāsuta /
analyzed: devānām nirayaḥ nā asti daityānām vinatā suta
translated: O son of Vinata, the gods have no hell, the demons have no heaven,

original: sukhasvarūpaṃ tannāsti viṣayotthamapi dvija // / / //
analyzed: sukha sva rūpam tat nā asti viṣaya uttham api dvija
translated: O Brahmin, there is no happiness in the form of objects either.

original: viṣayotthaṃ kiñcidapi devāveśādudīritam /
analyzed: viṣaya uttham kiñcid api deva āveśāt udīritam
translated: Some happiness arising from objects may be expressed due to divine possession.

original: tamo nāstyeva devānāṃ duḥ khaṃ nāsti svarūpataḥ // / / //
analyzed: tamaḥ na asti eva devānām duḥ kham nā asti svarūpataḥ
translated: But darkness does not exist for the gods, and they have no inherent suffering.

original: viṣayotthaṃ mahāduḥ khaṃ devānāṃ nāsti sarvadā /
analyzed: viṣaya uttham mahā duḥ kham devānām nā asti sarvadā
translated: The gods never have great suffering arising from objects.

original: duḥ khaśokādikaṃ kiṃ cidasurāveśato bhavet // / / //
analyzed: duḥ kha śoka ādikam kim cit asura āveśataḥ bhavet
translated: Some suffering, sorrow, etc. may occur due to demon possession.

original: ataḥ kaliḥ sadā duḥ khī sukhī vāyustu sarvadā /
analyzed: atas kaliḥ sadā duḥ khī sukhī vāyuḥ tu sarvadā
translated: Therefore, Kali is always unhappy, while Vayu is always happy.

original: manuṣyāṇā mṛṣīṇāṃ ca sukhaṃ duḥ khaṃ khageśvara // / / //
analyzed: manuṣyāṇām mṛṣīṇām ca sukham duḥ kham khageśvara
translated: O lord of birds, happiness and sorrow for humans and sages

original: bhavettatpuṇyipāpābhyāṃ puṇyabhogī ca mārutaḥ /
analyzed: bhavet tat puṇyi pāpābhyām puṇya bhogī ca mārutaḥ
translated: would be due to merit and sin. Vayu enjoys merit.

original: kaṣṭabhaṅgaḥ kalilayo nātra kāryā vicāraṇā // / / //
analyzed: kaṣṭa bhaṅgaḥ kali layaḥ na atra kāryā vicāraṇā
translated: The destruction of difficulties and the end of Kali - no doubt should be entertained about this.

original: prāṇādisukhaparyantā aṃśā ekonaviṃśatiḥ /
analyzed: prāṇa ādi sukha paryantāḥ aṃśāḥ ekonaviṃśatiḥ
translated: The nineteen parts, beginning with life and ending with happiness,

original: praviṣṭāḥ saṃti lokeṣu pṛthaksaṃti khageśvara // / / //
analyzed: praviṣṭāḥ saṃti lokeṣu pṛthak saṃti khageśvara
translated: have entered the worlds separately, O lord of birds.

original: mārutarevatārāṃśca śṛṇu pakṣīndrasattama /
analyzed: māruta revat tārān ca śṛṇu pakṣi indra sattama
translated: Listen to the incarnations of Vayu, O best of the lords of birds.

original: caturdaśasu candreṣu dvitīyauyo virocanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: caturdaśasu candreṣu dvitīyauyaḥ virocanaḥ
translated: In the fourteen Indras, the second one is Virochana.

original: sa vāyuriti saṃprokta indrādīnāṃ khageśvara /
analyzed: sa vāyuḥ iti saṃproktaḥ indra ādīnām khageśvara
translated: He is said to be Vayu, O lord of birds, among Indra and others.

original: haritattveṣu sarveṣu sa viṣvagyāvyatekṣaṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: hari tattveṣu sarveṣu sa
translated: In all the green principles, he is the all-pervading, undivided seer.

original: ato rocananāmāsau marudaṃśaḥ prakīrtitaḥ rāmāvatāre hanumānrāmakāryārthasādhakaḥ /
analyzed: atas rocana nāmā asau marut aṃśaḥ prakīrtitaḥ rāma avatāre hanumān rāma kārya artha sādhakaḥ
translated: Therefore, he is proclaimed as the Maruts' portion named Rocha. In the Rama incarnation, he is Hanuman, the accomplisher of Rama's tasks.

original: sa eva bhīmasenastu jāto bhūmyāṃ mahābalaḥ // / / //
analyzed: saḥ eva bhīmasenaḥ tu jātaḥ bhūmyām mahā balaḥ
translated: He alone, the greatly powerful one, is born on earth as Bhimasena.

original: kṛṣṇāvatāre vijñeyo marudaṃśaḥ prakīrtitaḥ // / / //
translated: He should be known as the Maruts' portion proclaimed in the Krishna incarnation.

original: maṇimānnāma daityastu saṃrākhyo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: maṇimān nāma daityaḥ tu saṃra ākhyaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: The demon named Maniman will be born in the future.

original: sarveṣāṃ saṃkaraṃ yastu kariṣyati na saṃśayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sarveṣām saṃkaram yaḥ tu kariṣyati na saṃśayaḥ
translated: He will undoubtedly cause a mixture of all castes.

original: tena saṃkaranāmāsau bhaviṣyati khageśvara /
analyzed: tena saṃkara nāmā asau bhaviṣyati khageśvara
translated: Therefore, O lord of birds, he will be named Sankara.

original: dharmānbhāgavatānsarvānvināśayati sarvathā // / / //
analyzed: dharmān bhāgavatān sarvān vināśayati sarvathā
translated: He will completely destroy all the pious deeds of the devotees of Lord Vishnu.

original: tadā bhūmau vāsudevo bhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: tadā bhūmau vāsudevaḥ bhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Then, there is no doubt that Vasudeva will be born on earth.

original: yajñārthaiḥ sadṛśo yasya nāsti loke caturdaśe // / / //
analyzed: yajña arthaiḥ sadṛśaḥ yasya na asti loke caturdaśe
translated: In the fourteen worlds, there is none equal to him in the matter of sacrifices.

original: ataḥ sa prajñayā pūrṇo bhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: atas sa prajñayā pūrṇaḥ bhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Therefore, he will undoubtedly be full of wisdom.

original: avatārāstrayo vāyormataṃ bhāgavatābhidham // / / //
analyzed: avatārāḥ trayaḥ vāyoḥ matam bhāgavata abhidham
translated: The three incarnations of Vayu are known as the Bhavata.

original: sthāpanaṃ duṣṭadamanaṃ dvayameva prayojanam /
analyzed: sthāpanam duṣṭa damanam dvayam eva prayojanam
translated: The purpose is twofold: establishing and subduing the wicked.

original: nānyatprayojanaṃ vāyostathā vairocanātmake // / / //
analyzed: na anyat prayojanam vāyoḥ tathā vairocana ātmake
translated: There is no other purpose for Vayu, and similarly for Vairocana.

original: avatāratraye vīndra duḥ khaṃ garbhādisaṃbhavam /
analyzed: avatāra traye vi indra duḥ kham garbha ādi saṃbhavam
translated: In the three incarnations, O lord of birds, there is no suffering arising from the womb, etc.

original: nāsti nāstyeva vāyostu tathā vairocanādike // / / //
analyzed: na asti na asti eva vāyoḥ tu tathā vairocana ādike
translated: It does not exist, it does not exist for Vayu, and similarly for Vairocana, etc.

original: śukraśoṇitasaṃbandho hyavatāracatuṣṭaye /
analyzed: śukra śoṇita saṃbandhaḥ hi avatāra catuṣṭaye
translated: The connection with semen and blood is in the four incarnations.

original: nāsti nāstyeva pakṣīndra yato nāstyaśubhaṃ tataḥ // / / //
analyzed: na asti na asti eva pakṣi indra yatas na asti aśubham tatas
translated: It does not exist, it does not exist, O lord of birds, because there is no inauspiciousness.

original: pūrvaṃ garbhaṃ samāśoṣya samaye prabhavasya ca /
analyzed: pūrvam garbham samāśoṣya samaye prabhavasya ca
translated: Having first dried up the womb and at the time of manifestation,

original: prādurbhavati deveśī hyavatāracatuṣṭaye // / / //
analyzed: prādurbhavati deveśī hi avatāra catuṣṭaye
translated: the goddess of the gods appears in the four incarnations.

original: trayoviṃśatirūpāṇāṃ vāyoścaiva khageśvara /
analyzed: trayoviṃśati rūpāṇām vāyoḥ ca eva khageśvara
translated: Of the twenty-three forms and also of Vayu, O lord of birds,

original: rūpairṛjusvarūpaiśca brahmaṇaḥ parameṣṭhinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: rūpaiḥ ṛju svarūpaiḥ ca brahmaṇaḥ parameṣṭhinaḥ
translated: with the forms and true nature of Brahman, the supreme lord.

original: satyameva na saṃdeho nityānandasukhādiṣu /
analyzed: satyam eva na saṃdehaḥ nitya ānanda sukha ādiṣu
translated: Truth alone, there is no doubt, in eternal bliss, happiness, etc.

original: evameva vijānīyānnānyathā tu kathañcana // / / //
analyzed: evam eva vijānīyāt na anyathā tu kathañcana
translated: One should know this alone, not otherwise in any way.

original: etasya śravaṇādeva mokṣaṃ yānti na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: etasya śravaṇāt eva mokṣam yānti na saṃśayaḥ
translated: By merely hearing this, they attain liberation, there is no doubt.

original: tadanantarajānvakṣye śṛṇu pakṣīndrasattama // / / //
analyzed: tad anantara jān vakṣye śṛṇu pakṣi indra sattama
translated: After that, I will tell about the subsequent ones. Listen, O best of the lords of birds.

original: kṛtau pradyumnataścaiva samutpanne khageśvara /
analyzed: kṛtau pradyumnataḥ ca eva samutpanne khageśvara
translated: In the creation, O lord of birds, Pradyumna was born.

original: striyau dve yamale caiva tayormadhye tu yadyikā // / / //
analyzed: striyau dve yamale ca eva tayoḥ madhye tu yadyikā
translated: And two women in a twin birth, and among them, the one born first,

original: vāṇītisaṃjñakāṃ vīndra brahmāṇīsaṃjñakāṃ viduḥ /🔽puruṣākhyaviriñcasya bhāryā sāvitrikā matā /
analyzed: vāṇī iti saṃjñakām vīndra brahmāṇī saṃjñakām viduḥ  puruṣa ākhya viriñcasya bhāryā sāvitrikā matā
translated: O Indra of birds, is known as Vani, and is known as Brahma's wife.🔽She is considered the wife of the Purusha-named Brahma.

original: caturmukhasya bhāryā tu kīrtitā sā sarasvatī // / / //
analyzed: caturmukhasya bhāryā tu kīrtitā sā sarasvatī
translated: And Sarasvati is declared to be the wife of the four-faced one.

original: evaṃ trirūpaṃ vijñeyaṃ vāṇyāśca khagasattama /
analyzed: evam tri rūpam vijñeyam vāṇyāḥ ca khaga sattama
translated: Thus, O best of birds, the three forms of Vani should be known.

original: vakṣye 'vatārān bhāratyāḥ samāhitamanāḥ śṛṇu // / / //
analyzed: vakṣye vatārān bhāratyāḥ samāhita manāḥ śṛṇu
translated: I will tell the incarnations of Bharati. Listen with a concentrated mind.

original: sarvavedābhimānitvātsarvavedātmikā smṛtā /
analyzed: sarva veda abhimāni tvāt sarva veda ātmikā smṛtā
translated: She is remembered as the essence of all the Vedas, because she presides over all the Vedas.

original: mahādhyātuśca vāyostu bhāryāsā parikīrtitā // / / //
analyzed: mahādhyātuḥ ca vāyoḥ tu bhāryā asā parikīrtitā
translated: She is declared to be the wife of the great wind god.

original: jñānarūpasya vāyostu bhāryā sā parikīrtitā /
analyzed: jñāna rūpasya vāyoḥ tu bhāryā sā parikīrtitā
translated: She is declared to be the wife of the wind god in the form of knowledge.

original: sadā sukhasvarūpatvādbhāratī tu sukhātmikā // / / //
analyzed: sadā sukha sva rūpa tvāt bhāratī tu sukha ātmikā
translated: Bharati is of the nature of happiness, because she is always of the nature of happiness.

original: sukhasvarūpa vāyostu bhāryā sā parikīrtitā /
analyzed: vāyoḥ tu bhāryā sā parikīrtitā
translated: She is declared to be the wife of the wind god of the nature of happiness.

original: gurustu vāyurevoktastasmin bhaktiyutā satī // / / //
analyzed: guruḥ tu vāyuḥ eva uktaḥ tasmin bhakti yutā satī
translated: The preceptor is said to be the wind god himself. She is full of devotion to him.

original: tatastu bhāratī nityā gurubhaktiriti smṛtā /
analyzed: tatas tu bhāratī nityā guru bhaktiḥ iti smṛtā
translated: Therefore, Bharati is always remembered as devoted to the preceptor.

original: mahāgurorhi vāyośca bhāryā vai parikīrtitā // / / //
analyzed: mahā guroḥ hi vāyoḥ ca bhāryā vai parikīrtitā
translated: She is declared to be the wife of the great preceptor, the wind god.

original: harau snehayutatvācca hariprītiriti smṛtā /
analyzed: harau sneha yuta tvāt ca hariprītiḥ iti smṛtā
translated: And because of her love for Hari, she is known as Haripriya (beloved of Hari).

original: dhṛtirūpasya vāyośca bhāryā sā parikīrtitā // / / //
analyzed: dhṛti rūpasya vāyoḥ ca bhāryā sā parikīrtitā
translated: She is also known as the wife of the wind god in the form of Dhriti.

original: sarvamantrābhimānitvātsarvamantrātmikā smṛtā /
analyzed: sarva mantra abhimāni tvāt sarva mantra ātmikā smṛtā
translated: And because she presides over all mantras, she is known as the essence of all mantras.

original: mahāprabhośca vāyośca bhāryā vai sā prakīrtitā // / / //
analyzed: mahā prabhoḥ ca vāyoḥ ca bhāryā vai sā prakīrtitā
translated: She is also known as the wife of the great wind god.

original: bhujyante sarvabhogāstu viṣṇuprītyarthamevaca /
analyzed: bhujyante sarva bhogāḥ tu viṣṇu prīti artham eva ca
translated: And because all enjoyments are enjoyed only for the sake of pleasing Vishnu,

original: atastu bhāratī jñeyā bhujināmnā prakīrtitā // / / //
analyzed: atas tu bhāratī jñeyā bhuji nāmnā prakīrtitā
translated: she is known as Bhuh (earth) and is proclaimed by the name of Bhujna (enjoyer).

original: citrarūpasya vāyostu bhāryā sā parikīrtitā /
analyzed: citra rūpasya vāyoḥ tu bhāryā sā parikīrtitā
translated: She is also known as the wife of the wind god in the form of Citrarupa (having variegated forms).

original: rocanendrasya bhāryā ca śraddhākhyā parikīrtitā // / / //
analyzed: rocanā indrasya bhāryā ca śraddhā ākhyā parikīrtitā
translated: And the wife of Rocha-Indra is known as Sraddha (faith).

original: hanumāṃśca tadā jajñe tretāyāṃ pakṣisattama /
analyzed: hanumān ca tadā jajñe tretāyām pakṣi sattama
translated: Then in the Treta age, that Hanuman was born, O best of birds.

original: tadā śivākhyaviprācca jajñe sā bhāratī smṛtā // / / //
analyzed: tadā śiva ākhya viprāt ca jajñe sā bhāratī smṛtā
translated: And then she, known as Bharati, was born from the Brahmin named Shiva.

original: na kevalaṃ bhāratī sāśacyādyaiścaiva saṃyutā /
analyzed: na kevalam bhāratī sā a śacī ādyaiḥ ca eva saṃyutā
translated: She is not only Bharati, but is also united with Sachi and others.

original: tasminsaṃjanitāḥ sarvāḥ prāpuryogaṃ svabhartṛbhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasmin saṃjanitāḥ sarvāḥ prāpuḥ yogam sva bhartṛbhiḥ
translated: All of them were born from him and attained union with their husbands.

original: anyageti ca vijñeyā kanyā tanmatisaṃjñikā /
analyzed: anyagā iti ca vijñeyā kanyā tad mati saṃjñikā
translated: And the daughter known as Kannya is to be known as Anyage (of another age) and Tammati (of that mind).

original: tretānte saiva pakṣīndra śacyādyaiścaiva saṃyutā // / / //
analyzed: tretā ante sā eva pakṣi indra śacī ādyaiḥ ca eva saṃyutā
translated: O best of birds, she herself, at the end of Treta, is united with Sachi and others.

original: damayantyanalājjātā indraseneti cocyate /
analyzed: damayantī analāt jātā indrasenā iti ca ucyate
translated: Born from the fire of Nala, she is called Indraseni.

original: nalaṃ nandayate yasmāttasmācca nalanandinī // / / //
analyzed: nalam nandayate yasmāt tasmāt ca nalanandinī
translated: And because she delights Nala, she is also called Nalanandinī.

original: tatra svabhartṛsaṃyogaṃ naiva cāpa khageśvara /
analyzed: tatra sva bhartṛ saṃyogam nā eva cāpa khageśvara
translated: There, she never had sexual union with her own husband, O lord of birds.

original: tatrānyagātvaṃ vijñeyaṃ puruṣasthena vāyunā // / / //
analyzed: tatra anya gā tvam vijñeyam puruṣa sthena vāyunā
translated: There, her being with another man should be known due to the wind present in the male.

original: kiñcitkālaṃ tathā sthitvā kanyaiva mṛti māpa sā /
analyzed: kiñcid kālam tathā sthitvā kanyā eva mṛti māpa sā
translated: Having remained like that for some time, she died as a virgin.

original: śacyādisaṃyutā saiva drupadasya mahātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śacī ādi saṃyutā sā eva drupadasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: She alone, united with Sachi and others, of the great-souled Drupada,

original: vedimadhyātsamudbhūtā bhīmasenārthameva ca /
analyzed: vedi madhyāt samudbhūtā bhīmasena artham eva ca
translated: arose from the middle of the altar, just for Bhimasena.

original: tatrānyagātvaṃ nāstyeva yogaśca saha bhartṛbhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatra anya gā tvam nā asti eva yogaḥ ca saha bhartṛbhiḥ
translated: There, there is no being with another man, and she is always united with her husbands.

original: kevalā bhāratī jñeyā kāśirājasya kanyakā /
analyzed: kevalā bhāratī jñeyā kāśi rājasya kanyakā
translated: The daughter of the king of Kashi should be known as solely Bharata.

original: kālī nāmnā tu sā jñeyā bhīmasenapriyā sadā // / / //
analyzed: kālī nāmnā tu sā jñeyā bhīmasena priyā sadā
translated: She should always be known as Kali, the beloved of Bhimasena.

original: vācyādibhiḥ saṃyutaivadraupadī drupadātmajā /
analyzed: vācya ādibhiḥ saṃyutā eva draupadī drupada ātmajā
translated: Draupadi, the daughter of Drupada, is united with Vachya and others.

original: dehaṃ tyaktvāviśiṣṭaiva kāraṭīgrāmasaṃjñakai // / / //
analyzed: deham tyaktvā a viśiṣṭā eva kāraṭīgrāma saṃjñakaiḥ
translated: Having abandoned her body, she will be known as Karati, the village.

original: saṃkarasya gṛhe vīndra bhaviṣyati kalau yuge /
analyzed: saṃkarasya gṛhe vīndra bhaviṣyati kalau yuge
translated: O lord of birds, in the house of Samkara, in the Kali Yuga,

original: vāyostṛtīyarūpārthaṃ sā kanyaiva mṛtiṃ gatā // / / //
analyzed: vāyoḥ tṛtīya rūpa artham sā kanyā eva mṛtim gatā
translated: that virgin died for the sake of Vayu's third form.

original: ityādyā vāyubhāryāśca brahmabhāryāśca satama /
analyzed: ityādyāḥ vāyu bhāryāḥ ca brahma bhāryāḥ ca satama
translated: These and others are the wives of Vayu and Brahma, O best of birds.

original: svabhartṛbhyāṃ ca pakṣīndra guṇaiścaiva śatādhamāḥ // / / //
analyzed: sva bhartṛbhyām ca pakṣi indra guṇaiḥ ca eva śata adhamāḥ
translated: They are a hundred times inferior to their husbands in qualities.

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttarakhaṇḍe tṛtīyāṃśe brahmakāṇḍe mahālakṣmyavatārādinirūpaṇaṃ nāma ṣoḍaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttara khaṇḍe tṛtīya aṃśe brahmakāṇḍe mahālakṣmyavatārādinirūpaṇam nāma ṣoḍaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the sixteenth chapter in the Third Parva of Srimad  Bhagavata Mahapurana, in the Vaikuntha-khanda, dealing with the incarnation of Mahalakshmi and other topics.

original: śrīgaruḍamahāpurāṇam
analyzed: śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam
translated: Sri Garuda Mahapurana

original: garuḍa uvāca /
analyzed: garuḍaḥ uvāca
translated: Garuda said:

original: caturjanmasu vai kṛṣṇa śacyādyaiḥ saha bhāratī /
analyzed: catur janmasu vai kṛṣṇa śacī ādyaiḥ saha bhāratī
translated: In the four births, O Krishna, with Sachi and others, Bharati

original: ekadeha viśiṣṭaiva bhuvi jāteti coktavān // / / //
analyzed: eka deha viśiṣṭā eva bhuvi jātā iti ca uktavān
translated: Is said to have been born on earth with an excellent body.

original: kāraṇaṃ brūhi me brahman śiṣyāya tava suvrata /
analyzed: kāraṇam brūhi me brahman śiṣyāya tava suvrata
translated: Tell me the reason, O Brahman, to your disciple, O you of good vows.

original: garuḍenaivamuktastamuvāca madhusūdanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: garuḍena evam uktaḥ tam uvāca madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by Garuda, Madhusudana said to him:

original: śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /
analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Sri Krishna said:

original: viśiṣṭadehasaṃ prāptau bhāratyāḥ pakṣisattama /
analyzed: viśiṣṭa dehasam prāptau bhāratyāḥ pakṣi sattama
translated: O best of birds, regarding the attainment of an excellent body by Bharati,

original: vakṣyāmi kāraṇaṃ vīndra sāvadhānamanāḥ śṛṇu // / / //
analyzed: vakṣyāmi kāraṇam vi indra sa avadhāna manāḥ śṛṇu
translated: I shall tell the reason, O lord of birds, listen with a concentrated mind.

original: purā kṛtayuge vīndra rudrabhāryā ca pārvatī /
analyzed: purā kṛta yuge vīndra rudra bhāryā ca pārvatī
translated: O lord of birds, in ancient times, in the Krita Yuga, Parvati was the wife of Rudra,

original: indrabhāryā śacī devī yama bhāryāca śāmalā // / / //
analyzed: indra bhāryā śacī devī yama bhāryā ca śāmalā
translated: Goddess Shachi was the wife of Indra, and Shayama was the wife of Yama.

original: aśvibhāryā uṣā devī bhartṛbhiḥ sahitā khaga /
analyzed: aśvi bhāryā uṣāḥ devī bhartṛbhiḥ sahitā khaga
translated: O bird, Ushā was the wife of the Ashvins, along with her husbands.

original: brahmalokaṃ yayustatra brahmāṇaṃ dadṛśustadā // / / //
analyzed: brahma lokam yayuḥ tatra brahmāṇam dadṛśuḥ tadā
translated: They went to Brahmaloka and there saw Brahma.

original: hāvaṃ bhāvaṃ vilāsaṃ ca darśayāmāsurañjasā /
analyzed: hāvam bhāvam vilāsam ca darśayāmāsuḥ añjasā
translated: They quickly displayed haughtiness, emotion, and playfulness.

original: dṛṣṭvā tā uddhatā brahmā śaśāpa khagasattama // / / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā tāḥ uddhatāḥ brahmā śaśāpa khaga sattama
translated: Seeing them haughty, Brahma cursed them, O best of birds.

original: uddhatāśca yato yūyaṃ mānuṣīṃ yonimāpsyatha /
analyzed: uddhatāḥ ca yatas yūyam mānuṣīm yonim āpsyatha
translated: Since you are haughty, you will attain human birth.

original: tatra svabhartṛsaṃyogamavāpsyatha khageśvara // / / //
analyzed: tatra sva bhartṛ saṃyogam avāpsyatha khageśvara
translated: There, O lord of birds, you will attain union with your own husbands.

original: evaṃ śaptāstu tāḥ sarvā ājagmurmeruparvatam /
analyzed: evam śaptāḥ tu tāḥ sarvāḥ ājagmuḥ meru parvatam
translated: Thus cursed, they all went to Mount Meru.

original: tatropaviṣṭaṃ brahmāṇaṃ vañcayāmāsurañjasā // / / //🔽tūṣṇīmeva sthite vīndra vañcayantyaḥ sthitāḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: tatra upaviṣṭam brahmāṇam vañcayāmāsuḥ añjasā  tūṣṇīm eva sthite vi indra vañcayantyaḥ sthitāḥ punar
translated: There, they quickly deceived Brahma, who was seated.🔽While he remained silent, O lord of birds, they remained deceiving him.

original: tatastūṣṇīṃ sthitaṃ vīndra vañcayāmāsurañjasā // / / //
analyzed: tatas tūṣṇīm sthitam vīndra vañcayāmāsuḥ añjasā
translated: Then, while he remained silent, they quickly deceived him.

original: trivārānantaraṃ brahmā śaptavāṃstā mahāprabhuḥ /
analyzed: tri vāra anantaram brahmā śaptavān tāḥ mahā prabhuḥ
translated: After three times, Brahma, the great lord, cursed them.

original: trivāraṃ vañcanaṃ yasmādekavāraṃ ca darśanam // / / //
analyzed: tri vāram vañcanam yasmāt eka vāram ca darśanam
translated: Since you deceived three times and showed yourself once,

original: kiṃ cāśrutvātaḥ paścāccaturjanmasu bhūtale /
analyzed: kim ca a śrutvā atas paścāt catur janmasu bhū tale
translated: and since you did not listen to this, in the next four births on earth,

original: ekadehānmānuṣatvaṃ bhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: eka dehāt mānuṣa tvam bhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ
translated: you will undoubtedly attain human birth in one body.

original: dvitīye janmani tathā anyagātvamavāpsyatha /
analyzed: dvitīye janmani tathā anya gā tvam avāpsyatha
translated: In the second birth, you will attain the state of others.

original: tṛtīye janmani tathā bhartṛsaṃyoga māpsyatha // / / //
analyzed: tṛtīye janmani tathā bhartṛ saṃyoga māpsyatha
translated: In your third birth, you will obtain union with your husbands.

original: janmanyādye caturthe ca nānyagātvamavāpsyatha /
analyzed: janmani ādye caturthe ca nā anya gā tvam avāpsyatha
translated: In your first and fourth births, you will not attain union with others.

original: tathā svabhartṛsaṃyogaṃ nāvāpsyatha ca sarvaśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tathā sva bhartṛ saṃyogam nā avāpsyatha ca sarvaśas
translated: And in every way, you will not obtain union with your own husbands.

original: evaṃ śaptāstu tāḥ sarvā brahmaṇā pakṣisattama /
analyzed: evam śaptāḥ tu tāḥ sarvāḥ brahmaṇā pakṣi sattama
translated: Thus cursed by Brahma, O best of birds, all of them

original: tadā vicārayāmāsurmilitvā merumūrdhani // / / //
analyzed: tadā vicārayāmāsuḥ militvā meru mūrdhani
translated: then deliberated together on the peak of Mount Meru.

original: brahmaśāpastvanirvāya upāyaiḥ śataśopi ca /🔽nīcaiḥ samāgamo nindyastathaiva ca vipattidaḥ // / / //
analyzed: brahma śāpaḥ tu anirvāyaḥ upāyaiḥ śataśas upi ca  nīcaiḥ samāgamaḥ nindyaḥ tathā eva ca vipatti daḥ
translated: Brahma's curse cannot be averted even by hundreds of means.🔽Union with an inferior is censurable and also brings about misfortune.

original: uttamena ca saṃgena daivenāpyarthado bhavet /
analyzed: uttamena ca saṃgena daivena api artha daḥ bhavet
translated: And union with a superior will bring about the desired result even by fate.

original: devānāmuttamo vāyustadarthaṃ saṃgamācaret // / / //
analyzed: devānām uttamaḥ vāyuḥ tad artham saṃgam ācaret
translated: Vayu is the best of the gods, therefore one should have union with him.

original: vicāryaivamumādyā bhāratyāḥ sevāṃ tu cakrire /
analyzed: vicārya evam umā ādyāḥ bhāratyāḥ sevām tu cakrire
translated: Having deliberated thus, they began to serve Bharati, O descendant of Bharata.

original: sahasravatsarānte sā bhāratī toṣitābravīt // / / //
analyzed: sahasra vatsara ante sā bhāratī toṣitā bravīt
translated: At the end of a thousand years, she, being pleased, said to Bharati:

original: matsevāṃ ca kimarthaṃ vai hyācariṣyanti suvratāḥ /
analyzed: mad sevām ca kimartham vai hi ācariṣyanti suvratāḥ
translated: O you of good vows, why do you serve me?

original: tasyāṃ raktāśca tā devyastvabruvansvacikīrṣitam // / / //
analyzed: tasyām raktāḥ ca tāḥ devyaḥ tu abruvan sva cikīrṣitam
translated: Those goddesses, being attached to her, told her their desire:

original: purā vayaṃ tu śaptāḥ sma brahmaṇā krodharūpiṇā /
analyzed: purā vayam tu śaptāḥ sma brahmaṇā krodha rūpiṇā
translated: Formerly we were cursed by Brahma, who was in the form of anger.

original: ekadehānmānuṣatvamavāpsyatha varāṅganāḥ // / / //
analyzed: eka dehāt mānuṣa tvam avāpsyatha vara aṅganāḥ
translated: O excellent women, you will attain human birth in one body.

original: caturthajanmanyapyevaṃ dvitīye janmani prabho /
analyzed: caturtha janmani api evam dvitīye janmani prabho
translated: O Lord, in the fourth birth also, in the second birth,

original: samāpsyathānyagātvaṃ cetyevaṃ śaptā ha bhāmini // / / //
analyzed: samāpsyatha anya gā tvam ca iti evam śaptā ha bhāmini
translated: you will attain the state of being born from another, thus cursed, O beautiful lady.

original: asmākaṃ vāyunā devenānyagātvaṃ na doṣabhāk /
analyzed: asmākam vāyunā devena anya gātvam na doṣa bhāj
translated: We are not at fault in attaining the state of being born from another by the god Vayu.

original: atastvayaikadehatvamicchāmo devi janmasu // / / //
analyzed: atas tvayā eka deha tvam icchāmaḥ devi janmasu
translated: Therefore, O Goddess, we desire to have one body in the births.

original: hatyuktā tābhiratha ca tathaityuktvā dvijottama /
analyzed: hatī uktā tābhiḥ atha ca tathā eti uktvā dvijottama
translated: Thus spoken to by them, and saying So be it, O best of Brahmins,

original: sā pārvatyādibhiryuktā bhāratītyabhavadbhuvi // / / //
analyzed: sā pārvatī ādibhiḥ yuktā bhāratī iti abhavat bhuvi
translated: She became Parvati and others on earth.

original: śivanāmno dvijasyaiva gṛhe sā tu kumārikā /
analyzed: śiva nāmnaḥ dvijasya eva gṛhe sā tu kumārikā
translated: In the house of a Brahmin named Shiva, she became a young girl.

original: karmaikyārthaṃ tapaścakreḥ viṣṇośca śivasaṃjñinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: karma aikya artham tapaḥ cakreḥ viṣṇoḥ ca śiva saṃjñinaḥ
translated: For the sake of unity of action, she performed austerities for Vishnu named Shiva.

original: tapasā toṣitā viṣṇuḥ śiva saṃjño mahāprabhuḥ /
analyzed: tapasā toṣitā viṣṇuḥ śiva saṃjñaḥ mahā prabhuḥ
translated: The great lord Vishnu named Shiva was pleased by her austerities.

original: varaṃ prādāttṛtīyesminkṛṣṇajanmani bho striyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: varam prādāt tṛtīye ismin kṛṣṇa janmani bho striyaḥ
translated: O women, he granted a boon in this third birth of Krishna.

original: samyaktvabhartṛsaṃyogo bhaviṣyati vinā bhavam /
analyzed: samyaktva bhartṛ saṃyogaḥ bhaviṣyati vinā bhavam
translated: You will have union with your husband properly, without Bhava (Shiva).

original: yatonayā ca pārvatyā preritā eva sarvaśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yatas unayā ca pārvatyā preritāḥ eva sarvaśas
translated: Because she was indeed urged by Parvati in every way.

original: vilāsaṃ darśayāmāsa brahmaṇaḥ parameṣṭhinaḥ /
analyzed: vilāsam darśayāmāsa brahmaṇaḥ parameṣṭhinaḥ
translated: She displayed a playful dance to the supreme Brahman.

original: ataḥ sā pārvātī śreṣṭhā brahmadehe na saṃśayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: atas sā pārvātī śreṣṭhā brahma dehe na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Therefore, that daughter of Parvati is the best in the body of Brahma, there is no doubt.

original: kṛṣṇadehepi tasyāstu na bhaviṣyati saṃgamaḥ /
analyzed: kṛṣṇa dehe pi tasyāḥ tu na bhaviṣyati saṃgamaḥ
translated: And in the body of Krishna also, there will be no union with her.

original: anyagātvaṃ dvitīyesminbhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: anya gā tvam dvitīye smin bhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ
translated: In the second one, there will be the state of being another's wife, there is no doubt.

original: rudrāntaḥ stho hariścaiva vahaṃ dattvā striyāṃ prabhuḥ /
analyzed: rudra antar sthaḥ hariḥ ca eva vaham dattvā striyām prabhuḥ
translated: Rudra is within, and Hari, having given the boon to the woman, the lord,

original: antardhānaṃ yayau śrīmānsvalokaṃ gatavānabhūt // / / //
analyzed: antardhānam yayau śrīmān sva lokam gatavān abhūt
translated: the glorious one disappeared and went to his own world.

original: visṛjya tāśca taṃ dehaṃ babhūvurnalakanyakāḥ /
analyzed: visṛjya tāḥ ca tam deham babhūvuḥ nala kanyakāḥ
translated: Having abandoned that body, they became the daughters of the sky.

original: indraseneti saṃjñāṃ ca labdhvā tāśca tapovanam // / / //
analyzed: indrasenā iti saṃjñām ca labdhvā tāḥ ca tapaḥ vanam
translated: And having obtained the name Indrasena, they went to the penance grove.

original: yayustatra carantyastā dadṛśurmudgalaṃ tvṛṣim /
analyzed: yayuḥ tatra carantyaḥ tāḥ dadṛśuḥ mudgalam tu ṛṣim
translated: And there, wandering, they saw the sage Mudgala.

original: tasya darśanamātreṇa babhūvuḥ kāmamohitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasya darśana mātreṇa babhūvuḥ kāma mohitāḥ
translated: By merely seeing him, they became infatuated with desire.

original: mudgalasyābhimānaṃ hi nāśayitvā ca mārutaḥ /
analyzed: mudgalasya abhimānam hi nāśayitvā ca mārutaḥ
translated: Having destroyed the pride of Mudgala, the wind god,

original: ramayāmāsa tatrasthā bhāratyādivarāṅganāḥ // / / //🔽taddehena visṛṣṭā sā babhūva draupadīti ca /🔽yasmātsā drupadājjātā tasmātsā draupadī smṛtā // / / //
analyzed: ramayāmāsa tatrasthāḥ bhāratī ādi vara aṅganāḥ  tad dehena visṛṣṭā sā babhūva draupadī iti ca  yasmāt sā drupadāt jātā tasmāt sā draupadī smṛtā
translated: enjoyed the excellent women headed by Bharati who were there.🔽Abandoned by his body, she became known as Draupadi.🔽Since she was born from Drupada, she is remembered as Draupadi.

original: vedimadhyātsamudbhūtā tasmātsāyonijā smṛtā /
analyzed: vedi madhyāt samudbhūtā tasmāt sā ayonijā smṛtā
translated: She arose from the middle of the altar, therefore she is remembered as born from a sacrificial altar.

original: kṛṣṇavarṇā yatastasmātsā kṛṣṇā bhūtale smṛtā // / / //
analyzed: kṛṣṇa varṇā yatas tasmāt sā kṛṣṇā bhū tale smṛtā
translated: Therefore, she is remembered as Krishna on earth.

original: kṛṣṇādehapi bhāratyā abhimānaḥ sadā smṛtaḥ /🔽śacyāderabhimānastu tasmindehe kadācana // / / //
analyzed: bhāratyāḥ abhimānaḥ sadā smṛtaḥ  śacī ādeḥ abhimānaḥ tu tasmin dehe kadācana
translated: The pride of Bharti is always remembered in Krishna's body, O descendant of Bharata.🔽But the pride of Shachi and others is sometimes in that body.

original: yasyāḥ svabhartṛsaṃyogakāle ca khagasattama /
analyzed: yasyāḥ sva bhartṛ saṃyoga kāle ca khaga sattama
translated: O best of birds, at the time of union with her own husband,

original: abhimānastadaiva syāttasyā eva na cānyathā // / / //
analyzed: abhimānaḥ tadā eva syāt tasyāḥ eva na ca anyathā
translated: the pride is only in her, not otherwise.

original: etāsāṃ ramaṇe kāle umāyāḥ pakṣisattama /
analyzed: etāsām ramaṇe kāle umāyāḥ pakṣi sattama
translated: O best of birds, at the time of enjoyment with these, Uma,

original: abhimānaśca nāstyeva svāpa eva ratāḥ sadā // / / //
analyzed: abhimānaḥ ca na asti eva svāpe eva ratāḥ sadā
translated: there is no pride, they are always engaged in sleep.

original: pārthasya ramaṇe kāle draupadyāśca kalevare /
analyzed: pārthasya ramaṇe kāle draupadyāḥ ca kalevare
translated: At the time of enjoyment with Partha and in Draupadi's body,

original: bhāratyāśca tathā śacyā abhimānadvayaṃ smṛtam // / / //
analyzed: bhāratyāḥ ca tathā śacyāḥ abhimāna dvayam smṛtam
translated: the pair of prides of Bharti and Shachi is remembered.

original: umādeḥ śyāma lādeśca abhimānakṣatistadā /
analyzed: umā ādeḥ lādeḥ ca abhimāna kṣatiḥ tadā
translated: Then there is loss of pride in Uma and Shayama, etc.

original: sarvāsāṃ svāpa eva syānnātra kāryā vicāraṇā // / / //
analyzed: sarvāsām svāpaḥ eva syāt na atra kāryā vicāraṇā
translated: Sleep is for all of them, there is no doubt about it.

original: arjunaṃ vīrarūpeṇa praviṣṭo vāyureva ca /
analyzed: arjunam vīra rūpeṇa praviṣṭaḥ vāyuḥ eva ca
translated: And Vayu himself, in the form of a hero, entered Arjuna.

original: bhāratīṃ ramate nityaṃ śāmalāṃ ca yudhiṣṭhiraḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhāratīm ramate nityam śāmalām ca yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: Yudhishthira always enjoys Bharti and Shayama.

original: suṃdareṇa ca rūpeṇa praviṣṭo nakule marut /
analyzed: suṃdareṇa ca rūpeṇa praviṣṭaḥ nakule marut
translated: Marut entered Nakula in a handsome form.

original: ramate bhāratīṃ nityaṃ nakulaścāpyuṣāṃ khaga // / / //
analyzed: ramate bhāratīm nityam nakulaḥ ca api uṣām khaga
translated: O bird, Nakula always delights in the Bharata (epic), and Sahadeva in Ushā.

original: nītirūpeṇa cāviṣṭo sahadeve ca mārutaḥ /
analyzed: nīti rūpeṇa ca āviṣṭaḥ sahadeve ca mārutaḥ
translated: The wind god entered Sahadeva in the form of policy.

original: draupadīṃ ramate nityaṃ sahadevotpayuṣāṃ khaga // / / //
analyzed: draupadīm ramate nityam khaga
translated: O bird, Sahadeva always delights in Draupadī, the daughter of Uṣa.

original: śacyādyā draupadīdehe nāpuḥ saṃgaṃ ca mārutaḥ /
analyzed: śacī ādyāḥ draupadī dehe na āpuḥ saṃgam ca mārutaḥ
translated: Śacī and others attained union with Draupadī's body, and the wind god with her.

original: tāsāmatonyagāmitvaṃ kṛṣṇādehe na cintayet // / / //
analyzed: tāsām atonya gāmi tvam kṛṣṇā dehe na cintayet
translated: Therefore, one should not think of Krishna's body as being visited by others.

original: dharmādidehasaṃgaṃ ca bhāratyā naiva cintayet /
analyzed: dharma ādi deha saṃgam ca bhāratyāḥ nā eva cintayet
translated: One should not think of the union of Dharma and others with the body of Bharata.

original: manujasya ca dehasya tāsāṃ saṃgaṃ cintayet // / / //
analyzed: manujasya ca dehasya tāsām saṃgam cintayet
translated: One should think of the union of those (goddesses) with the body of a human being.

original: aparokṣavatīnāṃ tu tāsāṃ lepo na sarvathā /
analyzed: aparokṣavatīnām tu tāsām lepaḥ na sarvathā
translated: But for those who have direct perception, there is no contact at all.

original: athavā mudgalasyeva ratikāle khageśvara // / / //
analyzed: athavā mudgalasya iva rati kāle khageśvara
translated: Or, O lord of birds, at the time of enjoyment, like Mudgala,

original: ramaṇaṃ cakrurevaṃ tā ato doṣo na vidyate /
analyzed: ramaṇam cakruḥ evam tāḥ atas doṣaḥ na vidyate
translated: they enjoyed in this way, so there is no fault.

original: ekasmindivase vīndra dharmo vāyuśca tāvubhau // / / //
analyzed: ekasmin divase vi indra dharmaḥ vāyuḥ ca tau ubhau
translated: O lord of birds, on one day, both Dharma and Vayu,

original: ramaṇaṃ cakratuḥ samyakkṛṣṇādehe 'pi mānada /
analyzed: ramaṇam cakratuḥ samyak kṛṣṇā dehe mānada
translated: properly enjoyed in Krishna's body too, O respectable one.

original: tathāpyananyāgāmitvaṃ cintanīyaṃ na saṃśayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tathā api ananya āgāmi tvam cintanīyam na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Nevertheless, one should undoubtedly think of her as not visited by others.

original: surāṇāṃ surabhogyāśca bhogaṃ jānanti devatāḥ /
analyzed: surāṇām sura bhogyāḥ ca bhogam jānanti devatāḥ
translated: The gods know the enjoyment of the gods and the enjoyments of the goddesses.

original: na jānantyeva martyāṃstu teṣu deheṣu te punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: na jānanti eva martyān tu teṣu deheṣu te punar
translated: They do not know the mortals who are again in those bodies.

original: nīrakṣīravivikaṃ ca haṃso vetti na cāparaḥ /
analyzed: nīra kṣīra vivikam ca haṃsaḥ vetti na ca aparaḥ
translated: And the swan alone knows the separation of water and milk, not anyone else.

original: ataḥ svabhartṛsaṃyogaṃ kṛṣṇādehena cintayet kṛṣṇādehenyagāmitvaṃ naiva cintyaṃ khageśvara // / / //
analyzed: atas sva bhartṛ saṃyogam kṛṣṇā dehena cintayet na eva cintyam khageśvara
translated: Therefore, one should contemplate the union with one's husband through Krishna's form, and one should never contemplate going to another through Krishna's form, O lord of birds.

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttarakhaṇḍe tṛtīyāṃśe brahmakāṇḍe bhāratyā viśiṣṭadeha saṃprāptyai kāraṇanirūpaṇaṃ nāma saptadaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttara khaṇḍe tṛtīya aṃśe brahmakāṇḍe bhāratyāḥ viśiṣṭa deha saṃprāptyai kāraṇanirūpaṇam nāma saptadaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the seventeenth chapter in the Brahmakanda of the Srimad Bhagavatam, in the third part of the Uttara Khaṇḍa, on the description of the cause for attaining the distinguished body of Bharata.

original: śrīgaruḍamahāpurāṇam
analyzed: śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam
translated: The Glorious Garuda Mahapurana

original: śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /
analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Shri Krishna said:

original: athānantarajānvakṣye śṛṇu pakṣīndrasattama /
analyzed: atha anantara jān vakṣye śṛṇu pakṣi indra sattama
translated: Now I will tell you about the younger brothers of Ananta. Listen, O best of the lords of birds.

original: śṛṇu tānsāvadhānena śrutvā tānavadhāraya // / / //
analyzed: śṛṇu tān sa avadhānena śrutvā tān avadhāraya
translated: Listen to them attentively, and having heard, understand them.

original: puruṣākhyaviriñcānujātaḥ śeṣo mahābalaḥ /
analyzed: puruṣa ākhya viriñca anujātaḥ śeṣaḥ mahā balaḥ
translated: The greatly powerful Shesha was born as the younger brother of Brahma named Purusha.

original: hare ramāyāśca yasya svasminnidrāṃ prakurvataḥ // / / //
analyzed: hareḥ ramāyāḥ ca yasya svasmin nidrām prakurvataḥ
translated: For Hari and Rama, who were sleeping in him,

original: śayanārthamabhūdeṣa tena kṛtyaṃ harerna tu /🔽sarvadā haridāsohaṃ sarvadā haripūjakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śayana artham abhūt eṣa tena kṛtyam hareḥ na tu  sarvadā hari dāsaḥ aham sarvadā hari pūjakaḥ
translated: this (Shesha) became for the purpose of lying down, but not for Hari's work.🔽I am always the servant of Hari, always the worshipper of Hari.

original: hare sadā namāmi tvāṃ bahu janmani janmani /
analyzed: hare sadā namāmi tvām bahu janmani janmani
translated: I always bow to you, Hari, in many births.

original: evaṃ buddhā tu garuḍo hyabhūcca śayanaṃ hareḥ // / / //
analyzed: evam tu garuḍaḥ hi abhūt ca śayanam hareḥ
translated: Thus, the Buddha became Garuda, the bed of Hari.

original: sūtranāmnastathā vāyoḥ sadāyaṃ vinatāsuta /
analyzed: sūtra nāmnaḥ tathā vāyoḥ sadā ayam vinatā suta
translated: The son of Vinata, Garuda, named Suparna, was always the vehicle of Vayu, named Suparna.

original: kālanāmā ca garuḍo vāhanārthaṃ harerabhūt // / / //🔽tato mahattattvatanorviriñcāttu khageśvara /
analyzed: kāla nāmā ca garuḍaḥ vāhana artham hareḥ abhūt  tatas mahat tattva tanoḥ viriñcāt tu khageśvara
translated: Garuda named Kala became the vehicle of Hari.

original: ahaṃ kārātmako rudraḥ samabhūtsovituṃ harim // / / //
analyzed: aham kārā ātmakaḥ rudraḥ samabhūt sovitum harim
translated: Then, O lord of birds, Rudra, consisting of the principle of Mahat, was born from Brahma, to protect Hari.

original: traya ete mahābhāga parasparasamāḥ smṛtāḥ /
analyzed: trayaḥ ete mahābhāga paraspara samāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: These three, O greatly fortunate one, are considered equal to each other.

original: gāyatrībhāratībhyāṃ te trayaḥ śataguṇā varāḥ // / / //
analyzed: gāyatrī bhāratībhyām te trayaḥ śataguṇāḥ varāḥ
translated: They are superior to Gayatri and Bharati by a hundred times.

original: śeṣaḥ sa eva vijñeyo bhakto nārāyaṇasya ca /
analyzed: śeṣaḥ saḥ eva vijñeyaḥ bhaktaḥ nārāyaṇasya ca
translated: He should be known as Shesha, the devotee of Narayana.

original: viṣṇorvāyoranantasya tribhiraṃśairyutaḥ sadā // / / //
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ vāyoḥ anantasya tribhiḥ aṃśaiḥ yutaḥ sadā
translated: He is always endowed with the three parts of Vishnu, Vayu, and Ananta.

original: sumitrāṃśo daśarathājjāto yo lakṣmaṇaḥ khaga /
analyzed: sumitra aṃśaḥ daśarathāt jātaḥ yaḥ lakṣmaṇaḥ khaga
translated: O bird, Lakshmana, born from Sumitra and Dasharatha,

original: sopi śeṣastu vijñeyo vāyvanantāṃśasaṃyutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: saḥ api śeṣaḥ tu vijñeyaḥ vāyu ananta aṃśa saṃyutaḥ
translated: he too should be known as Shesha, endowed with the parts of Vayu and Ananta.

original: rāmasya sevāṃ kartuṃ sā sītā bhūmyāṃ khagādhipa /
analyzed: rāmasya sevām kartum sā sītā bhūmyām khaga adhipa
translated: O lord of birds, Sita was born on earth to serve Rama.

original: balabhadrastu rohiṇyāṃ vasudevādabhūtkhaga // / / //
analyzed: balabhadraḥ tu rohiṇyām vasudevāt abhūt khaga
translated: O bird, Balabhadra was born from Vasudeva and Rohini.

original: soyamepa tu vijñeyastvaṃśadvayasamanvitaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ uyam epa tu vijñeyaḥ tu aṃśa dvaya samanvitaḥ
translated: He should be known as having two parts.

original: āviṣṭaḥ śuklakṛṣṇe hariṇā rohiṇīsutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: āviṣṭaḥ śukla kṛṣṇe hariṇā rohiṇīsutaḥ
translated: The son of Rohini (Balarama) was possessed by the white and black forms of Hari.

original: traya ete māhābhāgāvatārāḥ phaṇinaḥ smṛtāḥ /
analyzed: trayaḥ ete māhābhāga avatārāḥ phaṇinaḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: These three are considered to be the great incarnations of the serpent.

original: na vīndrāsyāvatārosti bhūmyāṃ cājñā tathā hareḥ // / / //
analyzed: na vi indra asya avatāraḥ asti bhūmyām ca ājñā tathā hareḥ
translated: There is no incarnation of Indra on earth, and Hari's command is thus.

original: rudrāvatārānvakṣyehaṃ tāñchṛṇu tvaṃ samāhitaḥ /
analyzed: rudra avatārān vakṣya iham tān śṛṇu tvam samāhitaḥ
translated: I will now describe the incarnations of Rudra. Listen to them with a focused mind.

original: yohaṅkārātmako rudraḥ sa evābhūtkhageśvara // / / //🔽sadāśiva iti tvākhyāmavāpa sa vināśakaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ uhaṅkāra ātmakaḥ rudraḥ saḥ eva abhūt khageśvara  sadāśivaḥ iti tu ākhyām avāpa sa vināśakaḥ
translated: That Rudra who is of the nature of ego became the lord of birds.🔽He obtained the name Sadashiva, the destroyer.

original: tamobhimānī sa jñeyastvaśivatvātsadāśivaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tamaḥ abhimānī sa jñeyaḥ tu aśiva tvāt sadāśivaḥ
translated: He should be known as the embodiment of darkness. He is Sadashiva because of his inauspicious nature.

original: kapālamālāmaśivāṃ sadā dhārayate yataḥ /
analyzed: kapāla mālām aśivām sadā dhārayate yatas
translated: Because he always wears the inauspicious garland of skulls,

original: ataḥ sadāśaivo jñeyo na ca bhāgavataḥ śivaḥ // / / //🔽gajājinaṃ cāpavitraṃ yato dhārayate haraḥ /🔽lokānamaṅgalānsarvānharate ca sadā haraḥ // / / //
analyzed: atas sadāśaivaḥ jñeyaḥ na ca bhāgavataḥ śivaḥ  gaja ajinam ca apavitram yatas dhārayate haraḥ  lokān amaṅgalān sarvān harate ca sadā haraḥ
translated: He should be known as Sadashiva, not as Shiva who is a part of Vishnu.🔽Because Hara always wears the impure elephant skin,🔽Hara always removes all inauspicious things from the worlds.

original: haryājñayā sadā lokānvipayāsaktacetasaḥ /
analyzed: hari ājñayā sadā lokān vipaya āsakta cetasaḥ
translated: Because he always makes people with minds attached to falsehood turn away from the worlds by the command of Hari,

original: vimukhānkurute yasmādviṣṇostasmātsadāśivaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vimukhān kurute yasmāt viṣṇoḥ tasmāt sadāśivaḥ
translated: Sadashiva is always Vishnu.

original: kadācidasurāveśādviruddhaṃ kurute haraḥ /
analyzed: kadācid asura āveśāt viruddham kurute haraḥ
translated: Sometimes Hara acts contrary (to dharma) due to being possessed by demons,

original: ataḥ sadāśivo jñeyo na ca bhāgavataḥ śivaḥ // / / //
analyzed: atas sadāśivaḥ jñeyaḥ na ca bhāgavataḥ śivaḥ
translated: Therefore, he should be known as Sadashiva, not as Shiva who is a part of Vishnu.

original: soyaṃ śmaśānavasatiṃ kartumaicchadyato haraḥ /
analyzed: saḥ uyam śmaśāna vasatim kartum aicchat yatas haraḥ
translated: He desired to make his abode in the cremation ground, hence he is known as Hara.

original: ataḥ sadāśivo jñeyo na ca bhāgavataḥ śivaḥ // / / //
analyzed: atas sadāśivaḥ jñeyaḥ na ca bhāgavataḥ śivaḥ
translated: Therefore, Sadashiva should be known, not Shiva who is a devotee of Vishnu.

original: daśavarṣaṃ tapaḥ kartuṃ viveśa lavaṇāṃbhasi /
analyzed: daśa varṣam tapaḥ kartum viveśa lavaṇāṃbhasi
translated: He entered the salty ocean to perform penance for ten years.

original: ato rudrastapaḥ saṃjñāmavāpa ca khagottama // / / //
analyzed: rudraḥ tapaḥ saṃjñām avāpa ca khaga uttama
translated: Therefore, Rudra obtained the name of austerity, O best of birds.

original: vyāsaputraḥ śukaḥ prokto vāyorāveśasaṃyutaḥ /
analyzed: vyāsa putraḥ śukaḥ proktaḥ vāyoḥ āveśa saṃyutaḥ
translated: Shuka, the son of Vyasa, is said to be possessed by the influence of Vayu.

original: rudrāvatāro vijñeyo jñānārthamabhavadbhuvi // / / //
analyzed: rudra avatāraḥ vijñeyaḥ jñāna artham abhavat bhuvi
translated: He should be known as an incarnation of Rudra, who came to the earth for the sake of knowledge.

original: atripatnyanusūyāyāṃ jajñe rudro mahātapāḥ /
analyzed: atri patnī anusūyāyām jajñe rudraḥ mahā tapāḥ
translated: Rudra, the great ascetic, was born to Atri's wife Anasūyā.

original: durvāsāstu sa vijñeyo mānabhaṅgāya bhūbhṛtām // / / //
analyzed: durvāsāḥ tu sa vijñeyaḥ māna bhaṅgāya bhūbhṛtām
translated: He should be known as Durvāsas, for the humiliation of kings.

original: droṇājjāto drauṇisaṃjño rudra eva prakīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: droṇāt jātaḥ drauṇi saṃjñaḥ rudraḥ eva prakīrtitaḥ
translated: He who was born from Drona is known as Aśvatthāmā, and is declared to be Rudra himself.

original: prārabdhaṃ bhoktukāmosau parapakṣaprakāśakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: prārabdham bhoktu kāmaḥ asau parapakṣa prakāśakaḥ
translated: Desiring to enjoy the results of his past actions, he illuminates the side of others.

original: īśānakoṇe saṃsthito yastu rudro hyavāpa vai vāmadeveti saṃjñām /
analyzed: īśāna koṇe saṃsthitaḥ yaḥ tu rudraḥ hi avāpa vai vāmadeva iti saṃjñām
translated: Rudra who resides in the northeast corner obtained the name Vāmadeva.

original: svavāmabhāge saṃsthitaṃ caiva vāyustaṃ yogyabhaktaṃ sevate sarvadaiva // / / //
analyzed: sva vāma bhāge saṃsthitam ca eva vāyuḥ tam yogya bhaktam sevate sarvadā eva
translated: And Vāyu, who resides on his left side, always serves that suitable devotee.

original: ato rudro vāmadeveti saṃjñā mavāpa śiṣṭatvamathottamatvam /
analyzed: atas rudraḥ vāmadeva iti saṃjñā m avāpa śiṣṭa tvam atha uttama tvam
translated: Therefore, Rudra obtained the name Vāmadeva, and the status of being righteous and supreme.

original: kālātmakatvaṃ ca balātmakatvamavāpa rudro na tu suṃdaratvataḥ // / / //
analyzed: kāla ātmaka tvam ca bala ātmaka tvam avāpa rudraḥ na tu suṃdara tvataḥ
translated: And Rudra attained the nature of time and strength, not due to his handsome appearance.

original: sadā rudro tripurasthāṃśca daityānviṣṇuduho hantu kāmo mahātmā /
analyzed: sadā tripura sthān ca daityān viṣṇu duhaḥ hantu kāmaḥ mahātmā
translated: Always, the great soul Rudra, desiring to kill the demons residing in Tripura, the enemies of Vishnu,

original: aghorarūpaṃ dhṛpavānrudra eva tatastvaghoreti sa āpa saṃjñām // / / //
analyzed: aghora rūpam dhṛpavān rudraḥ eva tatas tu aghora iti saḥ āpa saṃjñām
translated: Rudra himself assumed a terrible form, and therefore he obtained the name Aghora.

original: sevāṃ kartuṃ tvicchato daityasaṃghānkiñcitkālaṃ tapasā kliśyamānān /
analyzed: sevām kartum tu icchataḥ daitya saṃghān kiñcid kālam tapasā kliśyamānān
translated: Desiring to serve the groups of demons who were undergoing austerities for some time,

original: varāndātuṃ sadya evābhijātaḥ sadyojātetyeva saṃjñāmavāpa // / / //
analyzed: varān dātum sadyas eva abhijātaḥ sadyojāta iti eva saṃjñām avāpa
translated: In order to grant boons immediately, he was born immediately and thus obtained the name Sadyojata.

original: uroḥ putrastu aurvaśca rudra eva prakīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: uroḥ putraḥ tu aurvaḥ ca rudraḥ eva prakīrtitaḥ
translated: The son of Uru is also known as Aurva, and he is declared to be Rudra himself.

original: ityakṛṣṭavācitvādrusturodanavācakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: iti akṛṣṭa vāci tvāt rustu rodana vācakaḥ
translated: Thus, because of the meaninglessness of the word uru, it denotes Rudra, the eater of oblations.

original: urū rudro hyataḥ proktastatputraścaurvasaṃjñakaḥ /
analyzed: uruḥ rudraḥ hi atas proktaḥ tad putraḥ ca aurva saṃjñakaḥ
translated: Therefore, Uru is said to be Rudra, and his son is called Aurva.

original: rudramurvaritaṃ kartumaurvobhūdrudra eva saḥ // / / //
analyzed: rudram urvaritam kartum aurvaḥ bhūt rudraḥ eva saḥ
translated: In order to make Rudra the remaining one, Aurva became Rudra himself.

original: garuḍa uvāca /🔽rodanaṃ kurute kasmādurusaṃjño hare haraḥ /
analyzed: garuḍaḥ uvāca  rodanam kurute kasmāt uru saṃjñaḥ hare haraḥ
translated: Garuda said:🔽Why does Hari Hara, known as Uru, cry?

original: rudamurvaritaṃ kasmātkurute aurvākārakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: rudam urvaritam kasmāt kurute aurvā kārakaḥ
translated: Why does he, in the form of Aurva, make Rudra the remaining one?

original: etadvistārya mebrūhi pautrāya tava suvrata /
analyzed: etat vistārya me brūhi pautrāya tava suvrata
translated: Please explain this in detail to my grandson, O you of good vows.

original: ityuktastena sa hariruvāca karuṇānidhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ tena sa hariḥ uvāca karuṇā nidhiḥ
translated: Thus addressed by him, Hari, the abode of compassion, said:

original: śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /
analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Sri Krishna said:

original: dṛṣṭvā svabiṃbaṃ suguṇaistu pūrṇaṃ saṃkarṣaṇākhyaṃ natapādapadm /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā sva biṃbam su guṇaiḥ tu pūrṇam saṃkarṣaṇa ākhyam nata pāda padmam
translated: Seeing my own image, complete with excellent qualities, with the lotus feet of the one called Samkarshana,

original: śrībrahmaśeṣairjiṣṇukāmaistathānyairbhāratyā vai svasti paiścāpi nityam // / / //
analyzed: śrī brahma śeṣaiḥ jiṣṇu kāmaiḥ tathā anyaiḥ bhāratyāḥ vai svasti paiḥ ca api nityam
translated: By Brahma, Vishnu, Shiva, Indra, and others, always blessed by Bharati and the sages.

original: dṛṣṭvā hariṃ pulakāṅgastu rudraḥ sabhāṣpacakṣū ruddhakaṇṭhaśca hṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā harim pulaka aṅgaḥ tu rudraḥ sa bhāṣpa cakṣūḥ ruddha kaṇṭhaḥ ca hṛṣṭaḥ
translated: Seeing Hari, Rudra, with his body bristling with joy, his eyes filled with tears, his throat choked with emotion, and delighted,

original: anādyanantabrahmakalpeṣu naiva kṛtaṃ yayā smaraṇaṃ sarvadaiva // / / //
analyzed: anādi ananta brahma kalpeṣu nā eva kṛtam yayā smaraṇam sarvadā eva
translated: Who has never before remembered you, the beginningless and endless Brahman, at all times,

original: pādāravinde sunakhairvibhūṣite dṛṣṭe mayā kena puṇyena deva /🔽dṛṣṭvādṛṣṭvā pādapadmaṃ murāreḥ punaḥ punā ruddhakaṇṭho babhūva // / / //
analyzed: pāda aravinde su nakhaiḥ vibhūṣite dṛṣṭe mayā kena puṇyena deva  dṛṣṭvā a dṛṣṭvā pāda padmam murāreḥ punar punar ruddha kaṇṭhaḥ babhūva
translated: By what merit, O Lord, have I seen your lotus feet adorned with dogs?🔽Seeing and seeing again the lotus feet of Murari, he repeatedly became choked with emotion.

original: ruroda rudro bhayakaṃpitāṅgaḥ kathaṃ punardarśanaṃ me prabhoḥ syāt /
analyzed: ruroda rudraḥ bhaya kaṃpita aṅgaḥ katham punar darśanam me prabhoḥ syāt
translated: Rudra wept, his body trembling with fear, How can I see the Lord again?

original: mukunda nārāyaṇa viśvamūrte vāgindriyeṇa stavanaṃ me kathaṃ syāt // / / //
analyzed: mukunda nārāyaṇa viśvamūrte vāc indriyeṇa stavanam me katham syāt
translated: O Mukunda, Narayana, the universal form, how can I praise you with my speech and senses?

original: maddarśanaṃ sarvadā pāpuyuktaṃ tathā madvāk sarvadā pāpayuktā /
analyzed: mad darśanam sarvadā pāpu yuktam tathā mad vāc sarvadā pāpa yuktā
translated: My vision is always tainted with sin, and my speech is always tainted with sin,

original: maddarśanaṃ sarvadā strīṣu saktamabhūcca te darśanaṃ me hyasaktam // / / //
analyzed: mad darśanam sarvadā strīṣu saktam abhūt ca te darśanam me hi asaktam
translated: Your vision was always attached to women, but my vision is unattached to you.

original: āsaktatā putradārādikānāṃ samyak śaktistavane nāsti viṣṇoḥ /
analyzed: āsakta tā putra dāra ādikānām samyak śakti stavane na asti viṣṇoḥ
translated: There is no proper ability to praise Vishnu in the attachment to sons, wives, and so on.

original: viṣṇustutau nāvakāśosti vāco dṛṣṭohaṃ tvaṃ kena puṇyena deva // / / //
analyzed: viṣṇu stutau na avakāśaḥ asti vācaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ uham tvam kena puṇyena deva
translated: There is no opportunity for words in praising Vishnu. O God, by what merit have I seen you?

original: anantakarṇeśa sucandrasaṃjña śrotreṇa nityaṃ na kathā śrutā te /
analyzed: ananta karṇa īśa sucandra saṃjña śrotreṇa nityam na kathā śrutā te
translated: O Lord of infinite ears, O one known as Suchandra, I have never heard your stories with my ears.

original: śrutā mayā bahudhā lokavārtā dṛṣṭo mayā tvaṃ kena puṇyena deva // / / //
analyzed: śrutāḥ mayā bahudhā loka vārtāḥ dṛṣṭaḥ mayā tvam kena puṇyena deva
translated: I have heard the worldly news in many ways. O God, by what merit have I seen you?

original: dṛṣṭvādṛṣṭvā pādapīṭhaṃ hareśca punaḥ punā ruddhaṅkaṭho babhūva /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā a dṛṣṭvā pāda pīṭham hareḥ ca punar ruddhaṅkaṭhaḥ babhūva
translated: Having seen and seen the footstool of Hari again and again, Rudra became repeatedly agitated.

original: ruroda rudro bhayakaṃpitāṅgaḥ kathaṃ punaḥ śravaṇaṃ syātkathāyāḥ // / / //
analyzed: ruroda rudraḥ bhaya kaṃpita aṅgaḥ katham punar śravaṇam syāt kathāyāḥ
translated: Rudra wept with his body trembling in fear, thinking How can I hear the story again?

original: tvamīśa vaikuṇṭha suvāyusaṃjñastvadarpitaṃ gandhapuṣpādikaṃ ca /
analyzed: tvam īśa vaikuṇṭha suvāyu saṃjñaḥ tvad arpitam gandha puṣpa ādikam ca
translated: You are the Lord, Vaikuntha, known as Suvayu. The incense, flowers, etc. offered to you

original: sadā na liptaṃ ca bhujairviliptaṃ tanmūtraviṣṭhādimakardamāmbubhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: sadā na liptam ca bhujaiḥ viliptam tad mūtra viṣṭhā ādi makardama ambubhiḥ
translated: Are never smeared, smeared with the muddy water of your urine, feces, etc.

original: strīṇāṃ kucodaiśca kacodakaiścakakṣodakair gātrajalairmukunda /
analyzed: strīṇām kuca udaiḥ ca kaca udakaiḥ cakakṣa udakaiḥ gātra jalaiḥ mukunda
translated: O Mukunda, with the water from the breasts, hair, armpits, and bodies of women,

original: anarpitairvastragandhādikaiśca dṛṣṭo mayā kena puṇyena deva // / / //
analyzed: an arpitaiḥ vastra gandha ādikaiḥ ca dṛṣṭaḥ mayā kena puṇyena deva
translated: By what merit have I seen the Lord with clothes, fragrances, etc. not offered?

original: spṛṣṭvāspṛṣṭvā harinirmālyagandhaṃ punaḥ punā ruddhakaṇṭho babhūva /
analyzed: spṛṣṭvā a spṛṣṭvā hari nirmālya gandham punar punar ruddha kaṇṭhaḥ babhūva
translated: Again and again, touching the fragrance of Hari's leftovers, his throat choked up.

original: ruroda rudro bhayakaṃpitāṅgaḥ kathaṃ punaḥ sparśanaṃ syātsadā me // / / //🔽nṛsiṃha nāsāsthita nāsikeśa mannāsayā kvāpi supadmasaurabham /
analyzed: ruroda rudraḥ bhaya kaṃpita aṅgaḥ katham punar sparśanam syāt sadā me  nṛsiṃha nāsā sthita nāsikeśa mad nāsayā kvāpi su padma saurabham
translated: Rudra wept, his body trembling with fear, How can I always touch it again?🔽O Man-lion, O Lord of the nose, the fragrance of a beautiful lotus in my nose,

original: nāghrātamitthaṃ punarāghrātameva hyanarpitaṃ gandhapuṣpādikaṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: na āghrātam ittham punar āghrātam eva hi anarpitam gandha puṣpa ādikam ca
translated: has not been smelled like this. Thus, it has been smelled again and again. The fragrance and flowers, etc. not offered,

original: sunāsikaṃ suṣṭhudantaṃ murāre dṛṣṭaṃ mukhaṃ kena puṇyena deva /
analyzed: su nāsikam suṣṭhu dantam murāre dṛṣṭam mukham kena puṇyena deva
translated: O Murari, O Lord, by what merit has your well-nosed, well-toothed face been seen?

original: ghrātvā ghrātvā viṣṇunirmālyagandhaṃ punaḥ punā ruddhakaṇṭho babhūva // / / //
analyzed: ghrātvā ghrātvā viṣṇu nirmālya gandham punar punar ruddha kaṇṭhaḥ babhūva
translated: Smelling again and again the fragrance of Vishnu's leftovers, his throat choked up again and again.

original: ruroda rudro bhayakaṃpitāṅgo jighrāmi nirmālyamidaṃ kathaṃ te /
analyzed: ruroda rudraḥ bhaya kaṃpita aṅgaḥ jighrāmi nirmālyam idam katham te
translated: Rudra wept, his body trembling with fear, How can I smell your leftovers?

original: jihvāsthito jihva saṃjño murāre jihvendriyeṇāpi tathārpitaṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: jihvā sthitaḥ jihva saṃjñaḥ murāre jihvā indriyeṇa api tathā arpitam ca
translated: O Murari, O Lord of the tongue, it has been offered with the tongue sense also.

original: naivedyaśeṣaṃ tulasīvimiśritaṃ viśeṣataḥ pādajalena siktam /
analyzed: naivedya śeṣam tulasī vimiśritam viśeṣataḥ pāda jalena siktam
translated: The remnants of food mixed with Tulasī, especially sprinkled with water from the feet,

original: yo snāti nityaṃ purato murāreḥ prāpnoti yajñāyutakoṭipuṇyam // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ snāti nityam puratas murāreḥ prāpnoti yajña ayuta koṭi puṇyam
translated: One who bathes in front of Murari (Krishna) daily, obtains the merit of ten million horse sacrifices.
