original: etādṛśaṃ tava naivedyaśeṣaṃ na bhuktaṃ vai sarvadādityarūpam /
analyzed: etādṛśam tava naivedya śeṣam na bhuktam vai sarvadā āditya rūpam
translated: Such is the remainder of your naivedya, which is not eaten, always having the form of the sun.

original: anarpitaṃ tava devasya viṣṇorbhuktaṃ mayā bahuvāraṃ mukunda // / / //
analyzed: an arpitam tava devasya viṣṇoḥ bhuktam mayā bahu vāram mukunda
translated: O Mukunda, it has not been offered to you, O God Vishnu, but has been eaten by me many times.

original: pādāravinde nārpitaṃ bhakṣyabhojyaṃ dṛṣṭo mayā kena puṇyena deva /
analyzed: pāda aravinde na arpitam bhakṣya bhojyam dṛṣṭaḥ mayā kena puṇyena deva
translated: O God, by what merit have I seen the food not offered at your lotus feet?

original: bhuktvābhuktvā harinairavedyajātaṃ sukhaṃ tvadīyaṃ ramayā lālitaṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: bhuktvā a bhuktvā hari nairavedya jātam sukham tvadīyam ramayā lālitam ca
translated: Having eaten and eaten the remnants of Hari's naivedya, I have enjoyed your happiness, cherished by Rama.

original: dyubhvāśrayaṃ tava mūrdhānamāhuḥ kirīṭayuktaṃ kuṭilaiḥ kuntalaiśca /
analyzed: dyu bhvā āśrayam tava mūrdhānam āhuḥ kirīṭa yuktam kuṭilaiḥ kuntalaiḥ ca
translated: They call your head, the abode of heaven and earth, adorned with a crown and curly locks.

original: anekajanmārjitapuṇyasaṃcayairdṛṣṭaṃ mayā sajjanasaṃgamācca // / / //
analyzed: aneka janma arjita puṇya saṃcayaiḥ dṛṣṭam mayā sat jana saṃgamāt ca
translated: It has been seen by me through the accumulation of merits earned in many births and by association with the good.

original: anekajanmārjitapāpasaṃcayairadarśanaṃ yāsyati devadeva /
analyzed: aneka janma arjita pāpa saṃcayaiḥ adarśanam yāsyati devadeva
translated: O God of gods, it will not be seen by the accumulation of sins earned in many births.

original: evaṃ subhaktyā ca ruroda rudro dṛṣṭvā hariṃ survaguṇaiḥ saṃpūrṇam // / / //
analyzed: evam su bhaktyā ca ruroda rudraḥ dṛṣṭvā harim surva guṇaiḥ saṃpūrṇam
translated: Thus Rudra wept with great devotion, seeing Hari, full of many good qualities.

original: pādāravindaṃ tava viśvamūrte yogīśvarairhṛdaye saṃgṛhītam /
analyzed: pāda aravindam tava viśvamūrte yogi īśvaraiḥ hṛdaye saṃgṛhītam
translated: O embodiment of the universe, your lotus feet are held in the heart by the lords of yoga.

original: dṛṣṭaṃ mayā dayayā vāsudeva drakṣye kathaṃ punaritthaṃ ruroda // / / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭam mayā dayayā vāsudeva drakṣye katham punar ittham ruroda
translated: O Vāsudeva, I have seen it with compassion. How will I see it again? He wept thus.

original: dṛṣṭaṃ mayā tvarivale bhavināśiśaṅkhacakrādikaistrijagatāpi ca deva pūrṇam /
analyzed: dṛṣṭam mayā tu ari vale bhavi nāśi śaṅkha cakra ādikaiḥ trijagatā api ca deva pūrṇam
translated: O Lord, I have seen your belly, which is full of the conch, discus, and other weapons, and which is full of the three worlds.

original: etādṛśaṃ tvadudaraṃ ca kathaṃ rameśa drakṣye punaḥ punarahaṃ tviti saṃruroda // / / //🔽ānandapūrṇa nakhapūrṇa sukeśapūrṇa lomādipūrṇa guṇapūrṇa sughoṇapūrṇa /
analyzed: etādṛśam tvad udaram ca katham rama īśa drakṣye punar punar aham tu iti saṃruroda  ānanda pūrṇa nakha pūrṇa su keśa pūrṇa loma ādi pūrṇa guṇa pūrṇa su ghoṇa pūrṇa
translated: O Lord of Ramā, how will I see such a belly of yours again and again? He wept thus.🔽O Lord, your chest is full of bliss, full of nails, full of beautiful hair, full of hair, full of good qualities, full of a beautiful nose,

original: vakṣaḥ sthalaṃ tava vibhostu viśālabhūtaṃ sadbhūṣaṇaṃ vimalakaustubhaśobhi lakṣmyā // / / //
analyzed: vakṣaḥ sthalam tava vibhoḥ tu viśāla bhūtam sat bhūṣaṇam vimala kaustubha śobhi lakṣmyā
translated: and is a good ornament, shining with the spotless Kaustubha jewel and Lakṣmī.

original: sukomalaṃ śrītulasyāstathaiva supuṣpitaṃ canda naiścarcitaṃ ca /
analyzed: su komalam śrī tulasyāḥ tathā eva su puṣpitam canda naiḥ carcitam ca
translated: It is very soft, and is also well-flowered with Śrī Tulasī and worshipped with jasmine flowers.

original: etādṛśaṃ tava vakṣaḥ sthalaṃ ca dṛṣṭaṃ mayā tava kāruṇyadṛṣṭyā // / / //
analyzed: etādṛśam tava vakṣaḥ sthalam ca dṛṣṭam mayā tava kāruṇya dṛṣṭyā
translated: I have seen such a chest of yours with a compassionate glance.

original: punaḥ punardarśanaṃ me kathaṃ syādevaṃ rudraḥ sa ca bhaktyā ruroda /
analyzed: punar punar darśanam me katham syāt evam rudraḥ sa ca bhaktyā ruroda
translated: How can I see it again and again? Rudra wept thus with devotion.

original: atastūrurnāma saṃprāpya rudrastatputrobhūddaurvasaṃjñaḥ sa eva // / / //
analyzed: atas tūruḥ nāma saṃprāpya rudraḥ tad putraḥ bhūt daurva saṃjñaḥ saḥ eva
translated: Therefore, Rudra attained the name of Tūra, and he became the son of Tūra, known as Daurva.

original: yasmādrudaṃ corvaritaṃ vai cakāra tasmātsa rudrastvaurvasaṃjño babhūva /
analyzed: yasmāt rudam ca urvaritam vai cakāra tasmāt sa rudraḥ tu aurva saṃjñaḥ babhūva
translated: Since he wept and wailed, he became known as Rudra.

original: aurvastu lokānmokṣayogyāṃśca dṛṣṭvā hyatyantaṃ vai viṣayeṣveva niṣṭhān // / / //
analyzed: aurvaḥ tu lokān mokṣa yogyān ca dṛṣṭvā hi atyantam vai viṣayeṣu eva niṣṭhān
translated: Seeing that people were fit for liberation but were excessively attached to worldly pleasures,

original: stūddaiva caurvo viṣṇupādāravidaṃ smṛtvāsmṛtvā ruddhakaṇṭho babhūva /
analyzed: caurvaḥ viṣṇu pāda āra vidam smṛtvā a smṛtvā ruddha kaṇṭhaḥ babhūva
translated: the sage Aurva, remembering the lotus feet of Vishnu, repeatedly wept with a choked throat.

original: te pāpiṣṭhāḥ pāparūpānbhajanto dinedine durviṣayānkadindriyaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: te pāpiṣṭhāḥ pāpa rūpān bhajantaḥ dine dine durviṣayān kad indriyaiḥ
translated: Those most sinful people, worshipping forms of evil, day by day with their senses attached to bad objects,

original: kadā caitānheyabuddhyā vimuñce na jānehaṃ ceti samyag ruroda /
analyzed: kadā ca etān heya buddhyā vimuñce na jāna iham ca iti samyak ruroda
translated: I do not know when they will be released with the thought of renunciation.

original: ete hi mūrkhā viṣayānarthalabdhyai kurvanti yatnaṃ paramādareṇa // / / //
analyzed: ete hi mūrkhāḥ viṣaya anartha labdhyai kurvanti yatnam parama ādareṇa
translated: These fools, for the sake of worldly pleasures, make great efforts.

original: kadindriyārthaṃ hi dhanādikaṃ ca tyajanti ca sarve viṣayeṣu niṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: kad indriya artham hi dhana ādikam ca tyajanti ca sarve viṣayeṣu niṣṭhāḥ
translated: All those attached to worldly pleasures, for the sake of sense objects, give up wealth and so on.

original: tvanmāyayā mohitānnaṣṭabuddhīnkadā caitānmuñcase viśvamūrte // / / //
analyzed: tvad māyayā mohitān naṣṭa buddhīn kadā ca etān muñcase viśvamūrte
translated: When, O universal form, will you release them, deluded by your maya, their intelligence lost?

original: smṛtvāsmṛtvā vāsudevasya māyāṃ ruroda caurvo bhayakaṃpitāṅgaḥ /
analyzed: smṛtvā a smṛtvā vāsudevasya māyām ruroda caurvaḥ bhaya kaṃpita aṅgaḥ
translated: Remembering and remembering again the maya of Vasudeva, Aurva wept, his body trembling with fear.

original: atīva kaṣṭena ca lokavṛttyā śritā dainyaṃ svīyakāryaṃ vihāya // / / //
analyzed: atīva kaṣṭena ca loka vṛttyā śritāḥ dainyam svīya kāryam vihāya
translated: With extreme difficulty in worldly conduct, resorting to misery, abandoning their own duty,

original: atīva dainyena dhanādikaṃ ca saṃpādya sarve 'pi supāpaśīlāḥ /
analyzed: atīva dainyena dhana ādikam ca saṃpādya sarve su pāpa śīlāḥ
translated: Having acquired wealth and other things with extreme misery, all of them become extremely sinful in conduct.

original: kaṣṭārjitaṃ dravyadhanādikaṃ ca tyajanti sarve paśavo vyarthameva // / / //🔽satpātrabhūte viṣṇubuddhyā kadāpi tyajanti naite māyayā vai murāreḥ /
analyzed: kaṣṭa arjitam dravya dhana ādikam ca tyajanti sarve paśavaḥ vyartham eva  sat pātra bhūte viṣṇu buddhyā kadāpi tyajanti na ete māyayā vai murāreḥ
translated: All of them uselessly abandon the wealth and money earned with difficulty.🔽These never abandon (wealth) even for a moment, considering it to be Vishnu, due to the illusion of Murari (Krishna).

original: eṣāmāyurvyarthamāhurmahāntaḥ kathaṃ naṣṭā iti samyagruroda // / / //
analyzed: eṣām āyuḥ vyartham āhuḥ mahāntaḥ katham naṣṭāḥ iti samyak ruroda
translated: The great ones say that their life is useless. How did they perish? They wept profusely.

original: eṣāmāyurvyarthamevaṃ gataṃ ca eṣāṃ dṛṣṭvā yauvanaṃ tu dhruvaṃ ca /
analyzed: eṣām āyuḥ vyartham evam gatam ca eṣām dṛṣṭvā yauvanam tu dhruvam ca
translated: Their life has thus become useless. Seeing their youth and certainty,

original: skandhasthamṛtyurhasate kṛṣṇa viṣṇo taṃ vai na jānanti vimūḍhacetasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: skandha stha mṛtyuḥ hasate kṛṣṇa viṣṇo tam vai na jānanti vimūḍha cetasaḥ
translated: Death standing on their shoulders laughs, O Krishna, O Vishnu. The deluded ones do not know him.

original: gṛhaṃ madīyaṃ śatavarṣaṃ ca jīvetputrā madīyā śavatavarṣaṃ tathaiva /
analyzed: gṛham madīyam śata varṣam ca jīvet putrā madīyā tathā eva
translated: Let my house live for a hundred years, and my sons for the same period.

original: ahaṃ ca jīve śatavarṣaṃ sukhena madīyabhāryāpi sulakṣaṇā'ste // / / //
analyzed: aham ca jīve śata varṣam sukhena madīya bhāryā api su lakṣaṇāḥ te
translated: I shall live happily for a hundred years. My wife with good characteristics also lives.

original: gāvaśca me saṃti sadugdhapūrṇā mitrāṇi me saṃti mudā hi yuktāḥ /
analyzed: gāvaḥ ca me saṃti sa dugdha pūrṇāḥ mitrāṇi me saṃti mudā hi yuktāḥ
translated: I have cows full of good milk. My friends are full of joy.

original: dāsye sutaṃ vāraṇārthaṃ tu vadhvai putrīṃ vivāhārthamahaṃ dadāmi // / / //
analyzed: dāsye sutam vāraṇa artham tu vadhvai putrīm vivāha artham aham dadāmi
translated: I shall give my son for marriage to the bride. I shall give my daughter for marriage.

original: dāsye cāhaṃ satsu putrīṃ dhanaṃ vā dāsye cāhaṃ dhanikeṣveva nityam /
analyzed: dāsye ca aham satsu putrīm dhanam vā dāsye ca aham dhanikeṣu eva nityam
translated: I will always give my daughter in marriage to good men and wealth to creditors.

original: adṛṣṭaśūnyān bhagavānvāsudevo dṛṣṭvādṛṣṭvā hasate sarvadaiva // / / //
analyzed: adṛṣṭa śūnyān bhagavān vāsudevaḥ dṛṣṭvā a dṛṣṭvā hasate sarvadā eva
translated: The Blessed Lord Vāsudeva, seeing the world empty of the unseen [Lord], always laughs, seeing and seeing again.

original: nāhaṃ kariṣye śravaṇaṃ kathāyā madbhāgyanā śaśca bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: na aham kariṣye śravaṇam kathāyāḥ mad bhāgya nā śaḥ ca bhaviṣyati iti
translated: I will not listen to the story, thinking my good fortune will be destroyed.

original: nāhaṃ hariṃ pūjayiṣye sadaiva putrādināśaśca bhaviṣyatīti // / / //
analyzed: na aham harim pūjayiṣye sadā eva putra ādi nāśaḥ ca bhaviṣyati iti
translated: I will not always worship Hari, thinking the destruction of my son and others will happen.

original: kālekāle diṣṭanāmā haristu phalaprado vāsudevo 'khilasya /
analyzed: kālekāle diṣṭa nāmā hariḥ tu phala pradaḥ khilasya
translated: At every time, Hari, named Destiny, is the giver of fruits to all.

original: etādṛśānmūrkhajanāṃśca dṛṣṭvā ruroda caurvo vāsudevaikaniṣṭhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: etādṛśān mūrkha janān ca dṛṣṭvā ruroda caurvaḥ vāsudeva ekaniṣṭhaḥ
translated: Seeing such foolish people, Aurva, devoted solely to Vāsudeva, wept.

original: atastvaurvo rudrarūpī khagendra jānīhi nityaṃ kṛṣṇasuśikṣitārthaḥ /
analyzed: atas tu aurvaḥ rudra rūpī khaga indra jānīhi nityam kṛṣṇa su śikṣita arthaḥ
translated: Therefore, O best of birds, know Aurva to be of the form of Rudra, always well-instructed in the meaning of Krishna.

original: yadā satī dakṣaputrī khagendra dakṣādhvare svaśarīraṃ visṛjya // / / //
analyzed: yadā satī dakṣa putrī khaga indra dakṣa adhvare sva śarīram visṛjya
translated: When Satī, the daughter of Daksha, O best of birds, abandoning her body in Daksha's sacrifice,

original: jajñe punarmenakāyāṃ himādrestadā rudrastvaurvasaṃjñā mavāpa /
analyzed: jajñe punar menakāyām himādreḥ tadā rudraḥ tu aurva saṃjñā m avāpa
translated: was born again to Menakā from the Himalayas, then Rudra obtained the name of Aurva.

original: ūrdhvaretā bhavetyuktvā ūrdhvaretā babhūva ha // / / //
analyzed: ūrdhvaretāḥ bhava iti uktvā ūrdhvaretāḥ babhūva ha
translated: Having said, Let my semen be upward-moving, he became one with upward-moving semen.

original: pāṇigrāhaṃ rudradevo mahātmā yadā himādreḥ kanyakāyāścakāra /
analyzed: pāṇigrāham rudra devaḥ mahātmā yadā himādreḥ kanyakāyāḥ cakāra
translated: When the great Lord Rudra took the hand of the daughter of the Himalayas,

original: tasyāṃ paraṃ laṃpaṭaḥ saṃbabhūva ato rudraḥ parasaṃjñāmavāpa // / / //
analyzed: tasyām param laṃpaṭaḥ saṃbabhūva atas rudraḥ para saṃjñām avāpa
translated: he became extremely lustful towards her. Therefore, Rudra obtained the name Para (Supreme).

original: sadāśivādyā daśa rudrabhrātaraḥ saumitreyo hauhiṇeyastrayaśca /
analyzed: sadāśiva ādyāḥ daśa rudra bhrātaraḥ saumitreyaḥ hauhiṇeyaḥ trayaḥ ca
translated: The ten Rudra brothers beginning with Sadasiva, the son of Sumitra, and the three sons of Huhu,

original: samā ete mokṣakāle sṛtau ca śatairguṇairnyūnabhūtāśca tābhyām // / / //
analyzed: samāḥ ete mokṣa kāle sṛtau ca śataiḥ guṇaiḥ nyūna bhūtāḥ ca tābhyām
translated: are equal to each other in the time of liberation and in the time of creation, but they are a hundred times inferior to them in qualities.

original: garuḍa uvāca /
analyzed: garuḍaḥ uvāca
translated: Garuda said:

original: ānandanirṇayaṃ brūhi kṛṣṇa pūrṇadayānighe /
analyzed: ānanda nirṇayam brūhi kṛṣṇa pūrṇa dayā nighe
translated: Tell me about the determination of bliss, O Krishna, the fulfiller of compassion,

original: nirṇetuṃ jñānināṃ yadvajjñāpanārthaṃ tathā mama // / / //
analyzed: nirṇetum jñāninām yadvat jñāpana artham tathā mama
translated: in order to determine it like the knowledge of the wise and to inform me.

original: brūhi śiṣyāya dayayā uddhartuṃ māṃ ca sarvadā /
analyzed: brūhi śiṣyāya dayayā uddhartum mām ca sarvadā
translated: Tell me, your disciple, out of compassion, to always uplift me.

original: pūrṇakāmasya te kṛṣṇa kā spṛhā vidyate prabho // / / //
analyzed: pūrṇa kāmasya te kṛṣṇa kā spṛhā vidyate prabho
translated: O Krishna, what desire do you have, O Lord, when your desires are fulfilled?

original: evamukto hṛṣīkeśaḥ pakṣīśena mahātmanā /
analyzed: evam uktaḥ hṛṣīkeśaḥ pakṣīśena mahātmanā
translated: Thus addressed by the great lord of birds,

original: uvāca kṛpayā kṛṣṇaḥ prasannaḥ kamalekṣaṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: uvāca kṛpayā kṛṣṇaḥ prasannaḥ kamala īkṣaṇaḥ
translated: Krishna, the lotus-eyed one, spoke with compassion and joy.

original: śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /
analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Sri Krishna said:

original: gāyatryāśca śatānanda ekānandastu vedhasaḥ etādṛśaḥ śatānando brahmaṇaḥ parikīrtitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: gāyatryāḥ ca śatānandaḥ ekānandaḥ tu vedhasaḥ etādṛśaḥ śatānandaḥ brahmaṇaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translated: The bliss of Gayatri is one hundred times that of Brahma, and the bliss of Brahma is one hundred times that of Vishnu. Such is said to be the bliss of Brahma.

original: śeṣādeśca śatānandaḥ sarasvatyāḥ khagottama /
analyzed: śeṣa ādeḥ ca śata ānandaḥ sarasvatyāḥ khaga uttama
translated: And from the rest, Shatananda, the best of birds, from Sarasvati.

original: ekānandastu vijñeyo bhāratyā vinatāsuta // / / //
analyzed: ekānandaḥ tu vijñeyaḥ bhāratyāḥ vinatā suta
translated: And Ekamananda should be known, O son of Vinata, from Bharata.

original: evaṃ tu nirṇayo jñeya ānandasya sadā khaga /
analyzed: evam tu nirṇayaḥ jñeyaḥ ānandasya sadā khaga
translated: Thus, O bird, the determination of bliss should always be known.

original: evamuktaṃ mayā sarvaṃ kimanyacchrotumicchasi // / / //
analyzed: evam uktam mayā sarvam kim anyat śrotum icchasi
translated: Thus, I have told you everything. What else do you wish to hear?

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttarakhaṇḍe tṛtīyāṃśe brahmakāṇḍe rudrarodanahetvānanantānandatāratamyanirūpaṇaṃ nāmāṣṭādaśodhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttara khaṇḍe tṛtīya aṃśe brahmakāṇḍe rudrarodanahetvānanantānandatāratamyanirūpaṇam nāma aṣṭādaśaḥ adhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the eighteenth chapter in the Third Parva of Srimad  Garuda Maha Purana, the Brhmalam section, narrating the reasons for Rudra's weeping and the gradation of infinite bliss.

original: śrīgaruḍamahāpurāṇam
analyzed: śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam
translated: Sri Garuda Maha Purana

original: garuḍa uvāca /
analyzed: garuḍaḥ uvāca
translated: Garuda said:

original: tvayoktaṃ kṛṣṇa govinda rudrācchataguṇādapi /
analyzed: tvayā uktam kṛṣṇa govinda rudrāt śataguṇāt api
translated: You said, O Krishna, O Govinda, that you are a hundred times superior to Rudra.

original: brahmāṇī bhāratī cobhe adhike devasattama // / / //
analyzed: brahmāṇī bhāratī ca ubhe adhike deva sattama
translated: O best of gods, both Brahma and Bharati are superior.

original: mayā śrutaṃ viriñcena umāparyantameva ca /
analyzed: mayā śrutam viriñcena umā paryantam eva ca
translated: I have heard that even up to Uma, it is incomplete without the infinite parts.

original: anantāṃśairvihīnatvaṃ viriñcoktaṃ surādhipa // / / //
analyzed: ananta aṃśaiḥ vihīna tvam viriñca uktam surādhipa
translated: O lord of gods, Brahma has said that it is incomplete without the infinite parts.

original: sahasrāṃśairvihīnatvaṃ tvayoktaṃ kṛṣṇa mādhava /
analyzed: sahasra aṃśaiḥ vihīna tvam tvayā uktam kṛṣṇa mādhava
translated: O Krishna, O Madhava, you have said that it is incomplete without a thousand parts.

original: sarveṣāṃ caiva pūrveṣāmavekṣyaiva hare vibho // / / //
analyzed: sarveṣām ca eva pūrveṣām avekṣya eva hare vibho
translated: O Hari, O lord, having considered all the previous ones,

original: jñānānandabalādīnāṃ vāyuparyantameva ca /
analyzed: jñāna ānanda bala ādīnām vāyu paryantam eva ca
translated: The knowledge, bliss, strength, etc. are incomplete even up to Vayu.

original: sahasrāṃśairvihīnatvaṃ jñānādīnāṃ maheśvara // / / //
analyzed: sahasra aṃśaiḥ vihīna tvam jñāna ādīnām maheśvara
translated: O Mahesvara, the deficiency of knowledge and other qualities by thousands of parts,

original: nirṇayaṃ brṛhi govinda sarvajñosi na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: nirṇayam brṛhi govinda sarva jñaḥ asi na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Tell me the decision, O Govinda, you are omniscient, there is no doubt.

original: garuḍenaivamuktastu vāsudevobravīddhruvam // / / //
analyzed: garuḍena evam uktaḥ tu vāsudevaḥ bravīt dhruvam
translated: Thus addressed by Garuda, Vasudeva spoke decisively.

original: śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /
analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Sri Krishna said:

original: ānandāṃśairvihīnatvamapekṣyaiva khagādhipa /
analyzed: ānanda aṃśaiḥ vihīna tvam apekṣya eva khagādhipa
translated: Considering the deficiency of bliss parts, O lord of birds,

original: uttareṣāmuttareṣāṃ yogādevamiti sphuṭam // / / //
analyzed: uttareṣām uttareṣām yogāt evam iti sphuṭam
translated: It is clear that it is due to the combination of the latter and the latter.

original: parimāṇe śataguṇe ānande sphuṭatāvaśāt /
analyzed: parimāṇe śataguṇe ānande sphuṭa tā avaśāt
translated: In the measure of a hundred times more bliss, due to the power of clarity,

original: anantaguṇavattvaṃ ca brahmaṇā samudīritam // / / //
analyzed: ananta guṇavat tvam ca brahmaṇā samudīritam
translated: Brahma has declared the possession of infinite qualities.

original: sahasraguṇitatvaṃ ca vāyunā samudīritam /
analyzed: sahasra guṇita tvam ca vāyunā samudīritam
translated: And the possession of a thousand times more qualities has been declared by Vayu.

original: yathānande tathā jñāne viṣṇau bhaktau balādhike // / / //
analyzed: yathā ānande tathā jñāne viṣṇau bhaktau bala adhike
translated: As in bliss, so in knowledge, in devotion to Vishnu, in strength and superiority,

original: sarve guṇaiḥ śataguṇāḥ krameṇoktā nu te 'khilāḥ /
analyzed: sarve guṇaiḥ śataguṇāḥ krameṇa uktāḥ nu te khilāḥ
translated: All of them have been said to have qualities a hundred times more in order.

original: bhāratyāśca śataṃ jñānaṃ sukhaṃ bhaktibalādhike // / / //
analyzed: bhāratyāḥ ca śatam jñānam sukham bhakti bala adhike
translated: And in Bharati, knowledge is a hundred times more, and in devotion, strength and superiority,

original: evaṃ jñānaṃ suvijñeyaṃ mārutestu balādikam /
analyzed: evam jñānam su vijñeyam māruteḥ tu bala ādikam
translated: Thus, knowledge is to be well known, and in Marut, strength and so on.

original: evaṃ jñānaṃ śataṃ jñeyaṃ mārute nātra saṃśayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: evam jñānam śatam jñeyam mārute na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: Thus, knowledge is to be known as a hundred times more in Marut, there is no doubt.

original: bhāratyāśca śataṃ jñānaṃ balaṃ ca samudāhṛtam /
analyzed: bhāratyāḥ ca śatam jñānam balam ca samudāhṛtam
translated: And in Bharati, knowledge is declared to be a hundred times more, and strength is also declared.

original: evameva ca vāyośca jñānaṃ caivamiti sphuṭam // / / //🔽yathā dīpācchataguṇā agnijvālā na dīpavat /
analyzed: evam eva ca vāyoḥ ca jñānam ca evam iti sphuṭam  yathā dīpāt śataguṇā agni jvālā na dīpa vat
translated: In the same way, the knowledge of Vayu is also clear in this way.🔽Just as the flame of fire, a hundred times brighter than a lamp, does not shine like a lamp,

original: sphuṭībhavedyathaivāgnirbahulopi na sūryavat // / / //
analyzed: sphuṭībhavet yathā eva agniḥ bahu lopi na sūrya vat
translated: just as fire, though abundant, does not shine like the sun,

original: yathaiva sūryāddviguṇaścandro naiva sphuṭībhavet /
analyzed: yathā eva sūryāt dviguṇaḥ candraḥ nā eva sphuṭībhavet
translated: just as the moon, twice as bright as the sun, does not shine,

original: ānandatāratamyaṃ ca yathoktaṃ tu mayā tava // / / //
analyzed: ānanda tāratamyam ca yathā uktam tu mayā tava
translated: and just as the gradation of bliss has been described by me to you,

original: tathaiva jānīhi khaga nānyathā tu kathañcana /
analyzed: tathā eva jānīhi khaga na anyathā tu kathañcana
translated: know it in the same way, O bird, and not otherwise in any way.

original: ahaṃ vijānāmi mayi sthitān guṇānsarvairviśeṣaiśca khagendra saṃyutān // / / //
analyzed: aham vijānāmi mayi sthitān guṇān sarvaiḥ viśeṣaiḥ ca khaga indra saṃyutān
translated: I know the qualities that abide in me, O lord of birds, united with all distinctions.

original: susūkṣmarūpāṃśca sadā khagendra mayāpyadṛṣṭo nāsti nāstyeva kaścit // / / //
analyzed: su sūkṣma rūpān ca sadā khaga indra mayā api adṛṣṭaḥ na asti na asti eva kaścid
translated: And the extremely subtle forms, O lord of birds, I have never seen, there is no one who exists.

original: sarvāvatāreṣvapi vidyamānaṃ hariṃ vijānāti ramāpi devī // / / //
analyzed: sarva avatāreṣu api vidyamānam harim vijānāti ramā api devī
translated: Even in all the incarnations, the goddess Rama knows Hari.

original: harerguṇānsarvaviśeṣasaṃyutānakhaṇḍarūpānsā vijānāti devī /
analyzed: hareḥ guṇān sarva viśeṣa saṃyutān akhaṇḍa rūpān sā vijānāti devī
translated: The goddess knows Hari's qualities united with all distinctions, his unbroken forms.

original: susūkṣmarūpānsā vijānāti devī brahmādibhyo matprasādādhikaṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: su sūkṣma rūpān sā vijānāti devī brahma ādibhyaḥ mad prasāda adhikam ca
translated: The goddess knows his extremely subtle forms, more than Brahma and others, by my grace.

original: svātmasvarūpaṃ pravijānāti devī susūkṣmarūpaṃ suviśeṣaiśca yuktam /
analyzed: sva ātma svarūpam pravijānāti devī su sūkṣma rūpam su viśeṣaiḥ ca yuktam
translated: The goddess knows her own nature, with extremely subtle forms, united with excellent distinctions.

original: svānyaṃ prapañcaṃ pravijānāti lakṣmīstathāpyaśeṣaiḥ suviśeṣaiśca yuktam // / / //
analyzed: sva anyam prapañcam pravijānāti lakṣmīḥ tathā api aśeṣaiḥ su viśeṣaiḥ ca yuktam
translated: Lakshmi knows her own manifestation, which is endowed with all the special qualities.

original: brahmāpi paśyetsarvagaṃ vāsudevaṃ vāyvādibhyo hyadhikānsadguṇāṃśca /
analyzed: brahmā api paśyet sarvagam vāsudevam vāyu ādibhyaḥ hi adhikān sat guṇān ca
translated: Brahma also sees Vasudeva, who is all-pervading, and the good qualities that are superior to Vayu and others.

original: śrotraṃ na jānāti harerguṇāṃśca susūkṣmarūpāṃśca viśeṣasaṃyutān // / / //
analyzed: śrotram na jānāti hareḥ guṇān ca su sūkṣma rūpān ca viśeṣa saṃyutān
translated: The ear does not know the qualities of Hari, nor the very subtle forms endowed with special qualities.

original: spaṣṭasvarūpeṇa yathā viduḥ surā muktvā brahmāṇaṃ na tathā tepyamuktāḥ /
analyzed: spaṣṭa sva rūpeṇa yathā viduḥ surāḥ muktvā brahmāṇam na tathā te api amuktāḥ
translated: As the gods know the manifest form, not so they are not liberated, except Brahma.

original: svātmānamanyacca sadā viśeṣaryuktaṃ vijānāti vidhiśca mārutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sva ātmānam anyat ca sadā vijānāti vidhiḥ ca mārutaḥ
translated: Brahma and the wind know their own self and others always as endowed with special qualities.

original: vāṇī vijānāti harerguṇāṃśca svayaṃbhuvo naiva tāvadviśeṣān /
analyzed: vāṇī vijānāti hareḥ guṇān ca svayaṃbhuvaḥ nā eva tāvat viśeṣān
translated: The goddess knows the qualities of Hari, but not the special qualities of the self-existent one.

original: traiguṇyarūpātparataḥ sadaiva paśyedviṣṇuṃ kṛṣṇarūpaṃ khagendra // / / //
analyzed: traiguṇya rūpāt paratas sadā eva paśyet viṣṇum kṛṣṇa rūpam khaga indra
translated: O lord of birds, one should always see Vishnu in his Krishna form, beyond the form of the three qualities.

original: śeṣo rudro vīndra etaiśca sarve tamo mātre pravijānanti saṃstham /
analyzed: śeṣaḥ rudraḥ vi indraḥ etaiḥ ca sarve tamaḥ mātre pravijānanti saṃstham
translated: Shesha, Rudra, and Indra, all of them know the state that has entered into mere darkness.

original: vāṇīdṛṣṭānsaviśeṣān guṇāṃste jānanti no satyamevoktamaṅga // / / //
analyzed: vāṇī dṛṣṭān sa viśeṣān guṇān te jānanti no satyam eva uktam aṅga
translated: They know the qualities seen by the goddess, with special details. It is said to be true, O limb.

original: umā suparṇā vāruṇī ceti tisraḥ sahaiva taḥ pravijānanti sustham /
analyzed: umā suparṇā vāruṇī ca iti tisraḥ saha eva taḥ pravijānanti sustham
translated: Uma, Suparna, and Varuni, these three together know the well-established one.

original: harerviśeṣānarudra dṛṣṭānkhagendra jānanti naitāḥ kvāpi deśe ca kāle // / / //
analyzed: hareḥ viśeṣān arudra dṛṣṭān khaga indra jānanti na etāḥ kvāpi deśe ca kāle
translated: O Garuda, these special forms of Hari are seen by Rudra, but they are not known anywhere else in the world.

original: indrādayaḥ pravijānanti vīndra ahaṅkāre vyāptarūpaṃ hariṃ ca /
analyzed: indra ādayaḥ pravijānanti vi indra ahaṅkāre vyāpta rūpam harim ca
translated: O Garuda, Indra and others know Hari, who is all-pervading in the form of ego.

original: dakṣādyā vai buddhitattve sthitaṃ taṃ jānanti te somasūryādayaśca // / / //
analyzed: dakṣa ādyāḥ vai buddhi tattve sthitam tam jānanti te soma sūrya ādayaḥ ca
translated: Daksha and others know Him who resides in the principle of intellect, and also the Moon, Sun and others.

original: viṣṇuṃ hariṃ bhūtatattve sthitaṃ ca ye cānye ca pravijānanti nityam /
analyzed: viṣṇum harim bhūtatattve sthitam ca ye ca anye ca pravijānanti nityam
translated: And others always know Vishnu Hari who resides in the principle of elements.

original: anye ca paśyanti yathā svayogyamaṇḍāntarasthaṃ harirūpaṃ khagendra // / / //
analyzed: anye ca paśyanti yathā sva yogya maṇḍa antara stham hari rūpam khaga indra
translated: And others see the form of Hari residing in the inner circle according to their own eligibility, O Garuda.

original: kecitprapaśyanti hareśca rūpaṃ tvadīyahṛtsthaṃ hṛdi kecitsadaiva /
analyzed: kecid prapaśyanti hareḥ ca rūpam tvadīya hṛd stham hṛdi kecid sadā eva
translated: Some always see the form of Hari in their own heart, and some always see the form of Hari in their own heart.

original: evaṃprakāraṃ pravijānīhi vīndra hyatho śṛṇu tvaṃmama bhāryāḥ ṣaḍetāḥ // / / //
analyzed: evaṃprakāram pravijānīhi vi indra hi atho śṛṇu tvam mama bhāryāḥ ṣaḍ etāḥ
translated: Know this kind of form, O Garuda, and listen, these six are my wives.

original: rukmiṇyādyāḥ ṣaṇmahiṣyo mamaśrīrnīlā ca yā mama bhāryā khagendra /
analyzed: rukmiṇī ādyāḥ ṣaṣ mahiṣyaḥ mama śrīḥ nīlā ca yā mama bhāryā khaga indra
translated: The six queens beginning with Rukmini, and the blue Lakshmi who is my wife, O Garuda,

original: sarge pūrvasminhavyavāhasya putrī tāstā bhaje sadya evā viśeṣāt // / / //
analyzed: sarge pūrvasmin havyavāhasya putrī tāḥ tāḥ bhaje sadyas evāḥ viśeṣāt
translated: In the previous creation, she was the daughter of Havyavaha. I serve those who are especially like that.

original: kanyaiva sā kṛṣṇapatnī ca kāmāṃstāṃstān bhajenmanasā cintitāṃśca /
analyzed: kanyā eva sā kṛṣṇa patnī ca kāmān tān tān bhajet manasā cintitān ca
translated: She is the unmarried daughter of Krishna, and she serves those desires thought of in the mind.

original: atīva yatnaṃ kavyavāhaṃ khagendra pitṛṣvekaḥ sarvadā vai cakāra // / / //
analyzed: atīva yatnam kavya vāham khaga indra pitṛṣu ekaḥ sarvadā vai cakāra
translated: O best of birds, he made a great effort to carry the oblations, but he could not do so.

original: tathaiva sā naiva bhartāramāpa yatastu sā kṛṣṇaniṣṭhaikacittā // / / //
analyzed: tathā eva sā nā eva bhartāram āpa yatas tu sā kṛṣṇa niṣṭhā ekacittā
translated: Similarly, she did not get a husband, because her mind was solely devoted to Krishna.

original: tadābravītkavyavāhaśca putrariṃ patiṃ kimarthaṃ necchasi mūḍhabuddhe /
analyzed: tadā abravīt kavyavāhaḥ ca putra arim patim kimartham nā icchasi mūḍha buddhe
translated: Then the carrier of oblations said to his daughter, Why do you not desire a husband, O foolish one?

original: tadābravītkavyavāhaṃ ca puttrī hariṃ vinā sarvaguṇopapanne /
analyzed: tadā abravīt kavyavāham ca puttrī harim vinā sarva guṇa upapanne
translated: Then the daughter said to the carrier of oblations, Without Hari, who is endowed with all good qualities,

original: janmanyasmin bhartṛtā nāsti deva yato bhartā hariravaika eva // / / //
analyzed: janmani asmin bhartṛ tā nā asti deva yatas bhartā hariḥ ava ekaḥ eva
translated: I have no desire for a husband in this birth, because Hari alone is the husband.

original: yato loke sustriyaḥ sarva eva saṃdā jñeyā vidhavāste hi nityam /🔽anādi nityaṃ bhuvanaikasāraṃ susuṃdaraṃ mokṣadaṃ kāmadaṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: yatas loke sustriyaḥ sarve eva saṃdāḥ jñeyāḥ vidhavāḥ te hi nityam  anādi nityam bhuvana eka sāram su suṃdaram mokṣa dam kāma dam ca
translated: For all good women in the world should be known as widows, for they are always widows.🔽Who do not know such a one who is beginningless, eternal, the essence of the universe, very handsome, the giver of liberation and of desires,

original: etādṛśaṃ na vijānanti yāstu sarvāstā vai vidhavāḥ sarvadaiva /
analyzed: etādṛśam na vijānanti yāḥ tu sarvāḥ tāḥ vai vidhavāḥ sarvadā eva
translated: all of them are always widows.

original: nimittabhūtaṃ bhartṛrūpaṃ ca jīvaṃ daivopetaṃ haribhaktyā vihīnam // / / //
analyzed: nimitta bhūtam bhartṛ rūpam ca jīvam daiva upetam hari bhaktyā vihīnam
translated: The mere form of a husband, which is the cause, is a living being endowed with destiny, but devoid of devotion to Hari.

original: sukaśmalaṃ navarandhraiḥ stravantaṃ durgandhayuktaṃ sarvadā kutsitaṃ ca /
analyzed: su kaśmalam nava randhraiḥ stravantam durgandha yuktam sarvadā kutsitam ca
translated: Which is full of impurities, oozing through nine orifices, foul-smelling, and always despicable.

original: etāḥ dṛśe bhartṛjīve nu tāta prayojanaṃ nāsti kṛṣṇaṃ vihāya // / / //
analyzed: etāḥ dṛśe bhartṛ jīve nu tāta prayojanam na asti kṛṣṇam vihāya
translated: O father, for seeing these, there is no purpose other than the life of the husband and Krishna.

original: devastriyo nijabhartṝnvihāyu tatra sthitaṃ prīṇayantyeva nityam /
analyzed: deva striyaḥ nija bhartṝn vihāyu tatra sthitam prīṇayanti eva nityam
translated: The divine women, having abandoned their own husbands, always please him who is present there.

original: ataśca tāḥ sadhavāḥ sarvadaiva lokairvandyā nātra vicāryamasti // / / //
analyzed: atas ca tāḥ sa dhavāḥ sarvadā eva lokaiḥ vandyāḥ na atra vicāryam asti
translated: Therefore, they are always virtuous and should be worshipped by people. There is no doubt about this.

original: bhartāste haribhaktā yadi syurāsāṃ strīṇāṃ janmasāphalyameva /
analyzed: bhartāḥ te hari bhaktāḥ yadi syuḥ āsām strīṇām janma sāphalyam eva
translated: If their husbands are devotees of Hari, then the birth of those women is indeed fruitful.

original: anekajanmārjitapuṇyasaṃcayaistadbhartāro haribhaktā bhaveyuḥ // / / //
analyzed: aneka janma arjita puṇya saṃcayaiḥ tad bhartāraḥ hari bhaktāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: By the accumulation of merits earned in many births, their husbands would become devotees of Hari.

original: yadbhartāro haribhaktā na saṃti tābhistyājyaṃ svīyagātraṃ bhṛśaṃ hi /
analyzed: yad bhartāraḥ hari bhaktāḥ na saṃti tābhiḥ tyājyam svīya gātram bhṛśam hi
translated: If their husbands are not devotees of Hari, then they should completely abandon their own bodies.

original: svabhartṛtaṃ kṛṣṇarūpaṃ hariṃ ca smṛtvā samyag yadi gātraṃ tyajeyuḥ // / / //
analyzed: sva bhartṛtam kṛṣṇa rūpam harim ca smṛtvā samyak yadi gātram tyajeyuḥ
translated: If they remember their own husband in the form of Krishna and Hari, and properly abandon their bodies,

original: tadā naiva hyātmahatyādidoṣāḥ strīṇāmevaṃ nirṇayoyaṃ hi śāstre /
analyzed: tadā nā eva hi ātmahatyā ādi doṣāḥ strīṇām evam nirṇayaḥ yam hi śāstre
translated: then they will not have the sin of self-murder and so on. This is the decision in the scriptures.

original: yadbhartāro na vijānanti viṣṇuṃ tāsāṃ saṃgo naiva kāryaḥ kadāpi // / / //
analyzed: yad bhartāraḥ na vijānanti viṣṇum tāsām saṃgaḥ nā eva kāryaḥ kadāpi
translated: If their husbands do not know Vishnu, then they should never associate with them.

original: aneka janmārjitapuṇyasaṃcayāttadbhartāro viṣṇubhaktā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: aneka janma arjita puṇya saṃcayāt tad bhartāraḥ viṣṇu bhaktāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: By the accumulation of merits earned in many births, their husbands would become devotees of Vishnu.

original: kalau yuge durlabhā viṣṇubhaktā harebhaktirdurlabhā sarvadaiva // / / //🔽hareḥ kathā durlabhā martyaloke harerdīkṣā durlabhā durlabhā ca /🔽harestattve nirṇayo durlabho hi harerdāsaiḥ saṃgamo durlabhaśca // / / //
analyzed: kalau yuge durlabhāḥ viṣṇu bhaktāḥ hare bhaktiḥ durlabhā sarvadā eva  hareḥ kathā durlabhā martya loke hareḥ dīkṣā durlabhā durlabhā ca  hareḥ tattve nirṇayaḥ durlabhaḥ hi hareḥ dāsaiḥ saṃgamaḥ durlabhaḥ ca
translated: In the Kali Yuga, devotees of Vishnu are rare, devotion to Hari is always difficult to attain.🔽The stories of Hari are rare in the mortal world, initiation into Hari is rare, and so is the knowledge of Hari.🔽The determination of the truth of Hari is difficult, and association with the servants of Hari is also difficult.

original: pradakṣiṇaṃ durlabhaṃ vai murārernamaskāro durlabho vai kalau ca /
analyzed: pradakṣiṇam durlabham vai murāreḥ namaskāraḥ durlabhaḥ vai kalau ca
translated: Circumambulation of Murari is difficult, and salutations to Him are difficult in the Kali Yuga.

original: tadbhaktānāṃ pālanaṃ durlabhaṃ ca sadvaiṣṇavānāṃ durlabhaṃ hyannadānam // / / //
analyzed: tad bhaktānām pālanam durlabham ca sat vaiṣṇavānām durlabham hi anna dānam
translated: Protection of His devotees is difficult, and giving food to good Vaishnavas is difficult.

original: tantroktapūjā durlabhā vai murārernāmagraho durlabhaścava viṣṇoḥ /
analyzed: tantra ukta pūjā durlabhā vai murāreḥ nāma grahaḥ durlabhaḥ viṣṇoḥ
translated: Worship of Murari as described in the Tantras is difficult, and uttering the name of Vishnu is difficult.

original: suvaiṣṇavānāṃ pujanaṃ durlabhaṃ hi sadvaiṣṇavānāṃ bhāṣaṇaṃ durlabhaṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: su vaiṣṇavānām pujanam durlabham hi sat vaiṣṇavānām bhāṣaṇam durlabham ca
translated: Worship of good Vaishnavas is difficult, and speaking to good Vaishnavas is difficult.

original: śālagrāmasparśanaṃ durlabhaṃ ca sadvaiṣṇavānāṃ darśanaṃ durlabhaṃ hi /
analyzed: śālagrāma sparśanam durlabham ca sat vaiṣṇavānām darśanam durlabham hi
translated: Touching the Shalagrama stone is difficult, and seeing good Vaishnavas is difficult.

original: gosparśanaṃ durlabhaṃ martyaloke sadgāyanaṃ durlabhaṃ sadguruñca // / / //
analyzed: go sparśanam durlabham martya loke sat gāyanam durlabham sat gurum ca
translated: Touching cows is difficult in the mortal world, and finding a good singer and a good guru is difficult.

original: sadbhāryāḥ satputrakā durlabhā hi śeṣācalasthasya hareśca darśanam /
analyzed: sat bhāryāḥ sat putrakāḥ durlabhāḥ hi śeṣa acala sthasya hareḥ ca darśanam
translated: Good wives and good sons are indeed rare, and so is the sight of Hari residing on Mount Shrisha.

original: sudurlabhaṃ raṅganāthasya tīre kāveryā vai darśanaṃ viṣṇupadyāḥ // / / //
analyzed: su durlabham raṅganāthasya tīre kāveryāḥ vai darśanam viṣṇupadyāḥ
translated: The sight of Vishnu's foot on the banks of the river Kaveri, which is Rangayana, is extremely rare.

original: kāñcīkṣetre varadarājasya sevā sudurlabhā darśanaṃ caiva loke /
analyzed: kāñcī kṣetre varadarājasya sevā su durlabhā darśanam ca eva loke
translated: Service to the boon-granting king in the Kanchi region and his sight in the world are extremely rare.

original: sudurlabhaṃ darśanaṃ rāmasetoḥ sudurlabhā madhvaśāstre ca śaktiḥ // / / //
analyzed: su durlabham darśanam rāmasetoḥ su durlabhā madhvaśāstre ca śaktiḥ
translated: The sight of Ramasetu is extremely rare, and the power in the Madhva scriptures is also very difficult to obtain.

original: bhīmātīre saṃsthitasyāpi viṣṇoḥ sudurlabhaṃ darśanaṃ cāhurāryāḥ /
analyzed: bhīmā tīre saṃsthitasya api viṣṇoḥ su durlabham darśanam ca āhuḥ āryāḥ
translated: The noble ones say that the sight of Vishnu residing on the banks of the Bhima river is also extremely rare.

original: revātīre saṃsthitasyāpi viṣṇorgayākṣetre viṣṇupādasya caiva // / / //
analyzed: revā tīre saṃsthitasya api viṣṇoḥ gayā kṣetre viṣṇupādasya ca eva
translated: The sight of Vishnu residing on the banks of the river Revati, and of Vishnu's foot at the Gaya shrine, is also very difficult to obtain.

original: tathā badrau saṃsthita syāpi viṣṇoḥ sudurlabhaṃ martyaloke sthitānām /
analyzed: tathā badrau viṣṇoḥ su durlabham martya loke sthitānām
translated: Similarly, for those residing in the mortal world, the sight of Vishnu residing at Badari is extremely rare.

original: śeṣācale śrīnivāsāśrame ca tapasvino durlabhā martyaloke // / / //
analyzed: śeṣa acale śrīnivāsa āśrame ca tapasvinaḥ durlabhāḥ martya loke
translated: In the hermitage of Srinivasa on Mount Shrisha, ascetics are rare in the mortal world.

original: prayāgākhye mādhavasyāpi nityaṃ sudarśanaṃ durlabhaṃ vai nṛṇāṃ hi // / / //
analyzed: prayāga ākhye mādhavasya api nityam sudarśanam durlabham vai nṛṇām hi
translated: The constant sight of Madhava at Prayaga is also very difficult for men to obtain.

original: ato necchāmi bhartāraṃ kṛṣṇādanyaṃ kadācana /
analyzed: atas nā icchāmi bhartāram kṛṣṇāt anyam kadācana
translated: Therefore, I never desire a husband other than Krishna.

original: evamuktvā sā pitaraṃ yayau śeṣācalaṃ prati // / / //
analyzed: evam uktvā sā pitaram yayau śeṣa acalam prati
translated: Having said this to her father, she went towards the mountain of Śeṣa.

original: kapilākhyamahātīrthe āruroha mahāgirim /
analyzed: kapila ākhya mahā tīrthe āruroha mahā girim
translated: In the great holy place called Kapilā, she ascended the great mountain.

original: tatrasthaṃ śrīnivāsaṃ ca dṛṣṭvā natvā mahāsatī // / / //
analyzed: tatrastham śrīnivāsam ca dṛṣṭvā natvā mahā satī
translated: There, seeing and bowing to Śrīnivāsa, the great chaste woman...

original: tridinaṃ samupoṣyātha gatvā pāpavināśanam /
analyzed: tri dinam samupoṣya atha gatvā pāpa vināśanam
translated: Having fasted for three days, she then went to Pāpavināśana.

original: tatrasnātvā vivāhārthamekāntaṃ prayayāvatha // / / //🔽tasyā uttaradigbhāge krośayugme mahātale /
analyzed: tatra snātvā vivāha artham ekāntam prayayau atha  tasyāḥ uttara digbhāge krośa yugme mahā tale
translated: Having bathed there, for the sake of marriage, she then went to a secluded place...🔽In the northern part of that, in a great pit two kṛośas away,

original: gartabhūte ca ekānte cacāra tapa uttamam // / / //
analyzed: garta bhūte ca ekānte cacāra tapaḥ uttamam
translated: in a secluded place, she performed excellent austerities...

original: dhyātvā nārāyaṇaṃ devaṃ tatrāsīcca kumārikā /
analyzed: dhyātvā nārāyaṇam devam tatra āsīt ca kumārikā
translated: Meditating on Lord Nārāyaṇa, the young girl remained there.

original: divyavarṣasahasrānte stotuṃ samupacakrame // / / //
analyzed: divya varṣa sahasra ante stotum samupacakrame
translated: At the end of a thousand divine years, she began to praise...

original: kumāryuvāca /
analyzed: kumārī uvāca
translated: The young girl said:

original: tvameva mātā ca pitā tvameva bhartā ca sakhātvameva /
analyzed: tvam eva mātā ca pitā tvam eva bhartā ca sakhā tvam eva
translated: You alone are the mother, you alone are the father, you alone are the husband, you alone are the friend.

original: tvameva putraśca gururgarīyānmitraṃ svasā tvaṃ mama vallabhaśca // / / //
analyzed: tvam eva putraḥ ca guruḥ garīyān mitram svasā tvam mama vallabhaḥ ca
translated: You alone are the son, the most venerable guru, the friend, the sister, and the beloved.

original: anādyananteṣvapi janmasu prabho vicāryamāṇā na vijānepyahaṃ ca /
analyzed: anādi ananteṣu api janmasu prabho vicāryamāṇā na vijānepi aham ca
translated: O Lord, even in births without beginning or end, when I contemplate, I do not know you.

original: etai hi sarve ca nimittamātrataḥ pitrādayastvaṃ hyanimittamātrataḥ // / / //
analyzed: etaiḥ hi sarve ca nimitta mātrataḥ pitṛ ādayaḥ tvam hi animitta mātrataḥ
translated: These, the father and others, are merely causes, but you are the only cause.

original: ato murāreśca tavaiva bhāryā bhūyāsamityeva tadā vrataṃ me /
analyzed: atas murāreḥ ca tava eva bhāryā bhūyāsam iti eva tadā vratam me
translated: Therefore, O Murari, you alone are my wife. This is my vow then.

original: duḥ saṃgamātrādisamāgamaṃ na saṃsiddhirityeva vadānyamūrte // / / //
analyzed: duḥ saṃga mātra ādi samāgamam na saṃsiddhiḥ iti eva vadānya mūrte
translated: Not by mere association with bad people etc. is success. O embodiment of generosity,

original: tvaddūṣakāṇāṃ tava dāsavarya vidūṣakāṇāṃ darśanaṃ chindhi deva /
analyzed: tvad dūṣakāṇām tava dāsa varya vidūṣakāṇām darśanam chindhi deva
translated: O best servant of yours, break the sight of those who slander you, O God.

original: gurudruhāṃ darśanaṃ chindhi viṣṇo bhaktadruhāṃ mitratāṃ chindhi kṛṣṇa // / / //
analyzed: guru druhām darśanam chindhi viṣṇo bhakta druhām mitra tām chindhi kṛṣṇa
translated: Break the sight of those who harm the guru, O Vishnu. Break the friendship of those who harm devotees, O Krishna.

original: tava dhrugbhirbhāṣaṇaṃ chindhi deva tvaṃ saṃgamaṃ dehi padāravinde /
analyzed: tava dhrugbhiḥ bhāṣaṇam chindhi deva tvam saṃgamam dehi pada aravinde
translated: Break the conversation with those who hate you, O God. Give me union with your lotus feet.

original: śrīśailavāsāya namonamaste namonamaḥ śrīnivāsāya tubhyam // / / //
analyzed: śrīśaila vāsāya namaḥ namaḥ te namaḥ namaḥ śrīnivāsāya tubhyam
translated: Salutations again and again to you, the resident of Shrisailam. Salutations again and again to you, the resident of Shri.

original: svāmin parāvara rameśa nidānamūrte kālo mahānapi gataśca nidarśanante /
analyzed: svāmin parāvara rama īśa nidāna mūrte kālaḥ mahān api gataḥ ca nidarśana ante
translated: O Lord, the great time has also passed, observing you, the embodiment of the cause.

original: anantajanmārjitasādhanaiśca tvaddarśanaṃ syācca caturbhujasya // / / //
analyzed: ananta janma arjita sādhanaiḥ ca tvad darśanam syāt ca caturbhujasya
translated: By the means earned in countless births, may I have a vision of the four-armed one.

original: kathaṃ mama syāttava darśanaṃ prabho sarvaiśca doṣaiśca susaṃgatāyāḥ /
analyzed: katham mama syāt tava darśanam prabho sarvaiḥ ca doṣaiḥ ca su saṃgatāyāḥ
translated: O Lord, how can I have a vision of you, who am full of all faults?

original: dāsyāspadāyāstava dāsadāsyāḥ prasīda deveśa jagannivāsa // / / //
analyzed: dāsī āspadāyāḥ tava dāsa dāsyāḥ prasīda deveśa jagannivāsa
translated: Of me, who am not fit to be your servant, who am the servant of your servant, be pleased, O Lord of gods, O abode of the world.

original: evaṃ stutastathā viṣṇuḥ śrīnivāso dayānidhiḥ /
analyzed: evam stutaḥ tathā viṣṇuḥ śrīnivāsaḥ dayā nidhiḥ
translated: Thus praised, Vishnu, the abode of Shri, the ocean of mercy,

original: prādurāsīdvaradarāṭ bhaktyā tasyā janārdanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: prādurāsīt vara da rāj bhaktyā tasyāḥ janārdanaḥ
translated: appeared before him, the bestower of boons, Janardana, out of his devotion.

original: varaṃ varaya bhadraṃ te varadohamihāgataḥ /
analyzed: varam varaya bhadram te vara doham iha āgataḥ
translated: He said, Choose a boon. May you be fortunate. I have come here as the giver of boons.

original: hariṇodīritaṃ vākyaṃ śrutvā prāha smitānanā // / / //
analyzed: hariṇā udīritam vākyam śrutvā prāha smita ānanā
translated: Hearing the words spoken by Hari, she spoke with a smiling face.

original: uvāca parayā bhaktyā śrīnivāsaṃ jagatprabhum /
analyzed: uvāca parayā bhaktyā śrīnivāsam jagatprabhum
translated: She spoke with supreme devotion to Shri Krishna, the lord of the universe.

original: ahaṃ hi bhāryā bhūyāsaṃ tava mādhava suṃdara // / / //
analyzed: aham hi bhāryā bhūyāsam tava mādhava suṃdara
translated: She said, O Madhava, O handsome one, may I be your wife.

original: iti tasyā vacaḥ śrutvā śrīnivāso 'bravīdvacaḥ /
analyzed: iti tasyāḥ vacaḥ śrutvā śrīnivāsaḥ bravīt vacaḥ
translated: Hearing her words, Shri Krishna spoke these words.

original: śrībhagavānuvāca /
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: ahaṃ kumāri subhage kṛṣṇajanmani bhūtale // / / //
analyzed: aham kumāri subhage kṛṣṇa janmani bhū tale
translated: O maiden, O fortunate one, in the birth of Krishna on earth, I will be your husband.

original: bhavāmi tava bhartāhaṃ nātra kāryā vicāraṇā /🔽evamuktā sutā kanyā puraṇyarāśiṃ hariṃ param // / / //
analyzed: bhavāmi tava bhartā aham na atra kāryā vicāraṇā  evam uktā sutā kanyā puraṇyarāśim harim param
translated: There is no doubt about this.🔽Thus addressed, the maiden, a heap of merit, spoke to the supreme Hari.

original: uvāca paramaprītā harṣagadgadayā girā /
analyzed: uvāca parama prītā harṣa gadgadayā girā
translated: Extremely delighted, she spoke with words choked with joy.

original: kanyovāca /
analyzed: kanyā uvāca
translated: The maiden said:

original: kṛṣṇajanmanyahaṃ patnī bhūyāsaṃ prathamehani // / / //
analyzed: kṛṣṇa janmani aham patnī bhūyāsam prathamehani
translated: In the birth of Krishna, may I be your wife on the first day.

original: saṃskārātprathamaṃ cāhamaṃ ganābhyaḥ samāvṛṇe /
analyzed: saṃskārāt prathamam ca ahamam samāvṛṇe
translated: I will first be married to you before all the maidens.

original: omityuktaḥ punarvākyamuvāca madhusūdanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: om iti uktaḥ punar vākyam uvāca madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Thus addressed, the slayer of Madhu, the lord of the universe, spoke to the maiden.🔽He said, So be it. Then the maiden spoke to the lord of the universe.🔽She said, O lord, I will be your wife on the first day of the bright fortnight in the month of Bhadrapada.

original: śrībhagavānuvāca /
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: kumāryā vidhṛtatvācca matpradānācca bhāmini /
analyzed: kumāryāḥ vidhṛta tvāt ca mad pradānāt ca bhāmini
translated: O beautiful lady, due to the maiden's retention and my bestowal,

original: teṣāṃ manobhīṣṭasiddhirbhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: teṣām manaḥ abhīṣṭa siddhiḥ bhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ
translated: there is no doubt that their mental desires will be fulfilled.

original: iti tasyai varaṃ dattvā tatraivāntaradhīyata /
analyzed: iti tasyai varam dattvā tatra eva antaradhīyata
translated: Having given her this boon, he disappeared right there.

original: dehaṃ tatraiva saṃtyajya kumārī caiva putrikā // / / //
analyzed: deham tatra eva saṃtyajya kumārī ca eva putrikā
translated: The maiden, the daughter, also abandoned her body right there.

original: kumbha kasya gṛhe jātā nīlā nāmnā tu sā smṛtā /
analyzed: kumbha kasya gṛhe jātā nīlā nāmnā tu sā smṛtā
translated: Born in the house of Kumbha, she is known by the name Nila.

original: kuṃbhakastu mahābhāga nandaśobhasya śālakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kuṃbhakaḥ tu mahābhāga nanda śobhasya śālakaḥ
translated: O greatly fortunate one, Kumbhaka is the servant of Nandhashobha.

original: kalpavāhaḥ sa vijñeyaḥ pitṝṇāṃ prathamaḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: kalpavāhaḥ sa vijñeyaḥ pitṝṇām prathamaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: He should be known as the conveyor of the Kalpa, remembered as the first of the ancestors.

original: tasya gatvā gṛhamahaṃ vṛṣabhācalavāsinaḥ /
analyzed: tasya gatvā gṛham aham vṛṣabhācala vāsinaḥ
translated: Having gone to the house of that resident of Mount Vrishabha,

original: śivasya varataścaiva tvajeyaḥ khagasattama // / / //
analyzed: śivasya varataḥ ca eva tu ajeyaḥ khaga sattama
translated: and by the boon of Shiva, O best of birds, I am invincible.

original: ditijānvinihatyaiva nīlā prāptā khageśvara /🔽tato nāgnijito rājño gṛhe jātā kumārikā // / / //
analyzed: ditijān vinihatya eva nīlā prāptā khageśvara  tatas nā agnijitaḥ rājñaḥ gṛhe jātā kumārikā
translated: Having killed the sons of Diti, Nila was obtained, O lord of birds.🔽Then the maiden was born in the house of King Nagnijita.

original: nāgnijitkavyavāhobhūtkanyā nīlāhvayābhavat /
analyzed: nā agnijit kavyavāhaḥ bhūt kanyā nīlāhvayā bhavat
translated: Nagnijita became the conveyor of the Kavyas, and the daughter was named Nila.

original: tasyāḥ svayaṃvare cāhaṃ govṛṣānsaptasaṃkhyakān // / / //
analyzed: tasyāḥ svayaṃvare ca aham go vṛṣān sapta saṃkhyakān
translated: At her svayamvara, I obtained seven cows and bulls,

original: śivasya varataścaivāpyavadhyāndevamānuṣaiḥ /
analyzed: śivasya varatas ca eva api avadhyān deva mānuṣaiḥ
translated: who are invincible by gods and humans by the boon of Shiva.

original: baddhvā vṛṣānnṛpāñjitvā prāptā nīlā mahākhaga // / / //
analyzed: baddhvā vṛṣān nṛpān jitvā prāptā nīlā mahā khaga
translated: Having bound the bulls and defeated the kings, the great bird obtained the blue one.

original: kuṃbhakasya sutā nīlā dehasthāḥ prāviśan bhṛśam /
analyzed: kuṃbhakasya sutāḥ nīlāḥ deha sthāḥ prāviśan bhṛśam
translated: The blue daughter of Kumbhaka, residing in the body, entered deeply.

original: ekāvayavato yasmāttasmāttatraiva sāviśat // / / //
analyzed: eka avayavataḥ yasmāt tasmāt tatra eva sā aviśat
translated: Since she entered there itself from one part,

original: bhūmau dvidhā saṃprajātā kumāryeva na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: bhūmau dvidhā saṃprajātā kumārī eva na saṃśayaḥ
translated: she undoubtedly became divided into two on the ground, just like a maiden.

original: bhadrājanma pravakṣyāmi śṛṇu pakṣīndrasattama // / / //
analyzed: bhadrājanma pravakṣyāmi śṛṇu pakṣi indra sattama
translated: I will tell the birth of Bhadra, listen, O best of bird-kings.

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttarakhaṇḍe tṛtīyāṃśe brahmakāṇḍe nīlāvivāhanirṇayo nāmaikonaviṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttara khaṇḍe tṛtīya aṃśe brahmakāṇḍe nīlāvivāhanirṇayaḥ nāma ekonaviṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the Nineteenth Chapter, in the Third Section of the Uttara-Khanda of the Shree-Garuda Purana, describing the marriage of Nila.

original: śrīgaruḍamahāpurāṇam
analyzed: śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam
translated: Shree-Garuda Maha-Purana

original: śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /
analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Shree Krishna said:

original: yā pūrvasarge nalasaṃjñasya vīndra putrī bhūtvā viṣṇupatnī sakāmā /
analyzed: yā pūrva sarge nala saṃjñasya vīndra putrī bhūtvā viṣṇu patnī sa kāmā
translated: O lord of birds, she who was the daughter of Nala in the previous creation, became the wife of Vishnu out of desire,

original: pradakṣiṇaṃ bhramaṇaṃ vai cakāra guṇena bhadrā bhadrasaṃjñā babhūva // / / //
analyzed: pradakṣiṇam bhramaṇam vai cakāra guṇena bhadrā bhadra saṃjñā babhūva
translated: and performed circumambulation. By that virtue, Bhadra became known as Bhadra-sanjna.

original: kanyābhāve saṃsthitāṃ bhadrasaṃjñāṃ pitā nalastvabravīttāṃ sa paśyan /
analyzed: kanyā abhāve saṃsthitām bhadra saṃjñām pitā nalaḥ tu abravīt tām sa paśyan
translated: Seeing Bhadra-sanjna, who was in the state of a maiden, her father Nala said to her:

original: bhadre kimarthaṃ gātrapīḍāṃ karoṣi phalaṃ hi tannandini me vadasva // / / //
analyzed: bhadre kimartham gātra pīḍām karoṣi phalam hi tat nandini me vadasva
translated: O Bhadra, why do you inflict pain on your body? O Nandini, tell me the fruit of that.

original: bhadrovāca /
analyzed: bhadrā uvāca
translated: Bhadra said:

original: śṛṇutvaṃ me tāta namaskriyādeḥ phalaṃ vaktuṃ kā samarthā bhavecca // / / //
analyzed: śṛṇutvam me tāta namaskriyā ādeḥ phalam vaktum kā samarthā bhavet ca
translated: Listen, O father, who can speak of the fruit of bowing down and so on?

original: tathāpyahaṃ tava vakṣyāmi tāta yathāśaktyā śṛṇu samyagghitāya /
analyzed: tathā api aham tava vakṣyāmi tāta yathāśaktyā śṛṇu samyak hitāya
translated: Nevertheless, O father, I shall tell you according to my ability, listen properly with devotion.

original: sadā harimarma nātho dayālurahaṃ harestava dāsānudāsī /
analyzed: sadā hari marma nāthaḥ dayāluḥ aham hareḥ tava dāsa anudāsī
translated: The lord is always kind to Hari, I am a servant of Hari, not neutral.

original: māṃ pāhi viṣṇostava vande pade ityuktvā praṇāmaṃ cākaroddaṇḍarūpam // / / //
analyzed: mām pāhi viṣṇoḥ tava vande pade iti uktvā praṇāmam ca akarot daṇḍa rūpam
translated: Protect me, O Vishnu, I bow at your feet, having said this, he made a prostration in the form of a staff.

original: hareḥ praṇāmaṃ tviti kartavyaśūnyaṃ vyarthaṃ tamāhurjñāninastacchṛṇu tvam /
analyzed: hareḥ praṇāmam tu iti kartavya śūnyam vyartham tam āhuḥ jñāninaḥ tat śṛṇu tvam
translated: The wise ones say that Hari's prostration, which is devoid of what is to be done, is useless, listen to that.

original: rameśa madhveśa sarasvatīśetyevaṃ vadanpraṇamedviṣṇudevam // / / //
analyzed: rama īśa madhveśa sarasvatī īśa iti evam vadan praṇamet viṣṇu devam
translated: Saying thus, O lord of Lakshmi, O lord of Madhu, O lord of Saraswati, one should bow to Vishnu, the god.

original: yathā prasanno vandanāddevaddeva stathā na tuṣṭaḥ pūjanātkarmataśca /
analyzed: yathā prasannaḥ vandanāt devaddevaḥ stathā na tuṣṭaḥ pūjanāt karmataḥ ca
translated: As the god of gods is pleased by bowing down, so he is not satisfied by worship and rituals.

original: yathā nāmasmaraṇādvandanādvā pāpānniyacchetu tathā na cānyaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: yathā nāma smaraṇāt vandanāt vā pāpāt niyacchetu tathā na ca anyaiḥ
translated: As one can restrain from sin by remembering the name or by bowing down, so not by others.

original: dehaṃ tu ye poṣayantyeva tāta hareḥ praṇāmaiḥ śūnyabhūtaṃ ca puṣṭam /
analyzed: deham tu ye poṣayanti eva tāta hareḥ praṇāmaiḥ śūnya bhūtam ca puṣṭam
translated: O father, those who nourish the body alone, which is devoid of Hari's prostration, and which is nourished,

original: tadevamāhurvyarthameveti tāta tatpoṣakāṇāṃ narake duḥ khamāhuḥ // / / //
analyzed: tat evam āhuḥ vyartham evā iti tāta tad poṣakāṇām narake duḥ kham āhuḥ
translated: They say that is useless, O father, and say that the nourishers of that go to hell.

original: yamo 'pi taṃ tatra ulūkhale tu nidhāya piṣṭaṃ sukhalaiḥ karoti /
analyzed: yamaḥ pi tam tatra ulūkhale tu nidhāya piṣṭam su khalaiḥ karoti
translated: Yama also places him there on a mortar and grinds him happily with a pestle.

original: yo vā paraṃ na karotyeva tāta pradakṣiṇaṃ devadevasya viṣṇoḥ // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ vā param na karoti eva tāta pradakṣiṇam devadevasya viṣṇoḥ
translated: O father, he who never turns to the right of Vishnu, the god of gods,

original: tasyaiva pādau talayantre nidhāya yamaśca nityaṃ prakaroti piṣṭam /
analyzed: tasya eva pādau talayantre nidhāya yamaḥ ca nityam prakaroti piṣṭam
translated: Yama always places his feet in a machine and grinds him.

original: eṣāṃ jihvā harikṛṣṇeti nāma na vakti nityaṃ vyarthabhūtāṃ vadanti // / / //
analyzed: eṣām jihvā hari kṛṣṇā iti nāma na vakti nityam vyartha bhūtām vadanti
translated: Their tongues do not always utter the names Hari and Krishna. They say that such tongues are useless.

original: teṣāṃ jihvā yamaloke yamastu niṣkāsya piṣṭaṃ prakaroti nityam /
analyzed: teṣām jihvā yama loke yamaḥ tu niṣkāsya piṣṭam prakaroti nityam
translated: In Yama's world, Yama always takes out their tongues and grinds them.

original: kāśīnivāsena ca kiṃ prayojanaṃ kiṃ vā prayāge maraṇena tāta // / / //
analyzed: kāśīnivāsena ca kim prayojanam kim vā prayāge maraṇena tāta
translated: What is the use of residing in Kashi? O father, what is the use of dying at Prayaga?

original: kiṃ vāraṇāgre maraṇena saukhyaṃ kiṃ vā makhādeḥ samanuṣṭhitena /
analyzed: kim vā araṇa agre maraṇena saukhyam kim vā makha ādeḥ samanuṣṭhitena
translated: What happiness is there in dying in front of an elephant? What is the use of performing a sacrifice?

original: samastatīrtheṣvaṭanena kiṃ kimadhītaśāstreṇa sutīkṣṇabuddhyā // / / //
analyzed: samasta tīrtheṣu aṭanena kim kim adhīta śāstreṇa su tīkṣṇa buddhyā
translated: What is the use of wandering to all the holy places? What is the use of studying scriptures with a very sharp intellect?

original: yeṣāṃ jihvāgre harināmaiva nāsti yeṣāṃ gātrairnamanaṃ nāpi viṣṇoḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām jihvā agre hari nāmā eva nā asti yeṣām gātraiḥ namanam nā api viṣṇoḥ
translated: Those whose tongues do not have the name of Hari, whose bodies do not bow to Vishnu,

original: yeṣāṃ padbhyāṃ nāsti hareḥ pradakṣiṇaṃ teṣāṃ sarvaṃ vyarthamāhurmahāntaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yeṣām padbhyām nā asti hareḥ pradakṣiṇam teṣām sarvam vyartham āhuḥ mahāntaḥ
translated: Those whose feet do not circumambulate Hari, the great ones say that everything of theirs is useless.

original: haryarpaṇādrihitaṃ nāma kasmātpradakṣiṇaṃ namanaṃ cāhurarghyam /
analyzed: hari arpaṇa adri hitam nāma kasmāt pradakṣiṇam namanam ca āhuḥ arghyam
translated: Why is the circumambulation and salutation of the Lord called Arghya?

original: ato viṣṇornamanaṃ kāryameva harernāmasmaraṇaṃ tāta kāryam // / / //
analyzed: atas viṣṇoḥ namanam kāryam eva hareḥ nāma smaraṇam tāta kāryam
translated: Therefore, one should always bow to Vishnu. O father, one should always remember the name of Hari.

original: janma hyetaddurlabhaṃ naśvaraṃ tu yathā jalasthaṃ tattathaiva /
analyzed: janma hi etat durlabham naśvaram tu yathā jala stham tat tathā eva
translated: This birth is difficult to obtain and perishable, just like water in a mirage.

original: no visvāsaṃ kuru gātre tvadīye jīveṣvapi svaḥ paraśceti tāta // / / //
analyzed: no visvāsam kuru gātre tvadīye jīveṣu api svaḥ paraḥ ca iti tāta
translated: O father, do not have faith in your body and in the lives of others.

original: sadyaḥ kṛtaṃ namanaṃ na tvadīyaṃ sadyaḥ kṛtaṃ smaraṇaṃ na tvadīyam /
analyzed: sadyas kṛtam namanam na tvadīyam sadyas kṛtam smaraṇam na tvadīyam
translated: I have not immediately bowed to you, I have not immediately remembered you.

original: kadā prāpsye maraṇaṃ tanna jāne na viśvāsaṃ kuru gātre mahātman // / / //🔽etacchrutvā nalo vīndra putrīvākyaṃ sunirmalam /
analyzed: kadā prāpsye maraṇam tat na jāne na viśvāsam kuru gātre mahātman  etat śrutvā nalaḥ vīndra putrī vākyam su nirmalam
translated: I do not know when I will die. O great soul, do not have faith in the body.🔽O Indra among kings, having heard these very pure words of his daughter,

original: namaskāraṃ ca kṛtavānyathāśaktyā pradakṣiṇam // / / //
analyzed: namaskāram ca kṛtavān yathāśaktyā pradakṣiṇam
translated: Nala bowed as much as he could and circumambulated.

original: sāpi pradakṣiṇaṃ cakre namaskāraṃ sadā hareḥ /
analyzed: sā api pradakṣiṇam cakre namaskāram sadā hareḥ
translated: She also always circumambulated and bowed to Hari.

original: evaṃ bahudinaṃ kṛtvā dhyātvā nārāyaṇaṃ param // / / //
analyzed: evam bahu dinam kṛtvā dhyātvā nārāyaṇam param
translated: Having done this for many days, meditating on the supreme Narayana,

original: kalevaraṃ ca tatyāja maraṇe haricintayā /
analyzed: kalevaram ca tatyāja maraṇe hari cintayā
translated: she gave up her body, thinking of Hari at the time of death.

original: matpiturvasudevasya bhaginyā udare khaga // / / //
analyzed: mad pituḥ vasudevasya bhaginyāḥ udare khaga
translated: O bird, in the womb of the sister of my father Vasudeva,

original: kaikeyīti ca nāmnā sā tvabhavadbhadrasaṃjñakā /
analyzed: kaikeyī iti ca nāmnā sā tu abhavat bhadra saṃjñakā
translated: And she came to be known by the name of Kaikeyi, O you of auspicious signs.

original: yasmādbhadraguṇairyuktā bhadrā sā bhadranāmikā // / / //
analyzed: yasmāt bhadra guṇaiḥ yuktā bhadrā sā bhadra nāmikā
translated: Because she was endowed with auspicious qualities, she was auspicious and had the name Bhadra.

original: tasyātmajaiśca kaikeyaiḥ pañcabhiḥ khagasattama /
analyzed: tasya ātmajaiḥ ca kaikeyaiḥ pañcabhiḥ khaga sattama
translated: O best of birds, by her five sons, the Kaikeyas,

original: pratyāhṛtāmimāṃ bhadrāṃ prāptavān khagasattama // / / //
analyzed: pratyāhṛtām imām bhadrām prāptavān khaga sattama
translated: O best of birds, he obtained this Bhadra, who was taken away by them.

original: vakṣyehaṃ mitravindāyāḥ pāṇigrahaṇakāraṇam /
analyzed: vakṣye iham mitravindāyāḥ pāṇigrahaṇa kāraṇam
translated: I shall tell the reason for the marriage of Mitravinda.

original: sāvadhānamanā bhūtvā śṛṇu pakṣīndra sattama // / / //
analyzed: sa avadhāna manāḥ bhūtvā śṛṇu pakṣi indra sattama
translated: O best of birds, listen attentively,

original: mitravindovāca /
analyzed: mitravindā uvāca
translated: Mitravinda said:

original: yānpūrvasargepyavṛṇonnikāmato hyagnīṣomānnāmikā mitravindā /
analyzed: yān pūrva sarge api avṛṇot nikāmataḥ hi agnīṣomān nāmikā mitravindā
translated: I, Mitravinda, who was named Agnishoma in the previous creation,

original: mitraṃ hariṃ prāptukāmā sadaika tatropāyaṃ cintayāmāsadevī // / / //
analyzed: mitram harim prāptu kāmā sadā eka tatra upāyam cintayāmāsa devī
translated: Desiring to attain Hari, the friend, the goddess thought of a means for that.

original: hariprāptau sādhanāḥ saṃti teṣu mukhyaṃ kaciccintayāmāsa devī /
analyzed: hari prāptau sādhanāḥ saṃti teṣu mukhyam kacit cintayāmāsa devī
translated: Among them, the goddess thought of some as the principal means for attaining Hari.

original: teṣāṃ madhye śravaṇaṃ śreṣṭhamāhuḥ purāṇānāṃ sāttvikānāṃ sadāpi // / / //
analyzed: teṣām madhye śravaṇam śreṣṭham āhuḥ purāṇānām sāttvikānām sadā api
translated: Among them, they say that listening to the Puranas of the Sattva quality is always the best.

original: viṣṇorutkarṣo vartate yatra vāyostathotkarṣaḥ sajjanānāṃ purāṇe /
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ utkarṣaḥ vartate yatra vāyoḥ tathā utkarṣaḥ sat janānām purāṇe
translated: In that Purana, the greatness of Vishnu and Vayu and of good people is described.

original: śrāddhaṃ sadā viṣṇubuddhyā sadaiva nānyacchrāvyaṃ sādhanaṃ tatra caiva // / / //
analyzed: śrāddham sadā viṣṇu buddhyā sadā eva na anyat śrāvyam sādhanam tatra ca eva
translated: The Śrāddha should always be performed with the thought of Viṣṇu, and nothing else should be listened to or practiced there.

original: yasmindine śravaṇaṃ nāsti viṣṇosteṣāṃ janma vyarthamāhuḥ kathāyām /
analyzed: yasmin dine śravaṇam nā asti viṣṇoḥ teṣām janma vyartham āhuḥ kathāyām
translated: On that day when there is no listening to Viṣṇu, their birth is useless, it is said in the story.

original: snāna japaḥ pañcayajñaṃ vrataṃ ca iṣṭāpūrte kṛcchracāndro ca dattam // / / //
analyzed: snāna japaḥ pañcayajñam vratam ca iṣṭāpūrte ca dattam
translated: Bathing, japa, the five sacrifices, vows, desired and performed rites, austerities, lunar rites, and gifts -

original: sarvaṃ vyarthaṃ vaiṣṇavānāṃ ca dīkṣā kathāṃ vinā samyaganuṣṭhitāṃ vai /
analyzed: sarvam vyartham vaiṣṇavānām ca dīkṣā kathām vinā samyak anuṣṭhitām vai
translated: all are useless for the initiated devotees of Viṣṇu without the proper practice of the story.

original: yairna śrutaṃ bhāgavataṃ purāṇaṃ sasaṃpradāyairgurubhiḥ saṃyutaiśca // / / //
analyzed: yaiḥ na śrutam bhāgavatam purāṇam sa saṃpradāyaiḥ gurubhiḥ saṃyutaiḥ ca
translated: Those by whom the Bhāgavata Purāṇa has not been heard along with the traditional teachings and the gurus,

original: yairna śrutaṃ bhāgavataṃ purāṇaṃ yairna śrutaṃ brahmakāṇḍaṃ purāṇam /
analyzed: yaiḥ na śrutam bhāgavatam purāṇam yaiḥ na śrutam brahmakāṇḍam purāṇam
translated: those by whom the Bhāgavata Purāṇa has not been heard, those by whom the Brahma Khaṇḍa Purāṇa has not been heard,

original: teṣāṃ janma vyarthamāhurmamahāntastasmācchrāvyā harivārtā sadaiva // / / //
analyzed: teṣām janma vyartham āhuḥ tasmāt śrāvyā hari vārtā sadā eva
translated: the great ones say their birth is useless. Therefore, the stories of Hari should always be listened to.

original: na yatra govindakathāmahānadī na yatra nārāyaṇapādasaṃśrayaḥ /
analyzed: na yatra govinda kathā mahā nadī na yatra nārāyaṇa pāda saṃśrayaḥ
translated: Where there is no great river of the stories of Govinda, where there is no reliance on the feet of Nārāyaṇa,

original: na yatra viṣṇoḥ satataṃ vacosti na saṃvasettatkṣaṇamātraṃ kathañcit // / / //
analyzed: na yatra viṣṇoḥ satatam vacaḥ asti na saṃvaset tad kṣaṇa mātram kathañcid
translated: where there are no constant words about Viṣṇu, one should not stay there even for a moment.

original: yasmin grāme bhāgavataṃ na śāstraṃ na vartate bhāgavatā rasajñāḥ /
analyzed: yasmin grāme bhāgavatam na śāstram na vartate bhāgavatāḥ rasa jñāḥ
translated: In that village where the Bhagavata scripture is not recited, where there are no connoisseurs of the essence of the Bhagavata,

original: yasmin gṛhe nāsti gītārthasāraḥ yasmin grāme nāma sahasrakaṃ vā // / / //
analyzed: yasmin gṛhe na asti gīta artha sāraḥ yasmin grāme nāma sahasrakam vā
translated: In that house where the essence of the meaning of the Gita is not found, in that village where the thousand names [of Vishnu] are not recited,

original: tayo rasajñā yatra na santi tatra na saṃvasetkṣaṇamātraṃ kathañcit /
analyzed: tayoḥ rasajñāḥ yatra na santi tatra na saṃvaset kṣaṇa mātram kathañcid
translated: Where there are no connoisseurs of the essence of those two, one should not stay there even for a moment, somehow.

original: yasmin dine divyakathā ca viṣṇorna vāsti jantostasya cāyurvṛthaiva // / / //
analyzed: yasmin dine divya kathā ca viṣṇoḥ na vā asti jantoḥ tasya ca āyuḥ vṛthā eva
translated: On that day when there is no divine story of Vishnu for a living being, his life is indeed in vain.

original: garbhe gate nātra vicāryamasti tanmanyate durlabhaṃ martyaloke /
analyzed: garbhe gate na atra vicāryam asti tat manyate durlabham martya loke
translated: There is no doubt that he is in the womb. The wise consider it difficult to find in the mortal world.

original: karṇaṃ kalpairbhūṣitaṃ suṃdaraṃ ca na suṃdaraṃ cāhurāryā rasajñāḥ // / / //
analyzed: karṇam kalpaiḥ bhūṣitam suṃdaram ca na suṃdaram ca āhuḥ āryāḥ rasajñāḥ
translated: The noble ones, connoisseurs of essence, do not consider the beautiful and well-adorned ear to be beautiful.

original: viṣṇoḥ kathākhyābharaṇaiśca yuktaṃ tadeva karṇaṃ suṃdaraṃ cāhurāryāḥ /🔽tasmātsadā bhāgavatārthasāraṃ śṛṇvanti ye satataṃ vācayanti // / / //
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ kathā ākhya ābharaṇaiḥ ca yuktam tat eva karṇam suṃdaram ca āhuḥ āryāḥ  tasmāt sadā bhāgavata artha sāram śṛṇvanti ye satatam vācayanti
translated: The noble ones consider that very ear to be beautiful which is adorned with the embellishments of stories of Vishnu.

original: teṣāṃ janma svasthamāhurmahānto mahatphalaṃ cāsti tathaiva teṣām /
analyzed: teṣām janma svastham āhuḥ mahāntaḥ mahat phalam ca asti tathā eva teṣām
translated: Therefore, the great ones always say that the birth of those who constantly listen to and recite the essence of the meaning of the Bhagavata is good, and they have great fruit likewise.

original: soṣṇīṣakañcukayutāśca hareḥ kathāṃ vai śṛṇvanti yepi ca paṭhanti sadaiva martyāḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa uṣṇīṣa kañcuka yutāḥ ca hareḥ kathām vai śṛṇvanti ye api ca paṭhanti sadā eva martyāḥ
translated: Those mortals who listen to and always recite the stories of Hari, along with the headdress and armor,

original: sarvepi te pūjanīyā hi loke na vai śiśre codare caiva saktāḥ /
analyzed: sarve api te pūjanīyāḥ hi loke na vai ca udare ca eva saktāḥ
translated: All of them are worthy of worship in the world, not those attached to the head and belly.

original: ye dākṣiṇyādarthalobhādvadanti sadā purāṇaṃ bhagavattattvasāram // / / //
analyzed: ye dākṣiṇyāt artha lobhāt vadanti sadā purāṇam bhagavat tattva sāram
translated: Those who always speak the Purana, the essence of the truth of the Lord, out of kindness and greed for wealth,

original: pracchādayante tattvagopyāni ye tu teṣāṃ gatiḥ sūryasūnuḥ sadaiva /
analyzed: pracchādayante tattva gopyāni ye tu teṣām gatiḥ sūryasūnuḥ sadā eva
translated: Those who conceal the secrets of reality, their destination is always the Sun's son.

original: ye dharmakāṇḍe karmakāṇḍe sadaiva utpādayante suruciṃ tatra nityam // / / //
analyzed: ye dharma kāṇḍe karma kāṇḍe sadā eva utpādayante su rucim tatra nityam
translated: Those who always generate great affection for the Dharma Kanda and Karma Kanda,

original: maulyena ye kathayeyuḥ purāṇaṃ teṣāṃ gatiḥ sūrya sunaḥ sadaiva /
analyzed: maulyena ye kathayeyuḥ purāṇam teṣām gatiḥ sūrya sunaḥ sadā eva
translated: Their destination is always the Sun's son, those who would tell the Purana for a fee.

original: maulyena ye bhāgavataṃ purāṇaṃ śṛṇvanti vai hariśāstrārthatattvam // / / //
analyzed: maulyena ye bhāgavatam purāṇam śṛṇvanti vai hari śāstra artha tattvam
translated: Those who listen to the Bhagavata Purana, the truth of the meaning of Hari's scriptures, for a fee,

original: maulyena vedādhyayanaṃ prakurvate teṣāṃ gatiḥ sūryasūnuḥ sadaiva /
analyzed: maulyena veda adhyayanam prakurvate teṣām gatiḥ sūryasūnuḥ sadā eva
translated: Their destination is always the Sun's son, those who study the Vedas for a fee.

original: yadṛcchayā prāptadhanena ye tu saṃtuṣṭāste hyatra yogyāḥ sadaiva // / / //
analyzed: yadṛcchayā prāpta dhanena ye tu saṃtuṣṭāḥ te hi atra yogyāḥ sadā eva
translated: Those who are always content with wealth obtained by chance, they are always fit here.

original: dhanārjane ye tvatitṛṣṇābhiyuktāsteṣāṃ na vai bhāgavatedhikāraḥ /
analyzed: dhana arjane ye tu ati tṛṣṇā abhiyuktāḥ teṣām na vai bhāgavata idhikāraḥ
translated: Those who are excessively attached to earning wealth are not eligible for the Bhagavata.

original: matvā loke harirevati nityamantaryāmī nāsti tadanya īśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: matvā loke hariḥ evati nityam antaryāmī na asti tad anyaḥ īśaḥ
translated: Considering that Hari alone is eternal in the world, there is no inner controller other than Him.

original: evaṃ sadā ye pravicintayanti yogakṣemaṃ bibhṛyādviṣṇureṣām /
analyzed: evam sadā ye pravicintayanti yogakṣemam bibhṛyāt viṣṇuḥ eṣām
translated: Those who always think like this, for them Vishnu will take care of their well-being.

original: sadvaiṣṇavānāmaśubhaṃ nāsti nāsti pradṛśyate saṃśayajñānarūpāt // / / //
analyzed: sat vaiṣṇavānām aśubham na asti na asti pradṛśyate saṃśaya jñāna rūpāt
translated: For the true devotees of Vishnu, there is no inauspiciousness, no doubt or uncertain knowledge is seen.

original: karmānusāreṇa harirdadāti phalaṃ śubhānāmaśubhasya caiva /
analyzed: karma anusāreṇa hariḥ dadāti phalam śubhānām aśubhasya ca eva
translated: Hari gives the fruits of good and bad deeds according to one's actions.

original: atastadarthaṃ naiva yatnaṃ ca kuryāddhanārthaṃ vai haritattve ca kuryāt // / / //
analyzed: atas tad artham nā eva yatnam ca kuryāt dhana artham vai hari tattve ca kuryāt
translated: Therefore, one should not make efforts for wealth, but for the truth of Hari.

original: ataḥ snātvā divyamantraṃ japitvā visarjayitvā viṣṇunirmālyagandham /
analyzed: atas snātvā divya mantram japitvā visarjayitvā viṣṇu nirmālya gandham
translated: Therefore, having bathed, having muttered the divine mantra, having removed the fragrance of Vishnu's discarded garland,

original: śucirbhūtvā bhāgavataṃ purāṇaṃ saṃśrāvayetsarvavettāpi nityam // / / //
analyzed: śuciḥ bhūtvā bhāgavatam purāṇam saṃśrāvayet sarva vettā api nityam
translated: having become pure, one should always recite the Purana of Bhagavata, even if one knows all.

original: karmānusāreṇa dhanārjanaṃ ca vedārjanaṃ śāstrasamārjanaṃ ca /
analyzed: karma anusāreṇa dhana arjanam ca veda arjanam śāstra samārjanam ca
translated: Earning wealth according to one's actions, earning knowledge of the Vedas, earning knowledge of the scriptures,

original: bhaviṣyati śravaṇaṃ cāpi viṣṇoratyādarācchravaṇaṃ durghaṭaṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: bhaviṣyati śravaṇam ca api viṣṇoḥ ati ādarāt śravaṇam durghaṭam ca
translated: and listening to Vishnu with great respect, and listening to the difficult-to-attain truth of Vishnu.

original: atyādarādbhāgavatasya sāramāsvādayeddurghaṭaṃ martyaloke /
analyzed: atyādarāt bhāgavatasya sāram āsvādayet durghaṭam martya loke
translated: It is very difficult to taste the essence of the Bhagavata in the mortal world due to excessive devotion.

original: āsvādya tadbhāgavataṃ purāṇamānandabāṣpairyuktatā durghaṭā ca // / / //
analyzed: āsvādya tat bhāgavatam purāṇam ānanda bāṣpaiḥ yukta tā durghaṭā ca
translated: Having tasted that Bhagavata Purana, it is difficult to be united with tears of joy.

original: śrutvā tattvā nāṃ nirṇayaṃ dhāraṇaṃ ca sudurghaṭaṃ cāhurāryāḥ samastam /
analyzed: śrutvā tattvāḥ nām nirṇayam dhāraṇam ca su durghaṭam ca āhuḥ āryāḥ samastam
translated: Having heard the determination and retention of the principles, the noble ones say that everything is very difficult.

original: śrutvā tattvānāṃ dhāraṇānantaraṃ ca kāmakrudhorjāraṇaṃ durghaṭaṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: śrutvā tattvānām dhāraṇa anantaram ca kāma krudhoḥ jāraṇam durghaṭam ca
translated: Having heard the retention of the principles, the purification of desire and anger is also very difficult.

original: śrutvā tattvānāṃ dhāraṇānaṃ taraṃ ta tathā yoge durghaṭaṃ saṃgataṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: śrutvā tattvānām tathā yoge durghaṭam saṃgatam ca
translated: Having heard the retention of the principles, the union in yoga is also difficult to accomplish.

original: śrutvā tattvānāṃ dhāraṇānantaraṃ ca kāmakrudhorjāraṇaṃ durghaṭaṃ ca /
analyzed: śrutvā tattvānām dhāraṇa anantaram ca kāma krudhoḥ jāraṇam durghaṭam ca
translated: Having heard the retention of the principles, the purification of desire and anger is also difficult.

original: ete doṣā jñānapūtānapīha kurvanti saṃdehayutānsadaiva // / / //
analyzed: ete doṣāḥ jñāna pūtān api iha kurvanti saṃdeha yutān sadā eva
translated: These faults always make even the purified ones doubtful.

original: ato hyahaṃ śravaṇaṃ satkathāyāḥ sadā kariṣye nātra vicāryamasti /🔽tenāpyahaṃ harināmābhivāñchā niścitya cittaṃ śravaṇe vai cakāra /
analyzed: atas hi aham śravaṇam sat kathāyāḥ sadā kariṣye na atra vicāryam asti  tena api aham hari nāma abhivāñchā niścitya cittam śravaṇe vai cakāra
translated: Therefore, I will always listen to the good stories, there is no doubt about this.🔽By that also, I have decided to desire the name of Hari and have set my mind on listening.

original: ādehamevaṃ śravaṇaṃ ca kṛtvā tyaktvā dehaṃ bhūtale saṃprajātā // / / //
analyzed: ādeham evam śravaṇam ca kṛtvā tyaktvā deham bhū tale saṃprajātā
translated: Having listened thus till the body, having abandoned the body on the ground, I have been born again.

original: nivastuṃ vasudevasya bhaginyā udare khaga /
analyzed: nivastum vasudevasya bhaginyāḥ udare khaga
translated: O bird, to be born in the womb of Vasudeva's sister named Sumitra,

original: sumitrā saṃjñakāyāṃ ca jātā vai mitravindikā // / / //
analyzed: sumitrā saṃjñakāyām ca jātā vai mitravindikā
translated: And was born as Mitravindā.

original: śravaṇena hariṃ mitraṃ prāptā sā mitravindikā /
analyzed: śravaṇena harim mitram prāptā sā mitravindikā
translated: By hearing (the name of) Hari, she obtained the friend (Mitra), and thus she became Mitravindā.

original: ataḥ sā mitravindeti saṃjñayā saṃbabhūva ha // / / //
analyzed: atas sā mitravindā iti saṃjñayā saṃbabhūva ha
translated: Therefore, she came to be known by the name Mitravindā.

original: svayaṃvare mitravindā rājñāṃ madhye tu bhāminī /
analyzed: svayaṃvare mitravindā rājñām madhye tu bhāminī
translated: In the svayaṃvara (self-choice of a husband by a bride), the beautiful Mitravindā

original: mamāṃse vyasṛjanmālāṃ tāṃ gṛhītvā khageśvara /
analyzed: mama aṃse vyasṛjat mālām tām gṛhītvā khageśvara
translated: Cast her garland on me, O lord of birds, and taking it,

original: vidhūya nṛpatīnsarvānpurīṃ prāptāḥ khageśvara //
analyzed: vidhūya nṛpatīn sarvān purīm prāptāḥ khageśvara
translated: She left all the kings behind and reached the city, O lord of birds.

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttarakhaṇḍe tṛtīyāṃśe brahmakāṇḍe bhadrākṛtabhagavatpatitvaprāpakatapaścaryādinirūpaṇaṃ nāma viṃśodhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttara khaṇḍe tṛtīya aṃśe brahmakāṇḍe bhadrākṛtabhagavatpatitvaprāpakatapaścaryādinirūpaṇam nāma viṃśaḥ adhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twentieth chapter in the Third Kāṇḍa of the Uttarārdha in the Śrīmat Garga-Upaniṣad of the Skandapurāṇa, dealing with the austerities etc. that led to the attainment of the status of a consort of the Lord by Bhadrā.

original: śrīgaruḍamahāpurāṇam
analyzed: śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam
translated: Śrī Garuḍa Mahāpurāṇa

original: śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /
analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Śrī Krishna said:

original: kālindyā api cotpattiṃ pravakṣyāmi khageśvara /
analyzed: kālindyāḥ api ca utpattim pravakṣyāmi khageśvara
translated: I shall now describe the origin of Kālindī, O lord of birds.

original: vivasvānnāma sūryobhattasya putrī vyajāyata // / / //
analyzed: vivasvān nāma sūryaḥ bhattasya putrī vyajāyata
translated: The Sun-god had a daughter named

original: kālindīsaṃjñakā vīndra yamunā yānujā smṛtā /
analyzed: kālindī saṃjñakā vīndra yamunā yā anujā smṛtā
translated: Kālindī, O lord of birds, who is known as the younger sister of Yamunā.

original: kṛṣṇapatnītvakāmena cacāra tapa uttamam // / / //
analyzed: kṛṣṇa patnī tva kāmena cacāra tapaḥ uttamam
translated: Desiring to become Krishna's wife, she performed excellent austerities.

original: tapa ālocanaṃ proktaṃ tattvānāṃ ca vinirṇayaḥ /
analyzed: tapaḥ ālocanam proktam tattvānām ca vinirṇayaḥ
translated: Austerity is said to be contemplation and the determination of principles.

original: pūrvārjitānāṃ pāpānāmanutāpastapaḥ smṛtam // / / //
analyzed: pūrva arjitānām pāpānām anutāpaḥ tapaḥ smṛtam
translated: Repentance for sins previously committed is known as austerity.

original: prāyo nāma tapaḥ proktaṃ cittanigraha ucyate /
analyzed: prāyas nāma tapaḥ proktam citta nigrahaḥ ucyate
translated: Austerity is said to be restraint of the mind.
