original: prāyaścittamiti proktaṃ na tu kṣauraṃ khageśvara // / / //
analyzed: prāyaścittam iti proktam na tu kṣauram khageśvara
translated: It is called expiation, not shaving, O Lord of birds.

original: anutāpayutaṃ bhūtaṃ tacchaṇu tvaṃ khageśvara /
analyzed: anutāpa yutam bhūtam tat śaṇu tvam khageśvara
translated: Listen to that, O Lord of birds, which is accompanied by repentance.

original: pūrvaṃ na japtaṃ divyamantraṃ mukunda taptaṃ sadā kleśadāvānalena // / / //
analyzed: pūrvam na japtam divya mantram mukunda taptam sadā kleśa dāva analena
translated: O Mukunda, the divine mantra has not been chanted before, it has always been tormented by the fire of affliction.

original: na vai smṛtaṃ harināmāmṛtaṃ ca sadā smṛtaṃ haridoṣādikaṃ ca /
analyzed: na vai smṛtam hari nāma amṛtam ca sadā smṛtam hari doṣa ādikam ca
translated: The nectar of Hari's name has not been remembered, but the faults of Hari and so on have always been remembered.

original: na tu smṛtaṃ haritattvāmṛtaṃ ca samyak śrutaṃ lolavārtādikaṃ ca // / / //🔽na pūjitaṃ haripādāravindaṃ supūjitāḥ putramitrādikāśca /
analyzed: na tu smṛtam hari tattva amṛtam ca samyak śrutam lola vārttā ādikam ca  na pūjitam hari pāda aravindam su pūjitāḥ putra mitra ādikāḥ ca
translated: The nectar of the truth of Hari has not been remembered, but the gossip of the fickle has been well heard.🔽The lotus feet of Hari have not been worshipped, but sons, friends and others have been well worshipped.

original: na vanditaṃ haripādāravindaṃ suvandito mitrapādaḥ sughoraḥ // / / //
analyzed: na vanditam hari pāda aravindam su vanditaḥ mitra pādaḥ su ghoraḥ
translated: The lotus feet of Hari have not been bowed to, but the feet of a terrible friend have been well bowed to.

original: na dṛṣṭaṃ vai dhūpadhūmrairupetaṃ harervakraṃ kuntalaiḥ saṃvṛtaṃ ca /
analyzed: na dṛṣṭam vai dhūpa dhūmraiḥ upetam hareḥ vakram kuntalaiḥ saṃvṛtam ca
translated: The face of Hari, endowed with incense smoke and covered with curls, has not been seen.

original: putrādikaṃ lālitaṃ vai mukunda na lālitaṃ tava vakraṃ murāre // / / //
analyzed: putra ādikam lālitam vai mukunda na lālitam tava vakram murāre
translated: O Mukunda, O Murari, the son and others who are fondled are not fondled by you.

original: sulālitaṃ bhūṣaṇaiḥ putramitraṃ na lālitaṃ sarvapāpāpahāri /
analyzed: su lālitam bhūṣaṇaiḥ putra mitram na lālitam sarva pāpa apahāri
translated: The son and friend who are well fondled with ornaments, O remover of all sins, are not fondled.

original: na bhuktaṃ vai harinairavedyaśeṣaṃ mitrālaye ṣaḍrasānnaṃ ca bhuktam // / / //
analyzed: na bhuktam vai hari nairavedya śeṣam mitra ālaye ṣaṣ rasa annam ca bhuktam
translated: The food of Hari, the nectar, has not been eaten, but the food of six tastes has been eaten in the house of friends.

original: supuṣpagandhā nārpitā te murāre samarpitāḥ putramitrādikebhyaḥ /
analyzed: su puṣpa gandhā nā arpitā te murāre samarpitāḥ putra mitra ādikebhyaḥ
translated: The good flower scents have not been offered to you, O Murari, but have been offered to sons, friends and others.

original: santaptohaṃ putramitrādikeṣu kadā drakṣye tava vaktraṃ mukunda // / / //
analyzed: santaptaḥ aham putra mitra ādikeṣu kadā drakṣye tava vaktram mukunda
translated: I am tormented by sons, friends and others. When will I see your face, O Mukunda?

original: avaiṣṇavānnaiḥ śigruśākādikaiśca hyanarpitānnaiśca tathāpyasaṃskṛtaiḥ /
analyzed: avaiṣṇava annaiḥ śigru śāka ādikaiḥ ca hi anarpita annaiḥ ca tathā api asaṃskṛtaiḥ
translated: By the food of non-Vaishnavas, by the vegetables like sigru, by the food that is not offered and also by the unrefined,

original: tathāpyabhakṣyai rasanā ca dagdhā kadā drakṣye tava vaktraṃ mukunda // / / //
analyzed: tathā api abhakṣyaiḥ rasanā ca dagdhā kadā drakṣye tava vaktram mukunda
translated: and also by the inedible, the tongue is burned. When will I see your face, O Mukunda?

original: aṣṭākṣarīpūjayā divyatīrthairviṣṇoḥ purā bhrāmitaiḥ śaṅkhatīrthaiḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭākṣarī pūjayā divya tīrthaiḥ viṣṇoḥ purā bhrāmitaiḥ śaṅkhatīrthaiḥ
translated: By the worship of the eight-syllabled mantra, by the divine holy places, by the conch holy places that were formerly moved by Vishnu,

original: na pāvitaṃ maccharīraṃ murāre kadā drakṣye tava va ktraṃ mukunda // / / //
analyzed: na pāvitam mad śarīram murāre kadā drakṣye tava mukunda
translated: my body has not been purified, O Murari. When will I see your face, O Mukunda?

original: anarpitairgandhapuṣpādikaiśca anarpitairbhūṣaṇairvastrajātaiḥ /
analyzed: an arpitaiḥ gandha puṣpa ādikaiḥ ca an arpitaiḥ bhūṣaṇaiḥ vastra jātaiḥ
translated: By the unguents, flowers and others that are not offered, by the ornaments and garments that are not offered,

original: avaiṣṇavānāṃ digdhagandhādidoṣairgātraṃ dagdhaṃ kadā hyuddhariṣye mukunda // / / //
analyzed: avaiṣṇavānām digdha gandha ādi doṣaiḥ gātram dagdham kadā hi uddhariṣye mukunda
translated: When shall I rescue the bodies of non-devotees burned by the faults of poisoned scents and such, O Mukunda?

original: dagdhau ca pādau mama vāsudeva na gacchantau kṣetrapathaṃ hareśca /
analyzed: dagdhau ca pādau mama vāsudeva na gacchantau kṣetra patham hareḥ ca
translated: O Vasudeva, my feet are burned, I cannot walk on the path of the Lord's temple.

original: netre ca dagdhe mama sarvadāpi nālokitaṃ tava deva pratīkam // / / //
analyzed: netre ca dagdhe mama sarvadā api na ālokitam tava deva pratīkam
translated: And my eyes are burned, I have never seen your image, O God.

original: dagdhau ca hastau mama vāsudeva na pūjitaṃ tava viṣṇoḥ pratīkam /
analyzed: dagdhau ca hastau mama vāsudeva na pūjitam tava viṣṇoḥ pratīkam
translated: O Vasudeva, my hands are burned, I have not worshipped your image, O Vishnu.

original: mayā kṛtaṃ pāpajātaṃ murāre kadā drakṣye tava vakraṃ mukunda // / / //
analyzed: mayā kṛtam pāpa jātam murāre kadā drakṣye tava vakram mukunda
translated: The sins I have committed, O Murari, when shall I see your face, O Mukunda?

original: madīyadoṣāngaṇayanna pūrṇa dayāṃ kuru tvaṃ suddhadāsyānmukunda /
analyzed: madīya doṣān gaṇayan na pūrṇa dayām kuru tvam suddha dāsyāt mukunda
translated: Counting my faults, O Mukunda, have mercy on me, the pure servant.

original: yāvanti lomāni madīyagātre saṃti prabho sarvadorṣarvidūra // / / //
analyzed: yāvanti lomāni madīya gātre saṃti prabho
translated: O Lord, as many hairs there are on my body, O remover of all fears,

original: tāvanti pāpāni madīyagātre kadā drakṣye tava vaktraṃ mukunda /
analyzed: tāvanti pāpāni madīya gātre kadā drakṣye tava vaktram mukunda
translated: For so many sins there are on my body. When shall I see your face, O Mukunda?

original: anantadehe patiputrairgṛhaiśca mitrairdhanaiḥ paśubhṛtyādikaiśca // / / //
analyzed: ananta dehe pati putraiḥ gṛhaiḥ ca mitraiḥ dhanaiḥ paśu bhṛtya ādikaiḥ ca
translated: In an infinite body, with husband, sons, houses, friends, wealth, animals, servants and so on,

original: sukhaṃ nāptaṃ hyapumātraṃ mukunda sevā muktā tava devasya viṣṇoḥ /
analyzed: sukham na āptam hi a pumātram mukunda sevā muktā tava devasya viṣṇoḥ
translated: Happiness is not obtained, O Mukunda. I am liberated from service to you, O God Vishnu.

original: itaḥ paraṃ putramitrādikaṃ ca yāsye nāhaṃ tava dāsī bhavāmi // / / //
analyzed: itas param putra mitra ādikam ca yāsye na aham tava dāsī bhavāmi
translated: From now on, I will go to my son, friends, and others. I will not be your slave anymore.

original: yeye brūyuḥ putramitrādikaiśca samyak sukhaṃ jāyate martyaloke /
analyzed: ye ye brūyuḥ putra mitra ādikaiḥ ca samyak sukham jāyate martya loke
translated: Those who say that true happiness comes in the mortal world through sons, friends, and others,

original: teṣāmāsye mūtraviṣṭhādikaṃ ca samyak sadā patitaṃ ceti jāne // / / //
analyzed: teṣām āsye mūtra viṣṭhā ādikam ca samyak sadā patitam ca iti jāne
translated: I know that urine, feces, and other impurities always fall into their mouths.

original: mitrādīnāṃ yatkṛtaṃ dravyajātaṃ vṛthā gataṃ malarūpaṃ ca jātam /
analyzed: mitra ādīnām yat kṛtam dravya jātam vṛthā gatam mala rūpam ca jātam
translated: The wealth that is earned through friends and others becomes wasted and turns into filth.

original: sadvaiṣṇavānāṃ yatkṛtaṃ dravyajātaṃ hariprāpteḥ kāraṇaṃ syātsadaiva // / / //
analyzed: sat vaiṣṇavānām yat kṛtam dravya jātam hari prāpteḥ kāraṇam syāt sadā eva
translated: The wealth that is earned through good devotees of Vishnu always becomes the cause for attaining Hari.

original: etādṛśaṃ tattu jātaṃ mukunda alaṃ hyalaṃ tena duḥkhaṃ ca bhuktam /
analyzed: etādṛśam tat tu jātam mukunda alam hi alam tena duḥkham ca bhuktam
translated: Such wealth has been earned by me, O Mukunda, but it has been enjoyed in vain and with great sorrow.

original: saṃgaṃ dattātsajjanānāṃ sadā tvaṃ vinā ca tvaṃ durjanānāṃ ca saṃgāt // / / //
analyzed: saṃgam dattāt sat janānām sadā tvam vinā ca tvam durjanānām ca saṃgāt
translated: Always give association with the good and avoid association with the wicked.

original: saṃgaiḥ sadā durjanānāṃ murāre gātraṃ dagdhaṃ na virāgeṇa yuktam /
analyzed: saṃgaiḥ sadā durjanānām murāre gātram dagdham na virāgeṇa yuktam
translated: O Murari, the body is always burnt by association with the wicked, not by dispassion.

original: etādṛśāhaṃ kāṃ gātiṃ vā mukunda yāsye na jāne dayayā māṃ ca pāhi // / / //
analyzed: etādṛśā aham kām gātim vā mukunda yāsye na jāne dayayā mām ca pāhi
translated: O Mukunda, I do not know what state I will go to. Please protect me with compassion.

original: etādṛśo hyanutāpaḥ khagendra prāyaścittaṃ na ca kṣaurādikaṃ ca /
analyzed: etādṛśaḥ hi anutāpaḥ khaga indra prāyaścittam na ca kṣaura ādikam ca
translated: O lord of birds, such is the repentance, not the expiation like shaving, etc.

original: bhānoḥ kanyā hyanutāpaṃ ca kṛtvā vicārayāmāsa hareḥ sutattvam // / / //🔽sarvottamo harirekaḥ sadaiva yataḥ pūrṇaḥ sarvaguṇaistataśca /
analyzed: bhānoḥ kanyā hi anutāpam ca kṛtvā vicārayāmāsa hareḥ sutattvam  sarva uttamaḥ hariḥ ekaḥ sadā eva yatas pūrṇaḥ sarva guṇaiḥ tatas ca
translated: Having thus reflected, the daughter of the sun, having performed penance, contemplated on the true nature of Hari.🔽Hari alone is the best of all, always, because He is complete with all qualities.

original: sṛṣṭau yasmājjayate viśvajātamato hariḥ sarvaguṇaiśca pūrṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sṛṣṭau yasmāt jayate viśva jātam atas hariḥ sarva guṇaiḥ ca pūrṇaḥ
translated: And because He is victorious in creation over the entire universe, therefore Hari is complete with all qualities.

original: yo devānāmādya akāra eva yato brahmādyā naiva pūrṇāḥ samastāḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ devānām ādyaḥ akāraḥ eva yatas brahma ādyāḥ na eva pūrṇāḥ samastāḥ
translated: He who is the first letter a of the gods, from whom all, including Brahma and others, are not complete.

original: lakṣmīprasādāccirapuṇyena jāto yathāyogyaṃ pūrṇaguṇo viriñcaḥ // / / //
analyzed: lakṣmī prasādāt cira puṇyena jātaḥ yathāyogyam pūrṇa guṇaḥ viriñcaḥ
translated: By the grace of Lakshmi, by long-standing merit, Brahma was born with appropriate complete qualities.

original: na lakṣmīvadguṇapūrṇo viriñco na viṣṇuvadguṇapūrṇā ramāpi /
analyzed: na lakṣmīvat guṇa pūrṇaḥ viriñcaḥ na viṣṇu vat guṇa pūrṇā ramā api
translated: Brahma is not complete with qualities like Lakshmi, nor is Lakshmi complete with qualities like Vishnu.

original: na vāyuvadbhāratī cāpi pūrṇā na śeṣavadvāruṇī cāpi pūrṇā // / / //
analyzed: na vāyu vat bhāratī ca api pūrṇā na śeṣa vat vāruṇī ca api pūrṇā
translated: Nor is Bharati complete like Vayu, nor is Varuni complete like Shesha.

original: na vai rudravatpārvatī pūrṇarūpā hyanyepyevaṃ naiva pūrṇāḥ sadaiva /🔽ālocanāmevameṣā hi kṛtvā tapaścakre yamunāyāśca tīre // / / //
analyzed: na vai rudra vat pārvatī pūrṇa rūpā hi anye pi evam nā eva pūrṇāḥ sadā eva  ālocanām evam eṣā hi kṛtvā tapaḥ cakre yamunāyāḥ ca tīre
translated: Parvati is not complete in form like Rudra, nor are the others always complete.🔽Having thus reflected, she performed penance on the banks of the Yamuna.

original: tadācāhaṃ yamunāyāśca tīraṃ pārthena sākaṃ mṛgayāṃ gataḥ khaga /
analyzed: tadā ca aham yamunāyāḥ ca tīram pārthena sākam mṛgayām gataḥ khaga
translated: At that time, O bird, I went on a hunt to the banks of the Yamuna with Partha.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca tāṃ tatra tapaścarantīṃ tadābruvaṃ matsakhāyaṃ ca pārtham // / / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca tām tatra tapaḥ carantīm tadā abruvam mad sakhāyam ca pārtham
translated: Seeing her there practicing austerities, I then spoke to my friend Partha (Arjuna).

original: he pārtha śīghraṃ vraja kanyāsamīpaṃ tvaṃ pṛccha kasmādatra tapaḥ karoṣi /
analyzed: he pārtha śīghram vraja kanyā samīpam tvam pṛccha kasmāt atra tapaḥ karoṣi
translated: O Partha, go quickly to the maiden and ask her, Why are you performing austerities here?

original: evaṃ proktastatsamīpaṃ sa gatvā pṛṣṭvā caitatkāraṇaṃ śīghrameva // / / //
analyzed: evam proktaḥ tad samīpam sa gatvā pṛṣṭvā ca etat kāraṇam śīghram eva
translated: Thus addressed, he went to her, asked her the reason, and quickly returned.

original: āgatya māmavadatphālgunoyaṃ sarvaṃ vṛttāṃntaṃ tvasau matsamīpe /
analyzed: āgatya mām avadat phālgunaḥ uyam sarvam vṛttāṃntam tu asau mad samīpe
translated: He told me, Phalguna (Arjuna) has told me everything that happened in his presence.

original: tatastvahaṃ sumuhūrte ca tasyāḥ pāṇigrahaṃ kṛtavāṃstatra samyak // / / //
analyzed: tatas tu aham su muhūrte ca tasyāḥ pāṇigraham kṛtavān tatra samyak
translated: Then I duly took her hand in marriage at an auspicious moment.

original: tasyāśca tāpātsaṃtataṃ madvicārātprasannohaṃ satataṃ suprasannaḥ /
analyzed: tasyāḥ ca tāpāt saṃtatam mad vicārāt prasannā aham satatam su prasannaḥ
translated: And because of her suffering and my constant consideration, I am always pleased and very happy.

original: pūrṇānande ramamāṇāsya nityaṃ tayā ca me kiṃ sukhaṃsyātkhagendra // / / //
analyzed: pūrṇānande ramamāṇā asya nityam tayā ca me kim sukham syāt khaga indra
translated: Always delighting in perfect bliss with her, what happiness can there be for me, O lord of birds?

original: mayā vivāhonugrahārthaṃ hi tasyā aṅgīkṛto na tu saukhyāya vīndra /
analyzed: mayā vivāhaḥ anugraha artham hi tasyāḥ aṅgīkṛtaḥ na tu saukhyāya
translated: O Vindra, the marriage was accepted by me for her favor, not for my happiness.

original: tathā vakṣye lakṣmaṇāyāśca rūpaṃ pāṇigrāhe kāraṇaṃ cāpi vīndrā // / / //
analyzed: tathā vakṣye lakṣmaṇāyāḥ ca rūpam pāṇigrāhe kāraṇam ca api vīndrā
translated: In the same way, I will describe Lakshmana's form and the reason for taking her hand in marriage, O lord of birds.

original: śṛṇuṣva tattava vakṣyāmi gopyaṃ sacchiṣyake nāsti gopyaṃ gurośca // / / //
analyzed: śṛṇuṣva tat tava vakṣyāmi gopyam sat śiṣyake na asti gopyam guroḥ ca
translated: Listen, I shall tell you that which is to be kept secret from the disciple of a good Guru. There is nothing to be kept secret from the Guru.

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttarakhaṇḍe tṛtīyāṃśe brahmakāṇḍe bhagavataḥ kālindyā vivāhe hetunirūpaṇaṃ nāmaikaviṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttara khaṇḍe tṛtīya aṃśe brahmakāṇḍe bhagavataḥ kālindyāḥ vivāhe hetunirūpaṇam nāma ekaviṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-first chapter in the Third Section in the Uttara-Khanda of the Srima-Garuda Purana, describing the marriage of Kaliya's daughter with Krishna.

original: śrīgaruḍamahāpurāṇam
analyzed: śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam
translated: Sri Garuda Mahapurana

original: śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /
analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Sri Krishna said:

original: yā lakṣmaṇā pūrvasarge khagendra putrī hyabhūdvahnivedasya vettuḥ /
analyzed: yā lakṣmaṇā pūrva sarge khaga indra putrī hi abhūt vahnivedasya vettuḥ
translated: O lord of birds, she who was Lakshmana in the previous creation, was the daughter of Agniveda, the knower of the Vedas.

original: sulakṣaṇaiḥ saṃyutatvādyataḥ sā sulakṣmaṇeti prathitā khagendra // / / //
analyzed: su lakṣaṇaiḥ saṃyuta tvāt yatas sā sulakṣmaṇā iti prathitā khaga indra
translated: Since she was endowed with good characteristics, she became famous as Sulakṣmaṇā, O lord of birds.

original: yathā lakṣmīrlakṣaṇaiḥ sā supūrṇā yathā harirlakṣaṇairvai supūrṇaḥ /
analyzed: yathā lakṣmīḥ lakṣaṇaiḥ sā su pūrṇā yathā hariḥ lakṣaṇaiḥ vai su pūrṇaḥ
translated: Just as Lakshmi is fully endowed with good characteristics, just as Hari is fully endowed with good characteristics,

original: yathā vāyurlakṣaṇaiḥ pūrṇa eva yathā gāyatrī lakṣaṇaiḥ sā supūrṇā // / / //
analyzed: yathā vāyuḥ lakṣaṇaiḥ pūrṇaḥ eva yathā gāyatrī lakṣaṇaiḥ sā su pūrṇā
translated: Just as Vayu is fully endowed with good characteristics, just as Gayatri is fully endowed with good characteristics,

original: yathā rudrādyā lakṣaṇairvai prapūrṇā rudrādillakṣmaṇā caiva pūrṇā /
analyzed: yathā rudra ādyā lakṣaṇaiḥ vai prapūrṇā ca eva pūrṇā
translated: Just as Rudra and others are fully endowed with good characteristics, and Rudra and others are fully endowed with the characteristics of Rudra,

original: guṇenaivaṃ dharmataḥ kiñcideva tathānusaṃdhānādvriyate nāma cāpi // / / //
analyzed: guṇena evam dharmataḥ kiñcid eva tathā anusaṃdhānāt vriyate nāma ca api
translated: By virtue of this, and by virtue of Dharma, the name is also chosen by the connection with that.

original: tasmā dāhurlakṣmaṇetyeva sarve tallakṣaṇaṃ śṛṇu cādau khagendra /
analyzed: tasmai dāhuḥ lakṣmaṇa iti eva sarve tad lakṣaṇam śṛṇu ca ādau khaga indra
translated: Therefore, all of them call him Lakshmana. O lord of birds, listen to that characteristic first.

original: nārāyaṇe pūrṇaguṇe rameśe dvātriṃśatsaṃkhyāni sulakṣaṇāni // / / //
analyzed: nārāyaṇe pūrṇa guṇe rameśe dvātriṃśat saṃkhyāni su lakṣaṇāni
translated: In Narayana, the complete-natured one, the lord of Ram, there are thirty-two excellent characteristics.

original: saṃtyeva pakṣīndra vadāmyanu kramānmattaḥ śrutvā mokṣamāpnoti nityam /
analyzed: saṃti eva pakṣi indra vadāmi anu kramāt mattaḥ śrutvā mokṣam āpnoti nityam
translated: O lord of birds, they exist. I will tell you in order. Having heard from me, one always attains liberation.

original: yaḥ saptapādaḥ ṣaṇṇavatyaṅguloṅgaścaturhastaḥ puruṣastīkṣṇadantaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ sapta pādaḥ ṣaṇṇavati aṅgula uṅgaḥ catur hastaḥ puruṣaḥ tīkṣṇa dantaḥ
translated: He who is seven cubits tall, ninety-six fingers long, four cubits tall, with sharp teeth,

original: ya etatsarvaṃ militaṃ caikameva harerviṣṇorlakṣaṇaṃ cāhurāryāḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ etat sarvam militam ca ekam eva hareḥ viṣṇoḥ lakṣaṇam ca āhuḥ āryāḥ
translated: The noble ones say that all of this combined is a single characteristic of Hari Vishnu.

original: mukhaṃ strigdhaṃ vartulaṃ puṣṭirūpaṃ dvitīyaṃ tallakṣaṇaṃ cāhurāryāḥ // / / //🔽hanuryasyānunnataṃ cāsti vīndra tallakṣaṇaṃ prāhurāryāstṛtīyam /
analyzed: mukham strigdham vartulam puṣṭi rūpam dvitīyam tad lakṣaṇam ca āhuḥ āryāḥ  hanuḥ yasya anunnatam ca asti vi indra tat lakṣaṇam prāhuḥ āryāḥ tṛtīyam
translated: The noble ones say that the second characteristic is a smooth, round, well-nourished face.🔽O lord of birds, the noble ones say that the third characteristic is that his jaw is not prominent.

original: yaddantā vai tīkṣṇasūkṣmāśca saṃti tallakṣaṇaṃ cāhurāryāścaturtham // / / //🔽yasyādhare raktimā tvasti vīndra tallakṣaṇaṃ pañcamaṃ cāhurāryāḥ /
analyzed: yat dantāḥ vai tīkṣṇa sūkṣmāḥ ca santi tad lakṣaṇam ca āhuḥ āryāḥ caturtham  yasya adhare raktimā tu asti vi indra tad lakṣaṇam pañcamam ca āhuḥ āryāḥ
translated: The noble ones say that the fourth characteristic is that his teeth are sharp and fine.🔽O lord of birds, the noble ones say that the fifth characteristic is that his lower lip has a reddish hue.

original: yasya hastā atiraktāḥ khagendra tallakṣaṇaṃ prāhurāryāśca paṣṭham // / / //
analyzed: yasya hastāḥ ati raktāḥ khaga indra tad lakṣaṇam prāhuḥ āryāḥ ca paṣṭham
translated: O lord of birds, the noble ones say that the sixth characteristic is that his hands are very red.

original: yasminnakhāḥ saṃti raktāḥ suśobhāstallakṣaṇaṃ saptamaṃ cāhurāryāḥ /
analyzed: yasmin nakhāḥ saṃti raktāḥ su śobhāḥ tad lakṣaṇam saptamam ca āhuḥ āryāḥ
translated: The noble ones say that the seventh mark is the beautiful red nails.

original: yasminkapole raktimā tvasti vīndra tallakṣaṇaṃ hyaṣṭamaṃ prāhurāryā // / / //
analyzed: yasmin kapole raktimā tu asti vi indra tad lakṣaṇam hi aṣṭamam prāhuḥ āryā
translated: O Indra among birds, the noble ones say that the eighth mark is the reddish hue on the cheeks.

original: yasminkare śaṅkhacakrādirekhā vartante tannavamaṃ prāhurāryāḥ /
analyzed: yasmin kare śaṅkha cakra ādi rekhāḥ vartante tat navamam prāhuḥ āryāḥ
translated: The noble ones say that the ninth mark is the lines of conch, discus, etc. on the hand.

original: yasyo daraṃ tanturūpaṃ supuṣṭaṃ valitrayairaṅkitaṃ suṃdaraṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: yasya u daram tantu rūpam su puṣṭam vali trayaiḥ aṅkitam suṃdaram ca
translated: The noble ones say that the tenth mark is the beautiful and well-nourished navel marked with three lines.

original: tallakṣaṇaṃ daśamaṃ prāhurāryā ekādaśaṃ nimnanābhiṃ tadāhuḥ /
analyzed: tad lakṣaṇam daśamam prāhuḥ āryāḥ ekādaśam nimnanābhim tat āhuḥ
translated: The eleventh mark is the deep navel, they say.

original: ūrudvayaṃ yasya ca māṃsalaṃ vai tallakṣaṇaṃ dvādaśaṃ prāhurāryāḥ // / / //
analyzed: ūru dvayam yasya ca māṃsalam vai tad lakṣaṇam dvādaśam prāhuḥ āryāḥ
translated: The noble ones say that the twelfth mark is the fleshy pair of thighs.

original: kaṭirhi dīrghā pṛthulāsti yasya trayodaśaṃ lakṣma tadāhurāryāḥ /
analyzed: kaṭiḥ hi dīrghā pṛthulā asti yasya trayodaśam lakṣma tat āhuḥ āryāḥ
translated: The noble ones say that the thirteenth mark is the long and broad waist.

original: yasyāsti muṣko supariṣṭhito vai caturdaśaṃ lakṣma tadāhurāryāḥ // / / //
analyzed: yasya asti muṣkaḥ supariṣṭhitaḥ vai caturdaśam lakṣma tat āhuḥ āryāḥ
translated: The noble ones say that the fourteenth mark is the well-developed testicles.

original: samunnataṃ śiśramatho hi lakṣma yasyāsti tat pañcadaśaṃ vadanti /
analyzed: samunnatam śiśramathaḥ hi lakṣma yasya asti tat pañcadaśam vadanti
translated: They say that the fifteenth mark is the elevated penis.

original: sutāmrakaṃ pādatalaṃ khagendra tallakṣaṇaṃ ṣoḍaśaṃ prāhurāryāḥ // / / //
analyzed: su tāmrakam pāda talam khaga indra tad lakṣaṇam ṣoḍaśam prāhuḥ āryāḥ
translated: O lord of birds, the noble ones say that the sixteenth mark is the copper-colored soles of the feet.

original: nimnau ca gulphau saptadaśaṃ tadāhurgrī vārūpaṃ prāhuraṣṭādaśaṃ ca /🔽ekonaviṃśaṃ tvakṣipadmaṃ suraktaṃ prāhurbāhuṃ jānu viṃśaṃ tathaiva // / / //
analyzed: nimnau ca gulphau saptadaśam tat āhuḥ grī vārūpam prāhuḥ aṣṭādaśam ca  ekonaviṃśam tu akṣi padmam su raktam prāhuḥ bāhum jānu viṃśam tathā eva
translated: The two ankles are the seventeenth. They say the neck is the eighteenth.🔽The very red lotus of the eye is the nineteenth. They say the arm and the knee are the twentieth.

original: vistīrṇoraścaikaviṃśaṃ tadāhuḥ siṃhāskandhaṃ dvyuttaraṃ viṃśamāhuḥ /
analyzed: vistīrṇa uraḥ ca ekaviṃśam tat āhuḥ siṃhā skandham dvi uttaram viṃśam āhuḥ
translated: The broad chest is the twenty-first. They say the shoulders like a lion are the twenty-second.

original: trayoviṃśaṃ sūkṣmamāsyaṃ tadāhuścaturviśaṃ suprasanne ca dṛṣṭī // / / //
analyzed: trayoviṃśam sūkṣmam āsyam tat āhuḥ caturviśam su prasanne ca dṛṣṭī
translated: The fine face is the twenty-third. They say the very pleased eyes are the twenty-fourth.

original: hrasvaṃ liṅgaṃ mārdavaṃ cāpi vīndra tallakṣaṇaṃ pañcaviṃśaṃ vadanti /
analyzed: hrasvam liṅgam mārdavam ca api vi indra tad lakṣaṇam pañcaviṃśam vadanti
translated: The short penis and the softness, O Indra, they say are the twenty-fifth characteristic.

original: samau ca pādau kaṭijānu corū ṣaḍviṃśamāhuśca same ca jaṅghe // / / //
analyzed: samau ca pādau kaṭi jānu ca ūrū ṣaḍviṃśam āhuḥ ca same ca jaṅghe
translated: The two feet, waist, knees and thighs are the twenty-sixth. They say the shanks are even.

original: samānahastau samakarṇau militvā dvātriṃśatkaṃ lakṣaṇaṃ prāhurāryāḥ /
analyzed: samāna hastau sama karṇau militvā dvātriṃśatkam lakṣaṇam prāhuḥ āryāḥ
translated: The two hands and the two ears, adding up to thirty-two, the noble ones say are the characteristics.

original: dvātriṃśatkaṃ lakṣaṇaṃ vai mukunde dvātriṃśatkaṃ lakṣaṇaṃ vai ramāyām // / / //
analyzed: dvātriṃśatkam lakṣaṇam vai mukunde dvātriṃśatkam lakṣaṇam vai ramāyām
translated: The thirty-two characteristics are in Mukunda. The thirty-two characteristics are in Ramā.

original: dvātriṃśatkaṃ lakṣaṇaṃ brahmaṇopi tadbhāratyāḥ pravadantyeva satyam /
analyzed: dvātriṃśatkam lakṣaṇam tat bhāratyāḥ pravadanti eva satyam
translated: The thirty-two characteristics are in Brahmā. They truly say the same about Sarasvatī.

original: tathā ca śaṅkā samameva cakriṇetyevaṃ sadāmā kuru nirṇayaṃ bruve // / / //
analyzed: tathā ca śaṅkā samam eva cakriṇā iti evam sadā amā kuru nirṇayam bruve
translated: And thus, always make the determination that the doubt is equal to the discus-holder, I speak thus.

original: ekasya vai lakṣaṇasyāpi viṣṇorlakṣmīrantaṃ naiva samyak prapede /
analyzed: ekasya vai lakṣaṇasya api viṣṇoḥ lakṣmīḥ antam nā eva samyak prapede
translated: Lakshmi could not fully reach the end of even one characteristic of Vishnu.

original: atonantairlakṣaṇaiḥ saṃyutaṃ ca hariṃ cāhurlakṣaṇajñāḥ sadaiva // / / //
analyzed: atas anantaiḥ lakṣaṇaiḥ saṃyutam ca harim ca āhuḥ lakṣaṇa jñāḥ sadā eva
translated: Therefore, those who know the characteristics always call Hari, who is endowed with infinite characteristics.

original: jānāti lakṣmīrlakṣaṇaṃ vāyurūpe svāpekṣayā hyatiriktaṃ khagendra /
analyzed: jānāti lakṣmīḥ lakṣaṇam vāyu rūpe sva apekṣayā hi atiriktam khaga indra
translated: Lakshmi knows the characteristic in the form of Vayu, which is superior from her own perspective, O best of birds.

original: svalakṣaṇāpekṣayā bhāratī tu śatairguṇairadhikā vedhasopi // / / //
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa apekṣayā bhāratī tu śataiḥ guṇaiḥ adhikā
translated: But Bharati, in relation to her own characteristics, is superior to even the creator by hundreds of qualities.

original: khagendra tasmāllakṣaṇe sāmyacittaṃ viśvādīnāṃ sarvadā mā kuruṣva /
analyzed: khaga indra tasmāt lakṣaṇe sāmya cittam viśva ādīnām sarvadā mā kuruṣva
translated: Therefore, O best of birds, always do not have an equal mind towards the characteristics of Vishnu, etc.

original: aṣṭāviṃśatiṃ prāhū rudrādikānāṃ bhrūnetrayorlakṣaṇenaiva hīnāḥ // / / //
analyzed: aṣṭāviṃśatim prāhuḥ rudra ādikānām bhrū netrayoḥ lakṣaṇena eva hīnāḥ
translated: They say that Rudra and others have twenty-eight characteristics, which are inferior to the characteristics of the eyebrows and eyes.

original: alakṣaṇaṃ manyate yaddhi tasya durlakṣaṇaṃ naiva taccintanīyam /
analyzed: alakṣaṇam manyate yat hi tasya durlakṣaṇam na eva tat cintanīyam
translated: What he considers to be without characteristics should not be thought of as a bad characteristic.

original: aṣṭāviṃśatiṃ lakṣaṇaṃ vai harasya na bhāratīvaccintanīyaṃ khagendra // / / //
analyzed: aṣṭāviṃśatim lakṣaṇam vai harasya na bhāratī vat cintanīyam khaga indra
translated: The twenty-eight characteristics of Hari should not be thought of like Bharati, O best of birds.

original: ato haraḥ krodharūpī sadaiva tayorabhāvātsatyamuktaṃ tathaitat /
analyzed: atas haraḥ krodha rūpī sadā eva tayoḥ abhāvāt satyam uktam tathā etat
translated: Therefore, Hari is always in the form of anger, and due to the absence of those two, this is said to be true.

original: ato dvayaṃ nāsti rudre khagendra śiśrodare kiñcidādhikyamasti // / / //
analyzed: atas dvayam nā asti rudre khaga indra śiśrodare kiñcid ādhikyam asti
translated: Therefore, O lord of birds, there is no duality in Rudra. There is only a slight excess in the head and belly.

original: saptādhikairviśatilakṣaṇaistu samāyutāḥ svastriyo lakṣmaṇādyāḥ /
analyzed: sapta adhikaiḥ viśati lakṣaṇaiḥ tu samāyutāḥ sva striyaḥ lakṣmaṇa ādyāḥ
translated: Lakshmana and others have their own wives endowed with twenty characteristics with seven more.

original: ṣaḍvaviṃśatyā lakṣaṇaiścāpi yuktā vāruṇyādyā pañcaviṃśaiśca candraḥ // / / //
analyzed: ṣaṣ vaviṃśatyā lakṣaṇaiḥ ca api yuktā vāruṇī ādyā pañcaviṃśaiḥ ca candraḥ
translated: Varuni and others are endowed with twenty-six characteristics, Chandra with twenty-five.

original: arthaścaturviṃśatibhiścaiva yukto nāsāvāyordvyadhikā viṃśatiśca lakṣaṇaiścaikaviṃśatyā śacī yuktā na saṃśayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: arthaḥ caturviṃśatibhiḥ ca eva yuktaḥ na asau āyoḥ dvi adhikā viṃśatiḥ ca lakṣaṇaiḥ ca ekaviṃśatyā śacī yuktā na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Artha is endowed with twenty-four, Vayu with twenty-two more, Shachi is undoubtedly endowed with twenty-one characteristics.

original: pravāhā viṃśakairyuktā yama ekonaviṃśakaiḥ /
analyzed: pravāhāḥ viṃśakaiḥ yuktāḥ yamaḥ ekonaviṃśakaiḥ
translated: Pravaha is endowed with twenty, Yama with nineteen,

original: pāśyaṣṭādaśabhiryukto daśasaptayuto 'nalaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pāśī aṣṭādaśabhiḥ yuktaḥ daśa sapta yutaḥ nalaḥ
translated: Pasha is endowed with eighteen, Anala with seventeen.

original: vaivasvataḥ ṣoḍaśabhimitraḥ pañcadaśairyutaḥ /
analyzed: vaivasvataḥ ṣoḍaśa abhimitraḥ pañcadaśaiḥ yutaḥ
translated: Vaivasvata is endowed with sixteen, Mitra with fifteen,

original: catrurviṃśaistu dhanapaḥ pāvakastu trayodaśaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: catrurviṃśaiḥ tu dhanapaḥ pāvakaḥ tu trayodaśaiḥ
translated: Dhanapati with fourteen, Pavaka with thirteen.

original: gaṅgā dvādaśabhiryuktā budha ekādaśairyutaḥ /
analyzed: gaṅgā dvādaśabhiḥ yuktā budhaḥ ekādaśaiḥ yutaḥ
translated: Ganga is endowed with twelve, Budha with eleven,

original: śanistu daśasaṃkhyākaiḥ puṣkaro navabhiryutaḥ // / / //🔽atha ṣoḍaśasāhasraṃ bhāryāratu mama vallabhāḥ /
analyzed: śaniḥ tu daśa saṃkhyākaiḥ puṣkaraḥ navabhiḥ yutaḥ 🔽atha ṣoḍaśa sāhasram mama vallabhāḥ
translated: Shani with ten, Pushkara with nine.

original: aṣṭabhiścaiva saṃyuktāḥ saptabhiḥ pitarastathā // / / //
analyzed: aṣṭabhiḥ ca eva saṃyuktāḥ saptabhiḥ pitaraḥ tathā
translated: And those connected with eight, the ancestors with seven,

original: ṣaḍbhiśca devagandharvāḥ pañcabhistadanantarāḥ /
analyzed: ṣaḍbhiḥ ca devagandharvāḥ pañcabhiḥ tad anantarāḥ
translated: And the gods and gandharvas with six, and those after them with five,

original: caturbhaiḥ kṣitipāḥ proktāstribhiranye ca saṃyutāḥ // / / //
analyzed: caturbhaiḥ kṣitipāḥ proktāḥ tribhiḥ anye ca saṃyutāḥ
translated: And the kings are said to be connected with four, and others with three.

original: udare kiñcidādhikye hrasve pāde ca karṇayoḥ /
analyzed: udare kiñcid ādhikye hrasve pāde ca karṇayoḥ
translated: If there is some excess in the belly, shortness in the feet and ears,

original: śikhādhikyaṃ vinā vipra bhāryāyāṃ ca śivasya ca // / / //
analyzed: śikhā ādhikyam vinā vipra bhāryāyām ca śivasya ca
translated: Except for the excess in the tuft, in the wife and in Shiva,

original: lakṣmaṇāyāṃ pañca doṣāḥ śirogulphādikaṃ vinā /
analyzed: lakṣmaṇāyām pañca doṣāḥ śiraḥ gulpha ādikam vinā
translated: In Lakshmana, there are five faults, except for the head, ankle, etc.

original: nābhyādhikye sahaivāṣṭau doṣāḥ saṃtyativāhike // / / //
analyzed: na abhi ādhikye saha eva aṣṭau doṣāḥ saṃti ativāhike
translated: If there is excess in the navel, then there are eight faults together in the atmavahini,

original: jaṅghādhikye sahaivāṣṭau doṣāḥ śacyāḥ sadā smṛtāḥ /
analyzed: jaṅghā ādhikye saha eva aṣṭau doṣāḥ śacyāḥ sadā smṛtāḥ
translated: If there is excess in the shanks, then eight faults are always remembered to be together in Shachi.

original: evameva hi doṣāścāpyūhanīyāḥ khageśvara // / / //
analyzed: evam eva hi doṣāḥ ca api ūhanīyāḥ khageśvara
translated: In the same way, the faults should be combined, O lord of birds.

original: durlakṣaṇaiḥ sadā vīndra saṃśrutaistattvavidbhavet /
analyzed: durlakṣaṇaiḥ sadā vīndra saṃśrutaiḥ tattva vid bhavet
translated: One who knows the truth should always be known by these faults, O lord of birds.

original: mahodaro laṃbanābhirīṣāmātrogradaṃṣṭrakaḥ // / / //🔽andhakūpagabhīrākṣo laṃbakarṇauṣṭhanāsikaḥ /🔽laṃbagulpho vakrapādaḥ kunakhī śyāvadantakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: andhakūpa gabhīra akṣaḥ laṃba karṇa oṣṭha nāsikaḥ
translated: One with a large belly, a long navel, teeth as hard as a plowshare,🔽Eyes as deep as a dark well, long ears, lips and nose,🔽Long ankles, crooked feet, bad nails, dark teeth,

original: dīrghajaṅgho dīrghaśiśrastvekāṇḍaścaikanāsikaḥ /
analyzed: dīrgha jaṅghaḥ eka aṇḍaḥ ca eka nāsikaḥ
translated: Long shanks, a long tuft, and one with a single horn and a single nose,

original: raktaśmaśrū raktaromā vakrāsyaḥ saṃprakīrtitaḥ // / / //🔽dagdhaparva tasaṃkāśo raktapṛṣṭhaḥ kaliḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: rakta śmaśrūḥ rakta romā vakra āsyaḥ saṃprakīrtitaḥ  rakta pṛṣṭhaḥ kaliḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Red beard, red hair, and a crooked face are declared.🔽Resembling a burnt mountain peak, with a red back, Kali is remembered.

original: alomāṃso 'lomaśirā raktagaṇḍakapolakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: a loma aṃsaḥ loma śirāḥ rakta gaṇḍa kapolakaḥ
translated: Without hair on the shoulders, without hair on the head, with red cheeks and temples.

original: lalāṭe pāṇḍutā nityaṃ vāmaskandhe kare khaga /
analyzed: lalāṭe pāṇḍu tā nityam vāma skandhe kare khaga
translated: Always pale on the forehead, on the left shoulder, and on the hand, O bird.

original: krūradṛṣṭirdṛṣṭipādastathā vai ghargharasvaraḥ // / / //🔽atyāśī cātipānaśca stanau śuṣkaphalopamau /
analyzed: krūra dṛṣṭiḥ dṛṣṭi pādaḥ tathā vai gharghara svaraḥ  atyāśī ca atipānaḥ ca stanau śuṣka phala upamau
translated: Cruel glance, with a foot of sight, and also with a gurgling sound.🔽Excessive eater and excessive drinker, the breasts resembling dry fruits.

original: ūrau navāñjikāromaḥ tathā pṛṣṭhe ca mastake // / / //
analyzed: ūrau navāñjikāromaḥ tathā pṛṣṭhe ca mastake
translated: On the thigh, new unctuous hair, and likewise on the back and on the head.

original: lalāṭe trīṇi dīrghe tu same dvau saṃprakīrtitau /🔽sarpākārastu yo matsyastasya śiśre prakīrtitaḥ // / / //🔽pādatrāṇopamo matsyo rasanāgre prakīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: lalāṭe trīṇi dīrghe tu same dvau saṃprakīrtitau  sarpa ākāraḥ tu yaḥ matsyaḥ tasya śiśre prakīrtitaḥ  pāda trāṇa upamaḥ matsyaḥ rasanā agre prakīrtitaḥ
translated: On the forehead, three are long, and two are declared to be even.🔽The fish that is shaped like a snake is declared to be on its head.🔽The fish resembling a foot covering is declared to be at the tip of the tongue.

original: śiśrākāraśca yo matsyo gude tasya praśasyate // / / //🔽vṛścikākāramatsyastu padostasya praśasyate /
analyzed: śiśrākāraḥ ca yaḥ matsyaḥ gude tasya praśasyate  vṛścika ākāra matsyaḥ tu padoḥ tasya praśasyate
translated: The fish that is shaped like a boil is praised to be on its anus.🔽The fish that is shaped like a scorpion is praised to be on its feet.

original: śvākāraścāpi matsyo vai mukhe tasya prakīrtitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śva ākāraḥ ca api matsyaḥ vai mukhe tasya prakīrtitaḥ
translated: The fish that is shaped like a dog is declared to be on its face.

original: haste tu bahurekhāḥ syurloma nāsāpuṭe smṛtam /
analyzed: haste tu bahu rekhāḥ syuḥ loma nāsāpuṭe smṛtam
translated: There should be many lines on the hand, and hair is remembered in the nostrils.

original: atidīrghaṃ tu cāṅguṣṭhaṃ kaniṣṭhaṃ cātidīrghakam // / / //
analyzed: ati dīrgham tu ca aṅguṣṭham kaniṣṭham ca ati dīrghakam
translated: The thumb is too long, and the little finger is also too long.

original: durlakṣaṇaṃ tve vamādi kalāvasti hyanekaśaḥ /
analyzed: durlakṣaṇam tve vama ādi kalau asti hi anekaśas
translated: There are indeed many bad characteristics in the Kali age, starting with the lowest.

original: sulakṣaṇānyanekāni mayi saṃti khageśvara // / / //
analyzed: su lakṣaṇāni anekāni mayi saṃti khageśvara
translated: O Lord of birds, there are many good characteristics in me.

original: dvātriṃśallakṣaṇaṃ viṣṇorbrahmādyāpekṣayaiva tat /
analyzed: dvātriṃśat lakṣaṇam viṣṇoḥ brahma ādya apekṣayā eva tat
translated: The thirty-two characteristics of Vishnu are indeed in relation to Brahma and others.

original: sahābhiprāya garbheṇa brahmaṇoktaṃ tava prabho // / / //
analyzed: saha abhiprāya garbheṇa brahmaṇā uktam tava prabho
translated: O Lord, they were spoken by Brahma to you along with the intended meaning.

original: brahmoktasya mayoktasya virodho nāsti sattama /
analyzed: brahma uktasya mayā uktasya virodhaḥ nā asti sattama
translated: O best one, there is no contradiction between what was spoken by Brahma and what was spoken by me.

original: mayoktasyaiva sa vyāsaḥ kaṃbugrīvaḥ pradarśyate // / / //
analyzed: mayā uktasya eva sa vyāsaḥ kaṃbugrīvaḥ pradarśyate
translated: That Vyasa, who is described as having a conch-like neck, is indeed spoken by me.

original: raktādharaṃ rakta tālu caikīkṛtya mayoditam /
analyzed: rakta adharam tālu ca ekīkṛtya mayā uditam
translated: The red lips and the red palate are combined and spoken by me.

original: ato virodho nāstyeva tathā jñānātpratīyate // / / //
analyzed: atas virodhaḥ na asti eva tathā jñānāt pratīyate
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction, and it is understood thus from knowledge.

original: saptādhikairviṃśatilakṣaṇaistu samāyutā yāḥ striyo lakṣmaṇādyāḥ // / / //
analyzed: sapta adhikaiḥ viṃśati lakṣaṇaiḥ tu samāyutāḥ yāḥ striyaḥ lakṣmaṇa ādyāḥ
translated: The women Lakshmana and others who are endowed with twenty characteristics with seven more,

original: bhage netre ca haste ca stane kukṣau tathaiva ca /
analyzed: bhage netre ca haste ca stane kukṣau tathā eva ca
translated: In the vagina, eyes, hands, breasts, and belly,

original: bhāratyapekṣayā pañcabhirnyūnā tvasti lakṣaṇaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhāratī apekṣayā pañcabhiḥ nyūnā tu asti lakṣaṇaiḥ
translated: They are five characteristics less in relation to Bharati.

original: na rudravanna cānyāni lakṣaṇāni khageśvara /
analyzed: na rudra vat na ca anyāni lakṣaṇāni khageśvara
translated: O Lord of birds, the characteristics are not like those of Rudra or others.

original: ṣaḍviṃśatyā lakṣaṇaiścāpi yuktā vāruṇyāḥ ṣaḍlakṣaṇaiścaiva hīnā // / / //
analyzed: ṣaḍviṃśatyā lakṣaṇaiḥ ca api yuktā vāruṇyāḥ ṣaṣ lakṣaṇaiḥ ca eva hīnā
translated: And endowed with twenty-six characteristics, inferior to Varuṇa's by six characteristics.

original: karṇe kukṣau nāsikākeśapāśe gulphe bhage kiñcidādhikyamasti /
analyzed: karṇe kukṣau nāsikā keśapāśe gulphe bhage kiñcid ādhikyam asti
translated: In the ear, belly, nose, hair lock, ankle, and vagina, there is a slight excess.

original: indro yuktaḥ pañcaviṃśatyā khagendra sadā hīno lakṣaṇaiḥ saptasaṃkhyaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: indraḥ yuktaḥ pañcaviṃśatyā khaga indra sadā hīnaḥ lakṣaṇaiḥ sapta saṃkhyaiḥ
translated: Indra is endowed with twenty-five, O lord of birds, always inferior by seven characteristics.

original: haste pāde udare karṇayośca śiśre gulphe tvadharoṣṭhedhikaṃ ca /
analyzed: haste pāde udare karṇayoḥ ca gulphe tu adhara uṣṭha idhikam ca
translated: In the hand, foot, belly, ears, head, ankle, and lower lip, there is an excess.

original: caturviṃśatyā lakṣaṇaiścāpi yukto nāstikyavāyustadvadevāṣṭabhiśca // / / //
analyzed: caturviṃśatyā lakṣaṇaiḥ ca api yuktaḥ nāstikya vāyuḥ tadvat eva aṣṭabhiḥ ca
translated: And endowed with twenty-four characteristics, the non-believing wind is the same, and by eight.

original: nābhyāṃ gulphe hanurarṅghyośca skandhe dvije netre tvadharoṣṭhedhikaṃ ca /
analyzed: nābhyām gulphe hanuḥ arṅghyoḥ ca skandhe dvije netre tu adhara uṣṭha idhikam ca
translated: In the navel, ankle, jaw, knee, shoulder, forehead, eye, and lower lip, there is an excess.

original: trayoviṃśatyā lakṣaṇaiścāpi yuktā śacī tathā navadoṣaiśca yuktā // / / //
analyzed: trayoviṃśatyā lakṣaṇaiḥ ca api yuktā śacī tathā nava doṣaiḥ ca yuktā
translated: And endowed with twenty-three characteristics, Shachi is the same, and endowed with nine faults.

original: bhage keśe hyadharoṣṭhe ca karṇe jaṅghe gaṇḍe vakṣasi gulphayośca /
analyzed: bhage keśe hi adhara uṣṭhe ca karṇe jaṅghe gaṇḍe vakṣasi gulphayoḥ ca
translated: In the vagina, hair, lower lip, ear, calf, cheek, chest, and ankle,

original: tathottaroṣṭhe kiñcidādhikyamasti evaṃ vijānīhi khagendrasattama // / / //
analyzed: tathā uttara uṣṭhe kiñcid ādhikyam asti evam vijānīhi khaga indra sattama
translated: and in the upper lip, there is a slight excess. Know it thus, O best of lords of birds.

original: dvāviṃśatyā lakṣaṇaiḥ saṃyutastu daśabhirdeṣaiḥ pravaho nāma vāyuḥ /
analyzed: dvāviṃśatyā lakṣaṇaiḥ saṃyutaḥ tu daśabhiḥ deṣaiḥ pravahaḥ nāma vāyuḥ
translated: Endowed with twenty-two characteristics, the wind named Pravaha is by ten faults.

original: tathāṅguṣṭhe kiñcidādhikyamasti viṃśatyekādaśabhirdeṣatorkaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tathā aṅguṣṭhe kiñcid ādhikyam asti viṃśati ekādaśabhiḥ
translated: Similarly, there is a slight excess in the thumb, the sun is twenty-one fingers wide.

original: tadviṃśatyā lakṣaṇaiḥ saṃyutastu tadā doṣerdvādaśabhiśca yuktaḥ /
analyzed: tad viṃśatyā lakṣaṇaiḥ saṃyutaḥ tu tadā doṣeḥ dvādaśabhiḥ ca yuktaḥ
translated: Endowed with twenty such characteristics, he is then endowed with twelve faults.

original: ekonaviṃśatyā lakṣaṇaiścāpi yuktastrayodaśabhistadabhāvairyutogniḥ // / / //
analyzed: ekonaviṃśatyā lakṣaṇaiḥ ca api yuktaḥ trayodaśabhiḥ tad abhāvaiḥ yutaḥ agniḥ
translated: Endowed with nineteen characteristics, and also endowed with thirteen faults, Agni is so.

original: aṣṭādaśabhirlakṣaṇaiḥ saṃyutastu vaivasvatastadabhāvaiścaturdaśabhiḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭādaśabhiḥ lakṣaṇaiḥ saṃyutaḥ tu vaivasvataḥ tad abhāvaiḥ caturdaśabhiḥ
translated: Endowed with eighteen characteristics, Vaivasvata is so, and with fourteen faults.

original: mitrastu saptadaśabhirlakṣaṇaiḥ saṃyutaḥ khaga // / / //
analyzed: mitraḥ tu saptadaśabhiḥ lakṣaṇaiḥ saṃyutaḥ khaga
translated: O bird, Mitra is endowed with seventeen characteristics.

original: sadoṣaiḥ pañcadaśabhiḥ saṃyukto nātra saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: sa doṣaiḥ pañcadaśabhiḥ saṃyuktaḥ na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: He is undoubtedly endowed with fifteen faults.

original: taiśca ṣoḍaśabhiryukto dhanapo nātra saṃśayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: taiḥ ca ṣoḍaśabhiḥ yuktaḥ dhanapaḥ na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: He is undoubtedly endowed with sixteen, Dhanapati.

original: tadabhāvaiḥ ṣoḍaśabhiḥ saṃyuktaḥ saṃprakīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: tad abhāvaiḥ ṣoḍaśabhiḥ saṃyuktaḥ saṃprakīrtitaḥ
translated: He is declared to be endowed with sixteen faults.

original: taiḥ pañcadaśabhiścaiva yuktogrejyaṣṭhaputrakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: taiḥ pañcadaśabhiḥ ca eva yukta ugrā jyaṣṭha putrakaḥ
translated: The eldest son is endowed with fifteen such.

original: taiḥ saptadaśabhirdeṣaiḥ saṃyukto nātra saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: taiḥ saptadaśabhiḥ deṣaiḥ saṃyuktaḥ na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: He is undoubtedly endowed with seventeen faults.

original: taiścaturdaśabhiścaiva gaṅgā saṃparikīrtitā // / / //
analyzed: taiḥ caturdaśabhiḥ ca eva gaṅgā saṃparikīrtitā
translated: Ganga is declared to be endowed with fourteen such.

original: tathāṣṭādaśabhirdeṣaiḥ saṃyutā nātra saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: tathā aṣṭādaśabhiḥ deṣaiḥ saṃyutā na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: Similarly, she is undoubtedly endowed with eighteen faults.

original: taistrayodaśabhiścaiva saṃyuto budha eva tu // / / //🔽doṣairekonaviṃśatyā saṃyuto nātra saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: taiḥ trayodaśabhiḥ ca eva saṃyutaḥ budhaḥ eva tu  doṣaiḥ ekonaviṃśatyā saṃyutaḥ na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: And with those thirteen, Mercury is indeed endowed.🔽There is no doubt that Saturn is endowed with nineteen faults.

original: śanirviṃśatidoṣeṇa yuto dvādaśalakṣaṇaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: śaniḥ viṃśati doṣeṇa yutaḥ dvādaśa lakṣaṇaiḥ
translated: Saturn is endowed with twenty faults and twelve characteristics.

original: lakṣaṇaiścaikādaśabhiḥ puṣkaraḥ parikīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: lakṣaṇaiḥ ca ekādaśabhiḥ puṣkaraḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translated: Pushkara is declared to be endowed with eleven characteristics.

original: ekaviṃśatisaṃkhyākairasadbhāvaiḥ prakīrtitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ekaviṃśati saṃkhyākaiḥ asadbhāvaiḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: It is declared that Ketu is endowed with twenty-one inauspicious qualities.

original: daśabhirlakṣaṇairyuktāḥ pitaro ye cirāḥ khaga /
analyzed: daśabhiḥ lakṣaṇaiḥ yuktāḥ pitaraḥ ye cirāḥ khaga
translated: O bird, the ancestors who are endowed with ten characteristics are long-lived.

original: trayoviṃśatidoṣaiśca saṃyutā nātra saṃśayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: trayoviṃśati doṣaiḥ ca saṃyutā na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: There is no doubt that they are endowed with twenty-three faults.

original: aṣṭabhirlakṣaṇairyuktā devagandharvasattamāḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭabhiḥ lakṣaṇaiḥ yuktāḥ deva gandharva sattamāḥ
translated: The best gods and gandharvas are endowed with eight characteristics.

original: doṣaiścaturviṃśatibhiḥ saṃyuktāḥ parikīrtitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: doṣaiḥ caturviṃśatibhiḥ saṃyuktāḥ parikīrtitāḥ
translated: They are declared to be endowed with twenty-four faults.

original: saptalakṣaṇasaṃyuktā gandharvā mānuṣātamakāḥ /
analyzed: sapta lakṣaṇa saṃyuktāḥ gandharvāḥ mānuṣātamakāḥ
translated: The gandharvas who are the worst among humans are endowed with seven characteristics.

original: yaistu pañcaviṃśatibhirdeṣaiḥ saṃyuktāḥ prakīrtitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: yaiḥ tu pañcaviṃśatibhiḥ deṣaiḥ saṃyuktāḥ prakīrtitāḥ
translated: They are declared to be endowed with twenty-five faults.

original: ṣadguṇaiḥ kṣitipā yuktā ṣaḍviṃśatyā ca doṣataḥ /
analyzed: ṣadguṇaiḥ kṣitipā yuktā ṣaḍviṃśatyā ca doṣataḥ
translated: The kings are endowed with six qualities and twenty-six faults.

original: tadanye pañcabhiryuktāścaturbhiḥ kecideva ca // / / //
analyzed: tad anye pañcabhiḥ yuktāḥ caturbhiḥ kecid eva ca
translated: Some are endowed with five, and some with four.

original: tribhiḥ keccittato hīnā na saṃti khagasattama /
analyzed: tribhiḥ keccid tatas hīnāḥ na saṃti khaga sattama
translated: O best of birds, there are none who are inferior to those with three.

original: yasminnare kṣitipe vā khagendra ādhikyaṃ yaddṛśyate lakṣaṇasya // / / //
analyzed: yasmin nare kṣitipe vā khaga indre ādhikyam yat dṛśyate lakṣaṇasya
translated: In whom, O king, or in whom, O bird, the excess of the characteristics is seen,

original: na te narā naiva te vai kṣitīśāḥ sarve naiva hyuttamāḥ sarvadaiva /
analyzed: na te narāḥ na eva te vai kṣitīśāḥ sarve na eva hi uttamāḥ sarvadā eva
translated: They are not men, nor are they kings, all are not always the best,

original: ye devā ye ca daityāśca sarvepyevaṃ khagādhipa // / / //
analyzed: ye devāḥ ye ca daityāḥ ca sarve api evam khaga adhipa
translated: Those who are gods and those who are demons, all are thus, O lord of birds.

original: lakṣaṇālakṣaṇaiścaiva krameṇoktā na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: lakṣaṇa alakṣaṇaiḥ ca eva krameṇa uktāḥ na saṃśayaḥ
translated: And by the characteristics and the lack of characteristics, they are said to be in order, there is no doubt.

original: lakṣaṇaiḥ saptaviṃśatyālakṣaṇaiḥ saṃyutāḥ khaga // / / //
analyzed: lakṣaṇaiḥ saptaviṃśatyā alakṣaṇaiḥ saṃyutāḥ khaga
translated: O bird, they are endowed with twenty-seven characteristics and the lack of characteristics.

original: ataḥ salakṣaṇā jñeyā dvātriṃśallakṣaṇairna hi /
analyzed: atas salakṣaṇā jñeyā dvātriṃśat lakṣaṇaiḥ na hi
translated: Therefore, they should be known as having characteristics, not by thirty-two characteristics.

original: piturgṛhe vardhamānā sadāpi svakuṭuṃbaṃ śreṣṭhayituṃ khagendra // / / //
analyzed: pituḥ gṛhe vardhamānā sadā api sva kuṭuṃbam śreṣṭhayitum khaga indra
translated: Growing in the father's house, always wishing to honor one's own family, O lord of birds.

original: uvāca sā pitaraṃ dīyamānamannādikaṃ tramitrādikeṣu /
analyzed: uvāca sā pitaram dīyamānam annādikam
translated: She said to her father, The food and other things being given to friends and others,

original: sadāpi ye tvanusaṃdhānena yuktā antargate tatratatra sthite ca // / / //
analyzed: sadā api ye tu anusaṃdhānena yuktāḥ antargate tatra tatra sthite ca
translated: Those who are always connected by association, who are internally present there and there,

original: ajñātatve cānnapānādikaṃ ca dattaṃ saṃto vyarthamevaṃ vadanti /
analyzed: ajñāta tve ca anna pāna ādikam ca dattam saṃtaḥ vyartham evam vadanti
translated: And when it is unknown, the given food, drink and other things, the virtuous say thus in vain.

original: hariṃ vakṣye tatratatra sthitaṃ caṃ taṃ vai śṛṇu tvādareṇādya nityam // / / //
analyzed: harim vakṣye tatra tatra sthitam caṃ tam vai śṛṇu tvā ādareṇa adya nityam
translated: I will tell about Hari who is present there and there, listen to him with respect today, always.

original: bālo harirbālarūpeṇa kṛṣṇaḥ kṣīrādikaṃ navanītaṃ ghṛtaṃ ca /
analyzed: bālaḥ hariḥ bāla rūpeṇa kṛṣṇaḥ kṣīra ādikam navanītam ghṛtam ca
translated: The child Hari, in the form of a child, Krishna, always takes milk, curd, butter, ghee,

original: gṛhṇāti nityaṃ bhūṣaṇaṃ vastrajātamevaṃ dadyātsarvadā viṣṇutuṣṭyai // / / //
analyzed: gṛhṇāti nityam bhūṣaṇam vastra jātam evam dadyāt sarvadā viṣṇu tuṣṭyai
translated: ornaments and clothes. Thus, one should always offer these for the satisfaction of Vishnu.

original: mitrairhariḥ keśavākhyo mukundo bhuṅkte dattaṃ tvannaprānādikaṃ ca /
analyzed: mitraiḥ hariḥ keśava ākhyaḥ mukundaḥ bhuṅkte dattam tu anna prāna ādikam ca
translated: Hari, called Keshava, Mukunda, eats the food, breath, etc. offered by friends.

original: pūrvaṃ dadyātsarvadā vai gṛhastho dhanyo bhavedanyathā vyarthameva // / / //
analyzed: pūrvam dadyāt sarvadā vai gṛhasthaḥ dhanyaḥ bhavet anyathā vyartham eva
translated: A householder should always offer these first. Otherwise, it is useless.

original: gṛhṇāti nityaṃ mādhavākhyo hariścetyevaṃ jñātvā deyamannādikaṃ ca /
analyzed: gṛhṇāti nityam mādhava ākhyaḥ hariḥ ca iti evam jñātvā deyam anna ādikam ca
translated: Hari, called Madhava, always accepts these. Knowing this, food, etc. should be offered.

original: evaṃ jñātvā dīyamānena nityaṃ prīṇāti viṣṇurnānyathā vyarthameva // / / //
analyzed: evam jñātvā dīyamānena nityam prīṇāti viṣṇuḥ na anyathā vyartham eva
translated: Knowing this, if offered always, Vishnu is pleased, not otherwise, it is useless.

original: gṛhe nityaṃ vāsudevo haristu prīṇāti nityaṃ tatra tiṣṭhansuparṇa /
analyzed: gṛhe nityam vāsudevaḥ hariḥ tu prīṇāti nityam tatra tiṣṭhan suparṇa
translated: In the house, Vasudeva Hari always pleases, O Suparna, staying there.

original: evaṃ jñātvā svagṛhaṃ sarvadaiva alaṅkuryāddhāturūpaiḥ sadaiva // / / //
analyzed: evam jñātvā sva gṛham sarvadā eva alaṅkuryāt dhātu rūpaiḥ sadā eva
translated: Knowing this, one should always decorate one's own house with images of the Lord.

original: govindākhyastiṣṭhati vaṣṇavānāṃ putrairyutastiṣṭhati vāsudevaḥ /
analyzed: govinda ākhyaḥ tiṣṭhati vaṣṇavānām putraiḥ yutaḥ tiṣṭhati vāsudevaḥ
translated: Govinda resides in the houses of Vaishnavas. Vasudeva resides with his sons.

original: mitre mukundaḥ śālake cānirūddho nārāyaṇo dvijavarye sadāsti // / / //
analyzed: mitre mukundaḥ śālake ca anirūddhaḥ nārāyaṇaḥ dvija varye sadā asti
translated: Mukunda is in friends, Aniruddha in the courtyard, and Narayana always resides in the best of Brahmins.

original: goṣṭhe ca nityaṃ viṣṇurūpī haristu aśve sadā tiṣṭhati vāmanākhyaḥ /
analyzed: goṣṭhe ca nityam viṣṇu rūpī hariḥ tu aśve sadā tiṣṭhati vāmana ākhyaḥ
translated: In the cowpen, Hari in the form of Vishnu always resides, and the one called Vamana always resides in the horse.

original: saṃkarṣaṇaḥ śūdravarṇe sadāsti vaiśye pradyumnastiṣṭhati sarvadaiva // / / //
analyzed: saṃkarṣaṇaḥ śūdra varṇe sadā asti vaiśye pradyumnaḥ tiṣṭhati sarvadā eva
translated: Sanakarshana always resides in the Shudra caste, and Pradyumna always resides in the Vaishya caste.

original: janārdanaḥ kṣattrajātau sadāsti dāśeṣu nityaṃ mahidāso haristu /🔽mahyāṃ nityaṃ tiṣṭhati sarvadaiva hyupendrākhyo harirekaḥ suparṇa // / / //
analyzed: janārdanaḥ kṣattra jātau sadā asti dāśeṣu nityam mahidāsaḥ hariḥ tu  mahyām nityam tiṣṭhati sarvadā eva hi upendra ākhyaḥ hariḥ ekaḥ suparṇa
translated: Janardana always resides in the Kshatriya caste, and Hari as Mahideva always resides in the fishermen.

original: gaje sadā tiṣṭhati cakrapāṇiḥ sadāntare tiṣṭhati viśvarūpaḥ /
analyzed: gaje sadā tiṣṭhati cakra pāṇiḥ sadā antare tiṣṭhati viśva rūpaḥ
translated: The single Hari called Upendra always resides in the earth, and the discus-holder always resides in the elephant. The universal form always resides in the interior.

original: nityaṃ śuni tiṣṭhati bhūtabhāvanaḥ pipīlakāyāmapi sarvadaiva // / / //
analyzed: nityam śuni tiṣṭhati bhūtabhāvanaḥ pipīlakāyām api sarvadā eva
translated: The creator of beings always resides in the dog, and in the ant also always.

original: trivikramo harirūpyantarikṣe sarvajātāvanantarūpī hariśca /
analyzed: trivikramaḥ hari rūpī antarikṣe sarva jātau ananta rūpī hariḥ ca
translated: Hari in the form of Trivikrama resides in the sky, and Hari in infinite form resides in all beings.

original: harerna varṇosti na gotramasti na jātirīśe sarvarūpe vicitre // / / //🔽evaṃ jñātvā sarvadā lakṣmaṇā tu hariṃ sadā prīṇayāmāsa devī /
analyzed: hareḥ na varṇaḥ usti na gotram asti na jātiḥ īśe sarva rūpe vicitre  evam jñātvā sarvadā lakṣmaṇā tu harim sadā prīṇayāmāsa devī
translated: Hari has no caste, no gotra, no birth, O lord, in the wonderful form of all.🔽Knowing this always, O Lakshmana, the goddess always pleased Hari.

original: saparyayā vai kriyamāṇayā hariḥ patirmamasya diti cintayānā // / / //
analyzed: saparyayā vai kriyamāṇayā hariḥ patiḥ mama asya diti cintayānā
translated: Thinking Hari, my husband, is being served by this worship, she always worshipped Hari.

original: tatyāja dehaṃ viṣṇupatitvakāmā madreṣu vai vīndra putrī prajātā /
analyzed: tatyāja deham viṣṇu pati tva kāmā madreṣu vai vi indra putrī prajātā
translated: O Indra among kings, I was born as the daughter of the king of Madras.

original: svayaṃvare lakṣmaṇāyā ahaṃ ca bhittvā lakṣyaṃ bhūpatīndrāvayitvā // / / //
analyzed: svayaṃvare lakṣmaṇāyāḥ aham ca bhittvā lakṣyam bhūpatīn drāvayitvā
translated: In the svayamvara of Lakshmana, I shot the target and won the kings.

original: pāṇigrahaṃ lakṣmaṇāyāśca kṛtvā gatvā purīṃ ramayāmāsa devī /
analyzed: pāṇigraham lakṣmaṇāyāḥ ca kṛtvā gatvā purīm ramayāmāsa devī
translated: After marrying Lakshmana, I went to the city and delighted the queen.

original: tathaivāhaṃ jāṃbavatyā vivāhaṃ matpatnītve kāraṇaṃ tvāṃ bravīmi // / / //
analyzed: tathā eva aham jāṃbavatyāḥ vivāham mad patnī tve kāraṇam tvām bravīmi
translated: In the same way, I tell you the reason for marrying Jambaavati as my wife.

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttarakhaṇḍe tṛtīyāṃśe brahmakāṇḍe lakṣmaṇāvivāhahetunirūpaṇaṃ nāma dvāviṃśodhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttara khaṇḍe tṛtīya aṃśe brahmakāṇḍe lakṣmaṇāvivāhahetunirūpaṇam nāma dvāviṃśaḥ adhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-second chapter in the third section of the Uttara-khanda in the great Garuda Purana, describing the marriage of Lakshmana.

original: śrīgaruḍamahāpurāṇam
analyzed: śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam
translated: Shree Garuda Mahapurana

original: śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /
analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Shree Krishna said:

original: somasya putrī pūrvasarge babhūva bhāryā madīyā jāmbavatī mama priyā /
analyzed: somasya putrī pūrva sarge babhūva bhāryā madīyā jāmbavatī mama priyā
translated: In the previous creation, Jambaavati was the daughter of Soma and became my wife, dear to me.

original: tāsāṃ madhye hyadhikā vīndra kiñcidrudrādibhyaḥ pañcaguṇairvihīnā // / / //🔽yadāveśo balavānsyādramāyāṃ tadānāmasa priyate keśavolam /
analyzed: tāsām madhye hi adhikā vīndra kiñcid rudra ādibhyaḥ pañcaguṇaiḥ vihīnā  yadā āveśaḥ balavān syāt ramāyām
translated: O Indra among kings, among them, she is superior, slightly inferior to Rudra and others in five qualities.🔽When the powerful influence of Rama is present, then Keshava is called Priyatma (having a beloved).

original: yadāveśāddhrāsamupaiti kāle tadā tāsāṃ sāmyamāhurmahāntaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yad āveśāt hrāsam upaiti kāle tadā tāsām sāmyam āhuḥ mahāntaḥ
translated: When the influence decreases over time, the great ones say that they are equal.

original: lakṣmyāveśaḥ kiñcidastyeva nityamatastābhyaḥ kiñcidādhikyamasti // / / //
analyzed: lakṣmī āveśaḥ kiñcid asti eva nityam atas tābhyaḥ kiñcid ādhikyam asti
translated: There is indeed a slight possession of Lakshmi in them, so there is a slight superiority of them over others.

original: garuḍa uvāca /
analyzed: garuḍaḥ uvāca
translated: Garuda said:

original: tāsāṃ madhye jāmbavantī tu kṛṣṇa ārādhanaṃ kīdṛśaṃ sā cakāra /
analyzed: tāsām madhye jāmbavantī tu kṛṣṇaḥ ārādhanam kīdṛśam sā cakāra
translated: Among them, what kind of worship of Krishna did Jambavanti do?

original: tanme brūhi kṛpayā viśvamūrte ādhikye vai kāraṇaṃ tābhya eva // / / //
analyzed: tat me brūhi kṛpayā viśvamūrte ādhikye vai kāraṇam tābhyaḥ eva
translated: Tell me that with compassion, O embodiment of the universe, and the reason for her superiority over them.

original: garuḍenaivamuktastu bhagavān devakīsutaḥ /
analyzed: garuḍena evam uktaḥ tu bhagavān devakī sutaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by Garuda, the Blessed One, the son of Devaki,

original: meghagaṃbhīrayā vācā uvāca vinatāsutam // / / //
analyzed: megha gaṃbhīrayā vācā uvāca vinatā sutam
translated: Spoke to the son of Vinata in a voice deep like thunder.

original: śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /
analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Sri Krishna said:

original: yā pūrvasarge somaputrī babhūva piturgṛhe vartamānāpi sādhvī /
analyzed: yā pūrva sarge soma putrī babhūva pituḥ gṛhe vartamānā api sādhvī
translated: She who was the daughter of Soma in a previous creation, though remaining in her father's house, was a chaste woman.

original: janma svakīyaṃ sārthakaṃ vai cakāra pitrā sākaṃ viṣṇuśuśrūṣaṇe na ca // / / //
analyzed: janma svakīyam sārthakam vai cakāra pitrā sākam viṣṇu śuśrūṣaṇe na ca
translated: She made her own birth meaningful, along with her father, by serving Vishnu.

original: śuśrāva nityaṃ satpurāṇāni caivaṃ cakre sadā viṣṇupādapraṇāmam /
analyzed: śuśrāva nityam sat purāṇāni ca evam cakre sadā viṣṇu pāda praṇāmam
translated: She always listened to the holy Puranas and always bowed at Vishnu's feet.

original: cakre sadā tārakasyāpi viṣṇoḥ pradakṣiṇaṃ smaraṇaṃ kurvatī sā // / / //
analyzed: cakre sadā tārakasya api viṣṇoḥ pradakṣiṇam smaraṇam kurvatī sā
translated: She always circumambulated Vishnu, the savior, remembering him.

original: pitrā sākaṃ sā tu kanyā khagendra vairāgyayuktā śravaṇātsaṃbabhūva /
analyzed: pitrā sākam sā tu kanyā khaga indra vairāgya yuktā śravaṇāt saṃbabhūva
translated: O lord of birds, that maiden, along with her father, became detached through listening.

original: keśaṃ ca mitraṃ dviradādikaṃ ca anarghyaratnāni gṛhādikaṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: keśam ca mitram dvirada ādikam ca anarghya ratnāni gṛha ādikam ca
translated: And his hair, his friends, his elephants and other animals, his priceless jewels, his houses and other possessions.

original: sarvaṃ hyetannaśvaraṃ caiva mene mamādhīnaṃ hariṇā vai kṛtaṃ ca /
analyzed: sarvam hi etat naśvaram ca eva mene mama adhīnam hariṇā vai kṛtam ca
translated: He considered all this as impermanent and under his control, created by Hari.

original: yenaiva dattaṃ putramitrādikaṃ ca tenā hṛtaṃ vedanāṃ naiva cakre // / / //
analyzed: yena eva dattam putra mitra ādikam ca tena hṛtam vedanām nā eva cakre
translated: He did not feel any pain when the same person who had given him his son, friends, etc. took them back.

original: adyaiva viṣṇuḥ paramo dayāluḥ dayāṃ mayi kṛtavāṃste na suṣṭhu /
analyzed: adyā eva viṣṇuḥ paramaḥ dayāluḥ dayām mayi kṛtavān te na suṣṭhu
translated: Today only, the supremely compassionate Vishnu has shown me great mercy.

original: pitrā sākaṃ kanyakā sā tu vīndra sadātmani hyamale vāsudeve // / / //
analyzed: pitrā sākam kanyakā sā tu vīndra sadā ātmani hi amale vāsudeve
translated: O Indra of kings, that maiden, along with her father, always placed herself in the pure Vāsudeva.

original: ekāntatvaṃ suṣṭhu bhaktyā gatā sā yadṛcchayā sopapannena devī /🔽akalpayantyātmano vīndra vṛttiṃ cakāra yatsāvadhirādhaṃ prathaiva // / / //
analyzed: ekānta tvam suṣṭhu bhaktyā gatā sā yadṛcchayā sa upapannena devī  akalpayantī ātmanaḥ vi indra vṛttim cakāra yat sā avadhirādham prathā eva
translated: The goddess, who had attained the state of oneness with him by chance through excellent devotion, did not arrange for her own livelihood.🔽O Indra of kings, she made him her husband, though he was a poor brahmin.

original: sā vai vittaṃ viṣṇupādāravinde duḥ khārṇavāttarāke saṃcakāra /
analyzed: sā vai vittam viṣṇu pāda aravinde duḥ kha arṇava attarāke saṃcakāra
translated: She deposited her wealth in the lotus feet of Vishnu, the boat to cross the ocean of suffering.

original: vāgīndridriyaṃ khaga samyak cakāra harerguṇānāṃ varṇane vā sadaiva // / / //
analyzed: khaga samyak cakāra hareḥ guṇānām varṇane vā sadā eva
translated: O bird, she properly used her faculty of speech in always describing the qualities of Hari.

original: hastau ca viṣṇorgṛhasaṃmārjanādau cakāra devī gātramalāpahāram /
analyzed: hastau ca viṣṇoḥ gṛha saṃmārjana ādau cakāra devī gātra mala apahāram
translated: The goddess used her hands in cleaning Vishnu's house and removing the dirt from her body.

original: śrotraṃ ca cakre harisatkathodaye mokṣādimārge hyamṛtopame ca // / / //
analyzed: śrotram ca cakre hari sat kathā udaye mokṣa ādi mārge hi amṛta upame ca
translated: He made the ear for the rise of good stories of Hari, and for the path of liberation, which is like nectar.

original: netraṃ ca cakre pratimādidarśane anādikālīnamalāpahariṇī /
analyzed: netram ca cakre pratimā ādi darśane anādi kālīna mala apahariṇī
translated: He made the eye for seeing images etc., which removes impurities from beginningless time.

original: sadvaiṣṇavānāṃ sparśane caiva saṃge nirmālyagandhānuvilepane tvak // / / //🔽ghrārṇedriyaṃ sā haripādasāre cakāra saṃsāravimuktide ca /🔽jihvendriyaṃ harinaivedyaśeṣe śrīmattulasyādivimiśrite ca // / / //
analyzed: sat vaiṣṇavānām sparśane ca eva saṃge nirmālya gandha anuvilepane tvac  sā hari pāda sāre cakāra saṃsāra vimukti de ca  jihvā indriyam hari naivedya śeṣe śrīmat tulasī ādi vimiśrite ca
translated: The skin for the touch and association of good devotees of Vishnu, and for the anointing with the fragrance of the remnants of worship.🔽He made the nose sense organ for the feet dust of Hari, which grants liberation from worldly existence.🔽The tongue sense organ for the remnants of offerings to Hari, mixed with the auspicious basil leaves etc.

original: pādau hareḥ kṣetrapathānusarpaṇe śiro hṛṣīkeśapadābhivandane /
analyzed: pādau hareḥ kṣetra patha anusarpaṇe śiraḥ hṛṣīkeśa pada abhivandane
translated: The feet for following the paths of Hari's holy places, and the head for bowing at the feet of Hrishikesha.

original: kāmaṃ hṛdāsye tu haridāsyakāmyā tathottamaślokajanāścaranti // / / //
analyzed: kāmam hṛd āsye tu hari dāsya kāmyā tathā uttamaśloka janāḥ caranti
translated: The heart and face for the desire of Hari's face, and the people of the highest verse move thus.

original: niṣkāmarūpe ca matiṃ cakāra vāgindriyaṃ stavanaṃ svīcakāra /
analyzed: niṣkāma rūpe ca matim cakāra vāc indriyam stavanam svīcakāra
translated: He made the mind for the form of desirelessness, and accepted the sense of speech for praise.

original: evaṃ sadā kāryasamūhamātmanā samarpayitvā parameśapādayoḥ // / / //
analyzed: evam sadā kārya samūham ātmanā samarpayitvā parameśa pādayoḥ
translated: Thus, having always offered the group of duties to the feet of the Supreme Lord,

original: tīrthāṭanārthaṃ tu jagāma pitrā sākaṃ hareḥ prīṇanādyarthameva /
analyzed: tīrtha aṭana artham tu jagāma pitrā sākam hareḥ prīṇana ādi artham eva
translated: he went on a pilgrimage with his father, just for the sake of pleasing Hari.

original: ārādhayitvā brāhmaṇānviṣṇubhaktānādau gṛhe vastrasaṃbhūṣaṇādyaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: ārādhayitvā brāhmaṇān viṣṇu bhaktān ādau gṛhe vastra saṃbhūṣaṇa ādyaiḥ
translated: Having first propitiated the Brahmanas who are devotees of Vishnu, with garments, ornaments and other things in the house,

original: paścātkalpaṃ kārayāmāsa devī viṣṇoragre tīrthayātrārthameva /
analyzed: paścātkalpam kārayāmāsa devī viṣṇoḥ agre tīrtha yātrā artham eva
translated: Then the Goddess made arrangements for a pilgrimage in front of Vishnu.

original: yāvatkālaṃ tīrthayātrā mukunda tāvatkālaṃ tūrdhvaretā bhavāmi // / / //
analyzed: yāvatkālam tīrtha yātrā mukunda tāvatkālam tu ūrdhvaretāḥ bhavāmi
translated: For as long as the pilgrimage lasts, O Mukunda, for that long I shall remain celibate.

original: yāvatkālaṃ tīrthayātrāṃ kariṣye tāvaddattādvaiṣṇavānāṃ ca saṃgam /
analyzed: yāvatkālam tīrthayātrām kariṣye tāvat dattāt vaiṣṇavānām ca saṃgam
translated: For as long as I shall be on pilgrimage, for that long I shall have the company of Vaishnavas.

original: hareḥ kathāśravaṇaṃ syānmukunda nāvaiṣṇavānāṃ saṃgināmaṅgasaṃgam // / / //
analyzed: hareḥ kathā śravaṇam syāt mukunda na avaiṣṇavānām saṃginām aṅgasaṃgam
translated: O Mukunda, I shall listen to the stories of Hari, but not have physical contact with those who are not Vaishnavas.

original: suhṛjjanaiḥ putramitrādikaiśca dīrthāṭanaṃ naiva kuryāṃ mukunda /
analyzed: suhṛd janaiḥ putra mitra ādikaiḥ ca dīrtha aṭanam nā eva kuryām mukunda
translated: O Mukunda, I shall not go on pilgrimage with friends, sons, relatives and others.

original: kurvanti ye kāmyayā tīrthayātrāṃ teṣāṃ saṃgaṃ kuru dūre mukunda // / / //
analyzed: kurvanti ye kāmyayā tīrthayātrām teṣām saṃgam kuru dūre mukunda
translated: O Mukunda, keep far away from those who go on pilgrimage out of desire.

original: śālagrāmaṃ ye vihāyaiva yātrāṃ kurvanti teṣāṃ kiṃ phalaṃ prāhurāryāḥ /
analyzed: śālagrāmam ye vihāya eva yātrām kurvanti teṣām kim phalam prāhuḥ āryāḥ
translated: What is the fruit said by the wise for those who go on pilgrimage avoiding Shala-grama?

original: yadā tīrthānāṃ darśanaṃ syāttadaiva śālagrāmaṃ purataḥ sthāpayitvā // / / //
analyzed: yadā tīrthānām darśanam syāt tadā eva śālagrāmam puratas sthāpayitvā
translated: When there is a visit to the holy places, then only after placing Shala-grama in front,

original: tīrthāṭanaṃ pādacairaiḥ kṛtaṃ cetpūrṇaṃ phalaṃ prāhurāryāḥ khagendra /
analyzed: tīrtha aṭanam pāda cairaiḥ kṛtam ced pūrṇam phalam prāhuḥ āryāḥ khaga indra
translated: If the pilgrimage is done on foot, the wise say it gives complete fruit, O lord of birds.

original: pādatrāṇaṃ pādarakṣāṃ ca kṛtvā tīrthāṭanaṃ pādahīnaṃ tadāhuḥ // / / //🔽yo vāhane turage copaviṣṭastīrthāṭanaṃ kurute cārdhahīnam /
analyzed: pāda trāṇam pāda rakṣām ca kṛtvā tīrtha aṭanam pāda hīnam tat āhuḥ  yaḥ vāhane turage ca upaviṣṭaḥ tīrtha aṭanam kurute ca ardha hīnam
translated: They say that wandering to holy places while wearing footwear is equal to having no feet.🔽One who wanders to holy places while seated on a vehicle or horse, it is said to be half deficient.

original: vṛṣādīnāṃ vāhane pādamāhuḥ parānnānāṃ bhojane vyarthamāhuḥ // / / //
analyzed: vṛṣa ādīnām vāhane pādam āhuḥ para annānām bhojane vyartham āhuḥ
translated: They say that riding bulls and other animals is equal to having no feet, and eating other people's food is said to be useless.

original: mahātmanāṃ vedavidāṃ yatīnāṃ parānnānāṃ bhojane naiva doṣaḥ /
analyzed: mahātmanām veda vidām yatīnām para annānām bhojane na eva doṣaḥ
translated: There is no fault in eating the food of great souls, those who know the Vedas, and ascetics.

original: saṃkalpayitvā paramādareṇa jagāma sā tīrthayātrārthameva // / / //
analyzed: saṃkalpayitvā parama ādareṇa jagāma sā tīrtha yātrā artham eva
translated: Having made a great resolve, she went for the pilgrimage with great respect.

original: ādau snātvā harinirmātyagandhaṃ visarjayitvā śravaṇaṃ vai cakāra /🔽pitrā sākaṃ bhojanaṃ cāpi kṛtvā agre dine krośamekaṃ jagāma // / / //
analyzed: ādau snātvā harinirmātya gandham visarjayitvā śravaṇam vai cakāra  pitrā sākam bhojanam ca api kṛtvā agre dine krośam ekam jagāma
translated: First, she took a bath, offered incense to Hari, and then listened to the scriptures.🔽Having eaten with her father, she walked one mile on the first day.

original: tatra dvijānpūjayitvānnapāna rātrau tattvaṃ śrāvayāmāsa devī /
analyzed: tatra dvijān pūjayitvā anna pāna rātrau tattvam śrāvayāmāsa devī
translated: There, she worshipped the Brahmins with food and drink, and in the night, the goddess made them listen to the truth.

original: evaṃ yātrāṃ ye prakurvanti nityaṃ teṣāṃ yātrāṃ saphalāṃ prāhurāryāḥ // / / //🔽vinā dayāṃ tīrthayātrā khagendravyarthetyevaṃ vīndra cāhurmahāntaḥ /
analyzed: evam yātrām ye prakurvanti nityam teṣām yātrām saphalām prāhuḥ āryāḥ 🔽vinā dayām tīrtha yātrā khaga indra vyarthā iti evam vi indra ca āhuḥ mahāntaḥ
translated: The noble ones say that the pilgrimage of those who always perform in this way is fruitful.🔽The great ones say, O king of birds, that pilgrimage without compassion is useless.

original: divā rātrau ye na śṛṇvanti divyāṃ hareḥ kathāṃ tīrthamārge khagendra // / / //
analyzed: divā rātrau ye na śṛṇvanti divyām hareḥ kathām tīrtha mārge khaga indra
translated: O best of birds, those who do not listen to the divine stories of Hari day and night on the pilgrimage to holy places,

original: vyarthaṃvyarthaṃ tasya cāhurgataṃ vai aśvādīnāṃ vāhanānāṃ ca viddhi /🔽aśvādīnāmaparādhaṃ vadasva gaṅgādīnāṃ darśanātpāpanāśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vyartham vyartham tasya ca āhuḥ gatam vai aśva ādīnām vāhanānām ca viddhi  aśva ādīnām aparādham vadasva gaṅgā ādīnām darśanāt pāpa nāśaḥ
translated: their life is said to be useless. Know that the fault lies with the vehicles like horses.🔽Tell me the fault of horses etc. The sight of Ganga etc. destroys sins.

original: kṣetrasthaviṣṇordarśanātpāpanāśo mārjārasyāpyaparādhaṃ vadasva /
analyzed: kṣetrastha viṣṇoḥ darśanāt pāpa nāśaḥ mārjārasya api aparādham vadasva
translated: The sight of Vishnu residing in the holy place destroys sins. Tell me the fault of even a cat.

original: kṣetrasthaviṣṇoḥ pūjanātpāpanāśaḥ pūjāvatāmaparādhaṃ vadasva // / / //
analyzed: kṣetrastha viṣṇoḥ pūjanāt pāpa nāśaḥ pūjāvatām aparādham vadasva
translated: The worship of Vishnu residing in the holy place destroys sins. Tell me the fault of those who are devoted to worship.

original: japādīnāṃ kurvatāṃ pāpanāśo viṣṇordhyānātsadya evādhanāśaḥ /
analyzed: japa ādīnām kurvatām pāpa nāśaḥ viṣṇoḥ dhyānāt sadyas eva adha nāśaḥ
translated: For those who perform japa etc., sins are destroyed. By meditating on Vishnu, sins are destroyed instantly.

original: anusaṃdhānādrahitaṃ sarvameva kṛtaṃ vyarthameveti cāhuḥ // / / //
analyzed: anusaṃdhānāt rahitam sarvam eva kṛtam vyartham eva iti ca āhuḥ
translated: They say that everything done without proper contemplation is useless.

original: ato hareḥ pāpavināśinīṃ kathāṃ śrutvā viṣṇorbhaktimānsyātvagandra /
analyzed: atas hareḥ pāpa vināśinīm kathām śrutvā viṣṇoḥ bhaktimān syāt agandra
translated: Therefore, O best of birds, having heard the story of Hari, which destroys sins, one should be devoted to Vishnu.

original: dṛṣṭvādṛṣṭvā haripādāṅkitaṃ ca smṛtvāsmṛtvā bhaktimānsyātkhagendra // / / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā a dṛṣṭvā hari pāda aṅkitam ca smṛtvā a smṛtvā bhaktimān syāt khaga indra
translated: Seeing and seeing the mark of Hari's feet, and remembering and remembering, one should be devoted, O best of birds.

original: pitrā sākaṃ kanyakā sāpi vīndra śeṣācalasthaṃ śrīnivāsaṃ ca draṣṭum /
analyzed: pitrā sākam kanyakā sā api vīndra śeṣa acala stham śrīnivāsam ca draṣṭum
translated: O best of birds, that girl, along with her father, went to see Srinivasa residing on Mount Shesha.

original: jagāma sā mārgamadhye hariṃ ca sā cintayāmāsa ramāpatiṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: jagāma sā mārga madhye harim ca sā cintayāmāsa ramā patim ca
translated: In the middle of the path, she went to Hari and thought of the lord of Ramā.

original: kadā drakṣye śrīnivāsasya vakṣaḥ śrīvatsaratnairbhūṣitaṃ vistṛtaṃ ca /
analyzed: kadā drakṣye śrīnivāsasya vakṣaḥ śrīvatsa ratnaiḥ bhūṣitam vistṛtam ca
translated: When will I see the broad chest of Śrīnivāsa, adorned with the Śrīvatsa gem?

original: kadā drakṣye śrīnivāsasya tundaṃ valitrayeṇāṅkitaṃ suṃdaraṃ ca // / / //🔽kadā drakṣye śrīnivāsasya kaṇṭhaṃ maharlokasyāśrayaṃ kaṃbutulyam /
analyzed: kadā drakṣye śrīnivāsasya tundam vali trayeṇa aṅkitam suṃdaram ca  kadā drakṣye śrīnivāsasya kaṇṭham mahar lokasya āśrayam kaṃbu tulyam
translated: When will I see the beautiful neck of Śrīnivāsa, marked with three folds?

original: kadā drakṣye śrīnivāsasya nābhiṃ sadāntarikṣasyāśrayaṃ vai supūrṇam // / / //
analyzed: kadā drakṣye śrīnivāsasya nābhim sadā antarikṣasya āśrayam vai su pūrṇam
translated: When will I see the navel of Śrīnivāsa, the perfect abode of the atmosphere?

original: kadā drakṣye vadanaṃ vai murārerjanalokasyāśrayaṃ sarvadaiva // / / //
analyzed: kadā drakṣye vadanam vai murāreḥ janalokasya āśrayam sarvadā eva
translated: When will I see the face of Murāri, the abode of the Jana world, always?

original: śiraḥ kadā śrīnivāsasya drakṣye satyasya lokasyāśrayaṃ sarvadaiva /🔽kaṭiṃ kadā śrīnivāsasya drakṣye bhūrlokasyāśrayaṃ sarvadaiva // / / //🔽kadā drakṣye śrīnivāsasya coru talātalasyāśrayaṃ sarvadaiva /
analyzed: śiraḥ kadā śrīnivāsasya drakṣye satyasya lokasya āśrayam sarvadā eva  kaṭim kadā śrīnivāsasya drakṣye bhūrlokasya āśrayam sarvadā eva  kadā drakṣye śrīnivāsasya ca ūru talātalasya āśrayam sarvadā eva
translated: When will I see the head of Śrīnivāsa, the abode of the Satya world, always?🔽When will I see the waist of Śrīnivāsa, the abode of the Bhūloka, always?🔽When will I see the thighs of Śrīnivāsa, the abode of Talātala, always?

original: kadā drakṣye śrīnivāsasya jānu sukomalaṃ sutalasyāśrayaṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: kadā drakṣye śrīnivāsasya jānu su komalam su talasya āśrayam ca
translated: When will I see the soft knees of Śrīnivāsa, the abode of Sutala?

original: kadā drakṣye śrīnivāsasya jaṅghe rasātalasyāśrayeḥ sarvadaiva /
analyzed: kadā drakṣye śrīnivāsasya jaṅghe rasātalasya āśrayeḥ sarvadā eva
translated: When shall I see the thighs of Lord Srinivasa, which are always the support of the nether world?

original: kadā drakṣye pādatalaṃ hareśca pātālalokasyāśrayaṃ sarvadaiva // / / //
analyzed: kadā drakṣye pāda talam hareḥ ca pātāla lokasya āśrayam sarvadā eva
translated: When shall I see the soles of Lord Hari's feet, which are always the support of the nether world?

original: itthaṃ mārge cintayantī ca devī śeṣācale śeṣadevaṃ dadarśa /
analyzed: ittham mārge cintayantī ca devī śeṣa acale śeṣadevam dadarśa
translated: Thus, thinking on the way, the Goddess saw Lord Shesha on Mount Shrishaila.

original: phaṇaiḥ sahasraiḥ suvirājamānaṃ nānādrumairvānarairvānarībhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: phaṇaiḥ sahasraiḥ su virājamānam nānā drumaiḥ vānaraiḥ vānarībhiḥ
translated: Shining with a thousand hoods, with various trees, monkeys and female monkeys,

original: ananta janmārjitapuṇyasaṃcayānmayādya dṛṣṭaḥ paramācalo hi /
analyzed: ananta janma arjita puṇya saṃcayāt mayā adya dṛṣṭaḥ parama acalaḥ hi
translated: Today, I have seen the supreme mountain, the accumulation of merits earned in countless births.

original: taddarśanādvāṣpakalākulekṣaṇā sadyaḥ samutthāya nanāma mūrdhnā // / / //
analyzed: tad darśanāt vāṣpa kalā ākula īkṣaṇā sadyas samutthāya nanāma mūrdhnā
translated: With eyes filled with tears from seeing him, she immediately got up and bowed her head.

original: mukhaṃ ca dṛṣṭvā namanaṃ ca kāryaṃ pṛṣṭhādibhāge namanaṃ na kāryam /
analyzed: mukham ca dṛṣṭvā namanam ca kāryam pṛṣṭha ādi bhāge namanam na kāryam
translated: The face should be seen and bowing should be done, but bowing on the back and other parts should not be done.

original: sāpi dviṣaṭkaṃ namanaṃ ca cakre śālagrāmaṃ sthāpayitvā puro 'sya // / / //
analyzed: sā api dvi ṣaṭkam namanam ca cakre śālagrāmam sthāpayitvā
translated: She also did bowing twice, placing the Shala tree in front of him.

original: itthaṃ kāryaṃ vaiṣṇavaiḥ parvatasya tvaṃ vaiṣṇavairviparītaṃ ca kāryam /
analyzed: ittham kāryam vaiṣṇavaiḥ parvatasya tvam vaiṣṇavaiḥ viparītam ca kāryam
translated: Thus, the mountain should be treated by Vaishnavas, but you should treat it in the opposite way.

original: madhvāntaḥsthaḥ parvatāgresti nityaṃ ramābrahmādyaiḥ pūjitaḥ śrīnivāsaḥ // / / //
analyzed: madhva antar sthaḥ parvata agreḥ ati nityam ramā brahma ādyaiḥ pūjitaḥ śrīnivāsaḥ
translated: Lord Srinivasa, who resides in the middle of the mountain, is always worshipped by Lakshmi, Brahma and others.

original: susattamaṃ paramaṃ śrīnivāsaṃ drakṣye 'thāhaṃ hyārurukṣe 'calañca /
analyzed: su sattamam paramam śrīnivāsam drakṣye thā aham hi ārurukṣe calan ca
translated: I will then see the supreme and most excellent abode of Shri, and then I will ascend the mountain.

original: ityevamuktvā kapilākhyatīrthe sthānaṃ cakre sā svapitrā sahaiva // / / //
analyzed: iti evam uktvā kapila ākhya tīrthe sthānam cakre sā sva pitrā saha eva
translated: Having said this, she made her abode at the tirtha called Kapila, along with her father.

original: atraivāste śrīnivāso haristu dravyeṇa rūpeṇa na cānyatheti /
analyzed: atrā eva āste śrīnivāsaḥ hariḥ tu dravyeṇa rūpeṇa na ca anyathā iti
translated: Here itself resides Shri Hari, the abode of Shri, with His form and not otherwise.

original: ādausnātvā muṇḍanaṃ tatra kṛtvā tīrthaśrāddhaṃ kārayitvā sutīrthe // / / //🔽gobhūhiraṇyādisamastadānaṃ dattvā śailaṃ cārurohātha sādhvī /
analyzed: ādau snātvā muṇḍanam tatra kṛtvā tīrtha śrāddham kārayitvā sutīrthe  go bhū hiraṇya ādi samasta dānam dattvā śailam ca āruroha atha sādhvī
translated: First taking a bath, then shaving her head, performing the ancestral rites at the holy tirtha,🔽giving away all gifts like cows, land, gold, etc., the virtuous lady then ascended the mountain.

original: śālagrāmaṃ sthāpayitvā sa cāgre punaḥ praṇāmaṃ sāpi cakre subhaktyā // / / //
analyzed: śālagrāmam sthāpayitvā sa ca agre punar praṇāmam sā api cakre su bhaktyā
translated: Placing the Shalagrama stone in front, she again bowed down with great devotion.

original: sopānānāṃ śataparyantamevamāruhya sā hyupaviṣṭā tu tatra /🔽śuśrāva sā bhāgavataṃ purāṇaṃ śuśrāva vaiveṅkaṭādreḥ praśaṃsām // / / //
analyzed: sopānānām śata paryantam evam āruhya sā hi upaviṣṭā tu tatra  śuśrāva sā bhāgavatam purāṇam śuśrāva vaiveṅkaṭa adreḥ praśaṃsām
translated: Having ascended up to a hundred steps, she sat there.🔽She listened to the Purana of Bhagavata, and heard the praise of Mount Veṅkaṭa.

original: jaigīṣavyādgurupādātsubhaktyā suśrāva tattvaṃ veṅkaṭādreśca sarvam // / / //
analyzed: jaigīṣavyāt guru pādāt su bhaktyā suśrāva tattvam veṅkaṭādreḥ ca sarvam
translated: With great devotion, she heard all the truth about Veṅkaṭādri from her preceptor Jaigīṣavya.

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttarakhaṇḍe tṛtīyāṃśe brahmakāṇḍe veṅkaṭeśagiriyātrākramanirūpaṇaṃ nāma trayoviṃśodhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttara khaṇḍe tṛtīya aṃśe brahmakāṇḍe veṅkaṭeśagiriyātrākramanirūpaṇam nāma trayoviṃśaḥ adhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the Twenty-third Chapter, in the Third Section of the Uttara-Khanda in the Sri-Garuda Purana, dealing with the description of the pilgrimage to the mountain of Sri-Venkata.

original: śrīgaruḍamahāpurāṇam
analyzed: śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam
translated: The Great Garuda Purana

original: jaigīṣavya uvāca /
analyzed: jaigīṣavyaḥ uvāca
translated: Jaigishavya said:

original: kanye śṛṇu tvaṃ veṅkaṭākhyācalasya smerānanāṃ puṇyamāṃrohaṇe 'sya /
analyzed: kanye śṛṇu tvam veṅkaṭa ākhya acalasya smera ānanām puṇya māṃrohaṇe sya
