translated: When then, having been bound by Yama's messengers and beaten on the great path of Yama,

original: cūledavī kva palāyitābhūtsumūḍhabuddhe viṣṇupādaṃ bhajasva /
analyzed: cūledavī kva palāyitā abhūt su mūḍha buddhe viṣṇu pādam bhajasva
translated: Where did the Chaṇḍāla Goddess flee? O foolish one, worship the feet of Viṣṇu.

original: jvarādibhiḥ pīḍyamāne svaputre gṛhe sthitaṃ brahmadevaṃ ca samyak // / / //
analyzed: jvara ādibhiḥ pīḍyamāne sva putre gṛhe sthitam brahmadevam ca samyak
translated: While one's own son is afflicted by fever and so on, having properly worshipped the Brahman God while staying at home,

original: dhūrpairdīpairbhakṣyabhojyaiśca puṣpaiḥ pūjāṃ kṛtvā vidyamānaśca gehe /
analyzed: dhūrpaiḥ dīpaiḥ bhakṣya bhojyaiḥ ca puṣpaiḥ pūjām kṛtvā vidyamānaḥ ca gehe
translated: Having made an offering with winnowing baskets, lamps, food, and flowers, while existing in the house,

original: yadā tadā yamadūtaiśca baddhvā saṃtāḍyamāne veṇupāśādibhiśca // / / //
analyzed: yadā tadā yamadūtaiḥ ca baddhvā saṃtāḍyamāne veṇu pāśa ādibhiḥ ca
translated: When then, having been bound by Yama's messengers and beaten with bamboo nooses and so on,

original: sa brahmadevaḥ kva palāyitobhūtsumūḍhabuddhe viṣṇupādaṃ bhajasva /
analyzed: sa brahmadevaḥ kva palāyitaḥ bhūt su mūḍha buddhe viṣṇu pādam bhajasva
translated: Where did that Brahman God flee? O foolish one, worship the feet of Viṣṇu.

original: santānārthaṃ bṛhatīṃ pūjayitvā galena baddhvā bṛhatīṃ vai phalaṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: santāna artham bṛhatīm pūjayitvā galena baddhvā bṛhatīm vai phalam ca
translated: Having worshipped the Bṛhatī plant for the sake of progeny, having tied the fruit of the Bṛhatī plant around one's neck,

original: saṃtiṣṭhamāne yamadūtaiśca baddhvā saṃtāḍyamāne bṛhatīkaṇṭakaiśca /
analyzed: saṃtiṣṭhamāne yamadūtaiḥ ca baddhvā saṃtāḍyamāne bṛhatī kaṇṭakaiḥ ca
translated: While existing, having been bound by Yama's messengers and beaten with the thorns of the Bṛhatī plant,

original: tadā devī bṛhatī mūḍhabuddhe palāyitā kutra me tadvada tvam // / / //
analyzed: tadā devī bṛhatī mūḍha buddhe palāyitā kutra me tat vada tvam
translated: Then, O Goddess, the foolish-minded Bṛhatī fled. Tell me, where has she gone?

original: bhajasva mūḍha paradaivataṃ ca nārāyaṇaṃ tārakaṃ sarvaduḥ khāt /
analyzed: bhajasva mūḍha para daivatam ca nārāyaṇam tārakam sarva duḥ khāt
translated: O fool, worship the supreme deity Nārāyaṇa, the savior from all suffering.

original: sukṣudradeveṣu matiṃ ca mā kuru na ca śṛṇu tvaṃ phalguvākyaṃ tathaiva // / / //
analyzed: su kṣudra deveṣu matim ca mā kuru na ca śṛṇu tvam phalgu vākyam tathā eva
translated: Do not set your mind on inferior gods, and do not listen to such worthless words.

original: sukṣudradevān bhindipāle nidhāya visarjayitvā dūradeśe mahātman /
analyzed: su kṣudra devān bhindipāle nidhāya visarjayitvā dūra deśe mahātman
translated: O great soul, having placed the inferior gods in a club, and having sent them far away,

original: saṃdhārya tvaṃ svakulācāradharmaṃ saṃpātane narakaṃ hetubhūtam // / / //
analyzed: saṃdhārya tvam sva kula ācāra dharmam saṃpātane narakam hetu bhūtam
translated: uphold the dharma of your family and caste, which is the cause of falling into hell.

original: punīhi gātraṃ sarvadā mūḍhabuddhe mantrāṣṭakairjanmatīrthe pavitre /
analyzed: punīhi gātram sarvadā mūḍha buddhe mantra aṣṭakaiḥ janmatīrthe pavitre
translated: O foolish one, always purify your body with the eight mantras at the sacred birthplace,

original: hṛdi sthitāṃmārairvyamudrāṃ vihāya kṛtvābhūṣāṃ viṣṇumudrābhiragryām // / / //
analyzed: hṛdi vihāya kṛtvā ābhūṣām viṣṇu mudrābhiḥ agryām
translated: having abandoned the seal of Māra residing in the heart, and having made the excellent seal of Viṣṇu as an ornament.

original: sadā mūḍho harivārtāṃ bhajasva hyāyurgataṃ vyarthamevaṃ kubuddhyā /
analyzed: sadā mūḍhaḥ hari vārtām bhajasva hi āyuḥ gatam vyartham evam ku buddhyā
translated: Always be foolish, and worship the stories of Hari. Thus your life has passed in vain due to your evil mind.

original: sadvaiṣṇavānāṃ saṃgamo durlabhaśca kṣubdhaṃ jñānaṃ tāratamyasvarūpam // / / //
analyzed: sat vaiṣṇavānām saṃgamaḥ durlabhaḥ ca kṣubdham jñānam tāratamya svarūpam
translated: Association with true devotees of Viṣṇu is difficult to obtain. Your agitated knowledge of the nature of gradation is worthless.

original: hariṃ guruṃ hyanusṛtyaiva satyaṃ gatiṃ svakīyāṃ tena jānīhi mūḍha /
analyzed: harim gurum hi anusṛtya eva satyam gatim svakīyām tena jānīhi mūḍha
translated: O fool, following the true guru Hari, know your own destiny through him.

original: dagdhvā duṣṭāṃ buddhimevaṃ ca mūḍha subuddhirūpaṃ mā bhajasvaiva nityam // / / //
analyzed: dagdhvā duṣṭām buddhim evam ca mūḍha su buddhi rūpam mā bhajasva eva nityam
translated: Having thus burnt the wicked intellect, O fool, always resort to the form of the good intellect.

original: mayā sārdhaṃ sadguruṃ prāpya samyagvairāgyapūrvaṃ tattvamātraṃ viditvā /
analyzed: mayā sārdham sat gurum prāpya samyak vairāgya pūrvam tattva mātram viditvā
translated: Having attained the true guru along with me, having known the truth alone preceded by true detachment,

original: tenaiva mokṣaṃ prāpnumo nārjavairyattāryā viṣṇoḥ saṃprasādācca lakṣmyāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tena eva mokṣam prāpnumaḥ na ārjavaiḥ yat tāryāḥ viṣṇoḥ saṃprasādāt ca lakṣmyāḥ
translated: By that alone we attain liberation, not by the straight path, but by the grace of Vishnu and Lakshmi.

original: ityāśayaṃ manasā sannidhāya tathā coktaṃ bhaktavaryo madīyaḥ /
analyzed: iti āśayam manasā sannidhāya tathā ca uktam bhakta varyaḥ madīyaḥ
translated: Having thus resolved in the mind, the best devotee of mine spoke thus.

original: ato bhaktaḥ pravahetyeva saṃjñāmavāpa vīndra prakṛtaṃ taṃ śṛṇu tvam // / / //
analyzed: atas bhaktaḥ pravaha iti eva saṃjñām avāpa vi indra prakṛtam tam śṛṇu tvam
translated: Therefore, the devotee obtained the name Pravaha. O lord of birds, listen to the original story.

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttarakhaṇḍe tṛtīyāṃśe brahmakāṇḍe tāratamyanirūpaṇadvārā viṣṇorevopāsyatvamityarthanirūpaṇaṃ nāmāṣṭāviṃśatamodhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttara khaṇḍe tṛtīya aṃśe brahmakāṇḍe tāratamya nirūpaṇa dvārā viṣṇoḥ eva upāsya tvam ityarthanirūpaṇam nāma aṣṭāviṃśatamaḥ adhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-eighth chapter in the Third Parva of Uttara Khanda in the glorious Narada-Shri Garuda dialogue of the great Indian epic the Mahabharata, on the description of the worshipability of Vishnu alone through the determination of the gradation of beings.

original: śrīgaruḍamahāpurāṇam
analyzed: śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam
translated: The glorious Garuda Mahapurana

original: pravahānantarānvakṣye śṛṇu pakṣīndrasattama /
analyzed: pravaha anantara anvakṣye śṛṇu pakṣi indra sattama
translated: After Pravaha, I will tell you next, listen, O best of the lords of birds.

original: yo dharmo brahmaṇaḥ putro hyādisṛṣṭau tvagudbhavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ dharmaḥ brahmaṇaḥ putraḥ hi ādi sṛṣṭau tvac udbhavaḥ
translated: That Dharma, the son of Brahma, who arose from the skin in the first creation,

original: sajjanānsaumyarūpeṇa dhāraṇāddharmanāmakaḥ /
analyzed: sat janān saumya rūpeṇa dhāraṇāt dharma nāmakaḥ
translated: Is named Dharma because of holding good people in a gentle form.

original: sa eva sūryaputrobhūdyamasaṃjñāmavāpa saḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eva sūrya putraḥ bhūt yama saṃjñām avāpa saḥ
translated: He himself became the son of Surya and obtained the name Yama.

original: pāpināṃ śikṣakattvātsa yama ityucyate budhaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: pāpinām śikṣaka tvāt sa yamaḥ iti ucyate budhaiḥ
translated: Because of his role in disciplining the sinful, he is called Yama by the wise.

original: śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /🔽prahlādānantaraṃ gaṅgā bhāryā vai varuṇasya ca /
analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca  prahlāda anantaram gaṅgā bhāryā vai varuṇasya ca
translated: Shrikrishna said:🔽After Prahlada, Ganga became the wife of Varuna.

original: prahlādādadhamā jñeyā mahimnā varuṇādhikā // / / //
analyzed: prahlādāt adhamā jñeyā mahimnā varuṇa adhikā
translated: She should be known as inferior to Prahlada, but greater in greatness than Varuna.

original: svarūpādadhamā jñeyā nātra kāryā vicāraṇā /
analyzed: svarūpāt adhamā jñeyā na atra kāryā vicāraṇā
translated: She should be known as inferior in form, there is no doubt about it.

original: jñānasvarūpadaṃ viṣṇuṃ yamo jānāti sarvadā // / / //
analyzed: jñāna sva rūpa dam viṣṇum yamaḥ jānāti sarvadā
translated: Yama always knows Vishnu, the giver of the form of knowledge.

original: ato gaṅgeti sā jñeyā sarvadā lokapāvanī /
analyzed: atas gaṅgā iti sā jñeyā sarvadā loka pāvanī
translated: Therefore, she should always be known as Ganga, the purifier of the world.

original: bhaktyā viṣṇupadītyeva kīrtitā nātra saṃśayaḥ // / / //🔽yā pūrvakāle yajñaliṅgasya viṣṇoḥ sākṣāddharervikramataḥ khagendra /
analyzed: bhaktyā viṣṇupadī iti eva kīrtitā na atra saṃśayaḥ  yā pūrva kāle yajña liṅgasya viṣṇoḥ sākṣāt hareḥ vikramataḥ khaga indra
translated: She is undoubtedly glorified as Vishnu's foot, out of devotion.

original: vāmasya pādasya nakhāgrataśca nirbhidya cordhvāṇḍakaṭāhakhaṇḍam // / / //
analyzed: vāmasya pādasya nakha agrataḥ ca nirbhidya ca ūrdhva aṇḍa kaṭāha khaṇḍam
translated: She who in ancient times pierced through the upper shell of the universe, from the tip of the nail of the left foot of Vishnu, the manifest Hari, when he was assuming the form of a dwarf.

original: tadudaramativegātsampraviśyāvahantīṃ jagadaghatatihantuḥ pādakiñjalkaśuddhām /
analyzed: tad udaram ativegāt sampraviśya āvahantīm jagat agha tati hantuḥ pāda kiñjalka śuddhām
translated: She who enters the belly of that universe with great speed, and strikes the pure pollen of the foot of the destroyer of the world's sins,

original: nikhilamalanihantrīṃ darśanātsparśanācca sakṛdavagahanādvā bhaktidāṃ viṣṇupāde /
analyzed: nikhila mala nihantrīm darśanāt sparśanāt ca sakṛt avagahanāt vā bhakti dām viṣṇu pāde
translated: She who destroys all impurities by mere sight or touch, and grants devotion to Vishnu's feet,

original: śaśikaravaragaurāṃ mīnanetrāṃ supūjyāṃ smarati haripadotthāṃ mokṣameti krameṇa // / / //
analyzed: śaśi kara vara gaurām mīna netrām su pūjyām smarati hari pada utthām mokṣam eti krameṇa
translated: He who remembers the goddess, who is as fair as the rays of the moon, who has the eyes of a fish, who is to be greatly worshipped, and who originates from Hari's feet, attains liberation gradually.

original: indropi vāyukaramarditavāyukūṭabinduṃ ca prāśya śirasi hyasahiṣṇumānaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ api vāyu kara mardita vāyukūṭa bindum ca prāśya śirasi hi a sahiṣṇu mānaḥ
translated: Indra also, unable to bear the drop of air shaken by the wind, having drunk it on his head,

original: bhāgīrathī haripadāṅkamiti sma nityaṃ jānanmahāparamabhāgavatapradhānaḥ /
analyzed: bhāgīrathī hari pada aṅkam iti sma nityam jānan mahā parama bhāgavata pradhānaḥ
translated: Always knowing that the Ganges is the mark of Hari's feet, the foremost of the greatly exalted devotees,

original: bhaktyā ca khinnahṛdayaḥ paramādareṇa dhṛtvā svamūrdhni paramo hyaśivaḥ śivo 'bhūt // / / //
analyzed: bhaktyā ca khinna hṛdayaḥ parama ādareṇa dhṛtvā sva mūrdhni paramaḥ hi aśivaḥ śivaḥ bhūt
translated: With a heart weary of devotion, holding it with great respect, became extremely inauspicious and auspicious on his head.

original: bhāgīrathyāśca catvāri rūpāṇyāsankhageśvara /
analyzed: bhāgīrathyāḥ ca catvāri rūpāṇi āsan khageśvara
translated: O lord of birds, the Ganges had four forms.

original: mahābhiṣagjanendrasya bhāryā tu hyabhiṣecanī // / / //
analyzed: mahā bhiṣaj jana indrasya bhāryā tu hi abhiṣecanī
translated: The consecrating wife of the great physician Indra.

original: dvitīyenaiva rūpeṇa gaṅgā bhāryā ca śantanoḥ /
analyzed: dvitīyena eva rūpeṇa gaṅgā bhāryā ca śantanoḥ
translated: By the second form only, Ganga was the wife of Shantanu.

original: suṣeṇā vai suṣeṇasya bhāryā sā vānarī smṛtā // / / //
analyzed: suṣeṇā vai suṣeṇasya bhāryā sā vānarī smṛtā
translated: Sushena's wife is remembered as the female monkey of Sushena.

original: maṇḍūkabhāryā gaṅgā tu saiva maṇḍūkinī smṛtā /
analyzed: maṇḍūka bhāryā gaṅgā tu sā eva maṇḍūkinī smṛtā
translated: Ganga, the wife of the frog, is remembered as the same Mandookini.

original: evaṃ catvārī rūpāṇi gaṅgāyā iti kirtitamam // / / //
analyzed: evam catvāri rūpāṇi gaṅgāyāḥ iti kirtitamam
translated: Thus the four forms of Ganga are declared.

original: ādityāccaiva gaṅgātaḥ parjanyaḥ samudāhṛtaḥ /
analyzed: ādityāt ca eva gaṅgātaḥ parjanyaḥ samudāhṛtaḥ
translated: And from Aditya and Ganga, Parjanya is declared.

original: pravarṣati suvairāgyaṃ hyataḥ parjanyanāmakam // / / //
analyzed: pravarṣati suvairāgyam hi atas parjanya nāmakam
translated: It rains down excellent detachment, hence it is named Parjanya.

original: śaraṃvarāya pañcajanyācca pañca hitvā jagdhvā garvakaṃ ṣaṭkrameṇa /
analyzed: śaraṃvarāya pañcajanyāt ca pañca hitvā jagdhvā garvakam ṣaṣ krameṇa
translated: To the best of arrows, having abandoned the five from the five people, having eaten the pride, by the six stages,

original: svabāṇasya svahṛdi saṃsthitasya bhajetsadā naiva bhaktiṃ viṣaṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: sva bāṇasya sva hṛdi saṃsthitasya bhajet sadā nā eva bhaktim viṣam ca
translated: One should always worship one's own arrow, which is situated in one's own heart, and never have devotion to poison.

original: liṅgaṃ puṣṭaṃ naiva kāryaṃ sadaiva liṅgaṃ puṣṭaṃ kāryamevaṃ sadāpi /🔽yonau saktirnaiva kāryā sadāpi yonau mukte 'saṃgato yāti muktim // / / //
analyzed: liṅgam puṣṭam nā eva kāryam sadā eva liṅgam puṣṭam kāryam evam sadā api  yonau saktiḥ nā eva kāryā sadā api yonau mukte saṃgataḥ yāti muktim
translated: The linga should never be nourished, the linga should always be nourished in this way.🔽One should never be attached to the vagina, when liberated from the vagina, one goes to liberation without attachment.

original: vairāgyamevaṃ prakārotyeva nityamataḥ parjanyastvantakaḥ pakṣivarya /
analyzed: vairāgyam evam nityam atas parjanyaḥ tu antakaḥ pakṣi varya
translated: Detachment is of this kind, therefore Parjanya is the end, the best of birds.

original: etāvatā śarabhākhyo mahātmā sa cāntaro sa tu parjanya eva // / / //
analyzed: etāvatā śarabha ākhyaḥ mahātmā sa ca sa tu parjanyaḥ eva
translated: By this much, the great soul named Sharabha, he is internal, he is Parjanya himself.

original: śaśvatkeśā yasya gātre khagendra prabhāsyante śarabhākhyo payotaḥ /
analyzed: śaśvat keśāḥ yasya gātre khaga indra prabhāsyante
translated: O lord of birds, the one whose hair always shines on the body, the cloud named Sharabha,

original: yamasya bhāryā śyāmalā yā khagendra yasmātsadā kalibhāryāpiyā ca // / / //
analyzed: yamasya bhāryā śyāmalā yā khaga indra yasmāt sadā ca
translated: O lord of birds, the dark wife of Yama, who is always the wife of Kali,

original: matvā samyak mānasaṃ yā karoti hyataśca sā śyāmalāsaṃjñakābhūt /
analyzed: matvā samyak mānasam yā karoti hi atas ca sā śyāmalā saṃjñakā bhūt
translated: Thinking properly, she who makes the mind, therefore she became known as Shyamala.

original: malaṃ vakṣye haribhaktervirodhī sulohapātre sannidhānaṃ ca tasya // / / //
analyzed: malam vakṣye hari bhakteḥ virodhī su loha pātre sannidhānam ca tasya
translated: I will describe the impurities that are opposed to devotion to Hari, and the presence of those in a good iron vessel.

original: tadvaiṣṇavaistyājyamevaṃ sadaiva vastraṃ dagdhaṃ sandhijaṃ caiva janyam // / / //
analyzed: tat vaiṣṇavaiḥ tyājyam evam sadā eva vastram dagdham sandhi jam ca eva janyam
translated: The cloth that is burnt and born from the joints should always be thus abandoned by the devotees of Vishnu.

original: cikitsitaṃ paraduḥ khaṃ khagendra darerbhaktaistyājyamevaṃ sadaiva // / / //
analyzed: cikitsitam para dus kham khaga indra dareḥ bhaktaiḥ tyājyam evam sadā eva
translated: O king of birds, the treatment of others' suffering should always be thus abandoned by the devotees of Hari.

original: noccāśca te haribhaktervihīnāsteṣāṃ saṃgo naiva kāryaḥ sadāpi /
analyzed: na uccāḥ ca te hari bhakteḥ vihīnāḥ teṣām saṃgaḥ nā eva kāryaḥ sadā api
translated: They are not elevated and are devoid of devotion to Hari. Their company should never be kept at any time.

original: purāṇasaṃparkavisarjinaṃ ca purāṇatālaṃ ca purāṇavastram // / / //🔽sujīrṇakanthājinamekhalaṃ ca yajñopavītaṃ ca kalipriyaṃ ca /
analyzed: purāṇa saṃparka visarjinam ca purāṇa tālam ca purāṇa vastram  su jīrṇa kanthā ajina mekhalam ca yajñopavītam ca kalipriyam ca
translated: The incense that comes from contact with the Puranas, the palm tree of the Puranas, the cloth of the Puranas,🔽The worn-out blanket, the deer skin, the girdle, the sacred thread, and what is dear to Kali,

original: priyaṃ gṛhaṃ corṇavitā nakaṃ ca samitkuśaiḥ pūritaṃ kutsitaṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: priyam gṛham ca ūrṇavitā nakam ca samidh kuśaiḥ pūritam kutsitam ca
translated: The house that is dear, the woolen blanket, the despised house filled with sacrificial twigs and Kusha grass,

original: sarvaṃ cetkalibhāryāpriyaṃ ca naiva priyaṃ śārṅgapāṇeḥ kadācit /
analyzed: sarvam ced kali bhāryā priyam ca nā eva priyam śārṅgapāṇeḥ kadācid
translated: And if all this is dear to Kali's wife, it is never dear to the wielder of the Sharnga bow at any time.

original: kāṃsye supakvaṃ yāvanālasya cānnaṃ tuṣaḥ piṇyākaṃ tumbabilve palāṇḍuḥ // / / //
analyzed: kāṃsye su pakvam yāvanālasya ca annam tuṣaḥ piṇyākam tumba bilve palāṇḍuḥ
translated: In the bronze vessel, the well-cooked food of wheat, the husk, the oil-cake, the Tumba and Bilva, the onion,

original: dīrghaṃ takraṃ svāduhīnaṃ kaḍūṣṭaṇamete sarve kalibhāryāpriyāśca /
analyzed: dīrgham takram svādu hīnam kaḍūṣṭaṇam ete sarve kali bhāryā priyāḥ ca
translated: The long buttermilk, the tasteless, the pungent, all these are dear to Kali's wife.

original: sudurmukhaṃ nindanaṃ cāryajānāṃ satovamatyātmajānāṃ prasahya // / / //
analyzed: su durmukham nindanam ca ārya jānām satas vamati ātmajānām prasahya
translated: And severely rebuking the noble women, and forcibly insulting her own daughters,

original: supīḍanaṃ sarvadā bhartṛvarge gṛhasthitavrīhivastrādicauryāt /
analyzed: su pīḍanam sarvadā bhartṛ varge gṛha sthita vrīhi vastra ādi cauryāt
translated: And always causing great distress to the group of husbands, by stealing grain, clothes, etc. kept in the house,

original: prakīrṇabhūtānmūrdhajānsaṃdadhānaṃ karairyutaṃ devakalipriyaṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: prakīrṇa bhūtān mūrdhajān saṃdadhānam karaiḥ yutam deva kali priyam ca
translated: And arranging her disheveled hair with her hands, and being fond of quarrels with the gods,

original: ityādi sarvaṃ kalibhāryāpriyañca sunirmalaṃ prikarotyeva sarvam /
analyzed: ityādi sarvam kali bhāryā priyam ca su nirmalam sarvam
translated: And all this, which is unpleasant to the wife of Kali, she does with great purity.

original: ataśca sā śyāmaleti svasaṃjñāmavāpa sā devakī saṃbabhūva // / / //
analyzed: atas ca sā śyāmalā iti sva saṃjñām avāpa sā devakī saṃbabhūva
translated: And therefore, she obtained the name Shyamala, and that goddess Devaki was born.

original: yudhiṣṭhirasyaiva babhūva patnīsaṃbhāvitā tatra ca devakī sā /
analyzed: yudhiṣṭhirasya eva babhūva patnī saṃbhāvitā tatra ca devakī sā
translated: She became the wife of Yudhishthira, and Devaki was honored there.

original: candrasya bhāryā rohiṇī vai tadeyamaśvinyādibhyo 'hyadhikā sarvadaiva // / / //
analyzed: candrasya bhāryā rohiṇī vai tadā iyam aśvinī ādibhyaḥ hi adhikā sarvadā eva
translated: And this Rohini, the wife of Chandra, is always superior to Asvini and others.

original: roṇīṃ dhṛtvā rohati yogyasthānaṃ tasmācca sā rohiṇīti prasiddhā /🔽ādityabhāryā nāma saṃjñā khagendra jñeyā sā nārāyaṇasya svarūpā // / / //
analyzed: roṇīm dhṛtvā rohati yogya sthānam tasmāt ca sā rohiṇī iti prasiddhā  ādityabhāryā nāma saṃjñā khagendra jñeyā sā nārāyaṇasya svarūpā
translated: She is known as Rohini because she rises to a suitable place, holding the constellation Rohini.🔽O best of birds, the wife of the sun, known as Samjna, should be known as the form of Narayana.

original: saṃjānātītyeva saṃjñāmavāpa saṃjñeti loke sūrya bhāryā khagendra /
analyzed: saṃjānāti iti eva saṃjñām avāpa saṃjñā iti loke sūrya bhāryā khaga indra
translated: O best of birds, she obtained the name Samjna because she was recognized, and she is known in the world as the wife of the sun.

original: brahmaṇḍasya hyabhimānī tu devo virāḍiti hyabhidhāmāpa tena // / / //
analyzed: brahmaṇḍasya hi abhimānī tu devaḥ virāj iti hi abhidhām āpa tena
translated: The god who is the embodiment of the universe is called Virat.

original: gaṅgādiṣaṭkaṃ samameva nityaṃ parasparaṃ nottamaṃ nādhamaṃ ca /
analyzed: gaṅgā ādi ṣaṭkam samam eva nityam parasparam na uttamam na adhamam ca
translated: The six rivers Ganga etc. are always equal, neither superior nor inferior to each other.

original: pradhānāgneḥ pāvikānyaiva gaṅgā sadā śubhā nātra vicāryamasti // / / //
analyzed: pradhāna agneḥ pāvikā anyā eva gaṅgā sadā śubhā na atra vicāryam asti
translated: Ganga is always auspicious, the purifier of the primordial fire, there is no doubt about it.

original: āsāṃ jñānatpuṇyamāpnoti nityaṃ sadā hariḥ prīyate keśavolam /
analyzed: āsām
translated: By knowing these, one always attains merit, and Hari, Keshava, is always pleased.

original: gaṅgādibhyo hyavarāhyagnijāyā svāhāsaṃjñādhiguṇā naiva hīnā // / / //
analyzed: gaṅgā ādibhyaḥ hi avarāhī agnijāyā svāhā saṃjñā adhiguṇā na eva hīnā
translated: Svaha, the wife of Agni, is superior to Ganga and others, not inferior, but of higher qualities.

original: svāhākāro mantrarūpābhimānī svāheti saṃjñāmāpa sadaiva vīndra /
analyzed: svāhākāraḥ mantra rūpa abhimānī svāhā iti saṃjñām āpa sadā eva vi indra
translated: Svaha, the embodiment of the form of mantra, always obtains the name Svaha, O Indra of the gods.

original: agnerbhāryāto buddhimān saṃbabhūva brahmābhimānī candraputro budhaśca // / / //
analyzed: agneḥ bhāryātaḥ buddhimān saṃbabhūva brahma abhimānī candra putraḥ budhaḥ ca
translated: The intelligent one was born from Agni's wife, and Budha, the son of the moon, was the embodiment of Brahma.

original: buddhyāharadvai rāṣṭrajātaṃ ca sarvaṃ dhṛtaṃ tvato budhasaṃjñāmavāpa /
analyzed: buddhyā aharat vai rāṣṭra jātam ca sarvam dhṛtam tu atas budha saṃjñām avāpa
translated: Budha took away the entire kingdom with his intelligence, and was held, therefore he obtained the name Budha.

original: evaṃ cābhūdabhimanyurmahātmā subhadrāyā jaṭhare hyarjunācca // / / //
analyzed: evam ca abhūt abhimanyuḥ mahātmā subhadrāyāḥ jaṭhare hi arjunāt ca
translated: In the same way, the great-souled Abhimanyu was born in the womb of Subhadra and Arjuna.

original: kṛṣṇasya candrasya yamasya cāṃśaiḥ sa saṃyutastvaśvinorvai harasya /
analyzed: kṛṣṇasya candrasya yamasya ca aṃśaiḥ sa saṃyutaḥ tu aśvinoḥ vai harasya
translated: He was endowed with the parts of Krishna, the moon, and Yama, and also of the Ashvins and Hara.

original: svāhādhamaścandraputro budhastu pādāravinde viṣṇudevasya bhaktaḥ // / / //
analyzed: svāhā adhamaḥ candraputraḥ budhaḥ tu pāda aravinde viṣṇu devasya bhaktaḥ
translated: And Swaha, the lowest, is the son of Chandra, and Budha is the devotee of Lord Vishnu, at the lotus feet of his incarnation.

original: nāmātmikā tvaśvibhāryā uṣā nāma prakīrtitā /
analyzed: nāma ātmikā tu aśvi bhāryā uṣāḥ nāma prakīrtitā
translated: The wife of the Ashvins is known as Usha.

original: budhādhamā sā vijñeyā svāhā daśaguṇādhamā // / / //
analyzed: budha adhamā sā vijñeyā svāhā daśaguṇa adhamā
translated: She should be known as the lowest of Budhas, and Swaha is ten times lower than her.

original: nakulasya bhāryā māgadhasyaiva putrī śalyātmajā sahadevasya bhāryā /
analyzed: nakulasya bhāryā māgadhasya eva putrī śalya ātmajā sahadevasya bhāryā
translated: The wife of Nakula is the daughter of Magadha, the daughter of Shalya, and the wife of Sahadeva.

original: ubhe hyete aśvibhāryā hyuṣāpi upāsate ṣaḍguṇaṃ viṣṇumādyam /
analyzed: ubhe hi ete aśvi bhāryā hi uṣā api upāsate ṣaḍguṇam viṣṇum ādyam
translated: Both of them are the wives of the Ashvins, and Usha also worships the primordial Vishnu with six qualities.

original: ato 'pyuṣāsaṃjñakā sā khagendra anantarāñchṛṇu vakṣye mahātman // / / //
analyzed: sā khagendra anantarān śṛṇu vakṣye mahātman
translated: Therefore, O lord of birds, she is known as Usha, and next, O great soul, listen, I will tell you about the next one.

original: tataḥ śaktiḥ pṛthivyātmā śanaiścarati sarvadā /
analyzed: tatas śaktiḥ pṛthivī ātmā śanais carati sarvadā
translated: Then Shakti, with the nature of earth, always moves slowly.

original: ataḥ śanaiścaro nāma uṣāyāśca daśādhamāḥ // / / //
analyzed: atas śanaiścaraḥ nāma uṣāyāḥ ca daśa adhamāḥ
translated: Therefore, he is named Shani, and he is ten times lower than Usha.

original: karmātmā puṣkaro jñeyaḥ śanaratha yamo mataḥ /
analyzed: karma ātmā puṣkaraḥ jñeyaḥ yamaḥ mataḥ
translated: The soul of action should be known as Pushkara, and Shani is considered to be Yama.

original: nayābhimānī puruṣaḥ kiñcinnamno daśāvaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: naya abhimānī puruṣaḥ kiñcid namnaḥ daśa avaraḥ
translated: The person who is proud of his policy is slightly lower than Namna.

original: hariprītikaro nityaṃ puṣkare krīḍate yataḥ /
translated: Because he always delights in Hari and plays in Pushkara,

original: atastu puṣkalo nāma loke sa parikīrtitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: atas tu puṣkalaḥ nāma loke sa parikīrtitaḥ
translated: therefore, he is proclaimed in the world by the name Pushkara.

original: hari prītikarāndharmānvakṣye śṛṇu khagādhipa /
analyzed: hari prīti karān dharmān vakṣye śṛṇu khaga adhipa
translated: O lord of birds, I will tell you about the duties that always delight Hari. Listen.

original: prātaḥ kāle samutthāya smarennārāyaṇaṃ harim // / / //🔽tulasīvandanaṃ kuryācchrīviṣṇuṃ saṃsmaretkhaga /
analyzed: prātar kāle samutthāya smaret nārāyaṇam harim  tulasīvandanam kuryāt śrī viṣṇum saṃsmaret khaga
translated: Having risen in the morning, one should remember Narayana Hari.🔽One should offer salutations to Tulasī and remember Lord Viṣṇu, O bird.

original: viṇmūtrotsargakāle ca hyapānātmakakeśavam // / / //
analyzed: viṣ mūtra utsarga kāle ca hi apāna ātmaka keśavam
translated: At the time of defecation and urination, one should remember Keśava, the form of apāna.

original: trivikramaṃ śaucakāle gaṅgāpānakaraṃ harim /
analyzed: trivikramam śauca kāle gaṅgā pāna karam harim
translated: At the time of purification, one should remember Hari Trivikrama, the remover of the Ganges.

original: dantadhāvanakāle tu candrāntaryāmiṇaṃ harim // / / //
analyzed: dantadhāvana kāle tu candra antaryāmiṇam harim
translated: At the time of brushing the teeth, one should remember Hari, the one who entered the moon.

original: mukhaprakṣālane kāle mādhavaṃ saṃsmaretkhaga /🔽gavāṃ kaṇḍūyane caiva smaredgovardhanaṃ harim // / / //
analyzed: mukha prakṣālane kāle mādhavam saṃsmaret khaga  gavām kaṇḍūyane ca eva smaret govardhanam harim
translated: At the time of washing the face, one should remember Mādhava, O bird.🔽At the time of scratching cows, one should remember Hari Govardhana.

original: sadā godohane kāle smaredgopālavallabham /
analyzed: sadā godohane kāle smaret gopāla vallabham
translated: At the time of milking cows, one should always remember the lover of cowherds.

original: anantapuṇyārjitajanmakarmaṇāṃ supakvakāle ca khagendrasattama // / / //
analyzed: ananta puṇya arjita janma karmaṇām su pakva kāle ca khaga indra sattama
translated: At the time of the ripening of the deeds of birth earned through endless merit, O best of the best of birds,

original: sparśe gavāṃ caiva sadā nṛṇāṃ vai bhavatyato nātra vicāryamasti /
analyzed: sparśe gavām ca eva sadā nṛṇām vai bhavati atas na atra vicāryam asti
translated: One should always remember the touch of cows and men. There is no doubt about this.

original: yasmin gṛhe nāsti sadottamā ca gauryaṅgaṇe śrītulasī ca nāsti // / / //
analyzed: yasmin gṛhe na asti sadā uttamā ca gaurī aṅgaṇe śrī tulasī ca nā asti
translated: In that house where there is no excellent cow, and where there is no Tulasī in the courtyard,

original: yasmin gṛhe devamahotsavaśca yasmin gṛhe śravaṇaṃ nāsti viṣṇoḥ /
analyzed: yasmin gṛhe deva mahā utsavaḥ ca yasmin gṛhe śravaṇam na asti viṣṇoḥ
translated: In that house where there is no great festival of the Lord, in that house where there is no hearing of Viṣṇu,

original: tatsaṃsargādyāti duḥ khādikaṃ ca tasya sparśo naiva kāryaḥ kadāpi // / / //
analyzed: tad saṃsargāt yāti duḥ kha ādikam ca tasya sparśaḥ nā eva kāryaḥ kadāpi
translated: By association with him, one attains suffering etc. His touch should never be made.

original: gosparśanavihīnasya godohanamajānataḥ /
analyzed: go sparśana vihīnasya godohanam a jānataḥ
translated: For one devoid of touching a cow, ignorant of milking a cow,

original: gopoṣaṇavihīnasya prāhurjanma nirarthakam // / / //
analyzed: go poṣaṇa vihīnasya prāhuḥ janma nirarthakam
translated: and lacking in nourishing a cow, they declare birth to be meaningless.

original: gogrāsamapradātuśca gopuṣṭiṃ cāpyakurvataḥ /
analyzed: go grāsam a pradātuḥ ca go puṣṭim ca api a kurvataḥ
translated: For one who does not give a morsel of grass to a cow and does not take care of a cow,

original: gatirnāstyeva nāstyeva grāmacāṇḍālavatsmṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: gatiḥ na asti eva na asti eva grāma cāṇḍāla vat smṛtaḥ
translated: there is no destination, he is said to be like a village chandala.

original: vatsyasya stanapāne ca bālakṛṣṇaṃ tu saṃsmaret /🔽dadhinirmanthane caiva manthādhāraṃ smareddharim // / / //
analyzed: vatsyasya stana pāne ca bāla kṛṣṇam tu saṃsmaret  dadhi nirmanthane ca eva mantha ādhāram smaret harim
translated: While the calf is drinking milk, one should remember young Krishna.🔽And while churning curd, one should remember Hari, the support of the churning.

original: mṛttikāsnāna kāle tu varāhaṃ saṃsmareddharim /
analyzed: mṛttikā snāna kāle tu varāham saṃsmaret harim
translated: At the time of bathing with clay, one should remember Hari, the boar.

original: puṇḍrāṇāṃ dhāraṇe caiva keśavādīṃśca dvādaśa // / / //🔽mudrāṇāṃ dhāraṇe caiva śaṅkhacakragadādharam /
analyzed: puṇḍrāṇām dhāraṇe ca eva keśava ādīn ca dvādaśa  mudrāṇām dhāraṇe ca eva śaṅkha cakra gadā dharam
translated: And while applying tilaka marks, one should remember the twelve including Keshava.🔽And while wearing mudras, one should remember the wielder of conch, discus, and mace,

original: padmaṃ nārāyaṇīṃ mudrāṃ kruddholkādīṃśca saṃsmaret // / / //
analyzed: padmam nārāyaṇīm mudrām kruddha ulkā ādīn ca saṃsmaret
translated: the lotus, the Narayana mudra, the angry flame, and so on.

original: śrīrāmasaṃsmṛtiṃ caiva saṃdhyākāle khagottama /
analyzed: śrī rāma saṃsmṛtim ca eva saṃdhyā kāle khaga uttama
translated: O best of birds, at the time of sandhya, one should remember Sri Rama.

original: acyutānantagovindāñchrāddhakāle ca saṃsmaret // / / //
analyzed: acyuta ananta govindān śrāddha kāle ca saṃsmaret
translated: And at the time of sraddha, one should remember Achyuta, Ananta, and Govinda.

original: prāṇādikapañcahomecānirūddhādīṃśca saṃsmaret /
analyzed: prāṇa ādika pañca homa ica anirūddha ādīn ca saṃsmaret
translated: In the five oblations beginning with Prana, one should remember Aniruddha and others.

original: annādyarpaṇakāle tu vāsudevaṃ ca saṃsmaret // / / //🔽apośanasya kāle tu vāyorantargataṃ harim /
analyzed: annādyarpaṇa kāle tu vāsudevam ca saṃsmaret  apośanasya kāle tu vāyoḥ antargatam harim
translated: At the time of offering food, one should remember Vāsudeva.🔽At the time of Apushana, one should remember Hari residing within Vayu.

original: bastradhāraṇakākāle tu upendraṃ saṃsmareddharim // / / //
translated: At the time of wearing clothes, one should remember Hari Upendra.

original: yajñopavītasya ca dhāraṇe tu nārāyaṇaṃ vāmanākhyaṃ smarettu /
analyzed: yajñopavītasya ca dhāraṇe tu nārāyaṇam vāmana ākhyam smaret tu
translated: At the time of wearing the sacred thread, one should remember Narayana known as Vamana.

original: ārtikyakāle ca tathaiva viṣṇoḥ samyak smaretparśurāmākhyaviṣṇum // / / //
analyzed: ārtikya kāle ca tathā eva viṣṇoḥ samyak smaret parśurāma ākhya viṣṇum
translated: At the time of Aratikya, one should properly remember Vishnu known as Parashurama.

original: apośanevaiśvadevasya kāle tadanyahomādiṣu bhasmadhāraṇe /
analyzed: kāle tad anya homa ādiṣu bhasma dhāraṇe
translated: At the time of Apushana, Vaishvadeva, and other oblations, while wearing ashes,

original: smarettu bhaktyā paramādareṇa nārāyaṇaṃ jāmadagnyākhyarāmam // / / //
analyzed: smaret tu bhaktyā parama ādareṇa nārāyaṇam jāmadagnya ākhya rāmam
translated: one should remember Narayana known as Jamadagnya Rama with devotion and great respect.

original: trivāratīrthagrahaṇasya kāle kṛṣṇaṃ rāmaṃ vyāsadevaṃ krameṇa /
analyzed: tri vāra tīrtha grahaṇasya kāle kṛṣṇam rāmam vyāsadevam krameṇa
translated: At the time of taking the three-time holy bath, one should remember Krishna, Rama, and Vyasa in order.

original: śaṅkhodakasyoddharaṇe caiva kāle mukundarūpaṃ saṃsmaretsarvadaiva // / / //
analyzed: śaṅkha udakasya uddharaṇe ca eva kāle mukunda rūpam saṃsmaret sarvadā eva
translated: At the time of taking up Shankhodaka, one should always remember the form of Mukunda.

original: grāsegrāse smaraṇaṃ caiva kāryaṃ govindasaṃjñasya viśuddhamannam /
analyzed: grāsegrāse smaraṇam ca eva kāryam govinda saṃjñasya viśuddham annam
translated: At every morsel, one should remember Govinda. The food should be pure.

original: ekaikabhakṣyagrahaṇasya kāle samyak smaredacyutaṃ vai khagendra // / / //
analyzed: ekaika bhakṣya grahaṇasya kāle samyak smaret acyutam vai khaga indra
translated: At the time of taking each food item, O king of birds, one should properly remember Achyuta.

original: śākādīnāṃ bhakṣaṇe caiva kāle dhanvantariṃ smareccaiva nityam /
analyzed: śāka ādīnām bhakṣaṇe ca eva kāle dhanvantarim smaret ca eva nityam
translated: And at the time of eating vegetables etc., one should always remember Dhanvantari.

original: tathā parānnasya ca bhogakāle smarecca samyak pāṇḍuraṅgaṃ ca viṣṇum // / / //🔽haiyaṅgavīnasya ca bhakṣaṇe vai samyak smarettāṇḍavākhyaṃ ca kṛṣṇam /🔽dadhyannabhakṣe paramaṃ purāṇaṃ gopālakṛṣṇaṃ saṃsmareccaiva nityam // / / //
analyzed: tathā para annasya ca bhoga kāle smaret ca samyak pāṇḍuḥ aṅgam ca viṣṇum  haiyaṅgavīnasya ca bhakṣaṇe vai samyak smaret tāṇḍava ākhyam ca kṛṣṇam  dadhi anna bhakṣe paramam purāṇam gopālakṛṣṇam saṃsmaret ca eva nityam
translated: Similarly, at the time of enjoying other people's food, one should properly remember Vishnu with a pale complexion.🔽And at the time of eating ghee, one should properly remember Krishna known as Tandava.🔽At the time of eating curd-rice, one should always remember the supreme ancient Gopala Krishna.

original: dugdhānnabhoge ca tathaiva kāle samyak smarecchrīnivāsaṃ hariṃ ca /
analyzed: dugdha anna bhoge ca tathā eva kāle samyak smaret śrīnivāsam harim ca
translated: And at the time of enjoying milk-rice, one should properly remember Hari, the Lord of Shri.

original: sutailasarpiḥ ṣu vipakvabhakṣasaṃbhojane saṃsmaredvyaṅkaṭeśam // / / //🔽drākṣāsujambūkadalīrasālanāriṅgadāḍimbaphalāni cāru /🔽smarettu rambhottamanārikeladhātrīsubhoge khalu bālakṛṣṇam // / / //
analyzed: su taila sarpiḥ vipakva bhakṣa saṃbhojane saṃsmaret vyaṅkaṭa īśam                   smaret tu rambhā uttama nārikela dhātrī su bhoge khalu bālakṛṣṇam
translated: At the time of enjoying food cooked with oil and ghee, one should remember Vyakatesh.🔽Grapes, rose apples, plantains, mango trees, betel nuts, and beautiful pomegranates,🔽At the time of enjoying the excellent fruits of plantain, coconut, and betel nut, one should remember Balarama.

original: supānakasyaiva ca pānakāle samyak smarennārasiṃhākhyaviṣṇum /
analyzed: supānakasya eva ca pāna kāle samyak smaret nārasiṃha ākhya viṣṇum
translated: At the time of drinking sugarcane juice, one should properly remember Vishnu known as Narasimha.

original: gaṅgāmṛtasyaiva ca pānakāle gaṅgātātaṃ saṃsmaredviṣṇumeva // / / //
analyzed: gaṅgā amṛtasya eva ca pāna kāle gaṅgā tātam saṃsmaret viṣṇum eva
translated: And at the time of drinking the nectar of the Ganges, one should remember Vishnu, the father of the Ganges.

original: prayāṇakāle saṃsmarettārkṣyavāhaṃ nārāyaṇaṃ nirguṇaṃ viśvamūrtim /
analyzed: prayāṇa kāle saṃsmaret tārkṣyavāham nārāyaṇam nirguṇam viśvamūrtim
translated: At the time of death, one should remember Narayana, the bearer of Garuda, the attributeless, the universal form.

original: putrādīnāṃ cuṃbane caiva kāle suveṇuhastaṃ saṃsmaretkṛṣṇameva // / / //🔽sukhaṅgakāle svastriyaścaiva nityaṃ gopi kucadvandvavilāsinaṃ harim /
analyzed: putra ādīnām cuṃbane ca eva kāle suveṇu hastam saṃsmaret kṛṣṇam eva  sukhaṅga kāle sva striyaḥ ca eva nityam gopi kuca dvandva vilāsinam harim
translated: And at the time of kissing one's sons and others, one should remember Krishna, the wielder of the beautiful flute.🔽And always, at the time of sexual pleasure with one's own wife, one should remember Hari, the playful one between the breasts of the cowherdesses.

original: tāṃbūlakāle saṃsmaraiccaiva nityaṃ pradyumnākhyaṃ vāsudevaṃ hariṃ ca // / / //🔽śayyākāle saṃsmareccaiva nityaṃ saṃkarṣaṇākhyaṃ viṣṇurūpaṃ hariṃ ca /🔽nidrākāle saṃsmaretpadmanāmaṃ kathākāle vyāsarūpaṃ hariṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: tāṃbūla kāle saṃsmarait ca eva nityam pradyumna ākhyam vāsudevam harim ca  śayyā kāle saṃsmaret ca eva nityam saṃkarṣaṇa ākhyam viṣṇu rūpam harim ca  nidrā kāle saṃsmaret padma nāmam kathā kāle vyāsa rūpam harim ca
translated: And at the time of betel nut, one should always remember Hari, the form of Vishnu known as Pradyumna.🔽And at the time of going to bed, one should always remember Hari, the form of Vishnu known as Samkarṣaṇa.🔽And at the time of sleep, one should remember the lotus-named Hari, and at the time of storytelling, one should remember Hari in the form of Vyāsa.

original: sugānakāle saṃsmaredveṇugītaṃ hariṃ hariṃ pravadetsarvadaiva /🔽śrīmattulasyāśchedane caiva kāle śrīrāmarāmeti ca saṃsmarettu // / / //
analyzed: su gāna kāle saṃsmaret veṇu gītam harim harim pravadet sarvadā eva  śrīmat tulasyāḥ chedane ca eva kāle śrī rāma rāma iti ca saṃsmaret tu
translated: And at the time of singing well, one should remember Hari, the flute-singer, and one should always speak of Hari.🔽And at the time of cutting the auspicious basil plant, one should remember Rama, Rama, and Rāma.

original: puṣpādīnāṃ chedane caiva kāle samyaka smaredetkapilākhyaṃ hariṃ ca /
analyzed: puṣpa ādīnām chedane ca eva kāle harim ca
translated: And at the time of cutting flowers and other things, one should properly remember Hari, known as Kapila.

original: pradakṣiṇegāruḍāntargataṃ ca hariṃ smaretsarvadā vai khagendra // / / //
analyzed: pradakṣiṇe gāruḍa antargatam ca harim smaret sarvadā vai khaga indra
translated: And always remember Hari, who is within Garuda, circumambulating.

original: praṇamakāle devadevasya viṣṇoḥ śeṣāntasthaṃ saṃsmareccaiva viṣṇum /
analyzed: praṇama kāle devadevasya viṣṇoḥ śeṣa anta stham saṃsmaret ca eva viṣṇum
translated: At the time of bowing to Vishnu, the god of gods, one should remember Vishnu, who is within Shesha.

original: sunītikāle saṃsmarennārasiṃhaṃ nārāyaṇaṃ saṃsaṃmaretsarvadāpi // / / //
analyzed: sunīti kāle saṃsmaret nārasiṃham nārāyaṇam saṃsaṃmaret sarvadā api
translated: At the time of good counsel, one should remember Narasimha, and always remember Narayana.

original: pūrtiryadā kriyate karmaṇāṃ ca samyak smaredvāsudevaṃ hariṃ ca /
analyzed: pūrtiḥ yadā kriyate karmaṇām ca samyak smaret vāsudevam harim ca
translated: When the rites are being performed properly, one should remember Vasudeva and Hari.

original: evaṃ kṛtāni karmāṇi hariprītikarāṇi ca // / / //
analyzed: evam kṛtāni karmāṇi hari prīti karāṇi ca
translated: Thus performed, the rites are pleasing to Hari.

original: samyak prakurvannetāni puṣkaro harivallabhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: samyak prakurvan etāni puṣkaraḥ harivallabhaḥ
translated: Performing these properly, Pushkara, the beloved of Hari,

original: etasmādeva pakṣīśa karma yatsamudāhṛtam puṣkarākhyānamatulaṃ śṛṇoti śraddhayānvitaḥ /
analyzed: etasmāt eva pakṣi īśa karma yat samudāhṛtam puṣkara ākhyānam atulam śṛṇoti śraddhayā anvitaḥ
translated: From this very context, O lord of birds, one who listens with faith to the incomparable story of Pushkara, which is called the rite,

original: hariprītikare dharme prītiyukto bhavetsadā // / / //
analyzed: hari prīti kare dharme prīti yuktaḥ bhavet sadā
translated: Will always be filled with joy in the dharma that pleases Hari.

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttarakhaṇḍe tṛtīyāṃśe brahmakāṇḍe kṛṣṇagaruḍasaṃvāde tattvarahasyaṃ nāmaikonatriṃśodhyāyaḥ🔽samāptamidaṃ garuḍamahāpurāṇam /
analyzed: iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttara khaṇḍe tṛtīya aṃśe brahmakāṇḍe kṛṣṇa garuḍa saṃvāde tattvarahasyam nāma ekonatriṃśaḥ adhyāyaḥ  samāptam idam garuḍa mahā purāṇam
translated: Thus ends the twenty-ninth chapter in the Brahmakanda of the Skanda Purana, describing the secret of reality in the dialogue between Krishna and Garuda.🔽This Garuda Purana is complete.

original: iti śrīgaruḍamahāpurāṇaṃ samāptam /
analyzed: iti śrī garuḍa mahā purāṇam samāptam
translated: Thus ends the Garuda Mahapurana.
